review_body: Before the pandemic, we had the pleasant opportunity to stay at this hotel last weekend of January. Our spontaneous trip had a wonderful turnout thanks to the great staff and management at Hotel LeSoleil. General Manager John made our trip pleasant by covering all of our questions and concerns in the most professional way. Great location, large room accommodation, wonderful service. We will definitely return!

Loved our stay here. Perfect location, good size room for NY and housekeeping and other employees are friendly. You always got a friendly hello whenever we walked back in or when we passed them in the elevator. We would stay here again for sure, don’t want to leave in fact!

I stayed here in February and the hotel met my expectations. The room was huge. It had a separate sitting area with a nice little couch. Bed was very comfortable and there was a good size desk and fridge. Bathroom amenities were good too. Staff was very friendly. Newspapers in the lobby in the morning was a nice touch. Within walking distance to Times Square. Restaurants and shopping all around the hotel. Definitely will stay here again.

Was a very nice hotel for the value in a great location. We had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. Was very pleased with hotel staff who where attentive and assisted in any of our needs. Would stay there again,

We were unable to make it to NY because of the pandemic but my interaction with customer service was great. I had a total of four reservations -- all with different dates, number of guests, and room types. Y. Aviles was pleasant and patient. I was even offered discounted rates *after* the reservation was made! Can't wait to finally visit!

My boyfriend and I decided to go on a mini valentines day weekend getaway in the city and were so satisfied with our pick. This lovely hotel was recommended by my colleague who had stayed overnight and although her reservation was last minute, she was completely shocked at the exceptional service and accomondation she received. Our room was great, friendly and professional staff, great location. Would definitely go again.

My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights and it wasn’t enough! Great room, great staff! The mid town location is perfect for everything! The bar and restaurant was also fabulous! Good selections of beers and wine and food. We had a room with a queen and a sofa bed and it was a great size, especially for NYC. The concierge, Scott, was very helpful as were all the staff. Nothing was problem. Would definitely stay here again!

Staff wasn't judgmental of my quick check in and check out. And they always make me feel like a very important person. I definitely always try to book with this hotel. I don't even mind paying a little extra.

Great location, friendly staff, small room - I'm sure the agency booked me the cheapest but it was meant to be for 2 people. i was grateful that, being on business, I was alone because it would have been a very tight squeeze otherwise.Surprisingly large bathroom - would have stored a suitcase in here had there been two of us staying. It had everything i needed, it was just very compact.The restaurant wasn't open on Sunday evening, which i hadn't realised, but they recommended a nearby Italian which was superb.Breakfast was buffet or a la carte - i had cold buffet and it was absolutely delicious; fruit salad that actually tasted of fresh fruit and particularly good granola. The only criticism i had was that when i got back to my room after 16.00 it still hadn't been made up so i had to call housekeeping, who came to sort it out very quickly but it meant i had to go down to the lounge area. It didn't seem to be possible to get a cup of tea or coffee there, i think all service stopped after brunch on Sunday.Reception and concierge staff were very helpful.

The Queen Suite was refreshing and the room was quiet. Great front desk staff. Housekeepers were pleasant and kind. Great location “I didn’t even know was there” spots. Loved the Sun theme and motif throughout.
user_name:
Dacion2020
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff at this hotel was very accommodating and the hotel is in very good condition. Our only concern was that the room was very small. One of us had to walk over or through his luggage to get to the bathroom.

My wife and 2 of my adult daughter spent the weekend in New York on a business trip. this hotel surprised me. It is tucked in on 36th Street - almost unnoticed, but it is very good and has everything for a comfortable, worry-free stay.

My friends & I stayed at this hotel in February, and are returning to stay again in April, it is a beautiful hotel, I must say working with Yadira was a dream, the help that she provided me when booking our next group stay was unbelievable I could not say thank you enough!!! Do not look at another hotel for your stay in NYC, beautiful clean rooms, awesome restaurant and a amazing staff!!! Again thank you so much Yadira!!!! Jeff S.

Perfect location close to the subway and other major spots in midtown. My room was super quiet, couldn’t hear anything from the surrounding streets which was great. Would definitely recommend for someone looking to venture all over Manhattan since it’s in the center of it all!

This is the only place I book in midtown now. It's clean, quiet, and comfortable. It's the only hotel I've stayed at in the area that I can actually get rest in. Everyone that works there is wonderful to top it off. Shout out to Nicole for all of her help and going out of her way to make sure my stay is always great :)

Overall a good stay with a few minor niggles. Large room ( queen suite I think) as there were three of us and the pull out sofa bed in a separate area worked well. Clean room and serviced daily. Bathroom had lots of hot water but shower was in the bath so a little old fashioned. Only problem was some v loud drilling in the afternoons. Normally we wouldn’t be in the hotel then as our sightseeing etc but my daughter wasn’t feeling well one afternoon and came back to rest but with the noise it was impossible. Spoke to manager who said he’d get it stopped but unfortunately it continued and happened again briefly the next day. Prob better for the hotel to state in advance if the are doing Reno work or suggest a room change. That said, I would recommend this hotel for location close to Herald Sq and Times Sq and general service level. Didn’t use facilities as we had breakfast in a great cafe a few doors down the street so can’t comment on food.

Great location.good sized rooms with lots of space; Pillows too soft. Not able to close the bathroom door; Raw sewage smell in room 207. Complained to front desk who attempted to address but no resolution.

We stayed in a Queen, Empire State view room on 18th floor. The room was very comfortable for our four night stay and cleanliness was high. The view was amazing!All of the team at the hotel were friendly and helpful. The location is perfect for tourists. A few minutes walk to the Empire State Building and Times Square and close to multiple other big locations. Good Subway links too. Restaurants and bars on the doorstep if like us you are too exhausted to go far after 14 mile days!We would have given 5 stars but for a few small niggles which could be easily corrected. I still don’t understand resort fees; $22 per night for water and WiFi seems high, but standard for New York. We’d stay again if we return.Thank you!

This is my third time staying with Executive Hotel Le Soleil and I’ll be back. Really lovely staff. Very nice but not ostentatious. Great value. The beds are comfortable and the view from the upper-floor, south-facing rooms is fantastic. Strong recommendation.

The room is very small compared to other hotel with comparable amenities. Not easily seen or identified. the location was okay, it was trash day and the streets were pretty loaded with trash. Breakfast buffet was not worth the price

During this 4th consecutive stay at executive le soleil NYC I found this friendly atmosphere with the staff members. The doormen Keron and Joseph are attentive and friendly, always ready to make our stay pleasant. At the reception André always very patient and very professional with us whose English is not very American Lol.Thanks to Latch my favorite engineer who always has a solution to all our small daily problems and very reactive. Not to mention Scott, the concierge and Lyliana of the reception who was on maternity leave. Looking forward to seeing you next yearGuy-Raphael from Martinique

On the plus side: Bed is in its own area, separated from the sofa bed area, some privacy. The sofa bed is comfortable for one .It is decorated nicely and on the 12th floor even by the elevator it was really quiet. The bathroom was nice sized and clean. It too was nicely put together. You need a key to use the elevator. Staff was good and concerns were dealt with quickly. Negatives: The desk and small fridge are full with candy and sodas for you to buy. It is not there for you use. There is very little space for your stuff. You would have to clear the desk to use it. The room was cold. The staff tried to address that by coming right up and showing me how to use the thermostat and they gave us two blankets but it remained cooler than we wanted. There is a restaurant but breakfast did not start until 8 on weekends and both days we needed to be somewhere by then. There is a French bakery nearby so ..Once the sofa bed is out, there is no room to open the door. Apparently the wine left on the cluttered desk was complimentary but we weren't told that. Everything else cost a lot for what it was, so we did not take a chance and the desk never told us. They did tell us when asked, that the coffee was free to use and the two water bottles by the bed were complimentary. Small things on the whole, if you get a good deal , I'd recommend the place. Be aware though that they charge a resort fee and the place is not a resort. I guess its for the"complimentary" WiFi.Why does NYC allow the resort fees. It cuts into their tax revenue. Say upfront the nightly rate for the hotel so the customer can truly compare the cost of staying there.

Second time, even better, staff is great, very well located, superb room in every aspect. Everything is great about this hotel, especially the staff and location, 10 minutes walk from Times Square. Will repeat for sure

We booked the Hotel LeSoleil based on reviews. Was not real sure what we would find or the location but both were outstanding. The hotel was so clean and comfortable. The location and access to subway made everything so easy. There is so much to do and see in such a large city that I find location so overwhelming. We had no regrets. From check in to check out the staff was also amazing. Andrew checked us in. He was amazing with tips, kindness and glasses of wine. At night when we would come back he was there and asked how our day was. Our queen suite worked just fine for us and two adult children. It's not huge but was more than adequate and the shower was one of the best we have had. Yes, I do highly recommend this hotel. We will be back. I'm done searching for hours for the perfect hotel when going to NYC!

A very pleasant hotel with an outstanding staff that makes you feel welcome and provides exceptional service. The rooms are good size for Manhattan well furnished with a mini-bar and snacks. I'll definitely be back...

Stayed for 3 nights on a business trip and was very pleased. Pleasant service with every pone we encountered, nice clean spacious room suite and good happy hour drinks in hotel's restaurant, would definitely recommend and will be back.

Nice location, good restaurant. Just stay out of hotel limo, they charge too much and are not nice. For example, full road tool charged, but then driven via Bronx without actuall toll. Better take normal taxi instead.

Everything was easy at this hotel. From the helpful doorman, to the rest of the staff when we had the wrong room. They handled it quickly and easily. The location was perfect, we could walk to all the usual toruisty sites. Will definitely return. Was there for my 13 year old daughters birthday, along with her friends.

Sorry to leave such a review however this is factThis was a surprise trip for my husbands 50th birthday. On arrival the view from the room was great a lovely view of the Empire state but the room was tiny, like really tiny. The glass wardrobe was next to useless, about a foot long rail!! We had no drawers to store anything for our 5 day trip, just the foot long wardrobe! We arrived late afternoon and there was an odd smell from the bathroom but we were so tired we went to bed. OMG the next morning the stench from the bathroom was horrendous, it was like the worst sewer smell - this was my husbands birthday. It was terrible and no window to open. I went straight down to reception who offered us another room (a suite) but would not be ready until the next day. So we had to sleep again with the ferile stink of god knows what. My husbands birthday stay was ruined. After we moved rooms it was so nice. Loads of storage space and no stench, a little too late. (oh there was a bottle of fizz and chocolates waiting for us with a note) That first room should not have been let to anyone. I challenged resort fees after leaving by phone. I was told...... "resort fees are for the complimentary water in rooms and the WiFi". Eh??? Anyone make sense of that To summarise, this experience ruined a special occasion, the initial room should never of been let out, I am unlikely to return. Management if you want more info do let me know

Small room, not easy even to fit the luggages if you plan a long stay there.Very limited space for hanging your dresses, jackets etc. literally there is no wardrobe in the room, some glass separated space and hanging long dress or a long coat is almost impossible. so you really need to be very minimalist if you plan to stay in this room. and this extra destination (resort, facilty) fee should really be very well explained to the guests as you feel like being charged extra for no extra service etc.

We had a great experience, some minimal details in the room like the bathroom did not have all the hooks for the towels, but nothing major. The custumer service was expectional specially from Joseph the guy who helps with the luggages. Excellent location.

Planning a visit to NYC was a stressful experience as there is so many hotels to choose from. But after endless hours of decision I'm so glad I picked this hotel. From the moment I booked the hotel made contact and made themselves available for any questions or queries.On arrival check-in was very quick and the staff really pleasant and efficient. We had a room on the 19th floor with a stunning view of the ESB. The room was perfect, large TV and spacious bathroom. The hotel has excellent bar and dining facilities that include a daily happy hour for drinks.The rooms were cleaned every day and left as spotless as the day we arrived. The location of the hotel is perfect for planning your long days of walking and sight seeing in New York. Many of the major attractions and shops are within a short walking distance. As is the subway stations that you sometimes are really glad of when going that bit further away.I'm so glad I chose this excellent hotel and am planning the next visit already.Special word of thanks to Yadira who was really helpful in the week leading up to our arrival. Nothing was too much trouble.First class Hotel.

Myself and my partner actually stayed here twice. We went both times the end of November/December. It’s very central right beside Macy’s and Herald Square it’s also right off 5th Avenue it’s honestly a perfect location. Staff don’t really bother you which is what we like to just do our own thing. We were only there for an hour or 2 during the day and at night of course. It’s a small room but its New York so I wouldn’t let that affect anything. On our second time staying here a bottle of red wine was left in the room and a little message saying welcome back which I thought was great they went the extra mile. Room is spotless extremely friendly staff and there’s a coffee shop right on site we hired a car both times to drive us back to the airport it is about 60 dollars which is great because it’s so comfortable and we had extra cases from shopping. You will be charged a deposit of a couple hundred dollars when you check in but this is normal for the US you receive it back when you check out. When we go back to New York we will stay here again.

Fabulous location. Food in the bar ea expensive. Wasn’t happy that reception would not take my pre paid master card. I had to give them my credit card which they put a hold on so I didn’t have access to funds during my stay. On checkout a different receptionist had no problem taking my pre paid card???’ Consistency is needed!!’ Room was nice but tiny and needs shower gel in the bathroom. Car to airport was expensive also. Location was a1

We stayed here Valentine’s weekend to see a concert at Madison Square Garden. The rooms were nicely decorated with well thought out necessities for the space. Bed was very comfortable and our son said the pull out was the best he slept on. All of the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area and how to get where we needed to go. Don’t remember the name of the gentleman who checked us in late Friday night on the 14th but he saw weary travelers and gave us vouchers to use at the restaurant the next morning. Service and attention to details was fabulous! Jaime the bell hop/door man was awesome and checked in with us our daily adventures. Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, and Empire State Building are within easy walking distance. We ate breakfast at the restaurant and the food was delicious. Definitely a true gem and will be coming back to stay here again.

This is a great place to stay in New York. We were in the Decollette Penthouse and it was really nice. The best thing about Le Soleil is how nice the staff is. They were very responsive to our needs and always seemed to be smiling!

Great location and walking distance from major metro lines. Clean and confortable rooms.Too bad the breakfast buffet was not up to our expectation : very limited and repetitive choice.Overall, a very good experience and we'll certainly stay again at this hotel during our next trip to NY.

hotel car limo to airport very bad. No credit card approved, no receipt, they charge toll roads but drive slow way via Bronx where is no tolls, driver not nice. Big mistake not to take normal taxi, won´t be back.

We had difficulty in booking the hotel from the UK with the hotels website. When we got there the booking was only for one of us. We found this a bit strange as in the notes we asked for a high floor room if possible, as we was celebrating an anniversary. They don't do anything for anniversaries either. If you are looking for a hotel with a view, this isn't the hotel for you as a lot of the rooms like ours looked out onto an office block so no view at all. The first morning we went down to breakfast and the breakfast was only for one person. We checked with reception and this couldn't be changed. My advice is to book the hotel without the breakfast, as the buffet is limited in choice and expensive for what it is. There are lots of breakfast places around which are lovely. If you do have breakfast at the hotel go early, as that is when the food is fresh and warm. The restaurant doesn't seem to be part of the hotel. We went down to have a drink, we ordered our drinks and sat on a table. Next minute the restaurant manager said the table was reserved and we was escorted into the lobby, bit strange as no table reserved signs on the table, not a great experience.We asked what the late checkout option was and was told they were only available on the day. The man on reception said they were first come first served. We said we would get up early as we needed a later checkout. We went down to reception on our last day, to be told that the hotel could extend our check out time from 12.00 pm to wait for it 1.00 pm wow. We asked if we could check out at 4pm and was told to do this we would be charged a whole day's rate. Overall there are better hotels for around the same price in the area. I would not return to this hotel when I return to New York.

I have the choice of staying anywhere in Midtown, but I keep coming back to the Executive Hotel because simply put, the staff and doormen are so welcoming and helpful, the rooms are very clean and the cleaning staff also very helpful, and this hotel is centrally located to everywhere I need to go or see...literally a block or two from all varieties of restaurants, shopping, sites. The property is a couple of blocks from NY Penn Station so if you are going to the airport, to a business meeting in Jersey or to Brooklyn, its all very east to get to. Although the Executive is not the most "posh" or extravagant hotel in Midtown, for the price, cleanliness and service, why would I stay anywhere else. The rooms are more on the smaller size, but have everything you need...I would recommend the queen or king rooms, as the suites are a bit on the smaller size as well. A few months back, I missed my flight and had to wait till the evening, so I literally worked out of the quiet corner of the lobby most of the day and they were very understanding and let me do what I needed to do. I think the Executive Hotel NY is a gem and one of the best in MidTown for business and great for parties of 2 or 3. I'll be staying here whenever I am in Midtown.

If you stay here, you will feel like you're staying with family. The staff made my fiance feel so at ease especially after she checked out and had flown home only to realize she had forgotten her winter coat and phone charger in the room. A special thank you to Andre, from the front desk, who made sure my fiance was well taken care of and that her belongings were returned promptly. He went above and beyond to make her stay exceptional. A true example of genuinely caring customer service. Thank you Andre! We cannot wait to come back again for your hospitality.

Great rates, amazing location and perfect service given by everyone from the doorman to the counter staff to the cleaners. They all do a fantastic job and we weren't dissaponted once. Cleaners always making an effort to come back later if you were busy in the morning with your room. Room size more then adequate for midtown.

This beautiful Art Deco hotel is centrally located. Places are walking distance but easy to hop on a bus subway or get in a Lyft which we did often. Friendly staff let us check in early as we arrived early from our red eye flight. Small room but it did the job. I will definitely come back to this hotel next time we’re in NYC.

We stayed here for 7 days and I have to say the staff were amazing. They all went above and beyond for us. The room was clean, tidy and comfortable. I am glad I booked here, it's also very close to all the tourist attractions and great food. A special thanks to Jaime for giving us some great tips and being incredibly helpful, it's nice to walk into a hotel to welcoming and happy staff who want to help and make your trip as enjoyable as possible.

Lovely elegant hotel, great central location.efficient and friendly check in, good sized room, fresh and clean with good bath robe. Room over street bit noisy but good people watching. Lobby area nice and roomy, good art. Will stay again.
First time and this hotel and was given amazing customer service by Nicole and Meredith who went above and beyond to make my trip amazing! Please thank them for me, I will definitely come back again.

I was only staying for one night but wish it could have been longer. The location was great for getting to/from Penn Station, and plenty of dining was within walking distance. The hotel common areas and room were very clean, and for NYC were a fine size. I've staying in smaller rooms in smaller cities, so I was pleasantly surprised with the space I had here.

Let's start with the good - friendly staff, fast elevators, clean, nice decor, nice sitting areas in lobby.However, for me too many negatives:Do not believe the pictures on the hotel's website for the layout of the Queen suite with sofabed. This would be a terrible choice for 4 adults, it was ok for 1-2 adults and 1 child. The sofabed is very small and tucked in a tiny area (smaller than our bathroom), so you have to exit the bed by climbing out the bottom. They have one of this room type per floor (we say the room on 2 floors) and both were same strange layout.Without telling us in advance, they assigned us to a room with an ADA bathroom. It sucked. A huge empty area in the middle of the bathroom, with a minuscule counter (approx. 4 inches on each side of the sink. All that room and absolutely nowhere to lay down your toiletriesThe very least I have gotten in NYC for my $20+ resort fee (2 $1 bottles of water a day, coffee and GREEN TEA - no real tea, wi-fi).Also, very strange lighting configuration. you could not just have on one bedside lamp. to have a bedside lamp you had to have both bedside lamps, the lighting around the mirror above the desk and track lighting along the tops of the windows in both the bed and sofabed areas. Extremely poor design.

The hotel has an amazing location - with walking distance to both Times Square and the Empire State Building, and other sights. Very friendly and helpful staff. The room does appear larger than it is on the photos, but the bathroom is spacious. Can easily recommend this Hotel :)

We love staying at Executive Hotel LeSoleil... The location works great for access to theatre and shopping and the service is amazing. From check-in to check-out, everything is seamless. Rooms are comfortable and clean -- and everyone at the hotel is friendly and helpful.

Our recent 9-night stay here was our very first in Manhattan. This hotel has a convenient Midtown location, and we had a clean, modern and comfortable room which faced the very quiet courtyard at the back of the building. (Midtown is a very busy and noisy place, but I don't know if rooms facing 36th St. are quiet or not). There's a very friendly and helpful staff ranging from Jaime & Jonathan at the front entrance, to Eranny and ALL the others at the front desk, to the tremendous housekeeping staff. There's a wonderful breakfast available at the restaurant that's connected to the property. We have no complaints at all about this excellent hotel!

Very accommodating hotel in central location. As a female traveling solo I liked that front desk and door man acknowledged every time I came in or out of the hotel. Bed was comfy, room was on the small side but perfect for me alone and overall cleanliness excellent. Would happily stay again.

Basically good. Less impressed with cordiality of reception clerk when I opted to pay with cash instead of credit card but all other contacts with staff were positive. Also view from room was hardly overwhelming (1605).

Booked hotel for our honeymoon this coming March, Yadira went above and beyond to make sure she will have everything to plan for our arrival and personalised all dealings with us. Looking forward to our stay and meeting Yadira in person. Thanks again for all your help and to the GM, staff like Yadira are what brings guests to any premises. Roll on March .

Stayed here every year for more than 4 years now. Always great service, clean rooms and excellent location. Its close to great restaurants, Jacob Javits convention center, principal stores and attractions.

If you are looking for a hotel centrally located in Midtown, this is a great choice. It's moinutes from Penn Station, Bryant Park and multitude of great restaurants. The service level from Eranny at the front desk and bell hop was top notch. The rooms were a bit small, but confortable and and the room was quiet. I would stay there again!

Excellent service. Close to shopping, public transportation, restaurants, Madison Square Garden and other stores such as Macy's. Good for families, solo, couples, business. The room I had was beautiful even though the view could've been better.

Near train station, subway, sites and shopping. Reserved an executive suite for two of us at a reasonable price. Didn't use other amenities but they looked wonderful. The staff was extremely friendly whenever we were in the lobby and offered assistance even when not asked.

The staff was so helpful and friendly! The location is great for Times Square. It seemed a bit pricey to me, but I’m sure it’s in line with other NewYork hotels. They let us check in early (for a fee) as our bus dropped us off at 6 AM. We were also allowed to leave our baggage there after check out as our bus didn’t leave until 4:00pm.

Suite was small, however the reception changed my suite to a larger one. The new suite was large enough for tthree people. Location of the is perfect, and the room was very clean. The personnel is very friendly and helpful.

Greetings Yadira Thank you for being so helpful She helped me with booking my room and my sister's room for our upcoming stay,We're looking forward to a great stay in NYC at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil. Look forward to meeting Yadira in person.

The location was in the heart of manhattan. We were literally a short walk away from the Empire State Building. And walking distance to other major tourist attractions. The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Concierge recommended some great eats locally, which all turned out to be delicious. Will get return again.

Although the decor is a little tired in places, this hotel is fantastically located within minutes of The Empire State Building, Times Square and Broadway. 5th Avenue is at the end of the street where you will find great shopping.The staff at the hotel are first class with a special mention to Joseph, Andrew and Luis, these guys were so helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble.Room was spacious with everything we needed including Queen size bed, large bathroom with walk in shower, separate lounge area with additional TV, fridge and minibar and pod coffee machine.Restaurant and bar served good food, the ribeye steaks were outstanding.Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Fantastic service, fast and helpful will any requests we had. Bathrooms are big and modern, beds extremely comfortable and room heating was fantastic. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will stay here again! Location great! so close to Times Square.

I stayed here for business and was pleasantly surprised at how wonderful the hotel was. The rooms are an excellent size. The staff was friendly. I didn't get the opportunity to try the restaurant but I plan on staying here again when in town.

I'm a frequent world-wide business traveler and initially came to this hotel upon recommendation of a friend who contracts hotels in NYC for a tour operator. It did not disappoint! Been staying at the LeSoleil the last four years during an annual conference in NYC. The ambience, service, rooms, gym and benefit of the on-site restaurant is just what you need after a long day on business in town. I recommend to chose the King Room or higher category, the Queen Room tends to be on the small side, which is OK if it's just one person, though.The hotel is not over the top and pretentious like some others 4/5 stars in NYC, offers very good value for money and it's just a nice and welcoming atmosphere. I highly recommend it!

Stayed here for our wedding anniversary and had a fabulous time. I lived in Brooklyn for most of my life. I moved out of the state and still consider myself a New Yorker. We came back to stay in the City to go to the US Open. This hotel met our needs. The rooms were small, but the staff more than made up for it. Negesti at the front desk was so great. We loved the restaurant recommendation she gave us. She also gave us a room with nice view of the Empire State Building and sent up champagne and treats. Such a nice way to celebrate. The brunch at the hotel was very nice.

We arrived around 7:30 pm from Boston self driving 2 vans 12 people!They immediately took our luggage and registered us in and we entered our rooms and being New York they are not huge however they are very clean and comfortable. we found that there are many quick food stops very near to here and we were between 5th and 6th avenues, we didn't have any view sad.The staff were always friendly and very helpful.places that are within walking distance are, Times Sq, Chrysler building, Central station,Macy's and Empire State building all within a few blocks walk. If you needed to get to other parts of New York the subway is close actually Central.Buses are very regular if you like travelling on the surface. Uber was always very fast too.

My wife and I travel a great deal and found that the quality and service in the hotel was excellent. The rooms clean and comfortable. Although the room was not spacious (as is typical of mid-town NYC hotels in this price range), the design of the room made good use of space.
user_name:
Richard L
Wayland, MA, United States

review_body: In the fast pace of New York Hotel LeSolell is a delightful trip back in time. With all the amenities of a new modern hotel Hotel LeSolell has the nostalgia of a hotel experience of 100 years ago. The people were all gracious and friendly, the bar very cosy, the food and service excellent. It was a great choice to be right in the middle of New York City. The only negative was the elevator but it was such a busy time.

This was an absolutely amazing hotel ! The location was awesome, Close to everything we wanted to do and if it wasn't, close to a subway station. The only reason the sleep quality got a very good was simply because of the sofa bed, definitely needs replaced.

Great location between Empire State Building and Times Square. Clean but small rooms, friendly and helpful staff. Happy hour drinks were a good idea and great price for NY. Lounge area downstairs a nice place to relax after a day pounding the pavements

I reserved an Executive Queen Suite with sofa bed room as I found this kind of room was perfectlyadapted for 3 occupants and also after having seen the web pages of the hotel describing the highlightsof this type of rooms with pictures.In fact, the room we have had wasn't like the description : plan not the same, bed being just in front of the room door (corridor noises) , sofa stuck between two walls (not a lounge).Futhermore the room was noisy due to the lift mechanism just behind one of the walls.The sofa bed was unconfortable.So, you have to be very carefull when making reservations in this hotel.

We stayed at the Executive for 4 nights from Christmas Day and overall it was a very pleasant stay and I wouldn't hesitate to book again. The location was fabtastic, we were 2 blocks from the Empire State and 4 from Bryant Park. Everything "touristy" was very easily accessible on foot and for slightly longer journeys we used the subway. The staff on reception and the doorman were great - really helpful and nothing was too much trouble.The room was well equipped with a hairdryer, ironing board & iron, drawers, hanging space, safe & drinks making facilities. The bathroom was excellent too. Bed and pillows were comfy.My only gripe was that couldn't interdependently operate some of the room lights - for example you couldn't have the bedside lamps on without another main light being on. We tried the attached restaurant and had drinks during happy hour in the lounge - these were great too.

We had a wonderful time spending New Year at the hotel. From the efficient booking process with Ms Yadira to the kind service by all the staff during our stay, we felt really comfortable. The Executive Suite on the 19th floor is pretty spacious, and the hotel cares about the smallest details in the room to make guests feel at home. The only improvement we could think of would be a stronger water pressure in the shower and faucet. We would definitely stay there again.

The location of the hotel is excellent. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and the hotel is within walking distance of Macy’s and the Empire State Building. Despite being close to attractions the street felt quiet and safe at night. We found the reception staff, concierge and doormen to be very helpful and friendly. Particular mention must go to Jamie- nothing was too much trouble for him and he was always there to greet us each day offering advice and suggestions. When he found out my step dad had injured his back, he arranged a later check-out of the room so my stepdad could relax comfortably until he left for his flight. We stayed in an executive suite on the 9th floor. The room was clean and comfortable with a nice separate seating area with TV and sofa. The suite would have been great for 2 or 3 people but with 2 adults and 2 teenagers it was a bit cramped, especially as storage was limited. My mum had a larger room on a higher floor. It would be worth booking one of these if available, for the light, space and view. Breakfast was perfectly acceptable with hot and cold choices at the buffet e.g. fresh fruit, yoghurt, granola, bagels, pastries, sausages, bacon, eggs and potatoes. The bar/dining area where breakfast was served was small but we had no trouble getting a table each morning. In the evenings, the small size of this bar/dining space was limiting as you weren’t allowed to sit at one of the dining tables just to have a drink. There were only a small number of bar stools around the bar to have your drinks there. The limited space also meant that the hotel could not cope with the large number of guests wishing to dine on Xmas Day. This meant that the food and service were not up to the standard you would expect, and some guests like us, ended up having their meals in the small lounge area outside the bar/restaurant. The Xmas Day meal was the only thing which let our trip down especially as my mum ended up being charged for her meal twice. This was rectified by one of the hotel managers in the end but initially the restaurant staff were not very helpful. Overall, this would not put me off staying again.

The location is strategic. The hotel is located just walk away to empire state building & macy's. The neighbourhood is not empty, theres cafe/bar/restaurants/markets. The room is clean and cozy and most importantly, the staffs are all superb! Had great times staying in.

My friend and I stayed for a weekend in December! The hotel was very clean and staff was friendly. We took the NJ Transit from Secaucus. It was about a 10-15 minute walk. This is an amazing location very close to Times Square, Central Park and Bryant Park. I would definitely stay again!

Stay in the city frequently for work and leisure. Tough to find anything under $300 per night that is close to everything and has space (without being a dump). This was great for us and our 2 kids. Clean, decent size room, close to everything in mid town. Really helpful and kind staff.

This is the second time I have been in this hotel and I was really very satisfied. I’ll be back again . The staff has been always available and the service was Faultless. The availability of hotel services made the stay very comfortable.

My self and my family had an amazing time, from the moment I booked the hotel I was contacted my Yadira who ensured I was getting the best deal for our stay. Scott the hotel concierge was a great help in arranging our travel from the airport to the hotel and also providing recommendations for Broadway shows and the best place to book the tickets. This was all before we even arrived at the hotel. When we arrived we were greeted by the door men and they offered to carry our bags to our room. Check in was very easy and the rooms were cleaned to high standards, modern and serviced every day. The hotel was in a great location for shopping and sight seeing. Only a few minuets walk to time square and right on 5th Avenue. All the staff were very polite and helpful and I would highly recommend this hotel. I will definitely stay here again on our next trip to the big apple. Thanks to everyone at the hotel.

Had a great second visit to this great midtown hotel in heart of it all. Highly recommend as rooms are good size for nyc standards and rooms are clean with good service. Look forward to next visit in March.

We had a mixed stay at this hotel. To start with the location is great, it’s a short walk to the subway and Macy’s, and so it’s very easy to get around and pop back regularly to the hotel to drop off shopping and rest. The room was comfortable and clean, and although we were on a lower floor we were round the back of the building. So while there was no view, it was very quiet which suited us.Unfortunately the cleaning staff took my pajamas along with the bed sheets when our sheets were changed during our stay. Obviously it was unintentional but it was annoying. We asked for their return but eventually the hotel said they likely wouldn’t receive them back from the laundry company until after we’d flown home, so they arranged some compensation to cover the cost of purchasing new pajamas.When I returned home I saw the hotel had put through an unauthorised charge on my credit card of $438.40 which didn’t appear anywhere on our bill. I contacted the hotel and they replied saying it was a ‘computer glitch’. They refunded the money plus an extra amount in compensation to cover the inconvenience and also any currency fluctuations.All in all, the hotel itself was fine. The problems we experienced were dealt with quickly, but it was a hassle for a 4 night stay and a bit of a shame overall.

This hotel is well located in a safe environment. We had a suite which was very clean and spacious on the 19th floor. The room had a lovely view the only fault was lack of a wardrobe and chest of drawers. The front door man Jamie was extremely helpful as was Scott the concierge and helped to make our stay more enjoyable. They were both very knowledgeable and extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel has some lovely facilities the only thing that was not up to standard was the meal on Xmas Day. This was not worth the money with poor service and although I paid for the meal on the night when checking out I was informed the bill for the meal hadn't been paid. The female restaurant manager who dealt with this was very rude and unhelpful and it was only after the Manager of the hotel Hosel intervened at my request that the bill was settled in my favour.

The only issue we have is the elevators are extremely slow. Other than that, Nicole, doorman & another staff(sorry can’t remember their name) were very patient when we checked in! They were very helpful! Thx!

We brought our 10 month old son to NYC from Ireland for his first Christmas. This trip was made so much easier by Jaimie, who works in the lobby of the hotel. Reception and restaurant staff had informed us that food we had brought with us for our baby couldn’t be prepared/heated there. Jaimie went above and beyond to help us in any way he could. First class service by Jaimie. Location and hotel facilities are brilliant. Would highly recommend it when traveling to NYC.

We stayed at the Executive Hotel Le Soleil over the Xmas period 2019. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. It was my birthday and they arranged a bottle of sparkling wine which was a lovely gesture. The hotel is in an excellent position to explore all the sights of New York with a subway nearby and many sights within walking distance. We also felt very safe in this neighbourhood.Jamie the front door man was particularly helpful and had a lovely pleasant manner. He really helped to make our stay easier. The hotel is spotlessly clean and our suite was very spacious and inviting. The only negative about the room was lack of wardrobe space but we managed nevertheless.I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for anyone visiting New York.

We went to NYC to celebrate the holiday season. The hotel is in a perfect location to access most of (if not all) the major tourist sites. It felt safe, and though the downstairs/lounge area is loud (due to restaurant and bar access), our room was quiet. The room was small, but it is what you would expect for NYC given that real estate is at such a premium. We had a room with a queen-size bed and a fold-out couch. The queen-size bed was comfy; the fold-out couch was less comfy. But again, given expected prices, I was not surprised. The two things I noticed that could be improved upon were the plumbing and the carpet. The plumbing kept making a strange noise, and we thought it might have something to do with how the plumbing was connected to the venting??? I have no idea. The noise wasn’t particularly loud but it was fairly constant. Again, this was a really small inconvenience. When I bent down to put on shoes, I noticed the carpet had some old hair on it. Again, most people wouldn’t even notice this, but I was a little grossed out. In general, I wouldn’t hesitate to stay again. One reason we did say anything about the little nuisances was because, at the holidays, I know businesses are busy. My guess is that, had we said anything about the plumbing noise or carpet, the staff probably would have attended to it.

Everything was an outstanding experience, from the porters who greeted us at the door and took our luggage, to the front desk, to the cleanliness, safety and location. Will definitely stay there again.

Amazing hotel absolutely well located and close to many attractions. Friendly staff, cosy bar, 24h fitness. Special thanks to Yadira for her help and assistance to make my stay most comfortable right from the start.

Loved the hotel. Very conveniently located. There are only two items that bothered all of us. 1. The pocket door to the bathroom. It is way too hard to open or close. Something is missing to move the door, like a hook. 2. The temperature couldn't be adjusted to a lower setting. It was way too hot in the room.
user_name:
HEIKE C C
Houston, United States

review_body: Girlfriends getaway! My friend and I were both very pleased with this hotel. I liked the fact that the street was lined with other hotels, therefore at night it was very quiet, not a lot of commercial traffic. We both had an excellent night's sleep and liked everything about this hotel. In the future when I come to NYC, this is going to be my first choice of hotels.

This was our first time to stay at this location, and our family of four (self, spouse, two sons 4&8) really enjoyed staying here. First off, this is a fantastic location- Walking distance to so much, but not in the midst of noise and chaos. Everyone was incredibly friendly too- doormen, front desk staff- they always made it pleasant returning to our hotel with a smile and welcome. The room itself was normal NYC size (ie a little snug), but the separation between the bedroom and the small living area (couch pulled out to a bed) was actually very well laid out. And the sleeper sofa bed was not a miserable experience for our kids- they had a nice foam pad that made it very comfortable. I know, post kiddo bad dream one night I went and slept on it! Nice bathroom, everything was clean and well appointed, be prepared for very limited closet space- like 5 hangers worth. But they did their best with a nice dressing mirror, several small drawers and shelves in all the night stands. It has an attached restaurant, and is surrounded by great options- including Keens Steakhouse! I highly recommend this location and it’s a perfect option with kids. Safe travels!

Enjoy your stay here. The rooms are clean with modern bathrooms. My room was a queen size bed, and while not big, it was comfortable. Front desk was nice and the location was ideal. First night rate a little more than I wanted to spend but eventually balanced out on the 2nd and 3rd night.

I visited the Executive Hotel leSoleil in NYC for the past couple of days. What a great find...I booked through Expedia and this hotel did not disappoint!. The room was ready when we arrived so we were able to get an early check-in. The room was actually large, so unusual for NYC. It was spotless, towels were great, amenities were great, really great location. On 36th street with other hotels so not a lot of traffic noise at night. The hotel staff were outstanding, restaurant at the hotel was excellent, limited menu, but very good food and appetizers. If you are looking for a good hotel in this area, W. 36th Street, between 5th and 6th, don't miss this one, rates very reasonable for NYC. Pretty hotel as well, modern but not so modern that it was cold...the room had a very warm feel to it. Nice carpeting and clean, clean clean!

It's the only hotel in NYC that has it all: It is perfectly located so you are a short walking distance from both Time Square and Bryant Park. It is perfect for families (as it offers suits, so parents can enjoy some privacy). And all of that at a great price! We are booking it for every Christmas for our holiday NYC getaways. LOVE it!

Perfect location, hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The room was small and compact, but pretty much the norm for New York. We had a meal at the hotel the first night and it was lovely,. Yes I would recommend this hotel, especially for location, there's deli's close by and restaurants and a pub called the Keg Room just across road. Only five minutes away from Macys and approximately 10 mins from Times Square - perfect.

My sister and I stayed at this hotel and had the most wonderful time. We upgraded to a suite because we knew our suitcases would need more space.The staff were extremely friendly and the property was very clean.

Overall nice place, average service,very small rooms for the money, centrally located, good area, only the Bellman were very helpful and nice, other than that no one went an extra step, trust me! I would go back only in off season, bigger room if price was much lower.

I am from New York City but now live in Florida. I wanted to bring my boyfriend "home" for the holidays and chose this amazing hotel as our base for the experience. It did NOT disappoint! Staff are amazing,especially Andrew and Meredith. The view from our room was incredible and the accommodations, overall, were both comfortable and luxurious. Thank you for a perfect holiday trip. We will return!!!

We had an excellent experience! The room was nice and everything we expected. The location is perfect for sightseeing all of the Midtown attractions. An easy walk to Rockerfeller Centre, Times Square, Madison Square Gardens... We would definitely stay here again!

Just came into Manhattan for one night. On my own with 2 kids to see the Christmas magic of the city. This hotel is amazing. Extremely Clean, quiet, modern and very roomy especially by NY standards. Felt very safe alone at night walking to hotel no problem. Slept like a dream in comfortable bed with quality linens. Not a single noise from outside could be heard! Do yourself a favour. Stay here. Without a doubt amazing! The room set up with queen bed and sofa bed was excellent for traveling with kids. Bathroom with amazing shower divided the room nicely. We even had a partial view of Empire State from our room! We didn’t have time to eat here but it looked great too. Great location - easy walk from Penn station and we made our way to Rockefeller by foot that evening passing by Bryant Park which was lovely. Will stay here again for sure!

Great Experience Overall. Nice Room and View. Very clean with large bathrooms. Service at the desk was fantastic and friendly. Very helpful. The food at the restaurant was excellent with very nice wait staff. Selections were plentiful.

The hotel team was very professional and they help us a lot with everything that we needed. They can speak in spanish too. The room was totally clean all the days.The service was perfect.The hotel has a restaurant for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

This Hotel is a gem in the east side not too close to the bustle but walking distance to all the attractions. The concierge Scott was amazing and accurate with cab fares and walking times. His knowledge of the restaurants amazed me and we ate at his recommendation and were pleased,The helper in the front Joseph was also helpful with waving down cabs and arranging our luggage for storage.

Fantastic assistance by Yadira for our upcoming trip. I have just been dealing with Yadira regarding some special requests for our upcoming reservation and she has just been awesome and exceeded our expectations. We cannot wait to arrive in New York on 27 December to meet this great lady.

Really impressed with the timely and efficient customer service provided by Yadira ahead of our visit, so reassuring when you are travelling such a long way. We are very much looking forward to our stay.

Contacted the hotel via e-mail to clarify some things in advance of travel. Yadira at the hotel was prompt to reply, very positive and really helpful in answering the queries. Even ended up with a modest discount on the booking. Thank you.

Nice location, decor etc. was fine. For some bizarre reason, the towels wicked the water out to the edges of the fabric, and rather than becoming damp, you felt like you were merely spreading the water around.

We stayed at the hotel for a week, and never met an unfriendly staff member- everyone were so nice and helpful. The location is great- near Bryant park, Empire State building, Times square and a few subway stations. The room was a bit small but the bathroom was big and nice, and all in all we had everything we needed.

Hotel is clean, well located and staff is really friendly. We stayed for 1 week and had a great time.The rooms are not too big, so a little more storage space would have been appreciated. Our room was on 19th floor with great view towards Empire State Building.We had dinner at the hotel restaurant twice and like the food & service.

A fantastic hotel in a great, central location just around the corner from Macy’s. The rooms are spacious, modern and comfortable with plenty of useful amenities. The hotel staff have all been very friendly. Meredith was working at reception when we checked in and was extremely helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

This hotel was a pleasure to stay in spotless clean , all staff wonderfully friendly making our family stay a great success and it’s location was fantastic.5 min walk to Macy’s 5 min walk to the Empire State Building.

Just returned from NYC and after having stayed at Le Soleil for 4 days. Location is simply perfect, close to Times Square, Madison Square Garden, Empire State, Macy's (for shopping wife will be super happy). Staff has been always available and support received has been just perfect. Thanks to all of you, you've made our stay something to repeat!

From the minute we arrived to the minute we left I could not fault this hotel one bit.All the staff were extremely helpful but one person stood out in particular ,Jamie the porter he went over and beyond his call of duty to make our stay more enjoyable he organised everything for us .Thankyou Jamie from the 7 Irish ladies.A massive well done to all the staff at this fantastic hotel.

We found a lot of hotels in Manhattan and we finally booked the Hotel LeSoleil. The staff was awesome and very kind, the room was clean and the location was perfect. Cherry on the cake, we had a view on the Empire State Building. Thanks guys, we’re coming back!

My friend and I have visited NYC every December since 2014. We have stayed at the Le Soleil for the last 3 years. Everything is perfect-the location, the room cleanliness, and the friendliness of the staff. We can’t imagine staying anywhere else.

We received great service from Yadira Aviles at Reservations, she assisted me in making the booking which was fast, efficient and effortless. Can definitely recommend the hotel! Look forward to our next stay.

Great location. Very close to subway station. Macy’s and Empire state building are only 1 block away. I can see the empire state building from my room. Nice and friendly staffs. Yadira was really helpful about my reservation. Room is clean and new. I got the a surprise welcome gift and letter from the GM, Mr. Loizos. Thank you very much. I will definitely stay here again.

We had an issue with our booking before leaving Australia and booking.com could not help us at all. However Yadira reached out to us and resolved our issue promptly and with fantastic customer service. Extremely friendly and helpful. We look forward to checking in for our Christmas holiday!

I have a very pleasant and efficient experience with my reservation.I’m very happy and I look forward to spend my Holidays here. I had a problem with my reservation because I needed five night and no more six, as a I’ve fixed, but they allow me to solve very easily. Thanks to Yadira

Booked a queen bed and pull out sofa room for our family trip, and the accommodations were great. At checkin, we were greeted warmly by Nicole, who had wine ready to go for guests. The street noise was very minimal, and the bed was comfortable. The location is great for walking to nearby landmarks, and close to major subway lines. Would stay here again!

great location for all midtown must see destinationsfriendly staff, pricey but location worth the extra cost, 2 mins from 5th Avenuegood sized rooms for NYgood irish pub opposite and coffee shops/delis very close

We travel to NYC yearly and this fabulous hotel has become the only place we stay. The location is perfect and the hotel staff is amazing. We love interacting with Jaime at the front entrance and all the other employees as well. Thank you for a wonderful time. We will be back....

We stayed in this hotel in October 2017 and we are about to fly out tomorrow to celebrate our daughter's 18th. She chose to stay here again as it was so great last time in terms of location, service and the room layout for 3 adults, ensuring we weren't on top of each other!I have had alot of contact with Yadira via email at the hotel as we ended up booking direct this time rather than via Booking.com as the rate was cheaper. She gave us some great options and has helped to arrange a surprise for my daughter for her 18th. Always very responsive, replying almost immediately and we can't wait to get there tomorrow.

Yadira has been wonderful to work with! We received a free upgrade on our room! Our booking has been easy and worry free. We look forward to staying again. Christmas in New York is truly a magical experience.

Loved the hotel!! Staff, doormen and Meredith were great. Room was very nice and roomy for NYC. Great location and Great stay. Happy hour and music was also a plus. Great location to all the sights and Christmas time is magical in NYC. We will be back

This was a clean hotel, in a very good location. Easy access to most of Mid-town's attractions. The room was small and presented some issues for a couple with luggage. The accompanying restaurant had a nice atmosphere with good food.
user_name:
boconnor2019
New York City, New York

review_body: Very fun trip at a very good hotel. It was a great location to get anywhere in the city, and a very helpful staff that was willing to answer any questions you had as well as provide very good recommendations of places to visit.

We stayed at the LeSoleil for the first time for our annual Christmas season trip. Nice room with a dramatic view of the Empire State Building. Very friendly, helpful and professional staff. A block from Macy’s, and very close to Times Square, Bryant Park, NY Public Library. Lively bar with fun happy hour (house-made tonic for their gin & tonics) and solid restaurant.

The hotel staff are all super friendly. The experience was super. They gave us an upgrade upon arrival from a room and sofa for 4 to a room suite with 2 separate beds which was incredible. Best to book from their hotel directly for the best prices.

Overall experience was just ok. One of the front desk staff was very unaccommodating however another one was twice as fabulous as she needed too be. We had a refrigerator that did not work. and was told to use ice...how about sending up a repair man or a new fridge. we drank warm beverages. As mentioned the room was NOT super clean and the bedding in the pull out couch had a stained blanket. We also had called house keeping one evening and they did not supply us so we had to call again in the morning...not life or death but not acceptable.

Lovely, clean, fresh hotel in a great location.Staff all extremely helpful, especially Nicole on the main reception desk. Queen room is a good size with queen bed and sofa bed. Would definitely recommend

This is my first time to New York City. It’s a very nice property and in a great location to visit sites to be seen for the first time. Nicole and Keron were very helpful and welcoming when we checked in as was the rest of the staff during our stay!

Amazing check in although late at night All needs covered Location couldn’t be better Bar facilities exceptional All staff extremely helpful especially Joseph , Luis and Meredith . We will definitely be back Great start to the Christmas season

Haven’t even arrived and we are already very impressedYadira has already contacted us Twice to ensure all our special requests have been taken care of.In a busy city such a NY with thousands of hotels and travelers they take the time to contact the guests prior to arrival to welcome them... looking forward to the start of a great weekend!

I wanted to prepay my trip so the guest joining me could check-in before I arrived. The staff was so accommodating and made the process a snap! I cannot wait for our stay, this is my favorite time of the year to visit NYC.

Really enjoyed our 5 night stay at the Executive hotel LeSoleil, great hotel in midtown Manhattan, excellent view of the ESB from our room on the 19th floor. All staff very helpful and friendly from the housekeeping to the reception, in particular Meredith on reception. Would not hesitate on recommending this hotel for any one on a break in NYC. 5 stars.

We really loved our stay here! Friendly staff, clean rooms and a great view! The location is wonderful in regards to walking to major destinations. Meredith was super helpful and friendly our entire stay!!

The location of this Hotel is amazing. The quality of the rooms are good and the staff is very friendly with a great service! The rooms are quiet too and you can sleep very well im the middle of Manhattan!

From the moment we walked in everyone was so nice and accommodating. A very cute hotel. So glad we chose hotel le soliel for our stay! Very clean rooms. Great location. Staff is awesome! Will definitely stay here again when we come back.

New york is fantastic during Christmas time and this hotel is in a very good positionthe staff of the hotel is great extremely helpful and friendly... they helped me to plan my holiday in a wonderful way. Thanks to Yadira!

The staff (especially Yadira) went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect for our family of 6. Communication has been excellent with regular updates. The hotel is amazing with everything you need onsite i.e gym, restaurant and more.

Great location, clean, pull out bed was terrible, staff was very accommodating. All staff was very helpful especially the doormen, they were great. Front desk staff was great also, ALL the staff was very helpful and accommodating.

This is my 4th stay at this property. My first 3 visits were excellent. This stay was different. Checkin issues, payment limitations, room cleaning were not up to previous stays. The afternoon front staff we’re excellent and made every effort to resolve my issues. Perhaps the busy Tim’s was the reason .
Great hotel in perfect location for shopping and sightseeing.Very helpful and friendly service. Very comfortable and spotlessly clean rooms.I would highly recommend this hotel. Wifi very good also! .

The hotel was extremely clean, staff were welcoming, helpful, and very professional. Great Location to stay for Thanksgiving Parade. My family was impressed by the freindliness of all the staff. My family had two rooms. We stayed on the 12th floor facing the street. the room was spacey and very comfortable. On the fifth floor not facing the street the room was little small, however it was very clean comfortable enough.

I have nothing to complain about. Everything was literally EXCELLENT. The view was amazing, the service was great, clean rooms. I was right around the corner from Time Square, so it was perfect starting point to start our day. Will come back to this place.

It's our first trip to the Big Apple and couldn't be happier with the choice of our hotel. We booked the Empire View Queen Room (to ensure it's on higher floor) and stayed for 6 nights. We had a room on the 16th floor and there are only 8 rooms on this level so never had to wait long for the lifts as some travellers experienced at other hotels and it's fairly quiet too. The mid-town location is excellent, Macy's is just round the corner, 10 mins walk to Times Square, subway stations of all major lines nearby, loads of bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood, the list is endless .... Have read about the lack of wardrobe and storage space beforehand but not a big issue for us. What we like most is the spacious walk-in shower. We had a truly fantastic stay at Executive Hotel LeSoleil and can't wait to return in the future :-)

Great location, very friendly staff. One is greeted with a glass of red wine, nice touch! The location is convenient, easy walking distance.The rooms are small, to open the suitcase it needs to go on the bed but more than adequate. Clean, friendly staff. Would stay again.

Very good location, near everything. Very friendly and helpful staff. Very good concierge. Modern Hotel, with very comfortable and clean rooms. It was my second stay in this Hotel and surely not the last.

The hotel overall is doable, but the food in the restaurant is only average, the layout of my room had the desk and credenza so it lined up with the bathroom door opening, so had to literally climb over the chair to put my feet under the desk or to get up. After checking in I noticed that several grapes (with stem) were on the floor, so obviously missed by housekeeping from the prior occupant. Had to call multiple times to get a copy of my receipt that they were to email. Was abruptly put on hold for over 7 minutes when calling to find out about the receipt. If they are that busy at the front desk, then staffing considerations need to be taken into consideration. Was told that my female colleague and I couldn't be located on the same floor as no room. Yet three male colleagues (1 of whom checked in after us) were all on the same floor with me, except for her. Poor planning and execution I'm afraid. Somewhat dated appearance inside the hotel. Needs tweaking.

We go to NYC every year first week of December for a business conference and a fun weekend. For the last several years we've stayed at Executive Hotel LeSoleil. The location is excellent, vibe is cool, rooms are great and service is first class. This year we were disappointing that the hotel was sold out for one of our nights. After contacting Yadira Aviles in reservations, she managed to make it happen and all together, at better rate than anything we could find of this quality. She is a great communicator via phone and email.I would suggest calling her if you cant get what you need from the website. Thanks, Scott W.

Deposit taken on 1st day and nearly 1 month later I'm still waiting to receive my deposit back. Totally unacceptable. When I checked out I was told I had no extra charges so why is my deposit still being held

Everyone was so accommodating and friendly at the hotel. Even after we checked out, hotel staff offered us complimentary bottled water and also checked in to see if we had any questions about activities/places to visit in the city. Great location and very clean, comfortable rooms!

We loved everything about this hotel. The doormen were always so helpful and polite! WE needed to call the front desk a few times and they were always so polite and came up to our room quickly! We stayed in an executive suite with 2 queen beds and it was roomy and clean! We will definitely be staying here again.

The queen suite was great. No door between sitting area and bedroom but OK for close friends on sofa bed. Front staff very friendly. Doorman is helpful. Fair priced restaurants nearby. Easy access to subway and buses.

Clean? Yes. Updated? Yes. This was a perfect midtown property to call home base for my wife, adult daughter and I during a four day fun trip to the city. Pull out couch in small sitting room worked perfect as a second room for our daughter and gave all of us enough privacy. Staff were helpful and pleasant. No complaints!

I was in New York for a class and my parents were staying here. My airbnb has fallen through, so I came back to the executive to see if they had any rooms available. At first they didn’t but Nicole found me a room. She’s a lifesaver, I wouldn’t have had anywhere to stay or would’ve spend the better part of the night looking for another hotel. Both Nicole and Herntz were super friendly. I’d definitely stay here again.

Overall fantastic location in the heart of NY, ideal for getting around either by foot or public transport. All hotel staff friendly and helpful. Rooms comfortable and very enjoyable stay. Will definitely be back. Thank You..

Hotel excellent, all staff especially the reception and door greeters exceptional!! Loved our stay! Will definitely return to this hotel! Location is great, just off of fifth avenue, ideal to see all the sites with a short walk

I am due to stay there on 5th of December and due to over booking on my airline I will be arriving a bit earlier in the day than anticipated. So I emailed the hotel and had a response almost immediately Yadira was lady’s name who dealt with me she was so nice and helped me with all my concerns. If customer service is anything to go by I am sure my stay will be excellent. Many thanks. Jason

My wife and I traveled to NY City for 4 days to celebrate my 50th b-day. (our 2nd time in NY). Starting from Luis at the front desk, concierge, maintenance staff to the front door staff, breakfast staff, Thank you all for welcoming us to your Hotel and most of all the bottle of wine left in our room!! Scott at the concierge, thank you so much for all the recommendations, we really appreciate it. This Hotel is clean, beautiful views, safe, everything is walking distance. We can't wait to go back again! Note: the only thing we suggest is to offer more options for breakfast even though everything was delicious!

The hotel was clean, in a great location, and staff was super helpful and friendly. I spent a great deal of time researching a place to stay for our family trip to NYC. I found a winner in this place. Would definitely return again next time I stay in the city.

Family of four staying 6 nights and we really enjoyed our stay! Spacious and clean rooms, very friendly and proffesional staff and great location in midtown Manhattan. Good breakfast with great coffe:)

A must stay for adventure in the City. I spent the weekend of 11/10 - 11/12 for The Veterans Day parade. Had a wonderful time at the hotel. The room we stayed in had a view that is great and the staff made us feel special, even though we are not veterans. The fact that wifey used to be in the military makes it a memorial event. Staying in the hotel is what made this trip, starting with the warm welcome upon check in, to the quiet elevator ride to the room then the pillows on the bed that guarantees your sleep. You can't go wrong with this location. Though I've stayed here before i will continue to come back to my second home.
user_name:
js670044
New York City, New York

review_body: «Fantastic, modern, very clean, very central located . Near everythingBeautiful and comfortable rooms with spaces designed to be exploited to the smallest detail to allow maximum comfort.Staff really kind and helpful, really a commendation for all the guys at the reception and the bar. Fast check-in and check-out with the possibility of storing luggage - professional staff - EXCELLENT VALUE FOR MONEY  Very pleasant stay. We will definitely come back here if we stay in NY again "

Excellent rooms! I loved it! Staff very helpful and friendly during our stay! We booked two rooms and they were both super comfortable! There’s an excellent restaurant called Trademark where you can find tasteful food and great staff! I’ll be back for sure!

The hotel is very good. Location perfect, at higher floor the silence is guaranteed.The only problem is the sofà bed for two people in the executive suite room. It could be good only for two little kids. The bathroom is clean and sufficiently good, but small for four

My trip is coming up shortly but I wanted to write a note specifically regarding the pre arrival service I've received so far, which has been excellent. I got in touch to confirm my reservation before arriving and so far the service has been fantastic.Not only did I receive fast and friendly responses but I received some great enhancements to my visit all thanks to an amaziing reservation assistant. I'm really looking forward to my stay and if the pre arrival service is anything to go by my trip will be excellent. I'll write a review on the hotal stay once my trip is over.

I rarely write reviews for anything, mainly for lack of time. I was impressed with this small boutique hotel and will definitely return. The staff were to a person quite friendly and gracious. The room was fresh, modern, comfortable and in an excellent state of repair. No issues whatsoever. Excellent value in my opinion. Will return.

We received a very warm welcome on arrival and check in was very quick and easy. Room was spacious, very clean and comfortable with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building. We had a bath with a shower and every time we used the shower the water ran down the window (the shower should have been located down the other end of the bath). We had a microwave, fridge, sink and coffee machine (kettle available on request). There was also a safe, an iron and iron board in the room. There was very little hanging space in an open unit though. Bottled water was provided every day.The staff were very friendly and helpful except for one lady working in the bar. Breakfast menu was very limited but there are plenty of places nearby to eat instead.Fantastic location, very close to the Empire State Building and Macey's. There was also bars and plenty of plenty of places to eat within a very short walk. Times Square and Grand Central Station were about a 10 minute walk away also. We would definitely consider staying at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil again if we ever return to New York.

A very good location in Manhattan. Rooms are small and as a couple we were provided a shoebox seized room. nearby restaurants and sightseeing was great. Very good access to subway and pubic transportation.

expected more since I ”upgraded” my initial booking to include bigger room and breakfast on premisses. The room was average size except for the entrance area where there was nothing but a foldable bed/sofa. One would expect a closet to put the outdoor attire in at the least. The sofa was useless and was the second TV set on the wall. Otherwise room was OK. The service left a lot to be desired: out of our 7 nights stay 3 days we had to ask for the room to be cleaned and towels changed, bed made...and this was 3/4 pm! We made sure that there was NO do not disturb sign on the door after 11 AM. The food was adequate but there was always lack of some items which one considers essential ,like bread, fruit, eggs,,,,There was NO decaffeinated coffee unless one asked for it and on one occasion I had to pay extra to receive it, inspite of the fact that breakfast was ”included”. Service people seemed rushed and overworked. So I can only give the hotel an average grade, certainly below the advertised quality

I have chosen the hotel for its proximity to the early morning bus pick-up at Bryant Park for the NY Marathon. The staff is friendly and helpful and the room are functional with a good bed. Room for improvement: The breakfast offering is uninspired and underwhelming (same offering every day with little variety). In addition, it was unfortunate that during marathon week the treadmills in the gym were out of order (there were a couple of other marathon runners staying at the hotel).

Location, location and once more location. Hotel located in the middle of everything. On foot you can reach all Broadway theaters, Lincoln center events and Flatiron district restaurants. Hotel is clean and cozy. Staff reacted to all our requests in friendly and fast manner.

My husband and I met friends in NTC in October, 2019. We stayed at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil and were pleasantly surprised with the location. The Empire State Building was only 2 blocks away. The rooms were small but efficient. The service was superior. I left my passcode notebook in our room. I did not realize my mistake until we were back home in Idaho. Of course I panicked and called the hotel immediately. After a few phone calls, everything was resolved and my notebook sent back to me in Idaho. I especially wanted to thank Herntz. He was instrumental in organizing the rescue. Herntz and the whole crew were so personable and eager to help. Thank you!

Perfect location. Cleaning could improve in the bathroom a little. The did not even dry it and the soap was all messed up. Door to the bathroom can not be closed easily as it does not have a handle (per design) but not even a dent on the door to be able to pull it. Breakfast runs out of coffee, pastries, fruit, milk, etc. Guests have to remain the staff to check and change/fill them up again at the busiest time of breakfast. On the good side, dinner is quite nice!

Nice hotel with very good locations, near 5th Av, Times Square. Only thing to improve is breakfast, same every day with no changes and no fresh juice. Clean, silent rooms. Nice, smile, helpful service.

Everything was perfect: excellent location of the hotel, very personalized welcome, friendly staff always ready to help and to give advice, good breakfast.in a well decorated restaurant room (music a bit too loud), cosy bedrooms (ask to be at a high floor to avoid the noise coming from the street)... In short, very good experience with my family.

From check-in to check-out everything was smooth and quick. Our room was perfect.Joseph and Nicole are amazing and the overall experience was Great! We are looking forward to returning as soon as possible.

The location was perfect. Near 34th Street subway. Room was clean. Staff helpful. Food options nearby are lacking but the restaurant in the hotel was better than expected. The breakfast buffet is nice. Easy to get to and around city from this location.

Strange experience. Service very good. Room was cramp, badly set out. No bathroom door which actually looked directly to a large mirror so no privacy. On whole good stay. Private party on the Saturday and bar closed however manager was great and paid for us to have a couple of rounds in the lounge. Would stay again. But please ... new doors pls.
