Not stayed here yet but Expedia made 2 bookings in my name with only 1 visible to me.Expedia no use at all but the problem quickly and efficiently sorted out by Yadira at the hotel, if all the staff are as helpful we are in for another great stay in NY.

We commend this hotel for its superb service and super friendly staff. Facility/rooms are clean and nice design. Fast and reliable service, especially Joseph (bellman) and staffs at the desk. I love their toilettries

The Executive Le Soleil was a lovely hotel in the perfect location for visiting New York, Macy’s and Empire State Building were 5 mins away and Times Square 10 mins. The hotel was very well decorated, clean and value for money half the price of other hotels and not so good. The staff from cleaners to reception to the concierge guys were all friendly positive and had a can do attitude. A home away from home and tranquility amongst the huddle and bustle, the hotel and staff should be very proud of themselves

We traveled to NYC to celebrate my husband's birthday. I emailed the hotel in advance to let them know about our celebration and Yadira was kind enough to surprise us with a bottle of wine and nice birthday card! The room we had initially booked felt pretty tight for 2 people/4 nights (yes, it is NYC and rooms are small), but we decided to request a room change and we were VERY pleased with the change (we paid the difference p/night). MEREDITH and LOUIS in the front desk are SUPER STARS!! Always smiling, kind, courteous and genuinely interested in how our day was. Eager to help, provide information and tips. They are just the kind of people/professionals you want to be greeted by! The location of the hotel is unbeatable!! 2 blocks away from Empire State building, few steps away from 5th Ave., and surrounded by plenty of cafes and restaurants of all kinds and for all budgets. We can't wait to be back in NYC and for sure will stay again at LeSoleil!

We recently stayed at the Executive Hotel and the experience was great! as we arrived we were greeted and assisted at the front door, by friendly and genuine staff. Checking in was seamless and we were directed to our room. The rooms are well appointed but most importantly clean and elegant. While unpacking our luggage we recognized that there is ample space to place your items while maintaining a clutter free environment. Because of our late afternoon arrival we decided to dine in then hotel restaurant and called down to make reservations. Upon arrival in the dining area we were greeted by staff and seated almost immediately. The menu is well rounded and the food is gourmet and we offered our compliments to the Chef. All the staff in the dining area was friendly and accomadating and the food was presented well and was very good.We stayed at the Executive Hotel for two days and have only praise for the staff and management! We can wholeheartedly recommend anyone that is visiting midtown Manhattan that a stay at the Executive Hotel is a must. We will definitely will be staying at this hotel on our next visit to the Big Apple!

Underwhelmed by waking in. Very plain, nothing special. Upon check in we were directed to our executive suite for 2 adults and 2 children. When we got to our room, there was a sofa that pulled out into a bed and a queen bed. One problem: when the sofa was pulled out it blocked the door/exit. Not worth the $400 price tag for Suite that blocks the exit. Never would stay again. Bathroom also was plain, nothing special in toiletries. Cash bar in room had dented soda cans and beer. No remote for second TV in room. View was terrible, nothing to see.

Very Fun trip.Very nice people/staff. that worked at LeSoleil. Door men were very helpful. They could have used another elevator. Elevator hallway was small. Restaurant was a little pricey, but then again so is NY.

Truly, the location is wonderful. We walked everywhere and never used the subway. Lots of great restaurants nearby as well as a Starbucks and a Dunkin Donuts if you're so inclined. What impressed us the most was how professional, friendly, happy, and anxious to help every single staff member we met was. The people who took very special care of us in particular were: Herntz, Eranny, Louis, and Andre. There was another young woman who was also very helpful, but sadly I cannot remember her name to thank her. Eranny will know who I'm talking about. Full disclosure is that the rooms are small, but when you're in NYC, how much time do you really spend in your room. We had a wonderful experience and appreciate the attitude and atmosphere of the Executive Hotel LeSoleil.

This is a lovely little hotel staffed with friendly and delightful people. The room was comfortable, clean and cozy. Bathroom was nice and spacious with a great walk in shower. The food and adult beverages at the adjoining restaurant was so good that we found ourselves eating there often, especially after a long day at meetings.

Lovely hotel with a warm, modern style. We purchased a breakfast-included room, and were very pleased with the quality and choice of the breakfast. Our room, though not a suite, was still very large with a small chaise lounge and kitchenette. The location is handy to the subway. The staff were all pleasant and friendly. The room was very quiet and had a view of the empire state building!

Excellent 4 night stay in very convenient location - within walking distance of Penn and Grand Central Stations so very easy to get to from the airports. Definitely worth paying the extra for a superior room judging by the other reviews - we were on the 17th floor with an amazing view straight up the Empire State and open views south. large room with plenty of space. Sink, fridge, microwave with plates and cutlery if needed. Free bottles of water every day was welcome! Good breakfast was included - plenty of choice. Happy hour in the bar from 4-6pm. Nice staff throughout. Clean and tidy hotel which was easy to walk to all the main areas such as theatres, Times Square, 42nd St, adjacent to Empire State and very close to Subway which made getting to all attractions very easy

Really enjoyed my stay in LeSoleil. Concierge desk was super helpful and assisted me with a broken suitcase and tips for restaurant for breakfast. Room was bigger than expected for NYC hotel and sleep quality was excellent as we did not hear the traffic.

Good value hotel. Great location. Friendly service. Room sizes are adequate as opposed to spacious. Clean and tidy. Would certainly stay although cannot justify how that can justify a resort charge !!

Super Location, well-kept rooms, very friendly, helpful service. Good price-performance ratio. Good accessibility of the sights. From our room we had a direct view of the Empire State Building. Grand Central Station can be reached on foot in approx. 10 minutes.

Absolutely 1st class hotel great location. Nothing was to much trouble for the staff. Special thanks to Nicole on reception she is a credit to your hotel.Room was clean and comfortable. Will definitely stay here again.

We stayed in an executive queen suite. It was small but very clean and had all the amenities we needed for 3 people. The staff was very friendly and would always greet us upon return to the hotel. Self-parking was easy ( only 3 buildings from hotel) and much cheaper than valet. The location in Midtown was perfect for sightseeing. I would definitely stay here again!

My stay at the hotel was exceptionally wonderful. The room was clean and very nice. The best part of my stay was the wonderful doorman. They greeted us kindly everyday every night each and every time entering in and out of the hotel. Isaiah, Jamie, Joseph and Keron were wonderful host they made the trip fun and it felt like homeweeExtra special kudos to Isaiah!!!

The room was too tiny and there was not a proper closet but everything else was excellent. The location was perfect. The food in the restaurant was too expensive but good. We enjoyed the piano man. We arrived early from an overnight flight and were exhausted. It would have been nice if we could have checked in early.

A lovely hotel in a superb location, facilities and cleanliness were excellent. The Staff were very accommodating, friendly and all went the extra mile to help us, The hotel should be very very proud of itself, It made our experience in NYC a very positive one

Great experience and place. The room was comfortable with great view to New York City skylines. Restaurant with excellent food and good variation of dishes and drinks. The reception was friendly and effective.

I had to cancel my reservation after my « free cancellation » date because of an emergency in Europe which prevented my wife and I from returning to USA. They cancelled my reservation without it necessary for me to pay anything. They also showed sincere empathy for our situation and wished a successful outcome. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to New York. I have not often written reviews , but I think the consideration they showed me deserved sincere praise.Michael WSeattle

At the very center of midtown the hotel is at 36st between 5th and 6th. The hotel looks new. rooms are quite big beautifully and well equipped with a sitting corner and a sofa that can open for a bad so it can be used for 3-4. The staff very nice and friendly.Restaurant is offering meals which are not included. Breakfast 25$ per person including children. Very poor variety and in half the cost you can have a breakfast around the block and even better. The fitness is terrible! For those of us who like to run and don’t do it out in the heart of the city, a great disappointment. I chose the hotel after checking that it has good enough equipment but what if 3 of 5 machines are out of order? I am always running with my wife but we had to take shifts as only one treadmill was working. We reported about it every day but nothing really happened. All in all a good hotel with great rooms.

This is the best hotel for this price point in this neighborhood of NY for a business traveler. Great staff, comfortable room - the restaurant attached is really good with fantastic bar tenders for solo travelers. Love this place -

Property perfect for all our needs! Great location and services. Employees were all helpful and courteous. They provided answers to all our questions. We will definitely consider LeSoleil if we ever return to Manhattan!

This hotel is very clean and attractive. The staff is incredible...especially Meredith at the Front Desk and Joseph at the door! They were so kind, helpful, friendly and attentive! They made us feel so welcome! We did not eat at the restaurant, but did have cocktails/beer every day. They have very creative cocktails and a nice beer selection. The bartender was very attentive and provided good service. We do, however, have one significant complaint: the air conditioner operates by motion so when you sleep, no matter the temperature you set, it will not turn on because you are not moving through the room! We were extremely uncomfortable and did not sleep well at all. The beds are very comfortable, though, thankfully and the room had a nice "living" area with a couch. Well appointed and very clean.

Last week was our 5th time visiting Manhattan from Florida. The LeSoleil was the best hotel we have stayed in NYC.One reason is that the suite rooms have necessary extra space for spreading out and storing suitcases and bags. Since there are no closets for hanging clothes this was a wonderful “plus”!The bathroom is a great size and the beds and sheets are comfy. Floor to ceiling windows bring in light, and blackout curtains keep room dark in the early morning. Bring ear plugs for street noise. There is a nice desk , mini fridge , coffee maker and we had two televisions. All staff members are extremely amiable and efficient. Concierge, bellmen, front desk, restaurant employees- all provided excellent and friendly service!!!There is a living room area with chairs, couches, and coffee tables. The restaurant serves breakfast, lunch and dinner, and has a full bar.If you “opt for” the breakfast included in your room choice, you will have the same items to eat every day- scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon & sausage, oatmeal, toast & bread, croissants and jams, juices, and fresh fruit. Everything was good, but it would be nice if the eggs were maybe poached with a sauce, over easy, or served omelette style, for a change every few days. We had cocktails and snacks one night before leaving for a 7:00 play, and everything was delicious. Actually the only thing that I did not like during our 5 day stay was the coffee served in the morning. It tasted like burned bean grinds. So harsh that I had to go back to room to get coffee that I could drink. The location in midtown is perfect - near the Empire State Building, Macy’s, restaurants, and is an “easy walk” to Broadway, Times Square,....Had a wonderful stay! Three couples traveling together.

The room provided everything we could need—Keurig coffee maker, refrigerator, iron, bathrobe, even an umbrella! And when we called for help on how to work something, like the Keurig, a houseman appeared in less than 5 minutes.And the bar made a great martini.

We are discerning travellers and found everything was excellent. Very tastefully appointed, no bad smells, very quiet. Everything in the room seemed brand new and the whole place is spic and span, The staff especially were very accommodating and the facilities are clean and modern. The restaurant & bar, The Trademark, which is managed by a really wonderful man named Ryan, was fabulous! We were delighted when we discovered it on Yelp as one of the best in the area! It lived up to the reviews. They even have a Peloton bike in the little gym!

Repeat customer here, definitely willing to come back :-)Three weeks ago (mid September) we spent a week at NYC, staying at Le Soleil. What a wonderful hotel. It's exactly the way we expected it (2nd time there). Superb location in midtown. This really makes a difference with respect to the feeling you get with a trip, being 5min away from Bryant Park is awesome.

Yadira in Reservations is an incredible Ambassdor for this hotel.She took time to hear all of my questions. She listened with a compassionate ear and walked me through booking a hideaway to help journey through the sudden passing of my mom.If this hotel is half as wonderful as Yadira, we will be blessed!I wish I had more than 5 stars to give ***************************

We enjoyed this hotel very much, and it is very well located for our garment business meetings. We plan to stay again on our next visit to New York. The staff is most helpful and the neighborhood is safe and friendly.
user_name:
jimpoleski
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: First time to NYC and great first impressions when pulled up to this hotel. Check in was easy and location was excellent with easy walks to Times Square and Broadway as well as access to the subway system. Quiet in the room so sleep was not an issue considering location. Short ride to from La Guardia airport and very helpful and knowledgeable doormen and concierge.

I visited with some friends in May this year. We booked through Booking.com. We paid a deposit in advance and were due to pay the rest upon checkout. Whilst we were there the hotel took the rest of the payment on the card we booked on AND also asked us to pay in full on check out. When we got home my friend checked her bank and realised they had made a mistake. They took £394 too much and have refused to refund this. My friend has repeatedly tried to get in touch to have this money refunded and they are now refusing to get in touch with her and have stopped replying to emails. This is completely unacceptable! To this day they are still refusing to refund us.

Can't recommend this hotel enough.Super friendly staff (on arrival, sorting a question we had with card payment and arranging travel back to JFK for a great price), beautiful rooms also really large(especially for New York), we had a queen room which even had enough space for a sink, fridge, coffee maker and a microwave!Kept in constant email communication with yadira before our trip who was amazingly helpful in sorting our room with the view we wanted and making sure it was all sorted for our arrival as my partner is a Dr so isn't easy to always have the time so deal with things outside of work but yadira was more than happy to deal with myself (room was booked in her name)Will certainly be staying again next time we get back! Stephen

The hotel is very centrally paced for sightseeing and business. The rooms are small but adequate in size and are clean. The bathroom was generous in size. We had a problem with the plug in the sink which the staff never did get fixed while we were there. But overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to others.

I would recommend Executive Le Soleil based upon its great location, friendly staff and very quiet rooms. The layout for our upgraded suite was a little odd but we made the best of the extra room. There also weren't a lot of hangers for clothes but that was minor. We would stay at this hotel again.

This hotel was a great find, centrally located, it was an easy walk to Central Park and had excellent subway access. The room was small but it was clean and looked newly remodeled. The best part, however, was the staff. The bellmen were both great. Jaime set up our rides to and from the hotel and followed up to make sure everything was set. When we got to our room, the staff sent us up a bottle of wine for our anniversary. We had an excellent dinner in the restaurant and Muriel the bartender was great. The buffet breakfast was very good. We checked out to drive to Vermont and when we got back, there was a bottle of champagne waiting for us in the room. If I could give six stars to this hotel, I certainly would. I highly recommend this hotel.

center of everything ! Getting to hotel from Penn Station NY is less than 10mins walk with your bags. the location is walkable to many awesome sites like the Bee Hive (Vessel), Empire State Building, MSG, Macy's and Times Square..bring comfortable shoes ! The room with Queen bed is a little cramped for space, not good if you bring big suitcases.

It was a beautiful hotel and was so close to everything. (Time Square, Empire State Bldg,broadway, shopping, restaurants, etc) The staff was awesome. They were all so willing to help you with everything. The buffet breakfast was great.

Choosing the Executive le Soleil after reading all the reviews was the best decision for this trip. First, the entire staff from top to bottom was so lovely and personable. A true pleasure. And the amenities and rooms were just enough and a great value.Secondly, the location was perfection. Right in the middle of midtown’s midpoint. Easy access to every shopping, dining and entertainment option NYC has to offer.

Nice place, good people, perfect service, room generous (suite 15th floor), everything within reach, perfect not only for a one week stay in big apple. See you next time, stay tuned :-) The sun is up, the sky is blue, it's beautiful and so are you!

Very friendly staff who looked to cater to every need. In the heart of the city which was perfect, near NYC attractions. Room was clean, small but very functional. WiFi. Gym was good and onsite restaurant was pleasant with good food.

I’ve stayed here at least 10 times over the past 3-4 years. It’s a great centra location, comfortable and quiet rooms and all the employees are very nice and helpful. I will be back again later this fall!

The location is very convenient and is a short walk to all of the attractions in New York. The staff are friendly and the hotel and its rooms are clean and comfortable. I'll definitely stay in this hotel again next time I want to visit.

i would recommend this hotel to everyone, very nice, extremely clean, great helpful staff, nice restaurant. great location.. easy access to get around the city and subways .. very lovely hotel.. they deserve a 5 start rating!!

My family and I had an amazing time in this Manhattan hotel we just discovered. Walking distance to Macy's, herald square, times square, 5th Avenue, Penn station and all. The staff are warm and friendly.

I reviewed this hotel before my trip because I was so blown away by the incredible customer service of everyone I encountered, but especially Yadira from reservations. I'm not someone who has a lot of dispensable income, so this trip was a big deal for me, and Yadira made my mom and I feel like we were VIPs. Every single detail was perfect, from ease of check in, to the room, to the bottle of wine sent to our room for my mom's 70th birthday. Along with the wine was a lovely note, handwritten by Yadira, wishing my mom a happy birthday. We received an upgrade with a beautiful view of the empire state, and the room was wonderful. The treatment we received during our stay was enough to make a life long customer of me and everyone I know. I attended CatCampNYC during that trip and told everyone I saw how amazing this hotel was. When I got home, I told everyone at the cancer center where I work that they need to stay here the next time they're in New York. I truly can't say enough though about what a treasure Yadira is. We had never met before, but she greeted me like family and went way above and beyond to make our stay the best ever. You have a customer for life, and I genuinely feel like I made a friend. Thank you from the bottom of my heart! Sincerely, Stacie Sullivan

Wow, what an exciting and excellent experience. Our family was visiting(our god daughter 1st time in NYC) for a special y as Yankees game tribute for my late father whom passed away. He would have been 80 years old. To our blessing, the Yankees plays on his birthday. This hotel staff and services were exceptional and awesome. Took care of our needs. Traveling with kids can be tough but they made our experience low stress and memorable. We will definitely be back to this hotel.

My family enjoyed the warmth of the hotel especially Andre who was simply great! The rooms were always clean, the food was good too & the staff courteous. Location is also cool. 2 minutes walk to Macy's, 5 mins to the Penn Station &15 mins to Times Square.

We randomly chose this hotel and we haven’t been disappointed. Yes, it’s not the cheapest however the level of service from the bell boys to reception to the amazing crew in the bar has made our trip a wonderful experience. The location of this hotel is close to most things, yet far away from the noise and dizzy lights of Times Square. We’re planning to return to NYC and we’ll definitely stay in this hotel again.

Good location, lovely room although quite small. Staff all very friendly. Bar closes about 11 so don’t expect a night cap there after an evening out because you’ll be told ‘we’re closed!’Didn’t eat there so can’t comment on the food.

The location is unbeatable. 2 blocks from 34th st subway station and PATH to New Jersey where Korean town and Macy’s can satisfy all your dining and shopping needs. 10 minutes walk from Penn station to take the train to Long Island. There’s no better location to be in NYC. I used to live in the area and that’s why I chose this place the first time I returned to the city for business.The service is great too. I emailed them for a copy of the receipt and they got back to me in hours. Highly recommend for trips to NYC no matter for business or leisure.

From the front desk, to the doormen, to the maintenance guys and maids all were top notch #1. Had an early flight to NYC from Florida got to Penn station and walked a couple blocks to hotel my wife and I. Figured we would drop our luggage at hotel and go walking until check in time, but no they insisted we go to our room at 11:00 am and get settled, Awesome! The front desk was at all times helpful and helpful with a smile. The two doormen were great and very knowledgeable, sent us to some great places to eat and easy directions to where we wanted to go. Ran into the maintenance guys in elevator asked where the computer room was and he personally took me there. The hotel was super clean, the room was great just what we needed and always had a clean fresh room. The location was perfect walk to time square, central park and the big red bus on the corner. Could not be more impressed with this hotel and will definitely be back.David KempfVero Beach Florida

I don’t usually give top marks, but I will this time. We had a great stay in NY, and part of it was due to the hotel. Outstanding customer service when we got to the hotel about 1 AM after 24 hours trip (a big thank you, André), perfect room service and a warm “Good morning!” every day by Joseph. I don’t want to forget Yadira, and I apologize for not being able to give the names of other members of the staff we met. Good service, a smile and feeling home…what else can you ask for when travelling abroad? We were 2 in a Queen. Beautiful. Very good quality-price rapport. Even coffee was good…We will certainly go back to NY, and this time we won’t have to spend time looking for a hotel

Having booked a long weekend break for November with my wife, I contacted the hotel to see if could arrange for some tickets to be delivered there. This has turned into a contact with Yadira, who has changed our booking & saved us money. We have now booked directly with the hotel rather than a separate booking company. This has added to our excitement (and the money saved has covered the cost of our visit to MSG to watch the Rangers) of our pending once in a lifetime trip.

Due to changes in our flight schedules, i needed to rebook my stay at le soleil executive -the lady from the reservations departement was so kind and managed to Offer me a super deal at super rate-Many thanks. Super friendly service -I look forward to staying in the hotel. This is really a Five star rating !!!!

This was my first time staying at this hotel. I was very pleasantly surprised. The rooms are very large, for NY standards, with separate sitting and sleeping areas. There is an integral bathroom between the areas and a desk for work. There is also, wonder of wonders, sufficient hanging and drawer space for a long stay.The meals are good - I particularly enjoyed breakfast - but there are plenty of options in the area too for those who might wish it. Other facilities are just as advertised on the website.The staff were very friendly and helpful. There were no problems they couldn't fix, although there were few problems, and all the staff were polite at all times.The location is excellent, with Macy's less than one block away and easy access to tourist activities you might wish to do.In short, an excellent hotel option in the heart of New York. I'll certainly stay there again.

Booked for the second time for a 2 week stay at this hotel and again met all expectations! A very clean room with a great bed; what do you want more...Had a beautiful suite op the 19th floor with view of Midtown.I certainly come back next time!!

1. Perfect location. 2. Comfy bed/sofa and clean room. 3. Pretty big room in Manhattan.. it depends on the room type...4. Quick response from the front desk. 5. Convenience to access to a bar, market and restaurants.

Stayed her for 2 nights while traveling for work. The rooms are cleaned and updated - small, but that's typical in NYC. The front desk and bellhop(is that even an accurate term anymore...?!) staff were very helpful and so friendly. The location is also perfect, close to Time Square, Herald Square, Bryant park etc. I also really enjoyed the attached restaurant, awesome food with healthy yet delicious options. My only complaint is that they REALLY need to update the hair dryers in the rooms, they are old and just don't do the trick - if you plan on drying your hair and want a decent blowout, bring your own! But, I did love that they provide a robe in each room, most hotels don't do this anymore so it was a nice touch! Thanks again! I would definitely stay here again next time!

I usually don't take the time to write reviews but this hotel experience was exceptional. The initial impression the door staff and desk staff made was super welcoming, friendly and helpful. The room surpassed my expectations in size and quality, the price was a bargain. The lobby and bar area was very nice. The hotel is located below timesquare so the area is not mobbed with people at all. There are awesome bars and restaurants right on the same street. Can't praise the staff enough, they offered recommendations when I asked. The only thing was the sliding bathroom door was hard to shut and the handle piece almost came off when I shut the door. I notified the staff, left the room for a couple hours and came back to a fixed door. I really enjoyed my stay

Scheduled a last minute reservation for my family and boy was I happy I did. Yadira in reservations was amazingly helpful and gracious. She made sure we had the best room at an incredible rate. Amazing boutique hotel in the heart of Midtown. Great views, room was very clean, bed was very comfortable. We will be coming back later this Fall for sure!

my overall experience was great! … BUT upon checking in I was totally surprised my account would be debited an ADDITIONAL $400.00 ($100) per night, per room! … I get it … but come on … I needed my coins! …
user_name:
Sophia R
Baltimore, Maryland, United States

review_body: Everything was great! Most of the staff were friendly just not the people at the check in counter for some reason... would stay there again. The location was great and felt very safe walking around. Happy to have found this place.

Warm and friendly environment .requested for a bigger room, request was granted and we were all very happy. the room was cleaned everyday of our stay, toiletries and towels were replaced on a daily basis. the staff displayed professionalism and were VERY friendly. readily available to assist. Excellent experience.WiFi was also very good.

Spent 4 nights at this fab hotel - basic but suited us perfectly as we were out early and back late . Staff were all so friendly we had a pull out bed too as we had a double room for the 4 of us I was slightly worried as other reviews had mentioned that they had been uncomfortable luckily we found that it was comfortable and we all had a good nights sleep. Would definitely return . Great location 10/15 minutes from Time Square

Location is great but the cleanliness is not, very dingy and did not feel/smell as though the room was cleaned. I prefer a softer bed, this bed was terrible in my opinion, very very stiff and not comfortable at all.

A four evening stay for a special occasion. Location, price point, cleanliness reviews, classy Euro-boutique feel ... all of the above are reason to consider. Very familiar with upper east side haunts like the Pierre, plaza Athenee, Stanhope from years past. No, this is not that league, but more the bohemian upscale hostel. Small, clean, friendly, location, location!Inclusive with breakfast which was easy and available to us as our choice, great way to kick off a day of exploring. Served in a small pub setting, off the back of hotel Guest Parlor. Evening happy hour had live musical duo that added a nice ambiance before dinner or show. Met people in hotel from many parts of the world staying as guests. Security card elevators and friendly staff added to the draw. From doormen to front desk/ concierge and waitstaff, very nice group of employees. Walking to theatre or using LYFT, made it a great area for going anywhere in the city. Battery Park to Central Park and the train stations in between, we found it ideal to explore from. The lights of Times Square are a short walk, as is Herald Square and Penn Station, yet you’re removed enough to be focused more on Empire State ... pic shown of great view out our room. She loved the water towers that are quality NY eye candy. Other than a bath drain issue on first morning, I can’t fault this property. Quickly resolved, only now remember that small issue. We would stay here again and recommend to those looking for low key great value that delivers.

There was an unexpected $20 charge per night at the time of check in. Felt as though I had been taken. Only one person at desk on a busy Friday evening, at the start of a 3 day weekend. Was not able to clearly understand what the front desk was saying. Overall a very frustrating experience.

We stayed for a week as we transitioned our daughters to their dorm and school in the East Village. Rooms clean, staff helpful and pleasant. Great central location to shop or use subway. Room very quiet.

We tell everyone we know who asks us about our visits to New York that Executive Le Soleil is the best place to stay. We have stayed here multiple times (approximately 7) and we are never disappointed. It is without a doubt the biggest bang for your buck in NYC! Clean, clean, clean and that's my #1 top item in staying at a hotel, the cleanliness.

Great stay here, great location room lovely and clean, housekeeping staff lovely and helpful nothing too much trouble highly recommend. A mini fridge in the room instead of a mini bar would of been more useful to keep drinks , medications cool

Enjoyed the stay, I would stay at this location again, it's perfect for anyone desired to be in the heart of the city. This location has a bar and restaurant in the property which makes it easy to relax if you would like to stay in for the evening.

Overall nice hotel great staff. Restaurant was good they have a buffet option for breakfast. Areas a great location for shopping short distance of a walk to times square. Plenty of restaurants around to eat at.

First, let me start by saying I never write bad reviews...but had to for this one! Rooms were average, but buttons on the thermostat were removed and we couldn't control the temperature in the room. The room was extremely warm, and it was difficult to sleep. When checking out, valet returned my car with a large scratch. Hotel Le Soleil front desk manager came out to talk to parking attendant and assured me they would not charge me the valet parking fee....but they couldn't do anything else because they contract out with a local parking garage. A week later I noticed the hotel did charge my credit card the valet parking fee and when I emailed the manager who told me they would not charge me, she denied ever saying it.. I emailed the general manager twice, and they refuse to get back to me. Don't waste your time here...it's not worth the headache.

I had a stop at this hotel on my business trip. The location is great and the hotel is a brand new. Close to major business centers and with a descent traffic. Close by the tourist attractions and a walking distance from the Metro.Great overall experience!

On first arriving at our room, we were shocked at how tiny it was, there was no way we had enough space with our large luggage, being on a lengthy trip.Calling the front desk I was told we could pay to upgrade (for a fairly reasonable fee) to a larger room, and I’m very glad we did!It’s a shame we were allocated such a small room in the first place and that we had to pay more, but good to get sorted quickly and a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolate biscuits were delivered to our new room to help us celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary.

Perfect location in NY within walking distance to all you need. I had a room on the third floor facing the street but not a problem. Quite a big room. Strange that i did not Get any info about breakfast checking in or anything. Standard feeling about the hotel but at the price that’s what you Get. Could easily book here again.

This was a solo trip. I found the accommodation Ideally placed for all my interests. The room was adequate for one person but the wardrobe space would not have been for two in a double room. Neither would the space around the bed. The shower was well appointed nut could have done with more hanging space.

We stayed four nights for the US Open and have a lovely room that was small but beautiful. The bathroom was also very nice and I loved the robe . We had a great view of the Empire State Building from our 19th floor room

Were in City for US Open. Hotel great awesome location. Staff wonderful. We will stay there again when in city again for US Open. The hotel room is large for NYC standards. We were 5 minutes to Grand Central and all attractions the city has to offer.

We appreciated that the room was so quiet, though the hotel is not so far from Times Square.We also appreciated the 2 bottles of water we got every day and the bottle of wine when we arrived.The room size was OK, but there was a little lack of space to put away our things (we were 4 persons).

We enjoyed very much our holiday at Le Soleil. We chosed a queen suite for four people with a sofa bed (quite confortable for two adults) and the room was larger than usual for NY standard. Breakfast included was very good and various. We chosed a room at 2nd floor not to have problems with escalators when fulls. Air conditioning in the room too much noising. I will strongly recommed it.

My wife and I were in New York for a week with our 1 year old baby. The hotel (queen suite) was perfectly suited for a baby who has just started walking. We had a separate bedroom and the fold out sofa was a great option when he was struggling to sleep. The staff were friendly and very helpful, the room was kept very clean and the bathroom was a generous size considering similar rooms in NYC. Perfectly located a few blocks from Bryant Park, Time Square, The Flatiron Building and a view of the Empire Statebuilding. We would be happy to stay again.The only down side is queen size rooms actually means a double bed (compared to Australian beds so not sure if this is the norm in the US).

Location was good, the service was good.. The wifi was terrible, was never able to connect and stay connected to the wifi, had to use my data.. There were 3 of us in the room and all of us experienced the same issue..

My contacts with the staff from the Executive Hotel LeSoleil in New York (especially with a lady at the reception desk) on the phone and by email before our stay in the hotel was very charming, very friendly and helpful and very much appreciated! She was helping me with travel arrangements and booking the room. We are looking forward to an awesome and great stay in New York City and in the Executive Hotel "LeSoleil" (all for my forthcoming 50th anniversary) very soon... and to meeting her in person on our reception!:-).to be continued....:-)

The concierge & bell men were very helpful! Housekeeping should be improved as our rooms were not cleaned properly although the beds were made. The location is spot on as its in manhattan close to most attractions.

After a long trip, we were tired and exhausted. Thankfully, we booked at this hotel because upon arriving we were treated amazingly by a staff member called Andre who works overnight. Super professional but very genuine and kind, he made our stay wonderful! Thank you Andre!!!!!

We took the double bed room with sofa bed. Kids slept on the sofa bed. Room was spacious for us (2 adults and 2 kids). The hotel promotes empire state building views but we didn't get any views.Loved the hotel location: right between times square and 5th avenue. It was perfect to get everywhere. We walked to central park (30 minutes walk approx.). Hotel service was really good. Even though the hotel was in between two very busy areas it was very quiet at night and we were not disturbed at all.Only con was the concierge: we asked them once to arrange car from New York to Washington and they wanted to charge us 1200 USD while other private car companies charged 600 USD. I understand concierge want to make a commission but this was too much. Needless to say we declined the concierge offer and took the train to Washington which was very convenient.

Stayed here for 5 nights, from 28th July with my wife and 7 year old son.Lady on front desk was very friendly on arrival and explained all of the usuals. Room was good and a true reflection of what we had seen online when booking.My first issue was with the staff at other times. Our hotel room door was not closing automatically and so we returned one day (having been out all day exploring the city) to find our room open!!! I spoke to someone on the front desk and as well as not being that bothered, they also didn’t act on it, as the following day, it had still not been sorted out. I spoke to someone different the following day and it was eventually resolved.My other issue, was in the bar. We came back after a hot day out in NYC and fancied a drink in the bar whilst it was ‘happy hour’. As the three of us walked in, the young girl seemed confused that we wanted to come and have a drink. We explained we didn’t want a meal, just a nice cold beer and that we were residents of the hotel. We went to sit at a table (which we were initially shown to) and then we were told that we’d be better sitting in the HOTEL LOBBY(!!) as we had our 7 year old with us. What? We are paying over $1600 for 5 nights and I’m pretty sure we’re entitled to sit in the bar (not AT the bar) as a family! We reluctantly went into the lobby whilst my wife bought 2 beers at $5 each, as advertised.....only they weren’t. There was tax on top! A while later (still during ‘happy hour’) they tried to charge us a different amount for a repeat order!!?! Again, after dispute, we paid the original amount. On check out, I was asked if I required an invoice. I said yes and was told one would be emailed out. I supplied my email address at this stage on a Post-It note (??!) and was told it would be sent through. I checked regularly over the coming days and no sign. My wife emailed, I tweeted, but nothing. No response. We eventually called (almost a week later) and we’re told that it had been sent to an email address for my wife...a Yahoo! address that has never existed??! It was then sent to me - whilst on the phone - where I discovered that I had been charged for two items from the mini bar which I hadn’t had. They refunded them, but glad I checked!! Again, this is a staff issue and really poor customer service. Overall, we enjoyed our visit to NYC and the room was fine as a base for this. I just wish the staff cared more and responded to customers requests and needs.

Hotel is in a great location on a relatively quiet street. Building is only about 5 years old, and in excellent condition. Very nicely appointed; a warm and welcoming environment. The staff is very friendly and attentive to the guests; outstanding service. Room was very clean.and comfortable. Strongly recommended.

I like your hotel and we will come and stay again. Three things can improve and I may pay little more for them,Diest Auto switch off of AC at night has to stop. Second TV channels mix can be better. Third food delivery to rooms can improve. Tie up with UBer eat ?

First time at this hotel. Love it and we will come back. The rooms were really nice, the bed comfortable and amenities in the room excellent. The staff very helpful at all times and We loved the location

This hotel is centrally located with good room sizes (suites), decent breakfast, and amazing value for money for NYC. The suite we booked had enough room for the children to play and for us (a family of four) to not feel like we were trampling all over each other. We will definitely stay again.

I am satisfied every time I stay here--competent and friendly staff in a great location. I can walk to and from the AirTrain to Newark Airport--and I can walk to Broadway shows as well as to my appointments..

Would be the choice for the next trip to Manhattan. We loved the short ways to metro, time sqaure, Rockefeller and many other things you could reach by walking. Lots of restaurants and breakfast diners around.

A once solid stay - no longer unfortunately. Clean but checkin took forever. The credit card machine didn’t work. WiFi and cable out for a majority of the night. Staff didn’t seem to know that it was out and when it was coming back.
user_name:
mg2019254
New York City, New York

review_body: Had a lovely time, attentive but discrete service with relaxed atmosphere. Rooms were well equipped with plenty of space. Perfect location to explore Manhattan and beyond. Restaurant was nice and relaxed and the food and drink was excellent.

I had a pleasant experience here when I had to travel unexpectedly to NYC for family business. The rooms are very small but also very comfortable. I would not recommend them for more than one person, but for one person they work fine. The staff are super friendly and personable. I was concerned I would have to pay a scam resort fee based on other information I read online, and was very relieved they did not try to charge one. Thank goodness! Very nice bathrooms, very clean hotel. Touristy area but good location if you need to be in Midtown.

Everyone was very professional and pleasant. Never had a problem the whole time we were there. The only thing I would point out that is not perfect is the variety of the breakfast, don’t get me wrong the breakfast is great but for the quality of the hotel one would expect more options. Still I wouldn’t let this detail change my mind about going there again!

Our air conditioner wasn't working properly upon arrival. I reported it after 2nd night of our 8 night stay. We had a super busy itinerary all week. Were told the thermostat would be repaired during the day while we were out. It wasn't. Instead we were offered to move, as it would take some hours to repair. We opted to staying in the room so long as it was repaired next day. It wasn't. Option received late that night to move early next morning. Itinerary didn't permit. The air conditioner was supposedly fixed on 2nd to last day. Still didn't work that night. Result was: nice enough room, nice enough facility, but hanging in out any amount of time in the room was uncomfortable and sleeping was pretty much like camping: very expensive camping. Windows are sealed shut, so no opportunity for fresh air. Admittedly, if we had had time to rise and move before 8 am before beginning our day, moving would have been an option.

My daughter and granddaughter and I spent last Friday and Saturday nights in this wonderful hotel. The staff could not have been nicer (especially Meredith)! Although we were a bit disappointed that our room wasn't on a higher floor, I have never stayed in a quieter room. We were right in the the heart of the city, but heard no sirens, noise from the nearby elevator or other rooms.! It was also the most efficient shower setup up - a walk in with no shower doors to deal with, no sloppy splashes and clear simple instructions on how to use the rain shower faucet. We loved this place!

I stayed in Hotel LeSolail over the weekend. It was an exciting experience. The room was very clean. The customers service was very forthcoming and helpful. Above all, the hotel is situated in midtown close to lot of attractions.

Our family had an excellent stay at this hotel. The location could not have been better. It is walking distance to tourist sights, great shopping and lots of restaurants. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The rooms were not large but comfortable. Highly recommend staying here.

Nice hotel to stay in, very amicable staff, fast check in, very clean, nice view, easy access to shops and restaurants, great location, near to parks and entertainment, easy to find rooms and get around.

Stayed here for the 2nd time in a row, family of 3. First thing fast, what a lovely reception given by the doormen (3 doormen that are memorable), every single day in and out of the hotel, the doormen were particularly welcoming. Joseph, saved the days by giving a 1:1 lesson about NY subways, NY around and about. We fell at home and my family felt safe with his guidance. Thank you Joseph. Rating - 5 ✨ ⭐️ Regarding the hotel: Location is perfect, Check-in & out was reasonable, breakfast was below average, dinner at trademark was average. Cost of room versus quality / value for money - below average we paid at least 350 US-Dollar per night including the facility cost of 20 US-Dollar/ night (stayed 9 nights), no breakfast, much more than what we anticipated through booking.com, and compared to home Swiss standards. The sofa bed was uncomfortable, you could feel the bed springs right to your bone. We had to pay for a bottle of water on a hot sunny day (August) when they didn’t leave the daily 2 water bottles. Housekeeping was below average, only change was the new towels, dustbin was never emptied for whatever reason, luckily we didn’t have any compost. - Rating - 3 stars ✨ Will we come back again, Maybe but only because of the personnel not the hotel in itself, not worth the value for money. A big Thank you to all the personnel that made our stay worthwhile. I hope the Hotel management considers high bonuses for their employees, that’s the main reason for returning guests. Greetings from Zurich/ N, R & N

We stayed here for a week. Since first moment we felt just like home. Perfect room, friendly staff, top hygiene and excellent location are just few reasons why you should seriously consider this hotel when traveling to New York. Special thx goes to Joseph who made our last hours in NYC really unforgettable. For our next trip to NY this hotel is a must.

This is the second time I have stayed here (the first experience was so great we didn’t look anywhere else!). EVERY SINGLE staff member I encountered was always smiling, friendly and happy to help... I didn’t catch his name, but the doorman/bellman working the evening of 8/7/19 was awesome! Keeping us close under cover out to our car to keep us dry from the rain, always there to greet us with a smile and warm conversation. The rooms are well appointed, clean and never any issues. You can’t beat the location, it’s in the heart of everywhere you want to go. You won’t be disappointed staying here.

The hotel is located at 10 minutes walk from Times Square. Despite its central location, it is quiet. The rooms are clean and good-sized. The lobby area is a little dark but remains pleasant. The staff is very friendly and always ready to assist.

We chose this hotel for its TripAdvisor ratings and the fact that it had two queen beds which was hard to find in Midtown. I would note that the room was tight for four people (2 adults and 2 teens), but once we got our stuff settled it wasn't too bad. The staff was very friendly and super helpful. The restaurant was convenient and the food was very good. Location was very central to all the and only a short walk to Broadway theaters and Times Square. The overall value was excellent!

We stay at this property for business and the location is perfect, you're near midtown and Chelsea. The staff is amazing, with a restaurant, bar in the lobby with happy hour specials. On the same block is the amazing Keen's Steakhouse, and directly across the street is Habanero Mexican restaurant, which makes great Margs. Great value!

We had a suite on a lower floor that did not have a view of downtown, but was sizable for two people. It had a nice sitting area with a TV and sleeper sofa. The concierge and doorman were very helpful in making dinner reservations, suggesting places to go and how long to allow for transportation to arrive and estimated time to get to destination. Easy walking distance to lots of major attractions. This property would have received a 5 if we didn't have to wait a couple times for our room to be cleaned and to receive clean towels (after 6pm). We opted to include breakfast when we booked our room. It was ok, but I wouldn't recommend doing so if you plan on leaving for sightseeing before 7 am. I asked about a grab n go or brown bag option and they did not offer it so we missed breakfast a couple mornings and were not compensated for it because we had pre-paid.

Hotel turned out to be a fantastic find. Location was super convenient to everything. The rooms were extremely large and very well decorated. This was a business trip but looking forward to returning with my family for more of a vacation.

Andrew at the front desk welcomed us in the best way we have ever seen. Good location. Great view from the room to the Empire State Building direction One World Trade Center. Comfort room and good breakfast the day after.

We stayed here on the 16th floor city view. Room was spacious, bed was comfortable, linens were clean, room was maintained well, air conditioning was great on some of the hottest days in July. Complimentary water came in handy on walks everywhere. Hotel staff were always accommodating and friendly. Hotel is close to everything and we are avid walkers so this quiet off the main street hotel was perfect for sleeping. See a broadway show while in town and walk the highline. Subway is nearby too. Would stay here again! Next time we will book through the hotel directly for a better rate. Ice is on the 2nd floor. Hotel will add an ice machine to another floor to make it easier on guests.

Located in the heart of Manhattan this hotel is a gem. From checkin to checkout you will love your experience. Nicely appointed rooms and very friendly service. The jazz ensemble at the bar was awesome. Seconds from the Empire State Building and minutes to Time Square this hotel will not disappoint.

Excellent experience from when we checked it to the minute we had to leave. It was such a nice and comfortable room we extended our stay an additional day. The room was spacious, CLEAN and well appointed.

Except for a grumpy lady checking us in the lady next morning had a pleasant smile and was so nice, rest of the staff was really friendly and helpful. Rooms were nice but TV could have been easier to handle - ie search stations etc . Other hotels we stayed in the the US all had compliemtary coffee here you had to buy it 5 people = 50 dollars per day in just coffee !

The room was smaller than expected according to pictures. Bed linen was of average quality and bed was not very comfortable. Bathroom was good and clean, towels replaced each day.Carpet appeared not very clean and there was a smell coming out of it.Location not ideal but good with a lot of food stores and cafes around.

The hotel was great--Excellent service. Rooms were comfortable, linens were soft and food at the cafe was delish. It was very close to the office and lots of good restaurants around the hotel. I will look forward to returning on my next trip to NYC. The only complaint was that the coffee maker in my room was broken. Other than that, it was great!

Had a great visit hotel and have just finished booking my second stay at the hotel. I've been to NYC for business many times, but have found my new go-to!Yadira in reservations made it so easy for me and my group.

Stayed for 6 nights in July 2019. Excellent location, very central, right next to empire state building. Initially booked through third party site, but was contacted directly by hotel with better offer. Asked for south facing room with view of empire state and that's what we got - excellent view right down to world trade center. Room also had small kitchen area with sink/microwave/fridge which was a bonus, plus coffee machine. Large room for NYC - plenty of space. Air conditioning worked well. Clean room, well kept. Safe, iron and ironing board in room. Large TV. Nice en suite. Breakfast included - simple buffet with eggs, bacon, sausage and potatoes, plus small selection of pastries + cereals including oatmeal/pancakes. Staff all warm and welcoming throughout stay; helpful and knowledgeable. Others have mentioned needing to wait for lifts/elevators - we were on the 17th floor and never had to wait more than a minute. Overall excellent experience, but more expensive than other options - it is a 4 start hotel so to be expected.

This hotel is in a great location for all the sights but the positivity ends there. Kids' bed was not made up when we arrived and we had to ask them twice before it was done. We also only had 2 big towels and there was 4 of us in the room. Twice during the 5 days we had to ask for more. Booked a taxi to the airport on our departure and it never arrived so had to hail one on the street. We won't be back......

The hotel is close to Lincoln tunnel easy access for cars, nice area for being able to move around the city, hotel was clean, quiet and has a friendly staff happy to help. they offer allot of amenties and the hotel is clean

My stay was amazing. The location was perfect and the room immaculate. The staff were happy, courteous, and quick to assist. Isaiah is excellent, he was very attentive and assisted us very well. He always wears a smile. It really makes the stay so much more amazing when there is great staff. I Will definitely stay there again.

I've stayed at Executive Hotel LeSoleil a couple of times for business trips, and they never disappoint. The price is unbeatable for the quality of the stay. Rooms are spacious, service is wonderful and always accommodating, and the location is perfect in Midtown. I'll always choose to stay here when coming to NYC.

As a regular business traveller to NYC I chose Executive Hotel LeSoleil for the first time on my latest visit this week, and wasn't disappointed. From the immediate greeting by the Doorman, to the efficient valet parking, the warm and efficient service at the front desk from beginning to end, the excellent breakfast - this hotel checked all the boxes. this is also in one of the best areas to enjoy the personal time in Manahattan. For business or pleasure I highly recommend this hotel, and will personally return - the staff make you feel welcome!

Extremely friendly and service minded staff. Traveling with 2 teens and 2 adults. Queen size bed and sofabed. Clean rooms. Sofa bed a little bit hard, but got an extra mattress, then it was good. A lot of nice breakfast options just outside the hotel (or very close).

This is an incredibly average property by NYC standards. It is neither chic nor modern no current. I suspect the big draw is the room size and ability to have a separate sleeping area with a sofa bed for not alot of money.So if the price is over $400 a nigh you will be let down, as was I, especially if you don’t need alot of beds or space. Could not even get my bathroom door to close...

Been staying in this Hotel every time I go to NY for the past 6 years. Every time the property, personnel and comfort are just as impressive and even better than the first time I went.Location is also awesome. Your in the middle of it but just outside enough to be able to relax when you want to. Great access to subway station, pharmacy really close, great food around and very easy access out of the city towards JFK. You won't regret it!!!

Great location.Clean comfortable room.Staff is friendly and helpful. Free wi fi and convenient business center.This was our 4th year staying at this hotel.They also have a beautiful bar and restaurant.

The hotel is modern and well located, staff is friendly but there were two things on the day I was leaving that I want to point out:1) Hotel doesn’t offer a late checkout (like at 2pm or 5pm), not even if you’re willing to pay more for the service. That day I had a late flight, and I wanted to stay in the room working (instead of heading early to the airport) and it was not possible (normal checkout time was 12pm and I was allowed to stay till 1pm only).2) When leaving, I was told by the front desk clerk I needed to stop by to do the checkout in person, even though I didn’t have any additional charges or anything. I was lucky there was no line and the process was fast, but nevertheless this is unacceptable in NYC in 2019!

Friendly and helpful staff. A good location for our sightseeing plans. Near a subway station, if that is important to you. Used their car service to the airport which took away the stress and a competitive price. Food and service at their restaurant was excellent, but a limited menu. Sadly, the Grinder, which is the coffee part was not open on the weekend.

From arrival and the excellent front desk team to being pleasantly surprised at the quality of the room. Had a very good couple of nights and returned for an extra night again. Great beds. Very clean. Great bathroom. Small but very adequate. Great coffee machine. Good usb power points etc

Location to subway and midtown attractions was great. Friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms. Only downside was the rooms are small but that is to be expected in NYC. We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite and there really wasn't anywhere to sit in the room other than the bed. The bellmen were very friendly, helpful and courteous. Happy hour was nice too.

This is an email I sent to the GM of this hotel. We stayed at your hotel over the weekend and just wanted to let you know how much we enjoyed our stay. We met you in the elevator and explained how we missed a day of our vacation because of a weather delay at JFK, you sent a great bottle of wine to our room, with a hand written note. We really appreciated the gesture and will recommend your hotel to anyone headed to NYC. Your amazing leadership was evident in our interactions with your staff. The 2 doormen (the one who always wears the fedora hat, and the one with the beard), were so friendly with us and talked to us excitedly everyday when we returned from the Yankees game. It's so nice to feel welcome when being so far from home. Your front desk staff was so helpful and friendly every time we had questions, as first time NYC visitors! I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Manhattan!
user_name:
Robyn D
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: Very well located with easy access to business, shopping and social ventures in the city, This hotel is a very comfortable clean place to live. Highly recommended - great staff and service as well. Particularly good if you have to multi task in the city.

I travel to Midtown every month for work and this is the only place I want to stay. It's quiet (even streetside!) and walking distance to everything I need. The beds are comfortable, the hotel is clean and stylish, and the staff go above and beyond. I tried enough bad NYC hotels before I found this one to know that this is a gem and the only place I want to stay. I always have a great night sleep here. Love the cafe attached to the lobby as well. Highly recommend staying here!

Such a GEM!! I stayed for a week and was so pleased with the service, cleanliness, kind and HAPPY staff. Excellent location, very easy to get to. I drove and the staff parked my car for the entire stay. I will definitely be back and look forward to another enjoyable stay!!!

Don’t have any doubts with this place - it’s truly a great hotel, and not overpriced. We initially booked with another hotel nearby and were horrified by the experience (the room had cockroaches and mice). We promptly left and snagged the last 2 rooms at LeSoleil. I’ve never appreciated a hotel more than this one - taking a nice hot shower after a long trip and relaxing in a soft bathrobe felt like absolute heaven. The staff was great and super helpful and the location was amazing - we walked two blocks to Empire State Building and a block and a half to the nearest subway station. The restaurant food is also amazing. Yes, the rooms are on the small side, but everything in NY is. Overall we had an absolutely great experience here! Highly recommended!

Excellent location. Walking distance to many sites and attractions. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They made us feel very comfortable during our stay and went out of their way to answer any questions we had. We would recommend this hotel to others.

First impressions count and mine of Le Soleil weren't good. I'd booked and asked for a quiet king room for six nights. When I turned up at 6 pm after a tortuous journey from London I was told the room wasn't ready. At 6 pm?I was then given a third floor room over the street. It's not the noisiest street in New York but no way quiet.The following morning, expecting the usual half hearted response, I raised this with the front desk. They couldn't have been more helpful. I was moved to a much quieter room and the rest of my stay was delightful.The rooms aren't huge but the location is good. If you're picky about the kind of room you want I suggest phoning them direct and going through the options. I will and I suspect this will be my New York hotel of choice from now on.

This hotel is in an excellent midtown location close to almost all the major sites (we walked everywhere apart from the financial district). The staff are really quite excellent and housekeeping was immaculate. The room was clean and modern. We had a qeen suite which consisted of a queen bed and a pull out sofa bed for our 15 year old son, separated by a 'two thirds' wall, which afforded us both some degree of privacy. There was a large flat screen tv across from both beds. The room is - for New York - generously sized. The bed and bedding were very comfortable and we slept well, helped by black out curtains. As we were on the 12th floor, the noise from the street (which we faced) was minimal (although it is NY so you expect some noise!). I'd agree with other reviewers regarding lack of hanging space. After getting additional hangers form house keeping we did manage, but only just! Unfortunately we experienced 2 negative issues. The first - which the hotel could do nothing about during our stay - was with the bathroom door, which is a pocket door which slides into the wall. As there is no handle on the door, it's almost impossible to close it properly. You have to slide to close it, but if you slide it with too little force it stays relatively open, and too much force it simply bounces back open! This may be fine if you're single or a couple who don't mind listening to one another in the bathroom... (definitley not us!), but we loathed it and found it a major annoyance. We also had a second, more serious issue around health & safety. However, the hotel management dealt with this well and to our satisfaction, so I won't mention the detail here, other than to say it was a one off and highly unlikley to happen again to another guest. Despite this incident (and our hatred of the bathroom door!), we've given this hotel 4 stars. It would have been 5 stars if the bathroom door was 'normal'! In summary, we'd recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again, and you can't say fairer than that!

Stayed in Executive Le Soleil for a recent trip to NYC and what an absolute gem of a hotel. From the moment we walked in, nothing was too much trouble...our room 1705 was just amazing...had the most superb view of the Empire State and as it lit up at night it truly was a sight to behold.Even in the shower, you had this amazing view....it just made our whole trip so memorable. Also in the room was a little kitchenette area incl microwave and fridge and sink,,,Complimentary water every day without fail....we didnt use kitchen area much but could be v useful for some. We opted for breakfast package and it was great. Had Turkey sausages and fried potatoes,juices, a pancake station, fruit and yogurt, bread, cheese, jam and coffee/tea/..we really thought it was great.... But for us it was the staff that stood out...at reception they helped by confirming our dinner reservations at local restaurant, sent us a lovely card and wine for our Anniversary....honestly they were the friendliest people we met in the US....the Management of this hotel should be very proud of its staff! Cleaning staff impeccable with superb linen changes and towel changes - I love extra towels and there were plenty here even for me. Outside the hotel on the street about 5 doors down is THE KEG ROOM Irish bar and across road MCGETTIGANS IRISH bar and near that is the famous KEENS STEAKHOUSE - all on the same street so all amenities nearby. Times Square a leisurely 10 min walk, Macys a 5 min walk or less, Empire State 3 mins walk, Subway nearby but we didnt use that, we just got a cab or walked if you're thinking about this hotel - GO THERE...spend a bit extra for superb nice room!

We spent a week here with our grandson is a room perfect for the three of us: a separate alcove with a sofa bed for him and a nice space and queen bed for us. Great location in midtown, close to everything including a mainline subway stop. Staff was very friendly and quite helpful. Restaurant left something to be desired for breakfast, but we didn’t try other meals but had a nice cocktail in the lounge one night. fast, free WiFi. Delightful experience.

The hotel is a nice cosy property with staff who respond immediately to your needs. It’s located very conveniently. I would only Sunthari the breakfast menu that is included in the room rents should be a little more diverse.

We loved our stay, we had a room with a wonderful view on the Empire State Building, it was elegant, clean and also very quiet! The staff was very helpful and friendly. You have everything you need in short walking distance, you could even walk to all the sights!

This hotel has a perfect location, very close to empire state building and few minutes walk from times square. There are restaurants in neighborhood. Lobby is beautiful, rooms are spacious but there isn t enough space to put clothes in. Rooms are clean and quiet, there are 2 bottles of water everyday for free. We really loved thos hotel

I very much enjoyed my stay at Executive LeSoleil. The staff were excellent. Very knowledgeable, friendly and more than willing to help out with any request or query whether it was a recommendation for a restaurant or transfer to the airport - especially Meredith and Luis. Clean and comfortable, I’m looking forward to returning

Wow, what a treasure in NYC! It was our first time staying at Executive Hotel LeSoleil and will not be the last. As soon as we arrived the staff was super helpful. Matt at the front desk greeted us and had the bellmen (Joseph and Isaiah) help us with our bags. All were super friendly. We brought our puppy (Chewy) with us as the hotel is pet friendly and they sent us up goodies for her. She was so excited! Besides the location being so central, the hotel itself was fantastic. The room was so large and had an extra seating area, it felt like home. Can't wait to return!
user_name:
Michelle C
Miami, Florida, United States

review_body: Very good hotel. They helped us in changing the room I’ve originally booked as it was too small!! Very gentle and professional. Special thank to Lion and Keron for their help. Hope to see you guys in the once again in the future!!

Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was a little to hot for July. We had to call one day to have our room cleaned. Overall we enjoyed our stay. The happy hour offered was good. Lobby was warm and inviting.

The doormen were fantastic!!! But I highly recommend you allow them to wear more seasonal uniform in the summer.. they had to be dying on a 90 degree day in pants and long sleeves.. I say some nice Bermuda’s and short sleeve shirts.. Also, my AC didn’t work and it was really hot!!

Stayed for 4 nights with friends. Rooms are compact and bijou but have everything you need and are very very comfortable and for a city hotel very quiet. Staff without exception all amazing the receptionists very helpful and knowledgable and wonderful doorman (forgotten his name) who always got us a cab when we needed one. The hotel has a nice ambience. Nice breakfast although if a tea drinker dont expect great things!!. The only thing I would comment on to be wary of is the deposit taken at time of checking in is 100 dollars per night so for us it was400 dollars extra on our card that we hadn't budgeted for and will take 5-7 days to be credited back. Also there is a small charge for wifi use. Think the location of this hotel couldn't be any better for exploring the city and cant fault it for service. Would certainly stay again.

Very convenient location. Excellent staff; very friendly and exceedingly helpful. Quiet room even though located near elevator. Extremely clean. No closet, only small area to hang clothes. Could use updates in bathroom for more areas to hang clothes and towels.

I can’t say enough good things about this hotel. It was clean, accessible, in a good area but quiet, and the staff was excellent especially Frances at the concierge desk and Jamie at the doors. They were so helpful and very nice. The price was very reasonable and a good value for everything it had to offer. I would definitely stay here again.
nice place, only a Little bit Cold ;-)For the first time in New York City it is a great Location. everything is nearby.for calm, you must go to Brooklyn and Williamsburg. Have a anice stay there. xxx

Stayed here for a week with my daughter. 1st time in NYC. Couldn't have chosen a better place to stay! Location was perfect for seeing all the sights. Hotel was great - very friendly and helpful staff. Door always opened for you by smiling doormen. We were immediately upgraded to a suite when our cable TV stopped working. Cant think of a better place to have stayed in NYC, thank you hotel le Soleil!

The hotel is in a great location, easy access to to Empire state, Macys, grand central station, Greenwich village, Times square. Not a big issue but guests should be aware of $100 per night fee held to cover additional expenses, this is returned within 7 days following checkout.

We had the most wonderful 7 nigths at the Executive hotel. Absolute great, friendly, skilled and helpful staff with a lot knowledge about service and New York in general. Very nice and clean rooms but a bit small, although room enough for everything. We had all the facilities needed and if we missed anything we called the front drak and had it immediately delivered. Would recommend this top class hotel to everyone!

I have recently visited New York and spent 4 nights at the hotel it was very convenient for all attractions also close to some very nice restaurants and bars. The staff was very friendly and helpful nothing was too much trouble. The Room we had was very nice and clean and big with a small kitchenette that was very handy if you decided to eat in your room we really enjoyed staying here

Friendly & helpful staff. Great location. Breakfast was included in our price. Very good breakfast with a good choice. Again helpful & friendly staff.Our room was kept clean by polite and friendly staff.
user_name:
Relax50298269232
New York City, New York

review_body: Not worthy of 4 stars. Wouldn’t accommodate any early check-in (at 2:30pm.) Then after coming back, they only had one person working the desk at check-in time. They offered to bring our bags up for us which they had been holding onto, and that took more than 15 minutes, at which time the bellhop complained about how everyone wants to check in at the same time (at check-in time because they didn’t accommodate prior) so he was busy. Also, as a VIP member, I was supposed to receive a free bottle of wine, which wasn’t brought to our room until after we returned for the evening... and it wasn’t even kept cold (it was a Chardonnay!) Only staying one night so won’t even have the chance to drink it now. Definitely would not return and wouldn’t recommend. Plenty of other places in Manhattan probably more representative of a 4 star rating.

Excellent hotel - great location in the middle of Manhattan close to times Square and Penn station. Close to all shopping hubs around midtown and transportation hubsA very helpful staff and ALWAYS welcoming Rooms cleanSpecial thanks to Yadira

The staff at the hotel were amazingly helpful and fun. We were given directions, recommendations and advice during our stay. It made the experience easy and memorable. I will definitely stay here again.

Our group was myself, my teen daughter and my sister-in-law; first time visits for both of them. Check in was smooth. Rooms are small, which I expected but with 3 women more space for suitcases would've been good. This hotel is in a great location to do and see almost anything in NYC. It's just a short walk and you've got several subway stations at your disposal. Staff is very responsive; we had to call the desk several times for various reason and within 10 minutes our request /needs had been addressed.

I stayed in the hotel for a couple of nights. It did exactly what I needed it to. My room was on one of the lower floors but faced on to the back of the building so I didn't have any street noise or other disturbances during the night. There wasn't even the usual noise of people moving up and down the hallways. The room was perfectly sized and came with a decent Wifi set up so that I could easily connect my computer and get on with work as necessary. The bathroom was also ample for my needs with a great shower. The location was also good with easy access to the usual attractions and local offices. Overall it was great and I don't have any complaints.

The sleep quality was excellent and the staff still available to help.An improvement should be done in respect of the environment (Not necessary to change towels every day + Not keep the lights on when nobody is in the room).

most of all : the team from marshila,jose at the front desk, to yadiar at the reservation,to jose the bell boy - all super profetional and helping team. location - super. close to the main attractio. restaurant - over pricing.there is no cabinet at the rooms but thats fine

Amazing hotel...excellent central location, close to subway with easy access to anywhere in the city. Rooms were spacious, clean, comfortable and quiet (no noise from the street). Great value by New York standards. Check in and out was a breeze. 5 STARS to the Wonderful Staff that were extremely helpful and friendly (especially Frances and Lewis), all of which made our stay more enjoyable. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!!

The location and environment are excellent! The rooms are small but perfectly functional, clean and comfortable. The staff are always nice and helpful. I did not eat in the restaurant so I can't comment, but overall very satisfied and would stay again!

I would recommend The Executive Hotel Le Soleil in New York to anybody. a well situated hotel with great polite staff which added to the enjoyment of our stay in the city. The hotel was very clean and inviting after a long day walking around NYC.

From the moment we arrived to check in the hotel staff were superb friendly and welcoming. The hotel is clean, central location in the city and family friendly. Helped us unload, early check in and continued to remind us that we are on vacation so relax they will take care of everything. Check out was just as smooth, Jamie greeted us and helped load our luggage immediately provided the difference between Uber/lyft and how the convince and cost in using there car service with no wait and savings. Jamie was friendly, professional and knowledgeable. Only downside of the trip was check out when some other guest placed restaurant charges to our room. I would recommend having guest sign or add some additional security like may I see you let room key for verification because it did take some convincing on our part for the charges to be removed when in fact we never put them there to begin with. Overall I would bring my family here again based on the staff alone from the moment we walked in and out your greeters were the difference in our experience.
