First I want to thank the front staff of this hotel, regardless of the shift. They were all amazing, every time I had an issue or question. The doormen were amazing too in particular Joseph and especially Jaime. He went out of his way to connect me with the concierge, the on duty manager or anybody else I needed. He had great suggestions on getting around the City for attractions and local food joints. He was one of the main reasons we enjoyed our stay so much. (Thanks Jaime!)Now the hotel: It's super clean everywhere. Our room was done with a modern/hip touch and it was beautiful. Our fridge wasn't working right and the night time engineer was there in two seconds and fixed it.The location was simply unbeatable as well. We walked to almost everywhere and when we didn't, it was just a couple of minutes by ride sharing. This will be my "Go To" hotel from here on and I've been visiting New York for 18 years. I had an awesome stay. Thanks everybody!

We stayed at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil in May this year. It was our first visit to New York and the hotel was fabulous. The location is perfect, the staff incredibly helpful and the room clean and spacious. The only downside was the service tax that was added to the bill on our departure.

I typically dont visit boutique hotels. After careful research decided to give this one a try. I have already recommended it to several people since my stay. The room was huge in comparison to most in the city. Bathroom as well. Decorated nicely. Very very clean and updated. Staff was incredibly pleasant. So many wonderful places to eat on the block. It was an A+ experience.
user_name:
AmyGalm
Massapequa, New York, United States

review_body: Great staff and great location. The room was clean, cozy and quite. Nice brasserie where you can have a quick bite or complete meal. We lost the connection flight from Europe and delayed our arrival but the staff was so kind to re-arrange our reservation accordingly with no extra cost, very difficult to find such service in NYC.

It was a City Trip for me and two of my friends - we booked our stay with breakfast. The breakfast was very good and had something for everyone of our group. Our room was not to big but also not to small, the bed was amazing and our bathroom was very nice. Everyone was super friendly and helpful.What made us a little bit sad, was that we couldn't open the windows - even a little bit. But maybe that was good and I shouldn't smell New York in the morning :). Very very good location of this hotel. Recomended it to my parents, which are now very interessted to visit New York. Would absolutly come back.Thanks to the staff.Liebe Grüße aus Deutschland.

We do not get a chance to travel to NYC as often as we would like but I will say this , from now on any time we do there will be only 1 hotel to stay at and this is it ! It checked a 10 out of 10 on every box there is ! Starting and not ending with their staff , most notably , Mr.Andre Walker . If you have the good fortune to go to NYC , make this your only place to stay !!!

We had a terrible Airbnb situation and needed a place in the middle of the night. Andre at Hotel LeSoleil was polite at 2am and so helpful. He made sure we had everything we needed and then some! I would come back here next time I'm in New York!!!

We stayed four days - the hotel is modern, clean and well maintained, the bathroom is a really good size. Our king room was small, as all hotel rooms I've used in NYC are. The property is really conveniently located in midtown for our site seeing in all directions.

from The moment I walked in and met Joseph he made me feel super welcome and helped me more then I could of asked. And there front of house was the same with luis Andre and lilly so helpful and funny I would defo recommend staying here 100% amazing service and rooms impeccable!!!

I want to thank Mr. Christy, Scott who works at the concierge. I cannot express how thankful I am for all his excellent assistance with planning a birthday surprise for my girlfriend and her guest. Scott went above and beyond to ensure the surprise was done correctly and went so far as to provide excellent recommendations for beverages and flowers. The surprise definitely made my girlfriends and her guest stay very memorable. His professionalism and excellent customer service deserves to be recognized. Thank you once again Mr. Christy, Scott for all the help!

The room (executive) is nice and spacious, its quiet, the staff are really helpful. Yadira Aviles helped me get a good deal by going directly through the hotel (much better than on a third party site) and made the whole process simple. This was very much in keeping with the rest of the staff at the hotel. Friendly and incredibly helpful. The only down side is that there are only 2 lifts for 20 floors and you can occasionally wait a while if you are on the upper floors. Beyond that, it is a really good hotel. I will definitely return in the future...

Just finished a week long stay for the first time at the LeSoleil. Will definitely it recommend for future stays. Friendly, helpful staff. Very clean, comfortable quiet room, typical small but usable size for NYC, nice modern bathroom but could use some extra clothes hooks. The room AC worked great, (which was a treat having come from one night at the Laguardia Marriot where the AC didn't work at all!). We had a19th floor room with a direct view of the Empire State Building. The two elevators were fast, never had to wait more than half a minute. We did the included breakfast that is buffet style served in the first floor restaurant. The buffet was good, plenty of food, though the same every day. It would be nice to have the option of ordering off the menu in the inclusive package. We did not try the restaurant for dinner, but did see that it was very popular. The hotel's location is very convenient to bus stops, subways, walk to nearby sightseeing and walk to a wide range of food choices - we got take out most nights to bring back to our room. Free WiFi worked fine. There are two computers & a printer in the basement level. Would book it again!

We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They were always smiling. My wife needed special assistance and the they were always there. The rooms were very clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The location is perfect, just a five minute walk from Times Square and in a very safe area. I’m visiting New York in the next few months, and I’m definitely coming back to this hotel. You won’t regret your stay!

Very clean hotel in an upscale style; very friendly staff, unfortunately a bit lean breakfast; The style and presentation of the breakfast are absolutely fine, but the choice of food and the variety must be greater, matching the price and style of the hotel.

Very nice hotel, Great Staff, perfect location. My only complaint is the bed was very comfortable but the sofa bed was terrible. Very thin mattress .You could feel every coil. They should invest in some high quality sofa bed mattresses.

The hotel is near Times Square and other tourist spot in New York. Breakfast consist of bacon fresh fruits and juices and varieties of bread. The fitness center is good also. Just had a bad experience when they charged me for 2 Amstel light without me knowing about it. I just saw it in my credit card statement upon reaching my home country. Had to email them several times telling them that I did not order any nor got anything from the mini bar. Still unresolved at the moment. So make sure to double check everything when you check out in this hotel

Bed so soft, God must've placed them there. Stayed there for business and it was just what I needed. This is a must stay and will keep it in my list... The location is close to my meetings and stores for shopping. The staff was very helpful with getting around and I am pleased the night hours were peaceful. Keep up the great work because I will be back.Em

We stayed 1 week at the hotel. The staff was kind and helpfull. The location is very very good. Most of the NY must see landmarks are within walking distance. The rooms are clean and big compare to NY hotels

This was our first time visiting New York and this hotel and staff made it unforgettable! Great location, amazing staff especially front desk Luis, Eranny and bartender Amalia in the restaurant inside the hotel. Would recommend everyone to stay here. Won’t regret it!

Had a excellent stay I mean the beds felt like clouds the room was so clean it smelled like brand new and the staff was outstanding a+ amazing location I'm definitely coming back for the holidays felt like royalty thank you

Had a wonderful stay (AGAIN) at this amazing location. While there, was treated better than the last time. Have to commend all of the staff who is obviously under GREAT management. My family and I were provided with a room suitable for four and possibly a 5th person. Going to the parade from their location was better than i anticipated. Just a few blocks and we were there. This is the best location for all sorts of reasons. Being in the middle of Manhattan makes it easy for shopping, events and/or anything just right for staying in NYC. Please read this and know, you will be treated like royalty at this hotel.Yours Truly,Jay
user_name:
js670044
New York City, New York

review_body: Executive Le Soleil exceeded our expectations. We booked directly through the hotel with Yadira (who was incredibly helpful and accommodating). We were able to quote a price found on Booking.com and she beat it. The staff was cheerful, polite, and responsive. We were a little nervous about city noise with a hotel in such a central location, but we had a room that was virtually silent from street noise! The room was perfect for our family of four. With the spacious bathroom splitting the sofa bed area from the queen bed area, the room felt more like a cozy one-bedroom. Thank you for a perfect stay in New York City!

My wife and I very much enjoyed our four nights at the hotel. The room was great -- small, but with a really good use of space and actually, a spacious bathroom. We were especially pleased that it was very dark and quiet in the mornings, which was fantastic for us light sleepers. The staff was very friendly and provided perfect service, including Jaime, who made arrangements for us to get to the airport. The price seemed appropriate for a midtown Manhattan hotel, though we were a bit surprised by an extra $7 or so on our bill (due to tax that wasn't included in the estimate when we booked), and a little annoyed by double-billing, both times for more than the amount due. But I noticed the billing problem before leaving, and the desk staff helpfully cleared up the mistake. Our stay was so great that I'm giving this 5 stars in spite of those issues.

Stay here every time I am in NYC now. Rooms are well appointed and always clean and comfortable. Staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful. The one thing I look for when visiting for work is a bit of refuge from the hustle and bustle and noise of city life and Le Soliel cocoons you from this wonderfully despite being close to everything you could need in midtown.
user_name:
TravelPalate
Kingston upon Thames, United Kingdom

review_body: Room sizes very smallBreakfast food quality and choice options poor.Location was great and easy walking distance to all hot spots.The staff very helpful and check out and check in process very efficient. Adjacent coffee shop hours not long enough

I need to say I am a serial reviewer. I check every hotel I stay at in great detail and I review when leaving. This place is superb. The location is the best I could have hoped for!! The rooms clean, comfortable maybe a little small but we slept got up went out!! There is not one negative to the place. The staff excellent ask a question get an answer. I’m going back to New York and I’m staying here.

Wonderful experience , fantastic staff , top notch service This was my second time to this property and I will be soon making it a third. Everything about this place makes it a joy and a great part of the New York Experience

Got to the Executive Hotel LeSoleil at 11pm after a flight from SoCal. Francis greeted us at the Front Desk with a great smile and a hearty welcome. When she found out that my wife was a light sleeper, she offered to change the room location for a better location. My wife had a nice sleep in room 608. She also gave us directions to the nearest convenience store and provided recommendations for breakfast the next day. When we got up the next morning, Francis was still at the front desk and greeted us with a cheerful Good Morning. My wife was very impressed.Excellent room, service and location. Highly recommended.

I stayed at this property two years ago and was not disappointed , so it is only natural I would return. A very nice stay and equally pleasing, Its a central location and if you are showing up by car, there is a parking lot about 30 meters

Wonderful hotel at wonderful location. Very friendly and helpful staff. Nice breakfast, hotel very well kept and sparkling clean. Room nice and clean but small and cramped. We paid extra for view and had wonderful view on the empire state. Overall it was great and I would definitely return.

Great location, rooms are fine, there wasn’t really any decent storage for clothes in our room but wasn’t a problem, we had a view of the Empire State Building, which was lovely, check in was very easy, and everyone was really helpful. They took $100 deposit per night stay which they said we would get back at the end of our stay. We asked if there were any other charges and were told no, but were then charged the facility charge when we left and only realised we were overcharged when overhearing how much they charged our friends. This was then rectified, but not really sure what the charge was for. (Water in room/gym etc)

Booked this hotel for our first trip to New YorkExcellent location just off 5th Avenue, close to Broadway, Times Sq, Rockefeller Centre, Empire State Building, Grand Central Station (all within 10 mins walk), Central Park 25 mins walk away.Despite its location in the Heart of NY there was no room noise at night and location was very quiet.Suggest floor 15 and above to have a view of Empire State BuildingWe checked in at 11.00 and rooms are not ready until 15.00 however luggage was securely stored so we could make most of our day and was in room upon return.Check in staff very helpfulRooms are beginning to show signs of wear and tear and one or two "bodged" quick repairs to plaster around some plug socketsOnly 5 Coat hangers provided which is fine if just an overnight stay but for a weeks stay we had more clothes that required hangersRoom description advises provision of Dressing Gowns (plural) but only one provided, slippers (no sign of them)Room was clean and bathroom very light with step in bath with overhead shower which worked wellPlenty of plug sockets and 2 USB portsOnly 2 lifts which can be frustrating Overall excellent value for money, great location and staffI would use again

Perfect hotel for our first visit to New York! Friendly, welcoming staff and a quiet, clean, spacious room with comfy bed! Really central to the well known sights and nearby Bryant Park is just lovely.

Great Location and the suites were pretty nice. I would say though there are two types of Suite. One with Sofa and extra space and the other is smaller with a Chez Lounge and a mini kitchen with microwave and plates. Breakfast was average.

First discovered this lovely hotel shortly after it opened and was most impressed. Returned recently and found it as good as before, maybe better. Staff are wonderful and the rooms while small are well appointed and very well maintained. We received an upgrade which really provided more space! Will come back, again.

My trip hasn’t even happened yet but I felt the need to write a GLOWING review already. If even a handful of the staff is as amazing and accommodating as Yadira, I’ve found my go-to hotel anytime I go to NYC! Money is often tight for me and traveling can be stressful. Not this time. She made the whole experience stress free & I feel like I can actually enjoy this vacation. Yadira is not only incredible at her job but she makes you feel truly special and welcome like family. I’m so excited to get there. THANK YOU, YADIRA!!!

The location of the hotel is brilliant and I was able to walk to most places or use the subway from Penn or Herald Street.The staff from the doormen, check in and house keeping were all friendly and helpful. Each day 2 bottles of water were put in the room for us, and the room has a coffee machine which was great. I found the room to be of a very good standard and clean. I liked the bathroom and didn't think it was dated like a previous review, equally I found the mattress comfortable and I slept really well and I am a terrible sleeper. I booked a queen suite and it was perfect for the 2 of us. Air con worked brilliantly it was that good I had to turn it off to sleep as I was so cold. The room doesn't have a lot of hanging space but again it worked for my 5 night trip fine.I was given room 905 opposite the elevator. I was initially worried about the noise but didn't need to be. It was so quiet, I was surprised I would never have known I was in New York and that's a good thing. I didn't have a view but I had emailed after booking and asked for a quiet room over a view as I was travelling with my 11 year old daughter. We never heard a thing traffic, elevator, or staff working it was brilliant. On previous trips to New York my sleep has suffered due to noise so it was so good to not have that problem.Wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Great location for a very comfortable hotel, staff very nice , room large and clean. great view over empire state building, subway close. recommended if you want to stay midtown , good for business trips and for leisure as well

Overall the hotel is well positioned and the good size of the suite was the deciding factor in our decision to stay here. The bathroom is tired and the mattress could be better, having said that I would recommend this hotel for those on a budget. Staff pleasant enough.

We were so surprised with this hotel - when we arrived, we weren’t able to check in straight away but not long after (around 2pm) our room was available. We couldn’t believe the size of our room, for NYC it was so big. We had read everywhere the hotel rooms in NYC were always small - not this one, we got a great room! The room on our trip to Boston was smaller!As soon as we got into our room, Housekeeping knocked on our door and brought up a complimentary bottle of white wine and a lovely card welcoming us to the hotel.The room was a great size, was lovely and clean and the staff couldn’t have done enough for us during our 4 days in NYC.We will definitely be back on our next visit to NYC. Thank you for having us!

Convenient, clean, no surprises! For a quick business trip, the location, cleanliness and ease of check in/out made LeSoleil a welcome change from other Manhattan hotels.The only negative is the nagging survey Review that insists on 200 characters minimum before it allows you to submit the survey! LOL

This hotel was very accommodating. The location was great. Also the hotel staff was very friendly and amazing beyond expectations. Very welcoming hotel. Also the rooms were very comfortable. The restaurant was also quite amazing.

Le Soleil is an excellent choice for a hotel. It is convenient and within walking distance of Broadway, which was one of the main reasons for our visit, and surrounded by many eating choices. The staff was very helpful and cheerful. Everyone made us feel very welcome.

Tight quarters, but we did not come to New York City to hang out in the hotel. Otherwise, an excellent choice for small families looking for a suite near the theatre disctrict, times square, and other landmarks.

Booked a penthouse suite and this was not as advertised. It did not have two rooms with wonderful views. The view was of roof top AC systems across the street. But that’s fine. My main problem was: check-in was delayed by an hour because of housekeeping issues- I was told room was so big it would take longer. Room was pretty tiny- so expectations were not properly managed and website was misleading. Experience was marred but rude customer service with check-in desk. Dealt with an impatient, distracted manager. In general front desk seemed under staffed. House keeping never showed up (and no, i didn’t put out the “do not disturb sign”). I called down at 4 30 to request a room clean. Beds were made, but otherwise room was not cleaned. Very disappointing.If staff hadn’t been so rude this review might be a bit more forgiving. Not hospitable at all.Such a shame.

I spoke with Yadira in customer reservations. She was knowledgeable, helpful and cheerful. I have a reservation for 3 rooms on different dates. She was awesome at getting everything organized. On top of that she help me save money! If Yadira is representative of your hotel, this is going to be a fantastic week!

Location is perfect with a dedicated staff. I remember Emilio and Negesti who were really helpful and very nice but in general the whole crew was impeccable! It was a pleasure to spend my week in this hotel and I will for sure come back to this hotel.
user_name:
jeangeorgesd2019
Santa Maria di Leuca, Italy

review_body: I spent 4 nights and it felt like home. The room was so comfy with a great view of the Empire stage building.  the subway is just around the corner and there’s heaps of options for shopping and food in the area. It’s in such a great location for getting anywhere whether you want to walk, you can walk about 5 mins to Times Square and the Empire State Building. Or take the subway on 34-35th st basically anywhere in the city.The staff are exceptionally friendly and are happy to accomodate your wants and needs. I can’t praise them enough. Emilio was such a great bell boy in particular, he was always up for a chat and was a joy to see in the mornings.

Very and very good location. Central Park five min walk, broadway, 5th avenue in 3 min walk. High line park and gran₽ central are also nearby. Great stuff, especially door gays. Window view is not interesting, do not overpay. Rooms are small , do not take many bags. Place is good for city break weekend

We loved this hotel. The location in midtown is perfect and we walked to practically everything. Close to the subway too. The hotel has a wonderful vibe and the staff were top notch. We especially appreciated Emilio and his fellow bellmen. They made us feel so welcome and had great recommendations. Went out of their way to flag down cabs. I have worked in hospitality and I recognize when staff go above and beyond, and they did. The rooms are beautifully appointed and well serviced. We would definitely stay here again! Big thanks to all the staff for making our trip so special.

I just spent 6 nights at the LeSoleil with my family. This is an excellent hotel with excellent service in a great location right in the heart of midtown Manhattan. The only reason I'm not giving this a 5/5 is because of the breakfast that is included which was disappointing and limited eg they wanted to charge extra for things like juice, they were constantly out of certain things, and its just pretty basic. we just ended up having breakfast elsewhere since you have loads of options a short walk away. Location wise your right next to the empire state building, rockefeller, broadway, times square, macy's, madison square garden etc... with loads of restaurants, bars, coffee shops to choose from. Central Park is even walkable provided you're ok walking, its probably a 30-40 min walk or so...we enjoyed walking around everywhere. you also have an amazing steak house in keens only a few doors away.The rooms were great, clean, comfortable bed with everything you needed. The staff were all polite and super helpful and friendly. I recall Emilio, one of the bellman, was a real fun guy and very helpful with suggestions.If they sorted out the breakfast, I'd be giving this 5/5.

Just returned from a great week at this hotel, was a bit of a mix up with room, but Lilly sorted it out and everyone was happy.Room was clean and good size only built was not a lot of hanging space for clothes. Breakfast was good, general choice. Would definitely recommend this hotel very good location.Staff where very helpful and accommodating for my husband who has MS and mobility issues. Would stay again.

My friend and I decided to go on a little trip away to New York City and we stayed at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil. This hotel was very clean and the service was amazing. The staff helped with any questions we had and I had got locked out from the complementary gym and the staff came right away to assist me. The bellmen at the front door, Emilio, was very helpful. He help with our luggage and always greeted us with a warm welcome. Once are trip came to an end he got a car for us to the airport and loaded are luggage in for us. This hotel was very attentive to their guest and I would defiantly recommend for anyone to stay here. My friend and I loved the city so much and this hotel was in the heart of it all and we plan on stay here again!

We had a great stay a couple of weeks ago at Executive Hotel LeSoleil. From the moment we arrived to a warm welcome on reception and a much-needed drink. Initially we were on the 5th floor which was quite noisy (and obviously no view of the city) but we were easily able to upgrade to the 18th floor. From there we had a fantastic view across the skyline (not the empire state side but you can request this). This room was also bigger and seemed to be in a better state of repair, although the room we had on the 5th floor was also very nice. The rooms are a bit of a squeeze for 4 people - in the 5th floor room our kids shared a couch bed (double) but they had to crawl over each other to get to the bathroom. They had more space when we moved rooms. The service was outstandng, from Joseph and the other chap on the door who were always friendly (morning and night!) to the reception staff who spotted our kids needed a rest between moving rooms and arranged for us to use our old room. Lots of little things that made it good - newspapers freely available, well stocked (and reasonably priced) mini bar, nice robe (only one though!), nice bedding, good toiletries in bathroom. Food - we had breakfast included which at the eye watering cost of $25 each I was glad was included. It was good quality food, not a massive selection but enough to have something a bit different each day, They were happy to make me a decaf coffee but you do have to pay extra for cappuccino and (weirdly) breakfast juices (at $6 each!). But there's also loads of places around if you wanted to get a cheaper breakfast. We didn't eat in the restaurant at night but there are so many on your doorstep you are spoilt for choice. Service in here wasn't quite as slick as in the hotel but friendly and warm. Location wise it's spot on - next street is Empire State, Times Square is just round the corner. Subway entrance on the next street. I'd really recommend booking this hotel if you want a good central location.

I stayed here with family and the customer service is excellent. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. Emilio, the bellman at the front door always welcomed us with a smile and kind words. I hope to stay here again and would highly recommend it.

As usual a perfect stay! Even when the lights were out the engineering guys fixed it expeditiously. And then my grandson and I were treated to a delicious breakfast. Thank you. I will be back very soon.

I have been recently here for a special visit to NY. I had a small problem but the staff relaxed me, trying to find a solution to the problem. Result: the holiday started even with trouble but with the right positivity not to damage my journey. This is the way a good hotel should welcome you. For other things, the hotel was clean, efficient and the staff gentle as a good guest service should be. All was fine and pretty but the plus was the right, comfortable, elegant with casualty atmosphere that this hotel has, not been the top of the five stars services, but letting you understand that if the place is right, not stars are necessary to have a great stay.

Beautiful clean hotel central to a lot of attractions great place, I know people will give bad reviews on what you say is good and that's just the the way things go but this hotel is brilliant if I ever go to new york again I'll sleep in this hotel

Room exactly as it seems in the Booking photos, with a nice view to the top of Empire, nice cleaning and an hotel staff always available to help you with everything you need.Only thing to improve, the breakfast bufett.Anyway and for NY definitly a nice relation between price and quality.

Lovely, good value hotel, close to Macy’s. Lots of restaurants nearby, especially the good Irish bar, The Keg Room and the Tio Pio West which we visited everyday for breakfast. Rooms are standard size, but lacks wardrobe space, however, manageable for our trip.

We flew into NYC with one day to recover from international jet lag. The hotel staff accommodated us with graciousness, preparing us a room as soon as possible. From doorman “Jaime” that stored our luggage , recommended places to eat and arranged airport shuttle service, to the friendly tint desk staff that made us feel welcomed and special by efficiently preparing our room, doubling our points as executive members and fetching a bandaid for a blistered toe, we have always had a positive experience that will encouragre is to seek “Le Soleil”Wherever we travel!Ann & Doug

Great location and friendly and helpful staff made our first visit to The States a positively memorable one. Big thanks to Keron on the door and Lilly on the Desk for all your help. Hope to be back one day!

Had a great time. The staff was great and helpful. Comfortable room and spacious. Didn't even feel like I was in midtown. Great location with easy access. Enjoyed the food and service in the restaurant.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel along with three other couples for a weekend out on the town. I usually look for and find negative things to say and write about places I've been to. This time was an exception! From the service ,to the staff, to the rooms(size and decor) this place was magnificent. I speak for all the couples because they too feel the same way and are looking forward to staying there in the very near future. Compliments to the management!

this was our first stay, we will definitely be back! They made us feel so welcomed, my wife can’t stop talking about our stay! They were so professional so courteous and so kind we had that sense of our home away from home thank you so much we will definitely be back! And we love the location it’s close to everything !

We have just got back from staying at this hotel and cannot praise it enough. ALL the staff were friendly, courteous and extremely helpful. they guided us around new York and helped with subway, eating, shows, taxi information which we couldn't have done without. the room was fabulous (1505) with a view of the empire state building (beautiful when changing colour on a night time). We had a microwave, kettle, plates and a bath. the room was cleaned and spotless everyday. fresh towels daily too. We had a drink in the bar during happy hour and it, too, was clean and reasonably price. the hotel is right in the centre of NY and a 5-10 min walk to attractions like empire state building and times square. We used ubers a lot and found them quite reasonable. We asked for a late check out and this was fine, they also organised a ride back to the airport. All in all I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and would not even look for another one if I was to return to NYC.

Cool place in the heart of the city. Very friendly staff. Nice rooms. I have been here many times and the service is excellent. Loaded with tourists. One restaurant but serving very good food. I will definitely come back again.

The hotel is very nice, the rooms are small but hey, that is New York for you! The bellboys are absolutely awsome and the restaurants breakfast is ok. Beds are very comfortable! However - and this is what’s really bad - is the huge deposit the hotel demands, the extra fees (resort fee)and the worst; the receptionists attitude when we questioned the bill at check out. We stayed 4 nights which leaves us to pay a 400 USD deposit (apart from the first nigth being drawn from our credit card before check in time PLUS the full price for our four nights). We did this in cash and got it back at check out and discussed the bill which we could not quite understand and sat down in the lounge. While we are there we checked our bank account online and discovers that the receptionist actually took that 400 USD on our creditcard while giving us back the cash, the online bank account showed the exact time it had been drawn! She did NOT listen when we tried to explain that she had done a mistake but had such an arrogant attitude, blamed it on ”the system” and also on us! She implied that maybe we had told her college at check in to do both the full amount in cash AND credit?! She was not helpful or nice at all. She was rude! We had to force her to apologize but she would only apologize on behalf of ”the system”. It totally ruined the stay there for us. The fees, the outrages deposit and that awful employee totally without any service mind!

amazing hotel. absolutely faultless. room well equipped with microwave, sink, tea/coffee facilities, in room safe, bath and shower, good wifi, amazing views of empire state building. nothing too much trouble for all staff. very friendly and helpful. everywhere clean and tidy. good bar onsite. would not hesitate to revisit.

Whenever you want to travel to Manhattan, this Hotel ist probably the best Choice. Central but quiet, spectacular view to the Empire State Building, very comfortable beds, but the best was the kind and helpful staff! Thank you, LeSoleil!

Our experiance with Executive Hotel Le Soleil New York was very good! Nice hotel, friendly staff and a nice room. The staff does everything to make their stay as pleasant as possible. The location is very central for most sights or departure with the subway.

If you get a chance ask for a high level room at the rear. We had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building from our window [lit up at night]. As in most cases in NYC the room was not huge but well appointed. Lounge in the foyer was comfortable and bar/restaurant was very pleasant. Breakfast was very good but at $24 was only worth having if you intended it to last you until the evening meal. Happy hour [4 to 6] was enjoyable with gin and tonic, beer, cocktail at only $5. Bar food is also on happy hour menu but whilst tasty was limited. The restaurant food was very good.
user_name:
stanhenderson
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: We arrived on 4th April 2019 after an uneventful flight from Manchester, England. We were met by Joseph, who took our bags and carried them into the hotel for us, he welcomed us to both the USA and to the hotel, stating that if there was anything that he could do, all we had to do was ask. The check in was very efficient and the staff on the desk were extremely polite and welcoming. I had called ahead a couple of days prior to our visit, explaining that it was my wife's 60th birthday the day after we arrive and could they do something nice for her. We were given a room with a great view (1404) and when we opened the door to the room, there was a nice bottle of wine waiting for us, compliments of the hotel. The room was spotless and very well laid out. There was a mini bar and a tray of goodies (Not complimentary and VERY expensive, so be careful here). There is a bar on the ground floor that has a super atmosphere, just the place to start and end your nights out, again be aware that unless you visit the bar during happy hour (half price) the drinks are, as in the rest of NYC, VERY expensive, $10 for a 330ml can of IPA. Although we never ate in the bar, we met lots of people who did and the only had praise for the food and service. We had no issues at all during our stay and requests for extra water and pillows were completed within 30 mins of asking. Jaime, the head Concierge, was BRILLIANT, he was just the right mix of polite and friendly, thanks Jaime for all your hard work and for sorting both my daughters and our cabs to the airports. OK, here are a couple of things to look out for while in NYC.Make sure that you read the bill properly before just paying it, there is a tipping culture in NYC of between 10 and 25 percent, the vendors will put the tip on the bill under the heading of "gratuity", if this is already on the bill, don't feel obliged to also tip in cash. I would politely ask for the tip to be removed from the bill and leave a cash tip for the staff who waited on me, this has two benefits, one is that the person who dealt with your table gets the money and that they don't pay tax on it.Keep your Credit Card in view all all times! My wife's was cloned while we were there and although this was picked up by the bank and the card was cancelled, we luckily had access to other funds that we could draw on while we were there. Top Tip, us a PRE LOADED card, very secure. We had one as a backup, obtained from the Post Office, this turned out to be a life saver.Conclusion:-I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel, it's not cheap, but as the saying goes, you get what you pay for!

Although the room is a bit tiny, it fits all the needs: big beds with very comfortable mattress, mini refrigerator, desk, and large bathroom with extensive shower. Sleeping on the 13th floor did not let us hear any sounds from outside, slept all nights through for a week. Emilio and Anely made our stay even more perfect when we received coupons for coffee and pastry! Thank you guys! Definitely worth a stay if you want a clean hotel with friendly staff that’s on walking distance from Times Square, Empire State and Bryant Park!

A really perfect hotel for visiting New York. Very nice rooms, top location and a very friendly staff! Located at the centre of Manhattan.We had a wonderful time in New York and at the hotel. Highly recommended.

Although I´ve spent most of my days outside the hotel it was always good to come back to my room. Your positive experience starts right at the begin when you get off the cab and the doormen helps you with the door. The staff at the hotel is nice but what is most important that the faclitity is clean and quite. The location is just another advantage as you can walk to some of the major city´s landmarks.

Our fourth trip to New York, this time for our 31st wedding Anniversary, but our first time to this hotel and, I have to say, it was great. We stayed in room 307 and it was so quiet. No noise from the street. No noise in the hotel and the accommodation was so comfortable. The staff were so helpful and friendly. As for location the hotel isn't far from Macy's department store and Times Square as well as 5th Avenue. The subway is nearby to take you to the attractions. Definitely consider this hotel if you plan to visit New York.
user_name:
Patrick M
Glasgow, Scotland, United Kingdom

review_body: My wife and I stayed here on the recommendation of a friend and they were 100% correct about their praise. Beautiful small comfortable hotel with so much upside. Great room, clean, awesome view and location and tremendous, professional staff. felt very much at home. Just a perfect 3 day stay and will be sure to recommend and return.

We just spent for nights here and we loved it. I have allergies to cleaners and fragrances and they went to great care to make sure the room was allergy free. We loved our room, the size and the view of the Empire State building from our window. The staff was great, very attentive and really couldn't be better. We LOVED that we could walk to so many areas from this location. Would visit again.

We enjoyed a five night stay at this smallish, friendly hotel. The room was clean and well presented. A little on the compact side for a family of four, but that is to be expected at a central Manhattan location. The staff were all extremely helpful and friendly, especially Negesti on the front desk and Jamie and Joseph, the doormen. My only concerns are the whistling noise and draught coming from windows that need updating. Other than that we had a super time at this charming hotel. We would definitely stay there again.

Absolutely stunning hotel in the most perfect location. Hotel had everything we needed. We travelled with our 8 year old who also loved it. Staff were fantastic! Would definitely return! Thank you. A*

As I prepare to leave the hotel for the start of my journey back to Texas, I just wanted you to know what a blessing the staff was to me on my trip to NYC. From smiles, to your helpfulness and recommendations, I appreciated your help. The most important part was how you eased some of my anxiety getting around town on my trip.Please express my thanks to your management and your peers as everyone from doormen (Joseph) to concierge to other front desk personnel (Frances)were most helpful and attentive. Truly the staff here is outstanding.

Spent two nights with my husband, and had a great time. The room was a nice size and very clean considering how small rooms are in New York.A very nice restaurant called Trademark on the property, very nice pre-fixe lunch for only $21 and nice live music on Thursday night in hotel lobby. Will definitely be back.
user_name:
akavounidis
New York City, New York

review_body: One block away from Herald Square subway station and the Empire State Building. There are a number of places to eat and shop. It's also not as crazy as Times Square so that's enjoyable. It's also a few blocks away from the bus. We used all modes of travel. The hotel is wonderful and everyone treated us incredibly. From the front desk, to Joseph at the door, service was impeccable. The rooms are clean and modern. Our family of 4 was able to share a room (with sofa bed) with enough privacy. We had one minor issue with water draining in the sink and it was fixed by the time we got back from sightseeing. Everything was more than we expected. I will be staying there again in the future.

Excellent and very good service!!!In the midlle of New York with very good location!!!The stuff was very friendly and kind.The room was very clean with nice view!.Also you can visit a lot of intresting places around frim the lotel.

Had the best time at this hotel, amenities were great and staff were very friendly. Special mention goes to Emilio the doorman who made us feel welcome! Location was incredibly convenient will definitely stay here next time we’re in NY

Check your final bills very carefully and, if you made reservations ahead of time, review them against your confirmations. You’ll see that this hotel charges you JUST a little bit more than what you originally thought they were going to.In most some cases, it’s not a lot; but it’s just enough to where if they do it to thousands of guests per year, it adds up to nice pile of extra money, without causing too much concern with their customers. I stayed here several times last year, and to be honest, I almost didn’t even notice it, until something unrelated caused me to take a closer look. And yes, it turns out they did this during ALL of my stays.What’s sad about this situation, is that I did everything I could to contact the hotel and discuss this with them. I was hoping for a logical explanation, but sadly no. I received no explanation whatsoever. Management was completely silent, even after I sent multiple inquiries to various different people in management: their GM and Director of Rooms.I am really disappointed by this. I had planned many more trips in the coming year to NYC, but unfortunately, this hotel’s dishonesty has lead me to find other accommodations in the future. At the end of the day, if they’re doing this to me, they’re doing it to thousands of others as well, each and every year. Rest assured, I will never stay at this hotel again.

Great stay at this hotel. I was traveling with my son so it was important to have 2 beds which is sometimes difficult to find in NYC.The room was great and the location fantastic. No issues whatsoever. Highly recommend!

Very nice hotel with a great central location. Staff was really Helpful, room was of a decent size, furnished with taste and beding was confortable. We really enjoyed our timeWe ll definitely come back.
user_name:
vspat2016
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: I had booked the hotel for two nights , hotel is located very close to major attractions, rooms are nice and spacious .Unfortunately, I had death in the family and had to leave after one night stay , I had some issues with getting my one night stay refunded but I have to say that GM John Loizos personally contacted me and took care of everything. I highly appreciate how the senior management takes care of their customers . I will for sure stay at this property when I am back in New York.Thanks .

The rooms were very large for an NYC hotel room as well as being clean and comfortable. The staff was very pleasant and helpful and made us feel welcome as soon as we walked in. The restaurant has tasty food - the fries and the desserts in particular. It wasn't particularly large, but we were always able to get a seat quickly.

Stayed there for four days from February 28th to march 4th. We loved the hotel and the staff members. BUT we had to pay a deposit when we check in. $400, and we haven't had any information about that before we booked the hotel. When we check out the lady in the reception told us we would get our money back in a few days. Now its been FOUR!! weeks, and we haven't seen the money AT ALL!!! I've sent them a couple emails, and even called! But NO! respons. Ive stayed in MANY hotels, but I've NEVER been treated like this!!!!! 400 DOLLARS!! this is fraud, big time!!

Overall it was a very nice stay in a nice hotel. Staff was very kind and helpful. Location was ideal. Close to the metro - but a lot can be reached by foot. We took a queen suite with view. We were on the 16th floor. View was ok on Empire State but higher would have been nicer. Had a building right in front of us.

Fabulous location. Beautiful hotel with wonderful, helpful, kind staff. Beds were comfortable, room was clean, Gym was perfect. We were very happy we stayed here and will stay here again in our future.

I had an event at Gotham Hall down the block so it was super convenient especially returning late at night. Staff was friendly, bed was comfy and the room was clean.I recommend the restaurant too with several gluten free options
user_name:
Hillary G
New York City, New York

review_body: One Word—-Perfect! Location, staff, rooms, restaurant are excellent. Always enjoy my stay. There is no reason to stay anywhere else as hotel is within walking distance to Times Square, Macy’s, Broadway, Chelsea, MSG, Empire State Building, Hudson Yards, and a variety of bars/restaurants. Our go-to place when in NYC! Go to this hidden gem... you will not be disappointed,

Love this hotel ,they greet you wonderfully with a glass of wine .had a nice little room up high ,which Asked and they gave me .very comfortable ..anything that I needed they accommodated me .food is fabulous and love the ladies and the guys that work for this hotel and Restaurant .Yes very pleased I will see you all in the fall

This was a very nice hotel that took great care of me and my family. The location is very good and and centrally located. Despite the close access to lots of stuff to do, we were able to sleep soundly. The staff was very helpful and we really appreciated the cheerful help we received from Keron.

Our third visit to this hotel and it's our favorite. Exttremely nice, spacious lobby, beautiful rooms. Great staff - friendly, welcoming, professional. Great location - easy walk to theatres, from Penn Station, to many places. After staying in big hotels, it's a relief to be in a smaller hotel where you can always get an elevator. The restaurant is good and the adjacent coffee carryout place is terrific.

Great location, walk distance to Empire state building, Rockefeller, Fifth Ave shopping and Time square. Convenient to go to nearby bars and restaurants.Bellmen Emilio was very helpful and decent!Great experience overall.

Fantastic hotel in a great location in NYC, very peaceful and relaxing. Genuinely helpful and friendly staff, Jaime took care of us on our last day when he kindly booked our car to JFK and secured our baggage while we had a few hours to kill after we checked out. Good size rooms with everything you need including an umbrella. Very close to lots of great restaurants, superb shopping is just a short walk away and a few minutes from the subway and grand central station. A substantial breakfast was included for us and we dined in the restaurant on one of the evenings, the risotto and dessert were just divine.

Great location, professional friendly staff, sparkling, comfortable rooms. Close to Herald Square & subway there. The front door staff can assist you with whatever you need for the day. An umbrella was provided in the room for unexpected rainy days! We will definitely call and book a room here the next time we visit NYC!

A great area to stay in NY. Walkable in so many areas north and south. Plenty of options to dine nearby. Very friendly staff, attentive to details, manager promptly taking over to resolve issues.Rooms on higher floors with view of Empire State Building are great. Very nice bathrooms too.

Service was wonderful from the moment we got there. The bellman, Emilio, was incredibly friendly and helpful- as was the rest of the staff. Rooms were clean and modern. I would definitely come back again

Check in/out was very simple and the staff at the front desk were very kind and helpful. Our room was lovely and the bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was a wonderful size and very modern. Housekeeping were great. The room could do with a bit more lighting and there was a slight draft coming from the window but nothing too major. Apart from that the stay was very pleasant.

I was here for business and was very impressed with the level of service at this hotel. There were two different issues that occurred and they went above and beyond to accommodate us even though they didn’t cause the problem either time. The staff were all extremely courteous and helpful. Will definitely be staying again!

the location is great, the hotel is 4 and not 5 star, queen size bed really means queen size, not enough space for a couple, breakfast was good but again by far not 5 star but the location is simply perfect and the rates are quite satisfactory for midtown NYC sofa bed was so so, for small children use, not an adult, the hotel is very good but not 5 star and not any luxury

Centrally located near Herald Square and a walk away from Times square,Grand Central and the major attractions. The rooms are small,but neat and clean and functional and the bathrooms are a reasonable size and well appointed . Ask for a higher floor for a view . There is cosy lobby with a decent sitting area , and housekeeping is efficient . The one disappointment is the buffet breakfast which lacks variety and is the same menu everyday . Also you have to pay extra for a juice or any other hot beverage other than coffee! The wireless requires you to sign in afresh every time ,which is a minor annoyance . Overall however ,good value for money as Manhattan hotels go !

The only complaint I had was that I wish they’d change the sheets every night versus making the bed. Other than that, great experience. The location was perfect. I would definitely recommend to a friend.

Just returned from a 3 wk stay at this great hotel.Booked a room for 4 and we found the room to be a bit small for a 3 week stay, so on our first day we spoke to reception, and on our return we found our luggages moved to a more comfortable room. Rooms are as seen on website, no surprises!!All staff helpful and friendly, a clean and nice place to stay.Would definitely return, highly recommended.Veronica Degiorgio

I’ve been to many hotels in SF, LA and NY and honestly what I loved about this hotel was the outstanding attention to detail they have.Me and my wife felt very very comfortable and honestly it made a good part in us loving the city.

This was our second stay. We will continue to stay here. We brought another couple who enjoyed their stay. The hotel had a good price for its location, which was excellent. It is near Macy's and the subway. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance.The whole staff was friendly and courteous. They were attentive to our needs. It was a nice experience for us and our friends.

Just back from a lovely 6 days at this fantastic hotel. We have travelled extensively around Europe and this hotel has all of the essential hallmarks of a southern French boutique hotel. An absolute gem. On entry we were warmly greeted by the front of house staff and check in was relaxing. The concierge (both of the ones we met) were constantly professional and immensely affable. A credit to the establishment. Rooms are comfortable and warm, and importantly quiet! We heard nothing from outside which makes a welcomed change to previous NYC visits. When we return to New York this will be our go to hotel, always.many thanksWalker family.

Each time I go to New York City I like to experience a new hotel since there are so many to select from. The criteria is reasonably simple: price and location. In this instance Executive Hotel LeSoliel was acceptable: consistent 4-5 star reviews and a room price that was not outrageous. On reflection, I have to say that I couldn't find anything negative to point out. My room was very nice, the service was great and the staff was terrific; especially the front desk, housekeeping and the doorman. Pleasant, courteous, remembered that I was a guest; and, professional. The only minor issue- and its purely a personal preference- was that the bathroom sink had very little room for personal toiletries but it was manageable. It's a real stretch when this is the only insignificant comment. The linens and pillows were comfortable, the towels were fluffy and spotless. Really good hotel, location is excellent for mid-town and I highly recommend the place.

Great hotel, very helpful and friendly staff. Frances, Lily, Negesti on reception and Keron the Bellman were very helpful with everything we needed. They were friendly and fun. Assets to your hotel. Our room was very comfortable, lovely beds, great shower, very happy with our 4 nights stay. The only negative was that there wasn’t enough storage; only one small drawer and a few hangers so we kept most things in our cases opened on the floor. The room was plenty big enough for a small wardrobe and more drawers. A couple more luggage holders would have been good to put our cases on instead of the floor (the one provided was very small). Other than that it was perfect. Our room was very quiet, we heard nothing, not even the traffic so we slept very well. The hotel has a beautiful bar area and very comfortable lounge area and an impressive but not imposing entrance. I highly recommend staying there and hope to again sometime.

Stayed here for a girls weekend with my mom and sister and had a great time! I snap chatted the room to a few friends because I was excited and I got replies back from frequent NYC travelers that the room looked large- points there! The room was as clean as could be, bathroom was lovely, bathroom toiletries were plentiful, and the bed was comfortable. Aside from the room aspects, the staff was super friendly and all around awesome. Oh should mention location was what initially attracted me to book this place! Highly recommend staying here.

The hotel is in the perfect location for mid town especially if you are arriving or departing from Penn Station. The staff was really helpful and friendly. We got a few great tips from the doorman on duty regarding the subway and a stroll through Central Park. The room was great and very clean. I really enjoyed this hotel (it was my first stay here) and I was so glad to find this hotel so centrally located. I hope to stay here again next time in NYC!

I want to thank all of the staff at Executive Hotel Le Soleil New York, for a fabulous vacation experience! The staff were super friendly and helpful! Yadira is exceptionally helpful and friendly with reservations -thank you! We are looking forward to our next stay! Sincerely, Mrs. Quiles

The hotel is very well located, nice view, efficient staff (but for sorting out my wifi pb - I could access the wifi on my phone from everywhere in NY BUT my hotel room, very frustrating), lots of places to eat and drink nearby, easy from penn station. All good

I was expecting more about it. Since the moment of check in I found the employees kind of unpleasant.The room was so small with an awful view They didn’t prepare the room as we requested The room cleaning was so poor Never replaced the snacks of minibarThe location is okI definitely won’t come back

This hotel offered extremely great service. The staff are very pleasant especially Yadira Aviles, she made us very comfortable and met all our demands and was extremely welcoming. She made sure we stayed in rooms that suited our needs. I would highly recommend booking with her.

My favorite hotel in NYC. Very relaxing. I have to come into NYC for business, but my wife comes along, and we have a great time. But the best part is always coming back to Hotel Le Soleil. It's a little escape from the city.

Had a wonderful stay here during the recent snow storm in NYC. The hotel was extremely accommodating on such short notice. Great size room, warm service and conveniently located. Can’t ask for much more!!

Superb hotel in a great location for most things in NYC. Lovely friendly helpful staff. Rooms were roomy with extra sitting area. Close to lots of amenities, shopping and the subway to uptown and downtown.

My first but not my last stay at this lovely hotel. I true gem. Hospitality plus, clean, attractive. Great artwork. Whoever designed the interiors had great taste with an eye for detail. Classy but functional.

The front desk makes you feel like you're an imposition and the restaurants associated with the hotel has service issues. Theres a million hotels to choose from in NYC, and I will avoid staying in this one ever again.

I stayed at the Hotel LeSoleil for the first time in January for a business trip to NYC to attend a LinkedIn conference. From the moment I walked into the Hotel with the doorman (Joseph, follow Bronx born new friend) opening the door and welcoming me to the person at the front desk, everyone was extremely professional and made sure my visit was perfect. The room was very clean and just the right size for the business traveler. I will stay here again and recommend this Hotel to everyone. Thanks Mitchell

I've stayed at a few places in Midtown when visiting for work, and I know I've found the hotel that I will continue to book for future visits! Right when you walk in the hotel has a warm and welcoming environment, and the staff is extremely helpful and courteous. There is a bar/restaurant in the hotel along with many great restaurant options nearby as well. It's a really central location in Manhattan and just a block away from the 34 Street - Herald Sq Station.The room is comfortable, clean, and has all that you'd want during your stay!

From the minute you walk in, this place is a keeper. The staff is courteous and kind, the rooms are beautifully appointed, the view of the Empire State Building from my bed can’t be beat. The location is amazing and it is quiet. Hard to believe you get all this and even with taxes and amenity charge it is under 200$ per night. Wow! This has been my go to for the February gift show for the last 4 years. Thank you Le Soliel for making me feel so safe and comfortable.

I've been a repeat customer at Executive Hotel LeSoleil for a while now. The location is perfectly centered in the city making it easy to get everywhere quickly. The staff is so helpful and friendly, the restaurant serves delicious food, the blues music playing in the background really contributes to the entire vibe. It's a peaceful calm in the center of a hectic city. Keron was so incredibly helpful upon check in as my flight was delayed coming in and I had to collect my packages at the front desk and head to a work event asap. He had all my bags/packages up in minutes, with a car ready to go for my event - THANK YOU, Keron! I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

I was impressed with the service here. Everyone was really friendly and helpful. My shower water pressure was low and they sent someone up to fix it right away. Then the city turned the water off on that block (not their fault) and they handled it very well. In particular, Negesti at the front desk was really sweet and helpful. Made my very busy trip a breeze. Thanks all!

I stayed 3 nights in NY for business. This was my first time at Executive Hotel LeSoleil. It was by far, the best experience. Staff is polite and helpful. The hotel is beautiful. Rooms are clean. Having a restaurant on site is convenient.

Stayed over the weekend at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil (2 nights) in Midtown. The hotel is right next door to the Empire State Building and a few metres away from the closest subway station on the 5th Ave. Besides the stunning view of the ESB I could enjoy from my window at the 12th floor and the nice layout of the room's furniture, I found the personnel very welcoming and helpful. Hands down, one of the best structures I've visited in Manhattan.

Stayed for 5 nights at the Executive Hotel Le Soleil 9-14 Jan. Booked direct and received a much more favorable deal for 2 rooms (couple with 2 teenagers). Hotel is ideally located between 5th and 6th Avenues Midtown,within walking distance to major attractions eg. Empire state building, Times Square, Broadway (10-15 minute walk), The Rock (20 mins) with food shops (some open 24/7) located within 5 minute walk or less from front entrance. Major shopping areas also within walking distance. Penn Station if travelling locally or interstate is a 10 minute walk. JFK about 35min by cab. Found staff to be very friendly and helpful throughout our stay and are a credit to the management team. (Eranna at the front desk gets special mention here for her efficient and excellent service both prior to and throughout our stay).Rooms - beds very comfortable and rooms clean with minimal street noise (one of our rooms faced the street on 4th floor). Would suggest tea making facilities in addition to coffee machine to be included in rooms. Hotel caters for the business and tourist market so guests were a mixture of both. Had a cooked breakfast in-house which was excellent though would increase the variety of buffet offerings. Overall an excellent stay and would highly recommend this boutique hotel for the first time visitor to NY.

Check in staff is VERY helpful.Room is qualitative and CLEAN!Hotel is well located.LOVED the room and the staff. Only negative was the restaurant but appears to be under separate ownership.I travel ALL THE TIME and would highly recommend this hotel.

Very convenient hotel in midtown. Very friendly staff - thank you Andrew (AA!) at the front desk and Joseph at the door. The room was a very good size, esp for NYC. The location was very convenient to walk easily to the Central Library, 5th Ave shopping, Penn Station, etc.

Thank you very much for a wonderful time in your hotelwith friendly staff in a very great location.The rooms are very nice and absolutly clean. We slept in the 11th floor and it was very quitly. Everything, what we needed was in the room.

This is our regular NYC hotel because of its super convenient Midtown location, affordable luxury and wonderful staff. The rooms can be small, but they are very efficiently laid out, incredibly clean and have very nice bathrooms. The adjacent coffee shop is terrific and the nail salon next door is fabulous—the girls are really sweet and do a fabulous job.

Thank you so much to everyone the food was great the staff was excellent extra thanks to all the Gentlemens at the door. What a Beautiful blessed site to see when you come in the door and out the door of the hotel and greated with a nice big Smile from all the guys. Thank you Mr. Keron for your extra mile helping us with cab and car service also great direction Thank you Mrs. Jones

Was in nyc for work. Came across this spot after doing some research on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. Clean and large rooms. Great bang for your buck. Ideal location with lots of good restaurants around the area and a solid restaurant downstairs.Andre and Victor made the stay excellent. Service is everything and they exemplified this. Highly recommend.

I stayed one night at Le Soleil. I really enjoyed my stay and the Bellman, Keron was very polite and gave great recommendations on things to do in the city. I will definitely be back to visit. Great location as well!

You want a nice, comfortable room and people / staff who provide good / great service and attention? Look no further. Very nice, affordable hotel. And, upon checking in, ERANNY at the front desk noticed my birthday was two days prior ... and all of a sudden, I have a bottle of wine in my room !! Having traveled from CA, I was unfortunately dealing with a nasty cold ... and manager MATT gave me helpful local info, some nice teas, and a hand-written note. I needed to adjust my stay, and INNA and ANELY at the front desk were super kind and super helpful. I'll soon be back to NY and DEFINITELY will look to stay here again !! Highly recommend.

An additional quilted bed spread would great. The hotel atmosphere is warm and friendly. the robe in each room is an excellent touch. I have stayed in the hotel five time I will continue to my home away from home when I an travelling to NYC.

I had a wonderful experience at the hotel. All of the staff was friendly and helpful. Joseph and Emilio at the front door went above and beyond to make sure my stay was everything I had hoped.The hotel is beautiful, the location is perfect. Nice restaurants on 36th and 35th. Walking distance to so many of New York's many sites.I will absolutely be visiting again.

Low January rates help push this hotel to a five. If I was paying double what I paid, the size of the room, and the lack of storage and closetcloset might have brought it down oneone num.But Its a perfect location and a very nice hotel with an excellent staff. Well decortaed in a traditional style and it feels more permanene than many of the chain hotels that have sprung up in this neighborhood in the past decade. My room was actually quiet-- a wonder in these new built mid town hotel structures. I could hear nothing from the hallways and very little from the street.The room is small, but functional in every way but clothes storage. If the hotel has a fault is the lack of suitable space to unpack. The limited hanging space shares a nook with part of the rooms bar, so unless you're traveling with only halter tops and shorts, your clothes and a waterbottle, two wine glasses and some chips are going to constantly be fighting for the same limited space. I think Yotel, Pod 42nd, Citizen M all manage to do this better in more limited space-- but with less of the very comfortable traditional hotel room that Le Soleil provides. But for just fourfour the storage was nothing more than a mild annoyance. Because the room is comfortable for one person. The shower is great and very well designed. The bed is very comfortable. The wifi worked well. If i'd had someone with me, the space might have been too confined Skip the breakfast buffet, much better and cheaper places close by. I didnt eat any other meals at the restaurant.This is now definitly a hotel I will put on my repeat list. Very comfortable and friendly.

I picked this hotel late in the day when visiting Manhattan with my teen kids between Christmas and New Year and it was the best choice I made. Why? The staff are the best I have experienced in all my years of travel, helpful, thoughtful, supportive, understanding, patient and most of all sincere with their manner. Many hotels make you feel they are 'just doing their job' by helloing out, at this hotel they make you feel that it's embedded in them. It starts from their GM - John and leads all the way down. As for the rooms, very clean, large for Manhattan and also well kept. Great location and everything you could want in a hotel. Book here and you will not be disappointed.Well Done all and a big thank you from my family !

Beautiful holidays !!! Hôtel Executive le Soleil is great! Wonderful staff: Lilly : assistant of director, Joseph: the doorman, Keron: the doorman, and Latch the engeneer, are amazing so friendly and very well at work.It was a real pleasure Dora.

I picked the hotel primarily based on location - very close to Penn Station and where my meeting was held. The doors to the lobby were quite heavy and i had a very difficult time opening them. There was no doorman and there was no one to welcome you. The lobby was nice and well decorated but dimly lit. The checkin process was smooth but a little slow. He did give me a nice room upgrade. The restaurant had good food and a nice bar area but I was a bit disappointed with the service. The room was nicely decorated and clean but small, even with the upgrade. The bed was comfortable but the TV was quite small compared to other hotels I've been in recently. The shower was really cool with the drain length wise in the middle of the shower. It had a large shower head and was pleasant The bathroom had nice amenities and a makeup mirror but didn't have separate area for the sink and shower which might be important if you have multiple people trying to get ready at the same time. There were plenty of mirrors through out the room including a full length mirror in the living area. The fitness room had free weights and treadmills as well other equipment but was a bit worn and in the basement which meant no cell connectivity.Overall I had a pleasant stay and would stay there again.

We had a wonderful view of the Empire State Building, it felt like it was in the back garden. The staff were very friendly and helpful without being overpowering. The hotel was spotless and very comfortable. It was so easy to relax after a long day out and about sightseeing. Fresh bottles of water were provided each day in our room. We opted for inclusive breakfast and there was enough choice for the 7 days we were there. The location could not have been better, a very short walk to 34th Herald Sq train line. Ideally situated for 5th Ave, Broadway, Times Sq, Radio City, Rockefeller plaza (and the tree), Empire State Building, Macy’s, walking to Central Park for skating in the evening was achieved too as well as so much more.  This maybe a criticism for some but, we managed and it certainly wouldn’t put us off staying again, there wasn’t enough storage space for two people for a weeks stay.

Le executive le soleil hotel is a good choice to stay in Mid manhattan. Quality/Price relationship is fairly good. Staff is very gentle and collaborative. The hotel in general is fairly cleaned. The only con would be the size of the 4 adults room

The location was excellent. Good enough that it almost made up for the small items with which we took small issue. Many major landmarks within an easy walk.Staff was, for the most part, friendly.The extra charges added up to almost 27% more than the price listed when searching for the hotel (taxes, service charges, etc.)Two elevators in the entire hotel meant that both staff and guests would make use of them at the same time. That mean waiting for an elevator averaged five minutes. That doesn't seem long until you think about how long a person typically waits for an elevator. That and the multiple stops on the way.Front door was opened for us only 35% of our entries and exits combined and no effort to ask if we needed assistance to our room upon check-in.Housekeeping was fine, though forgot to refill coffee more than once meaning we had to take time to ask for it. Only one bathrobe for the entire room, seemingly regardless of how many guests are booked for the room. No lock on sliding bathroom door.Room was spacious for NYC. We also had a small two-person sofa in its own area with second television. Nice view. The thermostat's buttons were worn away to the point that you had to work out by guessing what each button's function was. Seemed as though either heat was fully on or fully off, without much in-between. Noise level minimal for the location. Could hear horns and sirens but in a city, that's expected.Front desk friendly enough but it was clearly a mechanical process to check in and out, rather than a pleasant conversation.

Nice little hotel with a warm family feeling. Nice family rooms, but i would say you need a lot more clothing storage, worst part of the review, enough room for one, not a family room. Great location, clean, and very helpful staff, the consignee was assume, we did not eat at the hotel, but it does look nice in there, we got recommendations for every day we stayed and helped with transport and printed of tickets for us also, great job

Who would of known, two stops away on the F Train, you could stay in a soft bed with sound proof windows. In November, my wife and I decided to go see The Christmas Show at Radio City Music Hall, when the show was over my wife and I decided to find a hotel to sleep over, instead of driving back home to Queens Village. Though we have chosen to stay at The Executive Hotel Le Soleil, in the past, while, we didn't expect it to be listed. To sleep in this hotel is like floating on feathers. Their beds are made to help you sleep, their staff is friendly and willing to please. When we woke up, we enjoyed breakfast while overlooking the city. Don't let me get into details about the shower... The restaurant that's affiliated with the hotel was absolutely fabulous. Even though this was a short stay, my wife enjoys the fitness center, because it's spacious for Yoga. Our next trip to Manhattan will be longer and allow us to take advantage of all the perks the hotel provides. Staying at this location will be wise, regardless of the amount of time. Jay
user_name:
js670044
New York City, New York

review_body: Really mice hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Rooms were good and the food was spot on. Keron the bellman was very helpful to guests and his service was excellent. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

the location is unbeatable, the treatment is perfect, they facilitate the visit with your kindness, tips for eating, visits, shopping, the cleanliness of the hotel is incredible. I will return and of course I will recommend it.

Nice hotel, great location. Clean room with wonderful view. Reception staff, while not impolite, appeared to dislike his job. Pre-authorised the cost of stay on credit card, ok we could deal with that, but was angry about what we had to hand over next! Charged $400 “security” deposit on check-in which we were not aware of prior. Told we’d get back on check-out. (Dollars not much use to us when we’re leaving) this really ruined check-in & the rest of that night, I was so pissed off. Terrible first day & night for my first visit to New York for my birthday.Doormen were lovely, chatty & smiley. Reception staff were miserable, unhelpful (asked if he would book a table for us) begrudgingly rang, then told my husband they not taking bookings (they didnt answer the phone, after a couple of rings) no offer to try another restaurant. Not once did I see a smile from any reception staff. Pity.

I stayed at Executive Hotel Le Soleil NYC for a few weeks in October and November 2018 for a business trip. Very friendly personnel with positive air, ready to help when you address with some request - like printing sth or receive a shipment on your behalf. Rooms are neat and tidy. Location is perfect. Special thanks to Choony from housekeeping who helped me to keep the room perfectly organized during my entire stay, including smallest details like - clean towels (properly following the convention - towel on the floor meaning replace, on the hook - leave), litter properly collected and even every time the toilet paper with a cute arrow fold in the end :) Ah, and always the coffee parts properly added so that I could start the day with a smile. Definitely a good choice for a hotel with positive and helpful team. Definitely will book again for next trips.

Just spent six days at the Executive Le Soleil in Manhattan. It was a very clean and stylish hotel and the location was outstanding. The only thing I might recommend is having one or two luggage racks in the room as the rooms are quite small and because there really is no closet or drawer space and you’re basically living out of your suitcase, it’s a little inconvenient having your suitcases on the floor. I know small rooms in NYC are not uncommon but this was perhaps the smallest I’ve experienced in my numerous trips to the city. Even with the two racks it will cut into the space to move around quite a bit, but at least it’s more convenient than having to dig through your luggage on the floor. Overall though the staff was very nice and accommodating. I know there isn’t much you can do with small rooms, but hanging and drawer space can be a real necessity, so anything the hotel can do to assist in this manner would be helpful.

I have stayed at many hotels for business and this is one of my favorites. Why?1. The staff is fantastic and I mean all of them. From Inna and Andre at the desk to Emilino the bellmen, they are all friendly, attentive, and genuine. 2. New York is a very loud city but the rooms in this hotel are quiet. Very important if you are a light sleeper.3. The beds are super comfortable. I believe most if not all have pillow tops.4. A good portion of their rooms are configured such that the air vent is NOT blowing across the bed. Stay in rooms that end in 02, 04, or 07 if this bothers you.5. The HVAC system is an in-the-wall system, not a free-standing monstrosity. In other words, its quiet. 6. The rooms are modern and well furnished for all types of guests. They are not large but that is NY.Are there areas for improvement? Sure and here are some.1. All of the rooms have an HVAC system that has a infrared motion detector that runs a timer. If it doesn't detect movement after an hour (I think) it turns itself off to conserve energy, which is awful when you are trying to sleep in a room that needs to be climate controlled. I spoke to the head engineer, he said there is no way to turn that feature off. 2. The light switches in the rooms have no rhyme or reason. Some do nothing and none work as you would expect. Many of the lamps have to be turned on/off individually which is a pain. 3. There are plugs with USB ports at the desk which is great but what about near the bed? Every time I stay I have to pull the night table out to plug in my phone charger.
