Put a plug in the lamp or something like that!Overall I highly recommend this hotel and I hope my review helps you decide!

I stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is located in an excellent location - and that's really important. My room was very clean. All the interiors look modern and are very nice - it felt like a cozy & warm place to stay at.My room was small (nice double bed, a little bit of room for the suitcase and nice small bathroom) - but I guess for the price and location - you can't get a better deal.Overall I was mainly outside the hotel, sightseeing, but the hotel was a good & comfortable place to return to, and serve as my base.

We stayed for 4 nights and what a lovely hotel friendly staff, we had a problem with our room on the first night and we were swiftly upgraded to a larger room and given a bottle of wine. Service is absolutely fantastic and the rooms are immaculate, 3 mins walk from maceys, 10 mins to Times Square and 15 to grand central. We loved the staff on the door. Thank you for a fantastic stay

I have stayed at Le Soleil for 3 nights in December. The stay was great, room was clean and staff really nice and helpful. The location is great, in the middle of New York and close to Penn Station if you need to go to the airport.

Great experience, good location, concierge service was excellent! Would definitely stay here again. Staff was friendly and room was clean restaurant seemed good but didn’t have a chance to eat there.Was able to navigate easily to lots of sights for the holiday spirit!

Rooms are very clean and nice. Beds are comfortable. I had a suite with a queen bed and sofa area. Very nice. Joe the gentlemen in the lobby was very accomodating in getting us a cab and holding our luggage until our room was ready. Desk staff was pleasant and accommodating. Enjoyed our stat

I cannot tell you how great this place is 5 stars across the board. This is our 6th stay and I will continue to submit rave reviews! Please do yourself a favor and book directly with the hotel you will not be disappointed...

We spent a week in early December and found the hotel to be perfect--location, convenience, attentive staff, clean, great room! It was a pleasure to return to it each evening after a chilly day on the town--warm, cozy, and friendly! We were well taken care of and will be recommending this to friends who travel to Manhattan!

We went there in December 2017 for our honeymoon. It was very nice. Amazing staff, very clean. The rooms where a little small but not a big incovenience. The location was perfect. Very close to Time Square, Bryant Park and Grand Central Station.

My traveling companion is a germaphobe. Many of the hotel reviews on other properties stated they were older and smelled old. We also wanted two beds and didn't want to pay what they were asking for another bed. This worked out perfectly for us. All rooms have ceiling to floor windows. On some floors the sitting room was as you enter but ours was by an elevator and the configuration was such I had a window, also. It was, hands down, the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. Staff was so helpful and very friendly. I mainly dealt with Drew and Joseph and I was ready to adopt them and bring them home. I trusted their opinions on places to eat and best way to get there. Location was perfect. .8 mile from Penn Station, couple of blocks form Macey's, around the corner to Empire State Building, and on and on. We both have bad knees and I'm 68. We walked everywhere because of the location...Times Square, Theater District, Bryant Park, The Rock. Never ate there only because we were always somewhere else when it was time to eat. Would stay there again in a heartbeat! The staff made our trip to NYC so much more enjoyable!!

A little gem of a hotel, off 5th Avenue, Walking distance to Empire State, Times Square, Penn Station and Macy’s. The hotel is small by Manhattan standards, a big plus, and the staff were really friendly, attentive and helpful throughout our stay. The rooms are a decent size, tastefully decorated, some with views, and have everything you need, fridge, coffee machine, USB port, etc. It has a small restaurant serving excellent food, and a lounge area with soft lighting and comfy sofas. Our flight home was late evening. We ordered a taxi through the concierge, checked out, stored our bags, then returned early evening for a light meal which we ate in the comfy lounge. It was lovely to be able to spend our last few hours before leaving for JFK in the comfort of the hotel where we were made so welcome even though we had checked out. I wouldn’t book anywhere else in Manhattan, this lovely hotel has everything and more.

So welcoming! Perfect location. Lovely friendly service. Very clean. Everything we needed for a short break. Dinner at the restaurant also very good. This is now the only place I’ll stay when in NY. Highly recommended.

Pocket door to bathroom was extremely difficult to close. Toilet wouldn't flush unless you spun the handle several times and found just the right combination. Reported these to front desk each day and nothing was done. The Queen "suite" was much smaller than it looks on the pictures. There was a big stain on the carpet. On one day, our room was not cleaned at all. Don't know why this is listed as a 4 star hotel. The only positive experience was the guys working the front door- very pleasant and helpful.

Great location for Holiday shopping, sightseeing. Close to Empire State Bldg and subway if your up to it. Walkable to Rockefeller Center again if your up to it. Great location for eating or sightseeing.

Hotel LeSoleil is a lovely boutique hotel in a great location! There were several good restaurants very close to the hotel. Part of our trip was to see the Macy's Thanksgiving parade. The parade passed 1/2 block from the hotel and the crowd was not large so we had a great view. The room was small but very well appointed and well suited for 2 people. We will definitely stay again!

Great stay at this hotel. The whole experience has been good from start to finish. Yadira was so helpful when sorting out my original online reservation, and all the staff have been friendly and very helpful once at the hotel. It is very well situated for getting around New York. The rooms are good and very clean, we were on 19th floor so quiet too. Breakfast was great, and busy friendly bar at night. My only small criticism is the small amount of hanging and drawer space in room. Would definitely stay again if back in New York and will recommend to friends too.

The hotel is clean and the employees are friendly and discreet. The rooms are very well decorated. Great location and the room service is super fast. There are also lots of restaurants and retail stores around the area. Overall an exceptional experience.

Good location of the hotel with walking distance to central places. Nice service. We think the room was very small. We were two girlfriends who traveled and it was difficult to put our stuff and suitcases. We also think the breakfast was pricey and bad, but hotel was a good option for our trip.

This was my 1st time staying here, and it was by far my best experience at a NYC hotel in years. Upon arrival the front desk staff offered me a glass of wine (complimentary).The bar staff was great, and had great recommendations for breakfast.The rooms are beautiful, and bathroom is impeccable.I will definitely attempt to stay here again!

We stayed 14 nights at this hotel and everything was just perfect. The location incl. the view from our room were excellent! The staff was so friendly and helpful. The room was clean and calm. If I ever come again to NYC I will definitely book The Executive Le Soleil hotel again!

Stayed here for four nights. My wife wanted to see New York at Christmas. We had a great stay at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil. Everyone was very accommodating especially the doorman who were both personable and helpful. The accommodations were very good , comfortable bed and a great shower. The room was small but that is not uncommon in New York. Location was good and the neighborhood seemed very safe. Highly Recommend!

This hotel was nothing but amazing. Emilio the bellman provided excellent service. He made sure we got all of our bags to our room and made sure that we had everything we needed for our stay. The whole staff was great! Definitely will return to stay here! Plus the location couldn’t have been better. Close to everything

If you want very good hotel in midtown this is the place!!The staff are helpful to any requirements. We had excellent time in the hotel in all aspect , the restaurant in the hotel is also ok. nice place for light dinner.

Been to NYC before but this has been the best hotel so far. Excellent staff with a special mention to Negesti on the front desk and Emilio the door man (loved is hat) both of whom always had a big smile and happy to help. We had an executive suite with sofa bed which worked well for us. Not much wardrobe space but enough room for the suitcases so was ok for us. Rooms are clean and the bed was really comfortable. Location is excellent with lots of places to eat breakfast, lunch or evening meals nearby. We will definitely stay here next time we visit NYC.

Rooms are greatly overrated on the website. The rooms are very small. Our upgraded room with a view is made to look much larger on the website. We felt scammed. Then - on our first day - we had an early pick up to go to Woodbury Commons. However - showing up at 7 am for breakfast, we got informed that they were late today and it would be a 45-minute delay. I have never in my life experienced such behavior. We had to leave without breakfast - and given no explanation. Upon leaving - our request for a later check out of two hours was denied free of charge. We were granted one hour late - but for an hour extra, we would have to pay a half day's charge for the room. 150 USD + tax for one hour extra before leaving for the airport is crazy. The room was free - otherwise, we would have been denied the late checkout - so not giving us the flexibility of two hours free seems petty. We have had no trouble with that from other hotels in NY.Overall - the location is hard to beat - but for the dollars spent - we could have stayed in other hotels with better service. Clean rooms - great view overlooking Empire State building - but we had to pay for the view.

Clean room, great location and friendly staff. Emilio, the bellman, was extremely welcoming and went out of his way to accommodate during my stay. Felt like home away from home. Will definitely recommend.

I would highly recommend this hotel because of it's excellent location so close to many of the magnificent sights in Manhattan the cleanliness and comfort of the rooms was top class and the staff were so friendly and helpful.

This hotel is amazing! Great rates, super clean and comfortable rooms, the staff is awesome, and the location is perfect! The receptionist Andre was super helpful, very processional, friendly, and made us feel very welcome. I will definitely return to this hotel, and I will definitely recommended to family and friends.

This is a boutique type hotel with a smallish number of rooms (20 floors - 4 to 5 per floor).The check in was very easy and friendly despite us booking over six months prior to arrival and forgetting we had changed our credit card details. The food staff really friendly, informative and just made a pleasure to come back each day.The room was an executive queen suite in the 18th floor and it had a nice view of the city, two TV’s in the room with a small sofa, table etc.The room was well appointed, tidy and room service was good each day.The food (we only ate breakfast once) was ok and the price was in line with other hotels. Made use of the gym, which whilst not huge was open 24hrs a day, everything was working, towels available along with water etc - much appreciated.Location just up one block from Macy and slightly away from the craziness of Times Square but it be reached in a five minute walk. Good location.Only downside two things - noise in New York when trying to sleep is crazy but that’s just New York (it would be worse if in Times Square) and the toilet door didn’t have a handle so difficult to slide backwards and forwards.

This was our 3rd visit to New York and our 1st to Hotel LeSoleil.We got this room at at an amazing price considering it was Thanksgiving week.In our opinion the reception and lobby area had a very upmarket feeling,checking in was quick and hassle free.Our room on the 15th floor had a south facing view at the rooftop water tanks on the building opposite but that becomes so insignificant when you have the fantastic Empire State Building looming down on you.The room was small but practical with nice furnishings,the shower room was excellent.Noise level from the outside and neighbouring rooms were non existent.We went to see the School of Rock at the theatre and I thoroughly recommend a visit to this venue.My feet are still killing me with all the walking we did,we spent a small fortune in the sales and it was freezing cold but you're guaranteed a warm welcome at Hotel LeSoleil!

I would definitely stay here again. Great location, great staff and very clean. Very nice restaurant in hotel but also nice restaurants near by. Within walking distance of Penn Station and shopping in fifth avenue.

From the very beginning of my stay to the end, this hotel was wonderful. Staff is helpful and friendly and the rooms were extremely clean!! I stayed with a few friends for a birthday celebration/reunion and the Executive Hotel couldn't be more accommodating! I would highly recommend this hotel!!!

This is our 3rd stay at this hotel. We like the location and it was easy to get to all the places that we wanted to visit.We had good service in the past, This time service was excellent and staff were very friendly. One small issue is the elevator, which can be slow at times. Overall it was excellent visit this time and we will choose this hotel again.Will be back again when we are in NYC.

Our company uses this hotel as it is close to our office and our associates really like it. I work with Yadira Aviles who is a most excellent customer service reservationist. She works with me to find the best rate, is attentive and thorough, and has a fantastic personality. If you book this hotel ask for Yadira. She is a rock star!

Comfortable, clean and amazing location. If you stay on the empire state side you can get a great view especially at night. I have stayed a few times and there seems to be multiple types of rooms. This time I had room with a couch and a 2nd TV! Room 603.

Great location, and good value. Quiet, clean and very comfortable!Convenient to everything you want to do. Bathroom amenities are very pleasant.Rooms are quiet and well equipped. I would definitely stay again!
What made our stay so much better than the usual business trip was the Bellmen. Emilin was a true gentleman and provided great advise and service. He genuinely cared for us during our stay.Thank you!

Nice and clean boutique hotel. The front desk staff are very friendly. The restaurant and bar is also very entertaining. Wish they have a better hair dryer. slipper and shower gel should be part of their standard supplies in the room.

Great people at this hotel...Took sincere care of us over weekend visit...including car logistics, travel assistance, complimentary gift and quick service. Nice warm & cozy environment. Very convenient spot in Midtown and would definitely go here again.

I can’t say enough great things about this hotel! The location is great, the rooms are very updated and clean; but what makes the hotel perfect are the amazing friendly people. Andre at the front desk, remembered my name when I checked in very late from a long day of travel. Not only was it nice to be remembered with a smile, he upgraded me to a fabulous room that made me forget about 5 hours in a middle seat! I finally found my home away from home in NYC. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends and colleagues.

I had a great stay here and would recommend it to anyone wanting to be close to all of the attractions in Manhattan. The rooms and big and comfy with great terry inside and cloth outside robes, the staff are always friendly and accommodating, and the ambiance is elegant and sophisticated. Executive hotels are based here in Vancouver so it was like staying in a local boutique hotel. I will be back...Macy’s is just down the street.

Great place to stay while in New-York City. Very clean and comfortable room. Excellent staff service and the food at the restaurant was good. Umbrella are provided in every room so you don't have to bring any.

We stayed in a suite with our 2 children and it suited us perfectly. Sufficient space for a NY hotel. Very comfortable bed and children were ok on the sofa bed. Fantastic location and fabulous view of the Empire State building. Shops and restaurants at your doorstep including Macy’s. Staff were helpful and friendly. Absolutely no noise which is great for NY. Only issue is very limited hanging space for clothes. Great hotel would highly recommend.

I have stayed here three times and each time has been better than the last! While the rooms and facilities are always impeccable and while there are great amenities, what always impresses me anew is the friendly and efficient service. The staff is ready and waiting to help with anything I have asked for. Fast and efficient and courteous service is a given here. Could not recommend this place enough, for both short or longer stays.

I stayed over a week recently and enjoyed every minute. There are amenities galore, staff is warm and friendly. They pay attention to every detail. Service is exceptional as well as the room, breakfast etc....I would like to thank again all the staff particularly Yadira Aviles for what she did for us. I recommand her for any reservation. And Scott the concierge who helped us every morning for our visits.

Le Soleil, the boutique hotel located in the Midtown Fashion Center, shines as bright as ever. I stayed over the weekend recently and enjoyed every minute. There are amenities galore, as well as a warm and friendly staff. Service is exceptional. Pet friendly and attentive to every detail necessary, Le Soleil masters the bustle and excitement of New York.

Cannot say how truly amazing this hotel was. I booked the rooms directly with Ya Ya in reservationsa who was a truly beautiful , professional person. She ensured that everything was just perfect for our stay and even left a beautiful gift for our 3 year old. The concierge and porteds could not have been nicer and the hotel gave us an upgrade to a stretch limoto the airport as a surprise . We were a family with 5 kids of varying ages . This hotel was perfect. Huge rooms beautifully set out and bang in the center of Manhattan!!!! Cannot say enough about this hotel and particularly Ya Ya’s professionalism to our group. Go book a fantastic hotel. Caitriona

Hotel has very good location. But... 1. We stayed in the suite with sofa. As we stayed there for 9 days we wanted to have more comfort. Anyhow this was not the case. As it was 3 of us we couldn't sleep on the Queen bed that it was very small. My husband had to stay on the sofa, that it was very uncomfortable.2. There are no closets (one very small). So it is not appropriate for long stay.It might be OK hotel if you have short visit in New York alone. But definitely not for longer stay with a child.

The hotel is a block and a half from everything in New York City. The staff (Chris, Enna, Scott and Joe) were very helpful in making my stay very comfortable and interesting. Thanks for everything. The only concern was that your coffee machines don't make tea.
very good location.The service was excellent.the hotel is very clean.the sleep quality was good' maybe they have to replace some of the sleep mattress.we enjoyed the hotel and the location very much.

Two girlfriends and myself just had a two night stay at this hotel. The best part of the hotel is the location. We walked everywhere from here. The second best thing was Joseph, one of the doormen. He was so friendly and so helpful!! The staff at the front desk were polite, but they were not super friendly. This is an ongoing complaint of mine for many places, how hard is it to just ask if we had an enjoyable stay and that they hope to see us again? We stayed in a queen suite that had a small area with a sofa bed. I slept there, very uncomfortable. We had brunch after we arrived in the restaurant which was very good.If the price was right I would stay here again because of the good location.

Nice , clean , contemporary European style hotel with nice accommodating staff! Second time staying there. Location is within walking distance everywhere. Loved our room with flat screen TVs and large windows. The walki in shower was spectacular a with nice terry robe. Appreciate of the complimentary bottle of wine . Loved everything about this hotel!

Just spent the weekend in NYC. We had an amazing stay. The staff is friendly welcoming and pleasant. They go above and beyond to make you feel like you’re at home. The hotel is clean the rooms are immaculate. Would really recommend your stay.

My fiance and I had a great two-night experience here. The hotel was just the right size, had a well-mannered crowd and included a restaurant downstairs, which had very good American style food/drinks. There is a great deal of attention to detail and it was nice to see what appeared to be the general manager walking the floor to make sure things were up to par. I would certainly stay again if I happen to have a city event going on. Best part, is the hotel is located just around all the hot-spots, so you don't have to venture too far!
user_name:
Vincent L
Glen Cove, New York

review_body: I have stayed at many different hotels in NYC and this one had the smallest rooms. At least it was clean. Had breakfast one morning and food was terrible. My biggest complaint is that I left a item in room when I checked out. I called hotel to see if they have it. I was transferred to housekeeping manager. No one answered so I left a message saying what I left and if they could call me. Never heard from them so I send a email. Never got a response from that either. How hard is it to make one simply call or email letting me know if you have my item.

Don't expect a palace, but expect kindness, professionalism, cleanliness, value, and great location; even a great restaurant. What's not to like? Our view was not good and the room color are not bright, but the room, bathroom, and beds are very clean. We are thankful and will return. 2 blocks from Macys!

Have stayed there several times. The hotel is wonderful and wonderfully located. Generally the staff tries hard. Had a less than perfect experience with staff during check-in. If you are a couple, book (at least) the executive queen suite which is just enough bigger than the executive queen room. It will make a substantial difference in your comfort (nothing wrong with the room, just a little too small).Also, I was told that they could match any price that you book online. If that is the case, book through the hotel by all means.

Overall a good experience but there’s were little things that could’ve been better. Towels and things coming to the room were forgotten so we had to call twice. Our luggage was misplaced while in storage as we put it there because we got in early. Tv was weird. Cable kept going out or was just slow when changing channels. Room was clean and beautiful. We love the place overall.

Staying here was better than expected. Came to visit some friends and had to bring them to see the lovely room. The view was great, the lobby was comfortably and staff warm. I suggest everyone who wants to feel like a king or queen stay here.

This was our second time staying at Hotel LeSoleil. We returned in large part because of the excellent service. Two people, in particular, made our stay outstanding. Emilio was our doorman. After a long travel day, we arrived before check-in. He was incredibly helpful and pleasant when we dropped off our luggage and later when we changed rooms he cheerfully helped us. Chris was working at the desk when we came back to check-in. He moved us to the hotel room that we had during our first stay, which we very much appreciated. Throughout our stay, they both made sure that we were comfortable and everything was perfect. We love the location of the hotel and that as a boutique hotel, the staff takes a personal interest in ensuring we have a fantastic experience. I recommend the hotel to my friends and family.

This was a 16th birthday trip for my son. He hotel was located I. Between all the things he wanted to see. The hotel was super clean, super easy to get onto and it was very quiet. You couldn’t hear the outside which is great for sleeping :) I would definitely go again

My family and friends ventured into Le Soleil in order to eat at Trademark (delish!) and the boys became friends w the bellman our first night so we decided to return again the next night just so they could see him again. What an amazing sweet man!! Thanks Emilio for your hospitality!!

Great midtown hotel location, near all main attractions. Was able to shop at my favorite stores like Macy's and Lord and Taylor among other great shops just a few blocks away. Restaurant and pubs on the block were great and Trademark restaurant located in the hotel was very good. Overall staff were all so pleasant and cleanliness was what I expected, definitely my new NYC hotel.Until next year, thank you Le Soleil!

Had a great stay with my family. We went to Rockaffeler Center for a show and the location was great made things better. The attached restaurant was well priced, but the staff at the hotel couldn't of been any better. They were all outstanding. We will return.

Good location clean confortable. A good place to do business because for families i think is expensive. The room was very confortable and have a excelent location near from subway and other places of interest

I planned a special surprise trip for my wife without the boys and settled on Le Soleil hotel. I wanted something in a good location close to shows and shopping. The location couldn’t have been better but what really made this much needed time together special, was the staff. They were so helpful with recommendations and suggestions. They even sent us a complimentary bottle of wine. My wife had the best and for that, I have to say thank you. We can’t wait to come back.
user_name:
Racer_X1900
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location and close to everything you want to see in New York, great hotel, great facilities, very clean, friendly crew, great customer service. I will definitely stay there again. highly recommended

Clean rooms, very friendly\helpful staff. Bed was comfortable, pillows could be better, more firm. Bar was good, did not have any food there. Sometimes you may have to wait for the elevators a bit, so don't be in a rush. Would stay here again!

Loved this hotel and our stay.Staff were amazing always happy to help and charming manor.Rooms were greatNoise level was minimum considering that you are right in the thick of it allThe hotel is right next to Macy’s and lots of shops and restaurants. In walking distance of lots of places.Had a great stay thank you so much

We stayed one week in the family room at the end of September. The room was very small, we expected bigger room based on the photos from booking. The King bed was comfortable but the part for kids was only the sofa behind the door and without any space. The sofa wasn’t comfortable even for kids. The room was modern, bathroom was clean and new. We don’t have view to the street we saw people working in the office in the building opposite from our window. We didn’t spend so much time in the room, we booked the room for its position, but expected a little more space in the room. The hotel is super situated in the middle of Manhattan, 500 m from Empire State Building, a few steps from 5th Avenue and 300 m from Macy’s. The hotel restaurant and the bar was very good and so expensive in compared with other restaurants in Manhattan.

This hotel is absolutely amazing and such a great location to reach all your needed destinations. What made my experience better was Emilio the bell/door assistant as he was so friendly and helpful, he is an absolute asset to the company! Thank you.

We stayed here for 5 nights for our first time in New York. This hotel was fantastic, located in central Manhattan. Excellent transport links local with great shops and places to eat. This was perfect for our trip!

Do: You should arrange your own taxi ride when departing the hotel unless you want to be scalped. They post a sign for $55 flat fee ride to LGA airport. It was a car ride and I was charged $70. Don't: Don't Eat at the hotel. I'm sure the food and drink there is fine, but go out in the city and experience dining New York style. Time Square is a short walk with lots of eating options on the way.

We changed the first reservation from a massive hotel at Times Square to this one, thinking that it would be better placed, but we were disappointed as the room was small, with a dark, dirty and noisy street in front, no view at all, no place to keep our clothes, “free” services (WiFi, mineral water, etc) that were charged at the exit. The best: the personnel working there, specially the doorman.

This boutique hotel is my favorite in NYC for location and quiet large rooms. Staff is excellent in every way. Rooms are clean. I can't say enough about this place. I stay in NYC for several days at at time, several times a year. This is by far my choice and I will stay here when in the city as often as I can.

Our son and his fiancé decided that they wanted to get married in New York. Well it was a lot work from Vancouver, but it went off without a hitch. When all of that kind of work needs to be done, it’s nice to not have to worry about your hotel. Le Soleil was a joy to work with. I managed to meet the manager over the phone because a great desk clerk connected us when she found out we needed multiple rooms. Different rooms, different dates but Bernie put it all together. He was so great to work with. The front desk staff were also so easy to get along with. Very engaging and helpful. The restaurant on site was great too. The location of the hotel could not have been better either. We walked uptown, downtown every where. The subway was around the corner for when we went to the Yankees game. We had the queen suite room and it worked very well for us. Rooms in NYC are small, but this one gave us a little breathing room. Bed was very comfortable and the finishings were modern. Cleaning staff did a great job too. I know there is always something that goes wrong, but not this trip. Thank you Le Soleil staff for making a very important event even better. It was our first trip NYC and we plan to return. A fabulous city made even better by a fabulous hotel!

Couldn't ask for better service at a hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful throughout the entire stay. The room itself was kept clean and stocked. Well done! Also, big shout out to bellman Emilio! Great service!
user_name:
xdessico
New York City, New York

review_body: Location is good. Too much work contacting staff for towels,unclog sink, clean room and do not deliver pot of coffee to room. Driver was good. We chose because of extra space, but foldout was uncomfortable and did not really fit. There was minimal hangar space.

This hotel saved our lives!!!!! We stayed Oct 4 - Oct 8, 2018.After being tricked into booking a horrible accommodation, Hotel LeSoleil saved us. The front desk attendant gave us accommodations where no one else in New York was available and we hit the JACKPOT. This hotel is beautiful from the entrance all the way to the rooms.Our room was beautiful and large enough for 3 adults to share without feeling like we were on top of each other, and we are not small. All three of us are plus size and fabulous and we fit comfortable. Every staff member we encountered was so friendly and accommodating to us. Only issue we had was that the room phone never worked and we reported it every day but it was never repaired.

In addition, the staff were friendly, and the interior design for both the rooms and the public areas is nice. New and clean. My room was on a lower floor facing the street but it still was quiet. Not enough closet (hanging) space, hangers, and drawers for more than one person.
user_name:
J6816GKtraveler
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel rooms and staff where amazing Will definitely be back for the Holidays We had the pleasure to meet the John manager Great person. Regarding restaurant the staff was friendly and very professional and the food amazing

Upon check in the clerk was very friendly. They ensured that my business partner that was arriving the following day would have a room on the same floor as me and gave me an upgrade so I had a view of 36th street vs the building next door. The room was clean and the bedding was nice. It was great to have a Keurig in the room so I could have my coffee before leaving each morning. The bottled waters delivered daily definitely were put to use.The location was fantastic for me. I was visiting a satellite off that was only two blocks away. I found a perfect breakfast café right down the street, and any other food choices I wanted was offered at the hotel restaurant or quick jaunt in any direction.

This hotel far exceeded my expectations. It couldn’t have been more centrally located, between 5th and 6th, on a quieter street, easy 5 minute walk to Empire State, Times Square and shopping, with restaurants, bars and stores close by. It was comfortable and service was friendly and efficient.

Overall, it was a pleasant stay, with welcoming, friendly front desk and reception staff. The hotel design is warm and inviting. We had a small problem as our room was not prepared for our arrival. This could have been due to an IT system failure at the time of our arrival. The receptionist was very helpful but we still had to wait 30-45 minutes at 1am to get a room. The gym is clean, adequately ventilated with clean towels and water available. The main problem was that despite being 3 in a Queen Suite, which is meant to accommodate 4 people, we kept on getting toiletries, coffees for 2 people (despite complaining multiple times. We also had to ask for an extra mug for the room. Some days we also had one bathrobe left in the room. WiFI in the room was quite poor too, slow and needing to repeatedly try to connect . Overall it was a pleasant stay however there are some better priced hotels nearby.

Stayed here for 4 nights in a city view room and what a view! Check in was easy. Staff were friendly and helpful - reception staff, doormen and concierge. Room was spacious and beds were super comfy. Location was fantastic and within walking distance to most places. We used the subway to Downtown and Brooklyn but walked everywhere else. Would not hesitate to stay here again and would definitely recommend it to family and friends.

Well worth a look, awesome stay, clean and nothing was to much for the staff, all so very helpful especially Joseph on the front door was amazing and so very helpful. Close to subway for easy access to tourist sites.

I travel frequently to NYC for work and with my office in Mid Town. This is located right by Penn Station, which makes the commute from the Newark airport by NJT a breeze. The hotel is very predictable - fast check in, clean rooms and fast check out. The gym is empty all the time, but at least there is a gym which is hard to come by in most NYC hotels. Unlike a lot of boutique/hipster hotels, there isn't a lobby filled with people on their macs or an acoustic set with the next indie star - which is exactly what I want to avoid in a hotel. I like the upper floors, then you avoid any loud street action in the middle of the night. The rooms with a 'lounge' are nice if you want an place to toss your jacket or bag and gives a bit of a buffer from the door. I've had rooms 1502 and 1501 a few times, and they seem good.

I enjoyed my 2 nights at this hotel. The room was spacious for New York, clean and in good repair. The staff were courteous and helpful and were very willing to assist with any questions that I had. Overall a good experience and I would stay there again.
user_name:
Kyle M
Bodden Town, Grand Cayman

review_body: In the shortest amount of words, BETTER THAN THE REST. Staying at this location is like enjoying you most favorite food and going back for seconds.This hotel is the best and deserves recognition. Tell
user_name:
js670044
New York City, New York

review_body: Two weeks ago (mid September) we spent a week at NYC, staying at LeSoleil. What a wonderful hotel! It's exactly what you see in thephotos. The room was so spacious, we could even work out in themorning! Its superb centric location (36W, between the Americas and 5Ave, next to the Empire State) makes it very convenient to come and goall around midtown, from Central Park to the Flatiron. And we'll givespecial regards to Joseph, the concierge (we hope he eventually readsthis), who has always been very attentive and ready to help. I evengot to see him again the week after my business mission in the US towish him well before I went back home to Barcelona. Good luck!

Spent one night there with my son, wish we had more days to spend. We had a very tirind day and the comfort of the room and the bed was like having a massage after a long tiring day. Definitely recommend it

I have stayed at this hotel for the last 4 years when I travel from LA for business and it continues to be my absolute first choice property in NYC- The staff is exemplary and offers true customer service..I do not say this lightly as I am sticker about good service -they all go above and beyond to make sure that you are comfortable and truly exceed expectations each and every time- the rooms are clean and spacious, the beds are sooooo comfortable and the lovely large baths are so relaxing after a long days work- the hotel restaurant is delicious with a varied menu of delicious food am -pm. The hotel is quiet and so conveniently located as well. I truly cannot say enough about this place. If I could give them 10 stars I would!!! Thank you especially to the concierge Chris Reyes who truly understands what VIP service is all about. I look forward to coming back for years to come:))

We had a great first experience with this hotel. Felt very taken care of by the staff especially by Emilio. He went above expectations to make sure we were happy and we were so appreciative! Would definitely stay there again

We planned a trip for education and booked this hotel bc it was near our venue. Staff was super friendly, fun and went out of their way to accommodate us. Our room wasn't a good fit for us and they went out above and beyond to make sure that we were happy! Highly recommend!!!

We are staying here now and Emilio has been amazing! He has went way above and beyond to satisfy us and make sure we were 100% happy! We needed to change rooms due to a mis hap in booking and not only did he move our stuff for us 3 times he did it extremely willing!

This is one of those well-outfitted, smartly decorated, comfortable boutique hotels where the staff really makes you feel at home. Close to Grand Central, the Empire State building, and Times Square, and of course to my favorite place--the NYC public library with its proud lions!

In the middle of Manhattan and near to Subway to get all places easily. Very nice and helpful staff all over the time. The room were very small and we must live directly from our baggages because very small space to put our personality things. Kingsize-Bed was excelent and we were sleeping wunderful. Thanks a lot to all to makes our holiday unforgetable.

The stay itself was decent. I’m a very low maintenance person and easy to please. I feel like I over paid for my stay. Again, the stay was decent. However, every interaction I had with the front desk they told me there was an extra fee. I paid an additional $600 for my week stay. Needless to say, I’m livid.

At $600 per night, even in NYC, I expected a better experience. GOOD:- Great service from the staff. Anything we needed they accommodated quickly and with a smile. - They have a GREAT restaurant next door attached to the hotel called TradeMark. Excellent food and staff. - The hotel is kinda boutique-ish and somewhat nice from lobby to rooms.BAD:- We entered our room and was greeted by a humid, musty room and a gross, nasty carpet stain. - The AC is set to turn off when it doesn't detect motion. Each night I was there I woke up around 2am sweating and had to 'motion' to the thermostat to turn on. Unacceptable.- WiFi sucks. It's slow, it logs you off and it doesn't stay connected. I finally had enough of the slow WiFi and called the front desk and they fixed it temporarily.All-in-all I won't come back here.

Apart from the choice of food for breakfast, everythinhg was perfect, thank you. Location is perfect (inc. car parking available nearby), staff friendly and helpful, price reasonable, great atmosphere.

I recently spent seven days at the hotel, and I cannot speak highly enough of the facility. The service and location are equally excellent. The next time that I'm in Manhattan, this is where I will stay.

My wife is hard to please, but even she was blown away at Lesoleil. The penthouse was perfect. We had an incredible view, plenty of space and room to entertain. A+ all the way. Our concierge Emilio was very helpful and always courteous, the check-in was easy and the other staff were all fantastic. We will definitely be staying here more often :)

My boyfriend and I celebrated our engagement in the city and decided to give hotel Le Soleil a chance after our initial hotel reservations downtown fell thru. Initially I heard about LeSoleil from a girlfriend who stayed there for business a while ago and praised the location and the service. What a wonderful stay!! ! Super friendly and professional staff, every person we met from the bell staff to the front desk and housekeeping staff, all the employees took the time to say hello and ask how we were enjoying our stay. The hotel is located in the garment district near lots of shopping and dining . We had drinks at Trade Mark which were excellent, we hope to return to there for dinner on our next visit! I wish we had planned a longer stay, but I'm happy to have a place to continue visiting after we get married! Cheers to the management team and leaders for a wonderful experience!

I almost hate to recommend this hotel, because we love it so much we don't want it to become too popular! We come to NY once or twice a year to visit museums and galleries, It is extremely convenient for going uptown and for going downtown. It is also very quiet, which is a necessity for us.

The staff were discourteous during the check-in procedure, interrupting it to discuss other matters between themselves. The room had dried blood on the sheets and a used contact lens left on the desk. Although the location is very good and the room was comfortable, this failure to meet the most basic of standards means that I could not recommend this hotel to other travellers.

A gem of a hotel centrally located near many midtown attractions and shopping. Staffs are welcoming and friendly. The rooms are large, airy with natural light and plenty of bathroom space. Trademark, their cozy inhouse restaurant, offers locally sourced food and is perfect if you dont want to venture too far. We absolutely loved it!

Would definitely recommend staying here. Room quality was nice, and spacious enough for 3 of us (husband and 5 year old). The service from the front desk and door men was outstanding. Very friendly and helpful.

This is the only place in NYC that I stay. I’ve stayed in excess of 15 times over the past two years and it’s never let me down. The staff are just awesome, the rooms spotless and a great size and the location is perfect. I can’t reccomend highly enough for business and personal.

I would highly recommend this hotel to business travelers, and those travelling with kids. The rooms are large and well appointed with all of the amenities one could need. I was travelling for business, but rented a mini suite with separate seating area complete with pull out sofa bed and flat screen tv, which would have been perfect if I had brought my wife and kids. The doormen always greeted me like I was coming back home, front desk was very helpful, and amenities like the gym and restaurant were convenient. I look forward to my next stay there!

We had a businesstrip to NYC with a lot of meetings spread all over Manhattan - to the north, middle and south of Manhattan. This hotel had a really good location with easy access to Metro or walking distance to central points of interests during the off duty time.

Our stay at this hotel was lovely but the staff was also very sweet and made our stay very comfortable. Chris at the front desk was extremely accommodating with handling our bill. The best part of this hotel was probably the location. Right in the heart of the city but tucked away a tiny bit. Walking distance to almost everything you’d want to see in manhattan. Would definitely stay again

Internet not working the second nite. Odd that a hotel of such calibre in today's day and age has internet issues. Room Service did not pick up phone neither did housekeeping. Wanted morning coffee, go no response

I recently had the pleasure of returning for a stay at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil, and just when I thought the team there couldn't do anything more to meet my expectations, Yadira Aviles (Reservations) proved me wrong. With her exemplary guest-services focus and her sensitivity, she went above and beyond to provide a stellar guest experience!! Because of her extra efforts, this last visit was a truly exceptional and wonderful stay. Additionally, I would be remiss if I did not call out Frances at the front desk for her wonderful demeanor and kind assistance. Last and not least, I still do not know how Emilio, one of the hotel's bellpeople, did it, but as soon as he opened the entrance door for me after a long day and evening of work commitments, he immediately had my checked luggage waiting for me without me even asking!! All part of the #ExecutiveHotelLeSoleilMagic. Every smart and discerning traveler visiting New York City should have Executive Hotel LeSoleil on the top of her/his hotel list!! The rooms are exceptionally clean and well appointed, the location is fabulous with both in-room and on-site dining and, as I have described herein, the hotel team enthusiastically does everything possible to treat the guests as valued family. If I could give Yadira, Frances and Emilio (and every other team member with whom I interacted) 10 stars, I gladly would!!! I cannot wait to return to this hotel in the near future because I know an enjoyable and relaxing stay awaits!!

Recommend you stay here especially if wanting to use subways, trains, PATH etc. Coffee shop and restaurant are really good and as they're set back with minimal frontage slightly quieter than others - you have to know about this place. Breakfast is great.

Recently stayed in NYC for the 2nd time and can honestly say my wife and I loved every minute of our stay at Executibe Hotel LeSoleil.The staff were fantastic from the door staff to management everyone has the time of day for you. We stayed in the penthouse and the room was amazing floor to ceiling windows in the lounge/kitchen and the bedroom and enough space to feel you can just relax and take time to take in the breathtaking views. I would 100% recommend this hotel, the hotel is situated just a few minutes from the Empire State Building and the street is full of bars and good restaurants- Macy's is less than 5 mins away so you are bang in the center. Can't thank the staff enough for making my wife's 40th birthday trip an amazing experience.

Another stay at Le Soleil and each time i feel like home away from home !Highly recommended !Great staff , great rooms and service at very high standard Location for my business meeting prefect well done to a great hotel

Beautiful Hotel, great location. Staff is amazing and friendly. Restaurant also is amazing with staff and food that is great. I love this hotel and would recommend to everyone who wants to have an amazing time in New York City.

We spent 6 nights with our 2 kids in this hotel. The location is amazing, everything is on your doorstep more or less. The staff were fantastic and so friendly and helpful. The hotel is new and clean and quite luxurious. Definitely highly recommend it!

Very contemporary styled boutique hotel in midtown. Clean, good service with friendly staff, especially concierge. This is the second time we’ve stayed here in our NYC visits. Very conveniently located between 5th 6th ave walking distance if you want to take the Path train from 33rd st.

Dear John & Staff, I would like to express my thanks and appreciation for the service and care I received at your beautiful hotel. I had an event to attend in NYC and had the pleasure of staying at your amazing hotel for a night and wished I could have stayed another night as I really enjoyed my stay. I am in the industry and I know good service and this hotel definitely has it and not to mention in a fabulous location. Your concierge, was able to get me what I needed immediately. Front desk was friendly and always willing to accommodate in every which was possible. Every staff member with whom I came in contact was attentive and kind including housekeeping. Rooms were warm and cozy and very clean. It truly was a great stay and will recommend to all of my colleagues, friends and family. Thank you again for such outstanding service. Sincerely, ​Laura Tsoumas
user_name:
laurats1965
New York City, New York

review_body: Location is perfect at walking distance of main attractions and with metro closeby. Very convenient to visit the cityHotel staff is very friendly and helpfull. Hotel room are comfortable but ask for upper level floors for the view and avoid street noise

Clean, great location, great staff and impeccable service! Amazing view, great vibe, friendly and helpful staff. Location is central to everything in the City. We will definitely stay here again and again!

My overall experience at The Executive Hotel LeSoleil was FANTASTIC!!! Everything and everyone was great, helpful and nice. The location was perfect for eating and shopping. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in the Manhattan area of NY.
user_name:
workinlady68
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Every year we are visiting our family in New York and every visit in a different hotel but this stay at the Executive Le Soleil was a very special one, besides great location close to everything, clean rooms and nice lobby the most outstanding part is the warmth of the staff, starting with the welcome of the doormen, the warmth of the receptionists and the help one receives from the concierge. Giving it a second thought on our visit next year we will probably book the same hotel.

We had such a wonderful stay. From check in to check out. Comfy bed, Clean room and the location was ideal. Close to Herald Sq. Everything was great. I have stayed in many NYC hotels and so happy we chose to stay at Executive. The restaurant Trademark in the hotel is great as well

This was my first stay at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil, and if I could have given four and a half stars I would have. The location is excellent, a short walk from Penn Station in midtown. The lobby is lovely, and the rooms are modern and very tastefully done. I have stayed at the chain hotels in the area and they all seem interchangeable -- I can't remember one from the next, but LeSoleil is distinctive and much nicer. The bathroom was roomy and a terry bathrobe was provided, an amenity missing in the chain hotels. A magnifying mirror was also helpful. The staff was friendly and very helpful, and even though I'm very familiar with NYC, the Concierge was eager to direct me to various museum shows on offer, which I greatly appreciated. My room also had a view of the Empire State Building, which was fun. And the windows open a bit, which is great if you want a little fresh air. I didn't try the restaurant, but the menu looks good, especially for breakfast and lunch. The room itself was small. I had to put the telephone on the floor to get more room on the desk, and the Keurig coffee machine took up way too much space on the other side of the desk. Also, there were no bedside electrical outlets, present sometimes in the lamps or next to them in other hotels (fortunately, I had an extension USB cable), and the pocket door of the bathroom was pushed so far into its pocket, I couldn't close it. This latter problem could have been solved by calling the front desk and asking for help, but it wasn't that important in the moment. I will definitely stay there again.

We stayed during the final week of the US Open so the room price was high but seemed very competitive with other choices. The room was small but I guess that is normal for NYC hotels. Very clean and comfortable. Friendly and helpful staff. Only 8 rooms per floor so you aren't waiting long for an elevator. It's not adjacent to any subway stop but easy walk to 34th St/Herald Square (B,D,F,M,N,Q,R,W), 33rd St (4,5,6), 5th Avenue (7) or even Grand Central. The Keg Room is right across the street and Maison Kayser at the corner of 5th Ave for breakfast/coffee.

The mattress is not comfortable and sofa bed is terrible. Be prepared to wake up with strong back pain.Location is great, hotel is clean and service is friendly. But what's the use if the bed is horrible?

Bellman Emilio was amazing. Super attitude and friendly. The hotel is beautiful as well!! The hotel did have to evacuate but they handled it very well. Would recommend because of the location and atmosphere.
user_name:
daylilychristy
New York City, New York

review_body: I called the hotel and was answered by Yadira,I never encountered so kind, pleasant and eager to assist.I highly suggest to call directly to the hotel, they will hear your needs and fit the right solution for your pocket

My wife and I recently stayed 6 nights at the LeSoleil in NYC and loved it. The customer service was fantastic and we especially appreciated Emilio, the bellman who did an excellent job helping us. Keep up the great work!Danny

Very good stay. The hotel is near important tourist sites. Many places to have lunch or dinner are also near. I totally recomend this hotel. The room was very comfortable, and the help of the front desk people were good.

Great hotel and location. The shower was very cool the way the water flowed underneath the tile to a drain that was not visible. The room was very nice. The beds could be softer. The hotel held our bags for several hours even after we checked out, which was super cool!

A cozy hotel with a tasteful interior and a friendly service is within a walking distance to majority of Midtown attractions, Penn station, Grand central and a Subway. We highly recommend and will stay again if opportunity arises.

Fantastic location close to all the attractions. However, what makes this place (the Soul of the Hotel) is it’s staff. I wanted to mention Scott,the Concierge. He made our holiday so much more possible and enjoyable. Thank you.

Three words: location, location location. Nicely located at a short distance from the Penn station and 34th street subway stations, the hotel is great for a busy stopover when transiting via New York. And just seven blocks from the Times Square.

The hotel is very nice and centrally located to explore all parts of Manhattan. We stayed 6 nights and were generally happy with our stay. We had the Executive Queen Suite. Three drawbacks: pullout sofa was uncomfortable, so daughter slept on couch instead, there is no place to hang towels, the lighting is a bit of a problem in that it is all operated by a master switch so you have little control over what areas you want to light, and there is very little space to hang or put clothes away, so expect to live out of your suitcases. The main bed was comfortable, staff was friendly and helpful!

Upon entering the hotel, you are greeted with an unpleasant moldy odor. The AC unit and alarm clock go into a standby mode and neither turned back on once we went to sleep, making for a very HOT night.

My wife and I had a great 2 nights stay at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil. We were able to drop our luggage on the morning of our arrival and were told that the room would be ready earlier than the check-in time. That was a nice surprise. The rooms are really nice, clean and conformable. The floor to ceiling windows allows for a true NYC experience. We stayed in NYC for 5 days only but I wished we stayed at that hotel the whole time. Also the location is great and the staff very helpful when it comes to giving tips for dinner for exemple. We will go back!

Hotel was very nice. Very good restaurant and is in the best location for getting around New York. Close to all the tourist areas and subway. Had a great view of the Empire State Building. I would recommend to others.

The location was perfect, walking distance to pretty much everything. Lots of shops nearby for anything you might need. Macy’s is right around the corner and the Empire State Building just a block away !! The staff was very helpful with everything and clean !! Great value !!

Our stay at Executive Hotel Le Soleil was an outstanding experience. The staff was courteous and helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is ideally located, within walking distance of innumerable destinations.

We booked for four nights in the hotel . Travelling with two youngsters our welcome was warm and friendly with all relevant information available . Hotel situated in a fantastic location only minutes from many attractions and easy walking around this fantastic city. The rooms were clean , modern and more than adequate after a long day sightseeing and exploring. Facilities were freely available , coffee machine , walk in shower , free WiFi . I feel THE most important aspect of our visit was the staff . Knowledgeable and friendly , nothing was too much trouble and it made our visit so much more enjoyable . From the guys at the front desk to the guys at the door , without fail they had a warm and engaging welcome and really made you feel at “home”. Without doubt we will be using this hotel again , having searched countless websites and pages I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to other travellers. Thank you so much guys for your professionalism and kindness .
user_name:
brian y
Newton Abbot, United Kingdom

review_body: For this trip to NYC, the hotel prices at my usual locations were too high. I saw that the LeSoleil was listed as a 4star hotel on our Concur travel site and the price was less than the Hampton Inn and HGI on 35th St. I elected to give them a try and was very happy with the selection. All staff were great, the room was very clean with large bathroom and walk-in shower. My 2 colleagues traveling with me, but staying at the HGI came by the hotel bar after dinner and were very impressed and wished they had stayed there as well. I will be back on my next trip.

First off, I want to mention what impressed me the most about this hotel. I was checking out on Aug. 12th 2018, the day of Dominican day parade in Manhattan blocking few streets completely. Hotel management gave me a heads up on Aug. 11th evening, with a written notice for people checking out on Aug. 12th. I realized the impact to my travel to JFK and planned accordingly.This hotel is two streets away from Empire state building and I was able to see Empire state building from my room. Hotel room was small but it was very well maintained.

This hotel is very clean and well appointed. It is centrally located, although the neighborhood is still a bit in transition around it. The rooms on the upper floors are better so you get a view and a bit more space.
user_name:
Kiril M
San Diego, United States

review_body: Great staff, beautiful hotel, great bedding, wine & cucumber water at check in. It's conveniently located in midtown & close to the theatre district & restaurants. There's an attached restaurant & bar, though I found the drinks overpriced for the size.

Unbeatable location, very friendly and efficient staff, room cleaning very correct, the only downside was to use a room with an extra bed that was not at all comfortable. For one night, no problem, but for five nights as has been our stay, it has not been the best solution.Localitzacio immillorable, personal molt amable i eficient, neteja de les habitacions molt correcte, la unica pega ha estat utilitzar una habitació amb llit pleglabe supletori que no era gens comode. Per una nit, cap problema, però per cinq nits com ha estat la nostra estada, no ha sigut la millor solució.

Great location, close to Times Square.Staff were very friendly and helpful and great at answering our questions.Rooms are small but updated, but who spends a lot of time in their room in NYC? Highly recommend this hotel.

Good location in the fashion district, walking distance to subway stations, times square and restaurants. Nice big modern rooms that are well maintained and clean. Comfortable beds. Excellent staff from the front desk to the bell boy

I stay at Le Soliel frequently and have always had a very nice stay at this property. The front desk staff are helpful and the housekeeping staff are the best. I have had a housekeeper named Choeny and she goes above and beyond to make sure I have everything I need. I would stay there just because of Choeny.

If you are looking for a place to stay in Manhattan, this is it! I discovered a gracious staff, up to date amenities and old world charm all in one location. The Concierge (Scott) is fantastic! He offered to conduct advance research and found good vendors in the city to work with us. He made every single arrangement we requested. Additionally, once he understood our preferences, he added friendly suggestions to further enhance our stay in New York. Scott is equally good at long-term planning and well as last minute changes and adjustments.Did I mention the impeccable service delivered by the front desk Bell Hops? Each of these gentlement are extraordinary! Anything thing you need, no request is too small. And the level of courtesy is beyond compare.I have stayed at a lot of different hotels in my life. This place is top shelf, try it, you'll love it!

Excellent hotel and location. The rooms were a decent size and had everything required. The staff were very hospitable, were polite and attentive. The coffee area was great! We had an americano and cappuccino. I would recommend the hotel to my friends.

I recommend that you find somewhere else. The pictures are the best part of this hotel past that nothing is as good as it appears. The elevators are constantly in use by their employees. The rooms are very small and very uncomfortable. The bathrooms are horrible.

I put small room in the title because people should be aware of this. The size of the hotel room was more a boutique hotel in Paris or Rome, not what we were expending in New York City, BUT that was not an issue for us. As I just stated, we are used to boutique style hotel rooms in Europe which can be quite small. The hotel room was modern, impeccable and comfortable. It was big enough for the 4 day stay. The bathroom was as large as the bedroom area. We had a decent view over the top of the other buildings looking uptown on the 18th floor. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The location is on 36th street between 6th and 5th Avenues. If you know New York, you are in walking distance to all of midtown Manhattan. You are also right near the subway stop for easy transit. Even though the room was small, I would happily stay here again. We were extremely please for the location and value.

Nice hotel with very good location and helpful personal. comfortable beds, however not enough place for clothes, bags etc. we did not take any breakfast in the hotel. would recommend this hotel to my friends...

Second time staying here and will be back! The rooms are great, staff is very friendly, and the location can't be beat. We had 2 adults and 2 children in the room and everybody slept comfortably. A great option in NYC.

Very nice and comfort hotel close to the main attractions (34 street. TS, Empire State)room was very friendly for a family of 4. Room and bathroom modern and clean. internet warkd properly on 6 different devices. will come a gain on our next time in NY

This midtown location is perfect for visiting Manhattan’s many exciting sites. The hotel is on a side street just off 5 th with several other hotels on it and lots of casual eating places in easy walking distance.The rooms are small but designed to be comfortable with high end beds, good linens, gorgeous tasteful furnishings and superb washrooms with large walk in showers.The staff are all outstanding with special mention to the front desk staff who go above and beyond to welcome you and to make you feel like family.This is an excellent choice for a visit to Manhattan.

Great hotel, perfect location and wonderful food all in one place! The rooms are very comfortable and well equipped including a small refrigerator and safe. The bathrobes are plush & perfect when getting out of the shower. Could use more water pressure for the shower but the rainhead is a nice touch.

We chose this hotel for its Excellent location in heart of New York, all attractions easily accessible from hotel. Spotless rooms, friendly and very helpful staff. Only down side, there was only coffee making facilities in the room so a kettle would have been helpful.

Everything you would want in an affordable, boutique hotel in midtown: friendly, personal, proactive staff at all levels, quality convenient restaurant next door as part of experience, managers who care to make your stay optimal and not overpriced.

This is a nice hotel. It is in a location near a subway and Macy's. The rooms are clean and comfortable, though small. The bathrooms are good size with a walk in shower. The employees are friendly and helpful. They offer a service to the airports with a fixed rate. The price is a good value for the location. We enjoyed our stay there and will return to this hotel.

We stayed 4 nights in a suite. Though still quite small it was spacious enough for two and there was a small wardrobe. The Empire State Building view from our room more than made up for that. Good toiletries and decent hairdryer. Close to subway and many attractions. Good breakfast cafes nearby. Would definitely stay here again.

Such a wonderful week stay in this hotel. The location is perfect for sightseeing around Manhattan and the view of the Empire State Building from the room was wonderful. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Special thanks must go to the consierge Scott who went above and beyond to help us when our Norweigan Air flight was cancelled at very short notice. He managed to get us a room for the night and helped calm us down when we thought we would be stranded. Norweigan Air were no help at all! We cant wait to come back as there is so much that we still didnt manage to see and I wouldnt stay anywhere else.

We stayed in one of the smaller suites at the hotel (called the Elan penthouse); overall spacious enough for my family of 4 (2 teenagers and my wife and I), Clean and very comfortable room at a decent nightly rate with a very nice view—just wish there was closet space, although this seems to be the trend these days where closets are omitted to allow for more room. The stand out with this hotel was the service—we had several questions and requests and everyone was extremely helpful and went above and beyond in my opinion. (Especially the management who seems to genuinely care about each and every guest experience.). Great overall experience for my family and definitely a solid option to the bigger chain hotels where service can be lost in the shuffle.

Great location and clean, but facilities in general could use some upgrading. Check in process was weird. Even at 4pm they didn't have a room for us so we had to wait. But staff was friendly and relatively helpful considering the circumstances.
user_name:
shock66
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at Le Soleil hotel for two weeks. In our opinion this is the best luxury hotel to be in for the price in Midtown Manhattan. We look forward to returning here in the future. The staff was warm, friendly and courteous. Everyone at the hotel was fantastic, from Emilio the doorman, Choeyni our housekeeper, Scott at the concierge, who had excellent recommendations on places to shop, dine and party in the city, to Francesca at the front desk, who accommodated all our requests - all in all, all the staff (including those whose names we cant remember) gave us a pleasant and welcoming experience!Aside from the amazing people, the location is unbeatable, right in the heart of midtown. The hotel room we were given was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The hotel has an amazing gym and restaurant. Especially enjoyable was their Jazz performances which take place in the lobby three days a week. We look forward to staying here again! Best, Prabha & Aditya
user_name:
jainaditya8
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel was the perfect location for our family of 4, 2adults and two kids! The hotel was a cute and quaint boutique style hotel the customer service was outstanding the front desk staff were awesome Chris in particular always was very attentive to us at m The hotel was a cute and quaint boutique style hotel the customer service was outstanding the front desk staff were awesome Chris in particular always was very attentive to us! We were walking distance to time square Broadway the garment district all the bus lines it was fantastic the price was great for time square hotels. The only drawback was that there were no closets in the room but that’s OK everything else made up for it. I did hours of research and reading reviews Take it for me this is the place you want to book.

This is an excellent hotel located a short walk from Macy's on 34th and the Empire State Building. Great central location for walking and subway access. We stayed at the hotel for a week for a holiday. All staff were very friendly. In particular, the building manager (William) was extremely helpful and understanding when I encountered difficulty with the business center. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Only downside is that the rooms are somewhat small (inevitable in Manhattan) and there was an issue with our window in the first night (it didn`t close properly so could hear noise from the street). However, the window issued was promptly fixed after we asked the front desk.

The people are what give this hotel its awesome rating. Everyone is engaging and really wants to help. Ritz Carlton trained? Maybe. But not stuffy! I would stay there again in a second. My room was very cozy (ok- small) but the bathroom was normal sized. Locating is walking distance to Broadway and Penn Station. Perfect. The people made it feel like home.

This is a great hotel, location and staff. Everyone is helpful and friendly. So close to all you want, midtown is best! I have stayed here a few times and it never disappoints. Go and enjoy yourself!!

We were in NYC to celebrate a milestone anniversary. The hotel staff was excellent. We chose an Executive Queen Room on a higher floor- we had a view of the city, Freedom Tower and the Empire State Building was right outside our door. There was a bottle of champagne and a Happy Anniversary note from the hotel in our room when we arrived. We were going to try to get a drink and quick bite at the attached Trademark Taste before a concert but it was packed. The Maitre D/manager suggested we sit In the hotel lobby (where a jazz band was playing- very nice)- he personally took care of us, taking and serving our drinks and apps. Amazing!All around fantastic experience and we will be back.Please note: some family members joined us a few days later- they were three in a room and with opening the pull out couch, it was a very tight squeeze. But it’s NYC- small rooms- and they loved the hotel too.

Had a great stay here. Great location. Wish I could have stayed longer!!!! Unfortunately did not get a chance to try the restaurant, but definitely will be back for another stay Highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a central location. Close to the subway, but also a nice walk from here to Rockefeller center and Times Square. Super close to the ESB. Loved this hotel!!!

Nice-sized room, great location, clean and comfortable. The bell staff--particularly Joseph--was helpful and professional. Room service available as well as comfortable lobby areas. Would definitely stay here again.

The room is new with a great design. However, it isn't big enough to actually open your suitcase or use the suitcase rack. The cleaning is lacking as evidence by a piece of plastic that was on the carpet when I checked and there when I checked out. The resort fee is a scam. The desk person explained that it was for the water, coffee, business center, etc. Water and coffee were never refreshed. What's next, a charge for electricity and towels?It was a business trip and the location was good for me. Other than that, it was a place to sleep and shower. If this was a personal trip, then it would be the wrong choice of a hotel.

The hotel is idealy located in NYC for visits by walk, and was very comfortable. Concerning the staff, it was the best staff I have ever seen in a hotel : helpfulness, readiness, friendly and efficiency.Thank you for all these qualities. I recommend this hotel for everybody. If I go back in NYC, I will come back into this hotel, it's sure.

We had a fantastic stay at this hotel . It’s central , clean and a very welcoming. The only thing is you pay a lot per day for WiFi , water and gym use . We didn’t use the gym so maybe the hotel would consider doing a separate price for water and WiFi or price the services separately . Bottles of water don’t cost a lot so maybe include it in the room price . This wouldn’t put us off stopping again .

We enjoyed our stay at the hotel . The staff made us feel like family ! The General Manager went out of his way to welcome us when he saw us at the lobby.The food at Trademark restaurant was very good and live music on Thursday night in the lobby was enjoyable.Great hotel and we highly recommend it.

Beautiful penthouse room with an amazing view. All staff members were friendly and efficient. Very helpful with all questions about transportation, locations of business and arranged privet car pick up to JFK. Frances was excellent at her job. Jamie was friendly, helpful and courteous. The entire day and night staff were very helpful. I have nothing but good things to say about my stay. This hotel is centrally located to so many must-see sites all within walking distance. I will be staying here again on my next trip to New York! Thank you, LeSoleil for making my first trip to New York even more rememberable with your accommodations.

Close to all attractions in time square, hotel was clean and very comfortable bed. Staff was very professional and courteous and always willing and ready to answer any questions. We will definitely stay there again if ever in New York again

Beginning of the stay was good, the room was comfortable and the breakfast was worth it. My Uncle had forgotten a shirt there when we left. Customer service was horrible for sending it back. We even emailed them a FedEx label, at their request; they never even opened it. We still have not received the shirt; even though we have contacted them many times since. Promised calls were never made to us!

Pleasantly surprised to find this nice modern hotel, located conveniently in midtown manhattan on 36th St., between 5th and 6th Avenues. Close to Penn Station, Time Square, subway stops, and shopping. Rooms are small, but did not feel cramped due to being smartly furnished. Comfortable lobby and good restaurant located away from street noise. Front patio for sitting outside. Friendly and helpful staff. Magdi, Jaime & Joseph were helpful with the arrival and departure to and from the hotel.

Great location, middle of the highlights of NY from Empire to Times Square. Great staff, friendly and kind. Andrew at front desk was awesome. Easy check-in and check-out. Clean rooms. Had a great time on NY. Definitely recommend it.

We stayed for five nights and really enjoyed it. Keep in mind it is in the heart of Manhattan so rooms will be a bit smaller than maybe what you are used to. During our stay all of our needs were quickly and promptly addressed by the very professional team at hotel soleil, thank you!

Great location...even better hospitality. From the time we checked in, we felt personally cared for. Whether it was the doormen or concierge to housekeeping or front desk, we were always overwhelmed by how they seemed to know what we needed or just gave an encouraging word. I can’t say what your experience will be but we left feeling it was a great foundation to our NY family vacation...Good Luck on yours! P.S...try Tonchin across the street for ramen, drinks and shaved ice.

This hotel was a nice place to stay. It was a little run down, torn curtain, stained carpet, but it was clean. It looked very posh but the staff lacked enthusiasm and a lesson in providing excellent customer service. It was okay but not great!

Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff. The room was clean, good atmosphere and with a very comfortable bed. The hotel has a good restaurant but there are also many good options for food nearby. Would recommend if you’d like to stay midtown, walkable both to up & downtown.

I had an excellent experience at the hotel. My son and I stayed one night prior to traveling to South America. The location is excellent, the service impeccable and the room was perfect. We had a great experience. They booked us a car to go to JFK and had a flat fee. The driver did say that was a surcharge to pay by credit card which I thought the flat rate was to pay either cash or cc. Something to reconfirm if booking a car. I would highly reccomend and can't wait to go back.

This location is great, the hotel was very clean and staff were fabulous. There were 4 of us and the room never felt small. Location was close enough to walk to Times Square, Central Park, Empire State, and subways. So glad we stayed here vs directly in Times Square. It was close enough to enjoy, but we didn’t have to deal with the crowds. Room was quiet and comfortable.

We loved our stay here! Our room was clean and comfortable (I wanted to take that terrific shower home with us) and the staff was very personable and accommodating. We told them our room was a little too cool and it was taken care of right away. The restaurant has a nice ambiance and a very pleasant staff, and the food was great.
