Magdi, one of the door men, was extremely helpful, knowledgeable, familiar with the area to recommend restaurants and places of interest, and very friendly (and handsome!). A terrific hotel and we would definitely return.

Our room (Executive - King Size) was rather small with hardly any space to put clothes and suitcases. The heavy wooden bathroom door was rather awkward to use. The cleaning was not very thorough. Apart from that the bed was very comfortable and although we were on the relatively low 10th floor we were not disturbed by any noise and slept well. The location is very good. The Herald Square subway station is just round the corner and many points of interest can be easily reached on foot.

Nice room with lots of space, good lobby restaurant and live music on some evenings. Lobby service people were wonderful, helped with everything - for example the late night snack delivery. Minor problems with cleaning, some days not at all cleaning or not towels. But after you contacted the lobby service they right away sent someone to take care oh the issue.

A centrally located hotel that is small and friendly. Staff are very helpful and nothing is a problem. The TV's in the room allow watching Movies at no additional cost, there is coffee and water provided daily at no cost, an excellent benefit. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again. It is located in Midtown so very central to all the places that most people would want to visit. Most things are walking distance

Just spent a very enjoyable few days in NYC at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil. Hotel was very comfortable, reasonably priced and close to subway. Also located close to a couple of good bars for the World Cup footy! Special thanks to Magdi, Jaime & Joseph who were so friendly and helpful.

The staff at the Hotel are exceptional. I especially want to mention the door guys, Magdi, Jaime and Joseph, who could not have been more helpful in every way, from helping with luggage, parking and loading to giving us great recommendations for restaurants. I also want to mention Halimaton in Housekeeping who is an absolute sweetheart. Of course this is NY so our room was small and there wasn't much space for clothes. However, Housekeeping brought us extra hangers and helped set us up.

The Executive LeSoleil was a great place to stay while in New York on business. Magdi, Jaime and Joseph were amazing at the front door, super helpful with my luggage and also helping me get a car to and from the airport. The rooms were clean, and definitely spacious for NY. I loved that they gave you two bottles of water each night and complimentary coffee - it's the little things when you're on the road a lot that make you feel more at home. I'll be requesting to stay here again when I'm on business! The only downside was the cafe downstairs. Sometimes they were very quick in the morning when getting food and on other days it took me 30 minutes to get a breakfast sandwich (someone ordered 25 minutes after me and got theirs at the same time). The breakfast sandwich was good - the avocado toast has way too much salt on it. Don't get it! I had a room on the 10th floor right by the elevators. I was worried it was going to be too noisy by the elevators but it wasn't at all. I also thought the room was very clean!

Magdi, Jamie and Joseph are the BEST!! Soooo friendly and helpful. Had a great time and will come back to this hotel. Close to all the best places, walking distance, bus and subway. Welcome to New York, it’s been waiting for you! Thanks guys!!

A perfect place if you are planning to stay in New York! The location could not be any better and the facilities are amazing! The staff was very friendly and always willing to help! It was absolutely perfect!

The Hotel provides an upscale experience without an upscale price. Modern room amenities, excellent customer service and a relaxing lobby. We will return again for a weekend excursion. Great location in MIdtown walkable to everything.

All the staff and facilities of the hotel are amazing. The room has a excellent space and confort. The location is fantastic: close by many subway lines and shopping options. If you wan to have a breakfast outside the hotel, the area has so many options of coffee shops and restaurantes

We had suite with a queen bed in 1 room and sofa bed in another for 2 kids. Rooms are quite small, but ok, as we were only in a room during the night. It was very quiet room, no noise which was a big plus for me. Bathroom is ok size, cleaning was done every day. We had breakfast included as I booked via booking.com, but it was very limited.Therefore after the 1st day we didn't use our breakfast coupons, instead we had breakfast just outside the hotel, there is a lot of choice and prices were very reasonable. Location is great, on a 36th street between 5th and 6th avenue. We walked everywhere around. Choice of restaurant around is also great. Maybe we could find something cheaper around, but we had 2 kids who had to sleep separately, so this choice was great for us. Recommend it to families with 2 kids.

Hotel is in a great location easy to get around town, easy access to Herald Square Subway station. Rooms were very nice, walk in shower was great, good room ambiance, Staff was very helpful with baggage and setup of transportation

I wasn’t sure if this hotel was going to work out well for us or not - and it exceeded my expectations overall! My teenage daughter and I were in NYC for the first time for a girls weekend. This hotel was in an excellent location for us - we easily got around all of Manhattan. We had everything we needed near the hotel. And, we felt like we got a good value. The only thing we weren’t ready for - there is so little room in the room itself that we had to get REALLY creative about where to put our belongings, even though we had packed lightly. As one example: we had virtually nowhere to place our soaking wet rain jackets! We settled on the shower - but there was not even a good way to hang them. I totally understood that the rooms would be small. The problem is that there are not viable storage solutions.

To see anything g you want to see in New York. Blocks from Empire State Building, Madison Square Gardens and broadway it is a nice clean and friendly hotel. Food is awesome and staff extremely friendly and helpful! Loved it there.

Very nice and comfortable hotel in an excellent location. I booked a room with a view, it wasn't very huge nevertheless it was beautiful and with everything you may need. I felt completely at ease with this soundless hotel and I think I will book it again in my next visit to NY.

It's a nice place for staying in Midtown. 36th street means you are a little away from overcrowded Times Square, but location anyway is very good to reach a lot of main tourism objects by ease. Hotel, room and restaurant were ok.

Nothing negative about this hotel.Ideal base to explore NY.Clean, very friendly, good breakfast (was included for us)The concierge was a golden man who does everything to help you. He is even powerful in the French language!I would recommend it to anyone.

We chose well when we picked this hotel! The location was perfect, only a few minutes from the Empire State Building, 5th Ave and the theatre district!The restaurant was great, as well. Friendly staff everyday!

Close to subway and Manhattan attractions. Plenty of good food outlets and the bell staff are extremely helpful and knowledgeable about how to best get to places. Any request met with courtesy and speed. The room size was very good for this part of the city.

Air Conditioning in the room was motion-sensor activated. Had to get up out of bed during the night constantly to reactivate the air conditioning by waving my hand in front of the sensor. We asked for it to be fixed and there was no change after engineer supposedly was sent to the room. Not Pleasant!

I stayed in room 1904. It's a queen suite with a sofa bed, about 400 square feet of space, which in NYC is palatial.View: This room does not face the Empire State Building, but instead has a pleasant northern view of the skyline featuring the Bank of America Tower and a sliver of the MetLife Building.Closet: As others have mentioned, the room does not feature a traditional closet. Instead, they offer an open-air hanging rack with three shelves, three drawers, and a standard customizable-code safe that easily fits a 13.3" laptop. They also provide a very comfortable robe, slippers, an iron and ironing board, hair dryer, small ice tub, and handy courtesy hotel umbrella.Bed: The mattress was very comfortable and the sheets were soft and welcoming. The pillows are also on the softer side, in case that matters for you.WiFi: The wifi service is available throughout the property and is sufficiently fast. Just be prepared to enter the password every time you go online.Noise: It's great that the windows open so you can get fresh air, but just be prepared for the street noice. That wasn't a big deal for me, since I love those sounds! Also, they wisely placed the bedroom and "living space" TVs on an interior dividing wall, so your TV-watching doesn't affect other guests and vice versa.On to the not-so-great, but not-nearly-close-to-deal-breaking issues: - They dropped the ball on providing adequate counter space in the bathroom. The bathroom area is ridiculously spacious. It would have been a simple matter to install a wider sink area or another shelf somewhere. By far, this is the most significant failing of an otherwise great hotel room. - The water pressure in the shower was a bit on the low side, but that just might be a function of being on a high-ish floor. - This could have been a fluke, but *in my view* the food in the restaurant lacked proper seasoning. Not to worry, the world-famous historical NYC landmark, Keens Steakhouse, is just a few steps down the street and is a must-do if you are in the area. Make reservations if you can, otherwise, you can try to get seats in the bar area. Aaron, one of the bartenders/servers is very knowledgeable, acommodating, and helpful. Find him -- you won't be disappointed! Also, Habanero Blues, just across the street, has really great food and drinks. In a nutshell, you're in a great area, try *everything*! - Other reviews mentioned the slow service of the elevators, since the hotel only has two, but I found that I didn't have to wait long for them. I suppose it depends on your expectations.All in all, this a great room in a well-cared for hotel. You can't go wrong here.
user_name:
mbazie
New York City, New York

review_body: Price, quality and location are perfect! Also the staff was very friendly en helpful.Bedding was excellent, also the rest of the interior in the room and in the hotel and restaurant.Breakfast was oke, the orange juice was missing.We like the spot of the hotel in the middle, were a lot is happening!

It was my first time in NYC and it was my dream to always visit. I was travelling by myself and once I opened the door to my room it was exquisite. It was the perfect size for me, queen bed and there was a sofa once you open the door, then a tv as well. There was another tv in front of the bed. The bathroom was perfect and so was the bed, very comfy. The noise was not too bad. You can hear the taxis honking their horns but late at night was not bad at all. The staff was so sweet to me and always answered my questions. Scott from the concierge helped me locate the subways and this hotel is located in a great spot if you plan on doing a lot of walking like I did!!! The bus boys were also super sweet and helped load my luggage into the car. I really appreciate the staff dealing with me and all my questions since I was so nervous coming there my first time. I definitely want to stay here again if I can next time. They are worth every penny. I love you guys!!!! xoxoxo Nancy from 508.

Hotel is 5-10 mins walk from Times Square and we could see the Empire State Building from our hotel room! Room was clean and comfortable, we slept very well. Good air con. We had one of the rooms with the sofa bed in so this was ideal for our toddler to sleep in. When I was looking at rooms in New York to book, most other places either had only a double bed, or we would have had to book somewhere with a 2 bedroom suite, which was very expensive, so I would recommend this hotel if you have a toddler as it was really good value. The front desk staff were especially lovey, taking the time to interact with our son. One of the staff even arranged for chocolates and prosecco to be left In our room when she found out it was my husband's 40th birthday. we will definitely stay here agin when we return to New York in the future.
user_name:
Jenni C
Rainford, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Visited New York City with my family and enjoyed the great service of this hotel! Rooms were clean and comfortable. Hotel staff immediately does whatever you’ve asked for right the way with great kindness. Very recommended!

The hotel is decent however the price is high for what you ultimately get. You can stay at another hotel for half as much and get the same level of amenities. The wait staff in the hotel was very slow and other guests were served before me who sat down after me.

For a hotel in central Manhattan, le Soleil is perfectly located, and also offers extremely good value for money. It is clean, rooms are very well appointed, and staff are very helpful. Excellent value for money. I rarely give a 5 out of 5 on anything but le Soleil deserves 5's on all aspects.

I liked the quiet location a few blocks from busy Times Square. The rooms have a nice sitting area, permitting some privacy and city views. I especially enjoyed having a high quality coffee bar at Trademark, which adjoins, and being able to come back to the hotel after a busy day and enjoy a nice cocktail away from the busy city. Very relaxing!

I stayed here for four nights and found the room lovely and the location fabulous, but the service was sub-standard overall. The front desk staff were not terribly helpful at check-in and with every query they passed the question to another person at the hotel. There was one shining light - the concierge. He was fantastic and very helpful.Additionally, I accidentally left a travel wallet in a drawer in the room when we checked out - doh! It had a credit card and our travel details in it. I know I left it, but it was mysteriously never found by the housekeeping staff. Only two options - they found it and decided to keep it or they couldn’t be bothered dealing w a left item. In either case, rubbish service!

The staff is always helpful and the rooms are generally clean, although the carpet could use a cleaning. Somne of the rooms are small but most are spacious. The location is perfect for midtown and close to some great restaurants

We love 36th St! Just close enough to walk to the theatre, but not too close to Time Square's noise. Our room was lovely, with great blackout curtains. (very important to us) We were in a queen bed room,and the closet was small for two people for a week. The bed was great, very comfortable. Nice to have live music in the lobby. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Great hotel near to Empire street bdg (basically 2 streets). Good access to public traffic, approx half way between City and Central park. As for higher levels then you will have a beautiful view. Please be prepared there are small room for clothes.

This hotel was beautiful, clean, friendly. Jaime, our bell man, had great advice when we asked him where to go and what to do. He even called for us to get a reservation to the steak place next door for that evening and we lucked out with a reservation. He really went above and beyond the call of duty. I didn't think New Yorkers were this friendly, he proved us wrong!!

This was our first visit to NYC and the staff could not have been more helpful. Ideally placed close to the Empire State building. When we asked if we could book a taxi to the airport they got us a limo/bus for the same price. We will definitely go here again.

Kindness and smiling of the staff (reception, restaurant, chauffeur...). Beautiful hotel and room. Very charming. Clean and quiet ! Good location in the city, next to subway, shops and famous locations

We had a wonderful stay at Le Soleil Hotelwith great service and great location. From our arrival with the welcoming doorman to the friendly front desk, the team members we saw in the elevators, all greeted us with a smile, made for a completely enjoyable experience. The hotel’s location is close to Broadway, Time Square, Hearald Square shopping including Macy’s, Koreatown, HiLine, Penn Station and subway stations. There are great restaurants all within walking distance. I highly recommend Le Soleil to anyone visiting New York City.

The worst hotel ever I have been in The careless employee from the manger till the housekeeper Small rooms ( pictures in websites were a trick) Dusty furniture and towels torn, disappearance of clothes and so much bad things happen in this fantastic hotel!

I was in the city with some friends for a mix of work and play. I was unfamiliar with this hotel, but was pleasantly surprised by the service and rooms. We were able to check-in early and the room was much larger than the typical NYC hotel room. We had four women staying in a two queen room, and had plenty of room to spare. The concierge assisted with obtaining and printing theater tickets. There is a great little cafe attached, which we did not get to visit, but looked great. The location is great, very convenient to the subway and to the touristy things that my friends wanted to enjoy. I would absolutely stay here again.

Stayed for 5 nights in this hotel. Really nice hotel with exceptional staff. Happy to do anything for you like all the Americans I came into contact with.Fantastic location with most attractions within walking distance. Would definitely stay there again. Highly recommend

You must fix the thermostat so people can sleep at night without the room temp rising to 72.5. Was told it now works in motion detector to get a tax break. That temp is too high for healthy sleep. After years of using your hotel for 4 business trips a year, our entire board is likely to go elsewhere.

We stayed here for 5 nights in a queen suite. The room was comfortable, spacious and clean. Theres a restaurant and gym and the location is perfect. It's about a 15 minute walk toTimes Square, Metro stations are close as well as many coffee shops and restaurants. The bellman was excellent and will answer all your questions. If you go JFK, the flat rate for taxi is $70 and the bellman will order for you. Will stay here again on next trip to NY.

I would recommend this hotel for a stay in NYC. The hotel is very well located: very closed to the Empire State building, the Rockefeller Center, Time Square....You could easily walk to those places. The rooms are great: good bed, large shower, clean. The only improvement to be done could be to have a bigger closet to tidy up our things. The staff is also very nice, helpful and available.

Hotel was nice clean. Hotel staff not too good on cleaning the room. Left paper wrappers didn’t even empty ice bucket water from the night before. The beds are so hard in this hotel you may be better of to sleep on the floor. Will not be staying here again.

The hotel itself is lovely and clean. The people are the best part. The men who work the bell area were friendly and professional. The engineering staff top marks. Room was perfect for us. My husband and I and my mother. My mother had the pullout sofa in a separate area and her own TV. The bathroom between us. She said the sofa bed was comfortable. She had no trouble sleeping.

Everything about this hotel is fabulous. The staff, the rooms, the facilities and the location are excellent. They have upgraded my room at no additional cost a couple of times without being asked. They appreciate returning guests. Being a boutique hotel makes it more intimate and cozy. I’ve tried many hotels in NYC and this is the best in the price range. I have stayed on numerous occasions and will continue to do so.

Breakfast we paid extra for was over charged for what was allowed to have,each person only allow ONE beverage (only tea or filter coffee, not latte or cappuccino), ONE pastry (muffin or a particular croissant) and ONE fruit (orange, granny smith apple or banana which they run out often so we can have a fruit parfait). To sum it up they are too over-strict with choices and very mean to charge over £23 a day per person for that kind of breakfast! You would get a very good quality filling breakfast for that price in a proper restaurant somewhere! And also not mentioning we had to take it to our room to eat it. They serve a buffet breakfast for an extra $7 per person if we want it! So it will work out to almost £30 per person per day if we went for that! So don't book your room with breakfast included, not worth it!! Room making was not the usual standard for a 4 star hotel. Overall quite disappointed, not as expected.

I had seen this hotel on trip advisor and it had gotten good ratings so I thought I'd try it. It was great. Great location. Service and staff were friendly and attentive. It was clean and comfortable. Overall a good choice.
user_name:
Jennifer L
las vegas, United States

review_body: Facility charges for Water, Wi-fi etc... none were asked for by us and charges unexpected and very disappointing as i now feel ripped off. NY hotels should take heed! Travellers are savvy and wont accept this scam. Air BnB from now on.

The hotel was great, I was a little nervous in the beginning as we had a couple of hiccups but by the time we left things were on point. Things to know: the dansin water is complementary, there is a small fridge in the room to hold adult beverages and we put in apple sauce and yogurts for the kids, there is a little keurig machine with coffee. Suggestions for the hotel: breakfast tea kcups, if you know kids are coming in go ahead and send up extra pillows for the other bed even if you find out at check in, something complementary for the kids would have really made them feel included i.e. hot chocolate or couple of hotels we've stayed at gave a small gift to the kids at check in..the kids go back to school talking about it and we have given that hotel name out after to parents who have heard. The rooms are small compared to other cities and you have to remember you're in NYC. Our room had a few weird issues, the shower leaked, toilet handle gets stuck and runs, the light switches worked weirdly, and we had to go back and forward with the one remote for 2 tvs. We weren't in the room long enough to watch that much tv anyhow but when the kids want to change the channel looking for cartoons the ended up with the remote and you can't control the tv on the tv. Also, we weren't sure if you was supposed to tip or not tip the housekeepers as they hadn't taken the tip the first couple days. The hotel was kind enough to hold our stuff on the last day to squeeze in the last request of the kids. Overall we would stay here again.

Good hotel with a perfect location near Times Square and very close to the Empire State. the staff was very helpful. The room are not very big but it is enought as you don't come to New York to sleep !

Have stayed in this Hotel often and will always go back when I am in NYC. It is well located and has a variety of restaurants within short walking distance, as well as in the hotel itself. Staff are friendly and efficient. The room is average sized for NYC but is exceptionally clean with modern furniture and bathroom, good-size flat screen TV with many channels and full length windows ceiling to floor.

Hotel is located perfectly for visit in New York :)Room was clean, bed was very comfortable (we had king size bed)Hotel service very friendly and helpful. We asked for support with arranging transfer from airport to hotel - and it was organized perfectly.

We recently stayed four nights at LeSoleil. It's in a great location and we were able to take the train from EWR to Penn Station and, from there, walk the few blocks to the hotel. It's close to Bryant Park if you need a relaxing day of people watching in the park. The staff is super friendly - extra points for that! The room was decent size for NYC as was the bathroom. We were on the 18th floor and had a nice evening view. We were fairly close to the elevator but it wasn't at all noisy. They had music in the small lobby a couple nights we were there which we sat and enjoyed. We also had dinner in the restaurant one evening which was just OK. There's a coffee shop accessible through the lobby and we went there every morning to grab a cup on our way out. We took the subway to several different places from a couple different stations just down the block. Very nice stay. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

This hotel is a very good central location,near to Macy's department store.There are numerous restaurants,bars in the local vicinity and we walked everywhere during our stay in New York.We stayed in a queen suite which had a large double bed and a pull out double sofa bed in the lounge.There was a partition wall but no door to separate the sleeping areas.When the sofa bed was pulled out there was not much room at the sides to get into the bed so getting in/out was done via the bottom of the bed-not a huge problem for us but if not so able bodied could be difficult.It had a large bathroom ,very good shower,no bath.A hairdryer is supplied and small bottles of toiletries.There is a safe in the room hidden in a cabinet-no charge for this.Also there is a small mini bar fridge-the prices for drinks were very expensive but we managed to put some of our own drinks in it to cool.The coffee machine worked well-we were stocked with about 4 pods daily and two small bottles of water to use in the machine-ask for extra mugs if needed as we only had 2 initially.There are plenty of sockets in the room and a usb port at the desk.The wifi worked very well.I used the computer/printer room located on the bottom floor of the hotel to print out our boarding passes prior to flying home.All the staff were very helpful/polite and the hotel arranged a taxi for us back to JFK airport for $70.A big thank you to Mr Tennasssee who dealt with a couple of post trip issues for us.

Very good hotel. Very convenient and friendly. Excellent location to visit New York, very central (not far from Time Square and Empire State Building). Missing drawers and coat hanging capacities in the room but we nevertheless recommend this hotel.

The room was really small for the price paid. And the breakfast was a real disappointment. Never stayed at a hotel where the breakfast was a croissant and a coffee. The location was great, right in the middle of most attractions.

I almost don’t want to write this review for fear it will be booked solid forever. Yes, this is a clean, quiet, modern, reasonably priced hotel in a great Manhattan location. I was only there for one short night on Business, but I’d stay there again in a New York minute. Yes, the rooms are small, but that’s Manhattan for you. Strangely, the bathroom is almost as large as the bedroom. There’s a huge amount of wasted space in the bathroom. If you have luggage you’ll probably end up storing it in the bathroom. Why? Because there’s no closet. That’s the main drawback of this hotel: zero closet space. The closet is a narrow, open shelf in the corner of the room with coat hangers on it. Good luck hanging a coat or suit there. I used the hooks on the spacious bathroom instead. The hotel is directly across the street from a great sports pub, the Keg Room.

Executive Hotel LeSoleil is a clean, quiet hotel in a location that can't be beat. Very close to the subway, very convenient. Room was very spacious. although more storage space would be appreciated. Staff were very friendly and efficient.

Clean, Centrally Located with Excellent Restaurant & Coffee Shop. I would definitively stay again in the near future. Staff was always helpful and courteous. Excellent Wi-Fi service throughout the property.

I have just spent a week staying at Executive Hotel in Manhattan. My daughter chose this hotel as the base for her destination wedding in New York City. After much investigation Executive Hotel was chosen for location, reasonable price, and it being a smaller boutique style hotel. From the moment we checked in, everything went smoothly and all the staff were excellent. The rooms were lovely with gorgeous comfortable beds. Housekeeping were prompt and rooms were made up to our liking. The location was truly perfect with everything we needed being close at hand. Clothes washing service was across the road (and very reasonably priced); little places for breakfast were a mere 100 metres away (cheap); Macy’s one block away; Starbucks at the end of the street; and the subway was also only one block away. Last time during our visit to NYC we stayed right in Times Square however we found the location of Executive Hotel to be not as crazy and we weren’t woken all night long with sounds of sirens As far as anything we needed for my daughter’s wedding preparations the staff were just amazing. Things we needed were attended to as requested (eg ice bucket to the room, rooms made up by certain time etc). The staff were so friendly and nothing was an issue for any of them. I would like to make a special mention of Andre at the front desk. He was so helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed talking to him late at night about a day in the life of a New Yorker!! We learned so much about many aspects of city life. If you are wanting to stay close to everything without the madness of Time Square I would highly recommend Executive Hotel NYC. We will certainly return the next time we stay in the most amazing city in the world!!!

We chose this hotel after reading many reviews. Since we required 4 rooms and needed a central location and didn't want any less than 4 stars, the executive was the perfect choice! The location is more than excellent, close to subways, right next to Macy's. We got snowed in during our stay and in spite of the fact that they were fully booked, they went out of their way to accommodate us in the same rooms for another few nights! The only problem with all the rooms is that they are small and don't have closet space. We got by living out of our suitcases. The concierge was also so amazing and friendly. All in all we had a great trip and stay there!

Going into this place I saw a few negative reviews but getting there, I absolutely loved it! Being on the higher floors, you're right in the heart of midtown but it has excellent sound proofing and was so quiet! The gym was pretty good and breakfast was great! The hotel staff is super friendly and organized a ride for us to the airport. Everything went well when we stayed here and actually enjoyed the smaller room (big bathroom).

I truly expected a luxury boutique hotel.It was far from luxury. The room was nice but no closet, only a narrow section for hanging clothes that could only accommodate a few items. That left us to hang things on door knobs. The telephone did not work and despite mentioning on a Friday ( this was Easter Weekend), no one actually respond until I bothered the front desk several times and they finally stated it could not be fixed until Monday due to the holiday.They could have moved us. There was no fan working in the bathroom. I got conflicting responses.Room service was terrible. Coffee which tasted leftover from the previous night, and a very limited menu.The staff at the front desk were congenial and sympathetic.For the cost of the stay and the promise of a luxury boutique hotel, this was very disappointing. I never felt that they were oriented to our needs.I will not be back.

This was our 1st visit to New York (and the U.S) so we were very excited and took quite a while choosing the hotel. We chose Le Soleil because of its location and the reviews we read alluded to the fact that this was the hotel for us. We booked an executive Queen suite with city view for 6 nights. After booking we made contact with Yadira at the hotel, to make 2 requests regarding our room which were not met. We were on the 19th floor (1901) and had a view of the empire state building. The bedroom carpet was stained as was the headboard. The curtains and nets also had marks on, something i wouldn't have expected given how long it has been open. Our sitting area had a wall mounted flat screen TV, 1 ikea style chair and a huge glass coffee table. The bathroom had a low bath and shower attachment on a slider rail which was not very powerful at all. We had booked a breakfast within our deal and were given 12 cards to cover the 6 days. Although we only ended up eating breakfast at the hotel on 4 days. This was an American continental breakfast which we discovered is run by a COMPLETELY separate company as is all the hotel food, and it is very different to a European version. Breakfast was obtained by producing two of these cards every morning in 'Trademark Taste + Grind', which you access from the small lobby. The voucher entitles you to 3 items... a muffin or a pastry served with a fruit platter or yoghurt with granola and a drink of your choice. On one day we were sat down (in the restaurant) and had placed our order when another table who had placed their order 10 minutes after us received their food. We told the manager that we were not waiting any longer and left. On our last day we walked in to be told that they had 'changed things around a bit'. They were now offering a buffet breakfast, more like a European continental breakfast for $19 each which we could have if we wished to pay. We declined and were told that our breakfast was now being served in the coffee shop but that we were more than welcome to come back in and eat our food in the restaurant! We went through to the coffee shop were we shown our options. Our drinks would have been served in a paper cup, the fruit platter was in a plastic pot (and much less than was on the platter) we never found out how the pastry would have been served!! By this point we had gone to speak to the manager who didn't seem bothered by our position and allowed us to walk out on our last day without a breakfast. Overall we would say that the accommodation was very average and the hotel staff although doing their best could do with further training and direction from the management to make the guests experience seamless as we would expect. If you are happy with no frills accommodation in a good location then the Le Soleil is for you!

We have chosen this hotel mainly for it's position. You have a lot of attractions quite close. There are restaurants and fast food places all around. Subway is close too. The street is not so cahotic and we had no problem of noise during the nights. The rooms are not so small considering we are in Manhattan. We had a room with king bed and a sofa for our kids. Good choice!

Excellent location- close to subway, shops, restaurants, bars. The front desk staff was extremely helpful as was other staff we encountered. The rooms were clean and comfortable. A good value for the money.

One of the best hotels to stay in Mid-Town. Great location, clean room, and excellent staff. If you are staying in mid-town check this hotel out. The room is a perfect size, the bathroom has always been clean. The bedding is also exceptional. Highly recommended!!

The location of this hotel could not be better!! It is a short maybe 8 minute walk to Time Square and all of the Broadway shows. There is a great Mexican Restaurant across the street with the BEST Margaritas!! The front desk staff and doorman was pleasant. We did not have much interaction with many hotel staff, and that was fine. We arrived about an hour early and the room was not ready, the staff did hold on to our luggage so we could grab a snack in the city while we waited. There are several comments about the room being small. We had a double Queen bed room and it was really large compared to other hotels I have stayed in the city. There isn't space to hang clothes, but we were there for fun so the only thing that required hanging was our coats. The are that the hotel is in felt very safe. We had a great time and I would for sure stay here again.

We won tickets to see the NYR, so we decided to make a night of it! I researched hotels in the area of MSG that had more of a boutique hotel vibe. Executive Hotel LeSoliel got nice reviews and the restaurant/coffee house next door got rave reviews. So we booked it. The lobby is very attractive and very clean although smallish. It really has an old NY vibe. Approaching the desk we were greeted by Lilly and Musukula..two warm and welcoming women. They treated us like we were old friends or family. What a great start to our stay. The room was on a higher floor which gave us a decent view but insured we didn’t hear any street noise. The room is small(aren’t most NYC rooms small?) but pretty and the space is used well. The bathroom is also spotless and a nice size! We ran up the street to the GingerMan for a quick bite and a couple of drinks and then returned to the hotel to grab our NYR stuff and walked over to MSG. So easy! The bed was very comfortable. In the morning we ended up downstairs in Trademark Taste and Grind. Wow! A hidden gem! Great looking space, the staff was cheerful and attentive and the food was deeeeeeeeelicious. Best avocado toast I’ve had and the coffee is divine. We would have bought a couple of lbs if they sold the beans. When we checked out our friends Musukula and Lilly were there at the desk again! They are great ambassadors for the hotel. Really sweet! We did have one miscommunication with the hotel that was disappointing. The manager on duty Jose came to our room to personally apologize and he was so very nice. Every employee that we met was kind and friendly.. who says New Yorkers are grumpy? Lol. The hotel offered us an upgrade the next time we visit. Unfortunately we don’t really come in to the city to stay over. ( hubby worked there for years and we mostly travel into New England) It was a nice gesture though. I can still say I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. And what do you know the NYR actually won the game so that made the night more fun! Maybe if they make the playoffs next year we can come and stay in that suite!

Excellent location, very friendly staff, especially the brunette girl at the reception desk and the Scott concierge. Scott's tips are always very helpful.Clean and neat, but next time we're looking for a little bigger room. It's perfect for one person. But everything else compensated that little lack of space. We were there almost a week, the end of February and the beginning of March. We really enjoyed it and will definitely come again. We recommend it to everyone.This photo is a view from our room. Enjoy guys
user_name:
Elinda R C
New York City, New York

review_body: Our room was so small.. we could barely turn around in the room, but that’s typical NYC. I’d rather go to Boston We paid extra for a nice view, but the view wasn’t even that nice. However the hotel was clean and the employees were great and helpful and knowledgeable of the city. My favorite part of this hotel experience was its employees. Small hotel

stayed from 10/03 to 17/03 check in very smooth, stayed in room 706 7th floor room more than adequate very clean everything you need fridge coffee making machine hair dryer ironing board etc not much wardrobe space but its manageable .all the staff were pleasant and approachable, very helpful when needed.Would definitely stay again .i see a number of peoples grumbles about this hotel but that depends on your own expectations and the price you have paid.My overall experience was very good no complaints

The staff was very friendly, informative and helpful. My minor needs and special requests were accommodated immediately. The room is very tight with no drawers for clothes and barely any hanging space for garments but I could make due with the shelves and get creative with hanging.the bathroom toilet was a little beat up with minor cracking around the handle and it had to be lifted back into place to stop the water from running.The price and location are an excellent match for the business traveler. Clean, no frills, what you need , you have but everything is minimalist. But not in a bad way. Very efficientHaving only 1 ice machine on the second floor ( I was on the 18th) is a bit annoying and inconvenient.

Watch for fees that the registration person doesn't mention and you only see if you read the registration card very carefully. would have been a great review if this hadn't occurred. No matter how good a deal it is when they pull something like this it ruins the hotel for me. I'm sure they will counter this review but trust me - I WASN'T told about the $20 fee after the rate of $139 a night was CONFIRMED to me upon arrival! And what is the extra fee for? I finally found it on their web page (they say it's clearly on the web page - yeah, if you click on About, scroll to the bottom under Hotel Policies click on click here for details then scroll again to Additional Info Resort/Facility Fee. And this is what it says: "The rate does not include a mandatory Facility Fee equal to $20.00 USD (before taxes) charged per night, per room. Includes: local calls, daily newspaper, 2 bottles of Dasani water per day, WIFI, In room Keurig Coffee, Unlimited 24/7 access to fitness center and package handling." But their web page says: "INTERNET Free WiFi in rooms and public areas." Under Amenities: • Complimentary bottled water daily • Complimentary in room coffee. Lies since you have to pay for it in the fee. I've never stayed in a room where the pod of coffee was charged nor a newspaper unless I requested it. So they nickel and dime you for things that are usually free or THAT THEY STATE ARE FREE ON THEIR WEB PAGE! Stay away from this hotel!

Location wise its really good. Also Trademark next door (attached is really good.)Check In - average and the amount they hold for incidentals is a bit too high imhoRoom - City View - hmmmm yes if you angle your head, and avoid the pipes on buildings in front of your eye line.Nice room, in that bed is comfy and TV good and bathroom nice. Plus the coffee machine and fridge (which struggled to chill stuff)The bad.... my room smelt a bit dodgy. Like damp.The room was small very small. I was travelling solo. You wouldn't want someone else in there.No where to store the suitcase.Lack of plugsockets, room came with ironing board and iron. Good. Nowhere to plug in iron or actually put up ironing board. BAD.Would I stay here again, probably. Would I book here again off my own choice. No probably not.

Hotel has beautiful lobby ...lovely lounge downstairs and great restaurant. Rooms are small but nicely decorated. Location is fabulous. There are lots of restaurants nearby and it is easy walk to subway, Penn Station, Times Square, up 5th Avenue etc. Street feels safe when returning late at night. Would definitely stay here again.

Anyone looking for a high-quality hotel in the heart of midtown NYC is in for a treat if Executive Hotel LeSoleil is selected! Very clean hotel with wonderful amenities to make your stay both comfortable and enjoyable. Every staff member with whom you interact goes out of her/his way to help you. A special thank-you to Jose and Jeremiah for all they did to assist me during my recent business-travel stay. Highly recommend this hotel!

Hotels in New York can be ridiculously expensive at any time of the year and one has to do their research diligently to find good accommodations at a relatively decent price. I like to stay midtown and my favorite hotels in the past have been the Sofitel and the Iroquois when their rates have been reasonable which for this last trip they were not. I had stayed once before at the Executive Le Soleil in New York and liked it and then at the one in Vancouver which is commendable as well.On this trip I booked through Booking.com an executive suite with view which perfectly met my needs for a total price of USD810.00 including taxes and the tiresome cash grab resort fee of $20.00 a night. The equivalent at Sofitel was USD1300 and USD1100 at the Iroquois.One could say that the more expensive hotels, both on 44th St between 5th and 6th avenue are better situated however The Executive Le Soleil is only eight blocks away on 36th and between 5th and 6th with arguably better amenities than the ancient Iroquois and the not so young and ridiculously expensive Sofitel.The large high floor room I received had a nice view of rooftops and buildings in the distance, an impeccably clean large bathroom, a microwave oven a mini bar fridge that allowed me to store my own stuff (instead of those hateful electronic ones that charge you each time you touch something) and best of all a Kruger coffee machine for your morning coffee. At the Sofitel you have to request one for your room (but it is complimentary and part of that horrid resort fee they don't tell you about) and at the Iroquois you have to trundle down to the lobby to get your coffee as there are no coffee makers in the room.My room also was blessedly quiet at night for sleeping and the bed very comfortable. Surprisingly another bonus was that there were tons of channels on the large HD Television which was fun to flip through in the morning when looking at the news. The hotel WIFI which is included was also very strong and fast. In fact faster than most hotels I have stayed at.The staff I encountered were all charming,professional and diligent.The location of the hotel is two blocks from the Empire State Building and ideal for shopping. Macy's is three minutes away as are a myriad of other great stores. Good restaurants are in abundance in the immediate area. Just up the street from the hotel is A.B. Sushi which serves excellent fresh sushi. The clear seafood soup is to die for as is the Chiarushi and all at very reasonable prices.Also a favorite is Ben's Deli on West 38th between 7th and 8th for fantastic deli food. Their Corned Beef and Pastrami sandwiches are legendary and the coleslaw and pickles that come free to the table out of this world. Going to the theatre district is a ten to twelve minute walk. My only criticism would be to avoid the breakfast at the hotel restaurant Trademark as it is disappointingly overpriced and underserved. There are much better places around (such as couple of doors away) with much better value.Overall I was very happy with my experience and felt that I got good value for my money and shall certainly return.

Somehow from the pictures online I thought the hotel would be a little nicer.. Room was not very clean - The curtain had stains on it and as this was the first thing I saw upon entering the room it wasn't a great start..The breakfast that was included was very basic.. The staff were nice in the restaurant and most of the staff at reception were lovely with one exception..The mini bar fridge did not keep drinks cool. The description of hotel had advised that it was sound proofed but we found it very noisy.Nice Hotel but NOT fabulous....

I enjoyed a lovely three night stay with friends at this beautiful hotel. Our room was roomy, clean, and comfortable. The room, bathroom, and lobby were beautifully designed. The hotel is surrounded by wonderful restaurants and is in convenient walking distance to many great city activities. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful and polite. I will be a frequent visitor at the LeSoleil.

I surprised my wife with a weeks vacation in Manhattan for Valentines Day. I read the reviews and thought the Executive Le Soleil would be a great place to celebrate our 40th Valentines Day together. I booked a city view room and contacted the hotel before hand to ensure an awareness of both the importance and purpose of my stay. Overall, the hotel was clean, rooms were in very good shape and staff were very friendly. The proximity to Times Square favoured nice walks and ease of access to various restaurants and activities. However, be very careful when booking here because there are a few surprises ... First, your room rate will be adjusted. Yes, a mandatory $20 per night "Amenities Fee" will be added to your bill. The hotel may advertise competitive nightly rates but they are adjusted upon your arrival. If you are comparing prices, be sure to consider an additional $20 night. Second, the hotel has an odd arrangement with the neighbouring bar. Don't expect to pop into the hotel lounge without a reservation. Believe it or not !! My wife and I returned to the hotel after our Valentines dinner and decided to relax in the hotel lounge (as small as it was) for a night cap before retiring to bed. We sat at one of the open tables in the hotel lounge when immediately a man came rushing through a door from the neighbouring bar and asked if we had reservations. We explained that we were guests of the hotel. The man insisted that all seats in the hotel lounge were reserved by the bar and there were people lined up at the bar next door waiting for them, this quickly proved to be a flagrant lie. I was stunned - I had never encountered this situation in over 40 years of travelling. The man insisted we leave, noting that we might have luck at another bar down the street. Despite being severely embarrassed, we put our coats back on went to our room. As we were leaving, others in the lounge conveyed their surprise that guests of the hotel were asked to leave the hotel lounge to make room for patrons of a neighbouring bar. We quickly noted our experience to the front desk and the door man. Each of whom were essentially unresponsive to our dilemma. The next morning I brought my concern to the front desk once again. I was advised that the manager would be advised, again no further action was taken. During checkout, I raised the matter once again and was advised I might get a call from the hotel manager. Net/net, we were guests of the hotel and were ordered to leave the lounge so that the neighbouring bar could make a few extra bucks. I brought my concern to numerous hotel staff, no one took either an interest or an action. In fact, the manager did not even take two minutes to come to the front desk and discuss my concern - disgusting customer service !!! Ironically, the surprise "amenities" fee apparently does not include the hotel lounge. Despite this hotel having excellent potential, the hidden charges and complete lack of interest of the hotel management to engage "customer service" situations does truly tarnish the reputation of this hotel. Despite all the "Customer Service" media, be very cautious of booking a stay. Very sad .., one of the worst examples of customer service failures I have seen in over 40 years !!! The complete disregard to customers essentially ruined a milestone 40th Valentines Day for my wife and I. Sadly, not one person at the hotel took an interest in my concern. Fortunately, social media provides an excellent mechanism for sharing these types of experiences to safeguard the risk of others falling victim to the same predicament.

We had a wedding in New York City, so we didn't want to spend a lot of time in the hotel. This hotel location was perfect for our short stay because it was not too small, yet it was easy to catch a taxi to anywhere in Manhattan that we wanted to visit. The staff were extremely helpful and professional, especially when we handed them a map and asked if it was possible to get to all these places (list of three or five) in just one day!

Had such a great experience with Yadira helping me through my booking that I had to leave a review before our stay. We are heading to NYC in April with some friends and our kids and she made sure all our rooms would be on the same floor and found us exactly what we needed. Knowing this was how we were taken care of before we even arrive, makes us all very comfortable and excited for our trip.

This was our 13th trip to NYC in the last 15 years. We've stayed all over, and each area gives a unique experience. Midtown area is very central and close to many things and subways making it an ideal place to stay. And this hotel, despite being right in the heart is really very quiet for sleeping. Very nice rooms, a great fitness gym, funky restaurant and coffee bar on site. We found all the staff to be friendly and professional, and a special shout out to Jeremiah on the front desk - superb!

I stayed during winter break from school the stay was amazing customer service was awesome, I met an young man by the name of Jeremiah if im not mistaken he was very informative and a great help, wonderful customer service he made me feel comfortable every step of the way , I enjoyed my 4 day stay hope to be back soon during next vacation offand hopefully run until that young man againNo complaints made keep it up

This hotel is the best! Very clean, lovely room with a great view, friendly, helpful and courteous staff, a very nice restaurant on premises and all in a fantastic location! We stayed there to attend a concert at Madison Square Gardens, within easy walking distance, then also walked after a nice breakfast downstairs to museums and up-scale lunch. We will definitely stay there again!

It would of been a 5 star rating if not a complete ignorance of a management team after we have left. We've been charged a deposit which we were told has been released during our check-out. It's been over a week and I haven't received neither my money nor a reply to my email. Very unprofessional and not trustworthy.

From the moment I walked into Executive Hotel Le Soleil, until the day I checked out I was treated like A Superstar!!! Jeremiah was ABSOLUTELY AWESOME!! I told him it was my first time in NYC and he stated well we must make it your Best experience Ever... and Exceeded my expectations!! Now whenever I visit New York It’s a must I stay at Le Soleil because it felt like I was right at home with some Extra love!!

We have just returned from a six night stay in an Executive Queen Suite with a city view and what a view! It was quite unbelievable! The Empire State Building right outside our window! What we didn't expect was being able to see all the way downtown to the World Trade Centre too! Our room was on the 19th floor and I couldn't have asked for more. The room was clean, quiet and so comfortable with a large bathroom and walk in shower. Excellent wifi connection for those wanting this included in their stay too. All the staff were most welcoming and friendly.We both could not fault the hotel in any way. Excellent location in midtown, two blocks away from the Empire State and easy walking distance to the subway and anywhere else you choose to visit in the city. I can only recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an excellent quality hotel with wonderful views of the city. We will definitely choose this hotel again when we return to New York (hopefully). We also got engaged at the hotel making it extra special for us. Thank you for a wonderful stay to all at Executive Hotel Le Soleil.

We stayed because our play was close and we had a last minute deal. It was the best choice I made all night. The bellman was super friendly. The hotel is super cute. Our room was gorgeous. Such a perfect view of the Empire State Building Check our was a breeze and the only thing that was a problem was the shower took me 20 min to figure out how to do it. Gotta push the bath faucet up! Other then that best hotel I stayed in the city.
user_name:
dominicq75
New York City, New York

review_body: I spent four nights here and really enjoyed the stay. The room was terrific - nicely updated and very clean. Space was more than adequate, especially for New York, and the room was quiet. A minor detail but the hanging space was a bit tight with three suits and shirts on the rack. Wifi was always strong. If you go, visit the Grind coffee shop off the lobby. The best bacon, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich ever...and huge. Highly recommend a stay here.

I had ah super stay at the Hotel i booked it one day before my stay. The check in was great. Jeremiah at the reception was extreme friendly and could help me with many questions i had about the city. The room was clean and without any pionts to brag about. Had a great time!

I spent two nights and 3days at this amazing hotel when I enter the front desk person Jeremiah was just wonderful he was welcoming and caring understanding and helped me so much when I enter that night 1/26/18 he was just so awesome and then I needed a corkscrew the next night and I got it in no time let's say in five minutes everyone here is so nice. I stayed in room 1001. Also it's not far from Central Park.

As we were spending 14 nights in New York and wanted the extra space and kitchen facilities, with the amenities of a hotel, I booked the Decollette Suite. After travelling for nearly 30 hours from Melbourne we were very tired on arrival. The welcome was less than friendly, and strangely I was asked to sign the check in details on an iPad with very small print that was difficult to read. The Decollette Suite is lovely. There is a very large living/dining/kitchen area, and reasonably sized bedroom and a bathroom with a shower but no bath, although as others have said the shower pressure is poor. Unfortunately, the noise from the mechanical services on the roof is so loud that it was very difficult to sleep. At first we thought it was the fan on the air conditioner and asked at the reception desk the next morning whether they could see if they could do anything to reduce the noise. Later the same day I complained again, and the nice young man on reception sent someone up to the room to have a look/listen. He immediately acknowledged the noise in the living room and we asked him to go into the bedroom where it is soooo much louder. He said he would speak to someone to see what could be done.On our way out the next morning, after a second night with little sleep, I enquired at reception as to whether anything could be done about the noise. We were asked to take a seat and the manager, Jose, came to speak with us. He explained that the noise was caused by the mechanical services on the roof and that nothing could be done. He offered to move us to another room, but without a kitchen or to leave with no cancellation penalty. As we had theatre tickets that night we stayed a third night, and then moved to another hotel on New Years Eve at a very inflated price, for one night, before moving to an apartment hotel. The Decollette Suite is not cheap. It is disappointing that it is offered at all, and that it took three enquiries at reception before the noise problem, that the hotel is clearly aware of, was acknowledged. We were very sorry to have to leave this hotel as it is very well located in Midtown just south of Times Square, close to Macy’s and walking distance to the theatres.

We have just had an amazing 5 night stay at this beautiful hotel to celebrate a 60th birthday. Everything about the hotel was perfect! Friendly, helpful and efficient staff, and especially courteous and cheerful doormen! A spotless, spacious, very nicely decorated room, very quiet on the 13th floor considering we were in NYC! A perfect hotel based in an ideal location to get around the city. Would highly recommend!

Have read so many things about NY hotels and Executive Hotel Le Soleil had passed my expectations. It’s not too big if its just standard room but enough to fit yourself and your baggage. Perfect room size for a queen room with view but too big if you are staying solo. Almost all is excellent, from staff to rooms to location. It’s superb! Only few lookouts for management to improve or just for them to highlight 1) Bedroom slippers is not available when we arrive. We have to request to have one. 2) There is no pen but there is a pad paper . 3) We tried to call the reception to ask where to get ice but no one answered even if its just past 10PM. We had to visit lobby and ask personally 4) Table lampshade (the one near the TV) is not working. 5) Window light switch is connected to the bedside light which is also connected to the clock/iphone docking. So if I switch it off, the clock turns off as well. Other than that, everything is excellent. You can charge your cellphone and GoPro directly from the USB socket. No need for adaptors! There is an umbrella ☔️. Microwave and complete tablewares is available for your use at Queen Room with view (1601). Pillows are wow soft. Many television channels to choose from. Huge bathroom. Appropriate or enough space for Standard Queen Room (1502). Both rooms 1601 abd 1502 has spectacular view of the Empire State Building. Nearby Mcdonalds at 6th Avenue if you starve at 2 AM in the morning. High five for Executive Hotel Le Soleil!!!! Cheers!

Booked 2 night, midtown romance package, queen suite with view, stay couple months in advance for my husband's birthday. On arrival we were given 15 floor room. Once we entered the room it was missing what comes with midtown romance package as well as it was wrong size room. We went downstairs, explained situation and front desk told us "uum well midtown romance is a package" Yes I know? As I paid extra money for it? Then he blamed housekeeping for not leaving champagne in our room. Absolutely lowest level of customer service, blaming it on your coworkers. Then when I said that room is supposed to come with guest accommodation he offered us 5th floor room. We had to decline as we booked view room. Now the midtown romance comes with 2pm late checkout. I called in the morning to double check with front desk as I had a feeling they probably will forget about it. And of course, as we came back to hotel from lunch at 1.30pm to check out, our key card was not working and we had to waste our time going back downstairs, front desk person knew which room we're from, but didn't bother telling us that key card will be locked after 12? Lovely, clean hotel, spacious room, completely ruined by staff. How was it possible not to be prepared when room was booked enough in advance.

Great stay (only one night)...front desk staff very nice...very clean hotel and room!! What makes the Hotel LeSoleil even better is its great location right on 36th! My room faced 36th so it was a bit noisy, but it is NYC and that is to be expected!!

We stayed at the Executive Hotel LeSolel from Jan 10 to Jan 15 2018. The hotel was great: classy decor, friendly staff, quiet and comfortable room. My only complaint is that when we checked out we were charged an additional $20 a night 'Facilities Fee". We had prepaid via Expedia and were not expecting additional charges. We were told that this fee covered the use of the basement 'business center', and the 'complimentary' bottles of Dasani water that were left in our room.As far as I can tell, this hidden charge is included so that they can advertise a lower nightly charge on sites like Expedia. It's a deceptive and deeply irritating business practice. Check the fine print on your booking to make sure you understand the actual expense of your room before finalizing your reservation. If you're okay with the cost (including the 'facilities fee'), the Executive Hotel LeSoleil is a fine place to stay.

This place is the best hands down. The staff of this hotel are an amazing group of individuals that go above and beyond for their guests day in & day out. I've stayed here 30+ days this year and I wouldn't trade it for all the warm weather in California. Bernie is one of the coolest guys you could ever hope to meet, I suggest you ask for him when you book your stay. I will be back time and time again in the best midtown hotel you can count on that.

Wow!!!! What a fantastic hotel. The location is perfect, the staff did everything in their power to ensure we had a fabulous experience. We received a "random upgrade" by the manager to a queen sweet.

Loved everything about this hotel; great location, friendly and helpful staff, safe and clean! I would highly recommend this place to anyone who likes to stay in classier, smaller properties with more personal service.

I hate writing this review because I know it might sway you to stay here... The ONLY reason I wouldn't want you to stay here is completely SELFISH! I don't want to drive up the demand therefore the prices But this hotel, the staff and the service we received not once but TWO years in a row was outstanding! We book directly through the Hotel Website which I highly recommend and I also attribute to the success of our stays at EHLS. Location is fantastic (subways are super close and easy to get to) and the sights in and around the hotel are equally impressive.I want to reiterate the AWESOMNESS of the service and the staff. All of our needs were met quickly and without hesitation. We have found our home in NYC without a doubt!

This excellent boutique hotel is located in the heart of Midtown Manhattan within a short walk of the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre, Madison Square Garden, Times Square & Grand Central Terminal as well as Macy’s & Saks for those who like to shop!The staff at the hotel are wonderful & can’t do enough for you and they like to look after their returning guests which is an added bonus.I’ve been lucky enough to deal with Yadira Aviles when booking who has been amazing & a great credit to the hotel.The photo attached is the view from our room so from our last visit so paying a little extra for a City View is well worth it.If you’re planning a trip & want a boutique hotel in a prime central Manhattan location then the Executive Hotel Le Soleil is the place to stop.

Enjoyed our Christmas visit to NYC! The hotel was conveniently located. Bed was fabulously comfortable. Staff was great!Jaime was so friendly and helpful from our arrival to our departure. Thank you again

Comfortable beds, small room but just too many small negatives adding up to make me try someplace else in future. Location was good, midtown and walking distance to many attractions and shops. The negatives, low floor room facing street and noise was terrible Saturday night, poor drainage of bathroom sink, slow elevators and some attitude from desk staff at check in with no early check in available.

We stayed at the Executive Le Soleil for three nights between Christmas and New Year’s. The hotel is located in the Garment district-a great location if you want to venture north and south In Manhattan during your stay. It is an easy walk to great restaurants in Korea Town, the Empire State Building, and Times Square, but on a quieter street. The staff was amazing-truly the heart of the hotel. They were helpful, responsive, and polite. The only negative I will note is room size . I selected this hotel in part because they have queen size beds and we are a family of 4. Yes, the beds are queen size, but there is NO closet or space to put even one suitcase (let alone 4). There is an open rack/ desk unit that has a tiny space to hang items and a couple of tiny drawers. The beds are relatively comfortable and the bathroom is sufficient. I have traveled extensively in Europe and had read reviews that the rooms at Executive are “European size”. I can tell you that the room was among the smallest in which I have stayed, and the lack of closet/floor space makes the room smaller. My recommendation is that they remove the desk/mini fridge unit and add a closet. In hindsight we probably should have gotten two rooms, but with the room cost at close to $500/night during the holiday that really was not a consideration. I certainly would stay at this hotel again-just not with the whole family.

Booked this hotel as the reviews were very good - not disappointed - as an elderly single traveller this hotel ticked all the boxes - Firstly the location is very good u r right near HERALD SQUARE ie Maceys and a good variety of top shops and if u turn right out of hotel u r on 5th avenue and only 10 minute walk to BRYANT PARK . The reception staff are all very accomodating and helpful and the only letdown was that twice my room was not cleaned and had to be attended to late evening. I had an executive room with a view - not large but enough for one person although the bathroom was very large but unfortunately not enough shelves for ones personal items. The restaurant adjoining the hotel is very good and the breakfast is typical american and again u cannot fault the good service although they did serve latti coffee in a small glass without a handle - too hot to drink! The overall impression is a very good run hotel, very clean and secure and I would not hesitate to recommend and I would definitely return for my next trip.

Stay away from this hotel. I came with my family to spent our Christmas holidays..it was our big mistake..the room was too small for 4 persons..the cold air from outside with -6 degrees was inside our room from the old and damaged windows! The staff was totally unprofessional and very rude! And for the breakfast????don’t ask..was terrible..and the best of all....the housekeeping stole an facial cleaning from our room...for all this and much more stay away!!!the 1 star is too much...

This hotel is lovely! Very good location and once inside so cosy with the open fire and Christmas tree, the room was nice we had the suite with bed and sofa in the lounge part which was lovely, only problem there was there nowhere to hang our clothes so had to keep everything in our case. The concierge staff make this hotel Jamie on the front door was amazing!!! and Scott so helpful please give them a huge thanks they really deserve recognition for how helpful they are, Scott the concierge he booked us the bus tour and Ellis Island/Statue tour, printed our tickets etc literally nothing was a problem took his time in advising us where to visit such a lovely man, these 2 really are a credit to your hotel. Your reception staff werent very friendly or helpful, the one lady I found quite sarcastic and had an attitude, we requested pillows for the sofa bed which wasnt delivered had to ask again the next day, the plug in the bathroom sink was blocked so the water took ages to drain tried to tell this particular lady on reception (works the mornings) but again very sarcastic with her answer, tried to tell me I hadnt pressed the plug part so the water couldn’t run out, I didnt bother explaining I have the same tap so know how to work it and that its just the fact the sink is blocked! my mum thought she lost her bag in the lobby the prev evening had her passport etc in there so we were panicking, called the reception to ask if it had been handed in but again she wasnt helpful, just couldnt be bothered to help, I asked her if she could check the restaurant but she said it was closed and there was nothing she could do (this was at 8am there is staff there) i heard her shuffling a few papers and she said nope its not here! I put the phone down and came down straight away and surprise!! The restaurant was open!!, the kind lady in the restaurant checked lost and found and my mums bag was there! Receptionist just couldnt be bothered moving from her desk! Other than that it was a lovely stay and thanks again to Jamie and Scott and the lovely staff in the restaurant, but not the lady on reception

Ok the negative is that the room was quite small yet strangely the bathroom was quite large in comparison. The room did not have much storage and I had to put my spare clothes in the bedside tables. I am not sure how two people would cope. But I had a really lovely time. The room was really quiet and the bed really comfy. I slept better with the air con off because then I didn't get a draft in bed. The wifi was fast. The location was brilliant. I was less than a 5 minute walk to a lot of sights and places. There's loads of places to eat and drink nearby. I was in NYC on business and would stay again.

We stayed in the Elan Penthouse (2 bedroom) on the 20th floor. The rooms were not quite ready when we arrived so we were given two $10 breakfast vouchers which was nice....we sat by the fire and Christmas tree and had a cocktail in the bar while we waited. Went to dinner and a show and decided to open a bottle of wine when we returned. We did not have a corkscrew but a 3 second call to the concierge, at 11:00pm!, and within a few minutes someone was at the door with a corkscrew. Can't ask for better service. Checkout is noon which was perfect as we had friends meeting us in the morning so we had plenty of time to warm up and head out for a day in the Big Apple. Complimentary bag storage for the day was a plus. Rates for the penthouse were reasonable I believe for a TWO BEDROOM ($390 plus tax). Disclaimer: We did book several months prior to our arrival, so took advantage of advanced reservation promo.

We stayed at this hotel Saturday evening December 16. The hotel appears swanky in the lobby. The bed was comfortable. The sofa bed was tiny . The room was wholly inadequate to sleep 3 adults and a 5 year old child. When the sofa bed was opened there was no access to the front door. The front desk staff was uncooperative when I asked for 10 additional minutes for check out. The Marriiott hotels will routinely give you an exr a hour. We do Not recommend these rooms for more than 2 occupants. Next time for about the same price I will stick with Marriott. This place offers zero value for a hefty price. They do not even have a decent closet to hang up your clothing and coats.

I'm a little bewildered at all the positive reviews because my experience was both underwhelming and uncomfortable. Let's start with the good - the lobby looked very nice upon check-in, with a cozy lounge area and fireplace, and on-site restaurant that I would have taken advantage of if we were staying longer. Check in and check out was very quick. We had a view that showed us the top of the empire state building, which was pretty cool. Street noise was loud but we were high enough that it didn't bother us with the windows closed. Beds were reasonable comfortable. Staff was friendly, I can't complain about them personally, but the overall execution of service was just not good. For starters, we get to the room and my first reaction is "oh it's tiny, but at least it's clean." Wrong. I go into the bathroom to wash up and there are tiny flies zipping around the bathroom around the sink, shower and toilet. Then I notice the walls are full of dark scuff marks like someone walked on the walls in their snow boots. There are splash marks on the wall by the sink, and worst of all, a brown stain on the sheets. I called the front desk to alert them of the problem and I'm told he'll call me back once he "shuffles things around." I thought that meant we're getting another room, but instead the maid came to change the sheets and someone threw a chlorine tablet down the shower drain (did nothing, we dealt with the flies the rest of our stay). And no, the front desk never called us back. Then there were other small details that would not have bothered me or been worth mentioning had the room been in good clean condition. For example, there was only one umbrella and one bathrobe in a room occupied by two people. The Keurig had only coffee, no tea. Two of our towels were tattered at the edges. The room was so tiny that if one person was sitting at the desk, the other person had to climb over the bed. The bathroom was 1/3 of the entire room, which seemed like a completely unnecessary configuration as I'd rather be able to walk comfortably around the sleeping area than have a dance party in the bathroom. Overall, we enjoyed our staycation in NYC but would not stay at this hotel again, as the conditions were unacceptable for the price we paid and for the ratings it received.

Although our room was not ready @ check-in time, we were quite comfy in the lobby sitting area for the short time we waited. The 2 Queen room we were given was also much smaller than we expected, but the front desk staff & Chris were very accomodating in getting us into a more suitable room. Although all of the staff I encountered were very friendly & helpful Jamie was a outstanding.
user_name:
Carol G
Meriden, Connecticut, United States

review_body: I spent four nights at Le Soleil on a recent business trip. The location is great, and the hotel rooms are modern and quite spacious for Midtown. My only complaint was the check-in experience. After a longhaul international flight, I couldn't wait to get my room. Unfortunately the party checking in ahead of me fully occupied both desk staff for 15 minutes, while I waited exhaustedly. I appreciate the staff were dealing with fellow guests, but I was disappointed that nobody else could help me or that one of them couldn't step aside for a moment.Apart from that, I was very happy and would stay again.

We recently stayed at this hotel and enjoyed our stay. The location was very central and easy access to the subway, restaurants and attractions. The room was really nice, a good size and a great bathroom with walk-in shower. The only drawback was no closet and not enough room to hang clothes. Also, there were no drawers to store clothes and other items. We would definitely stay again.

It's a mystery how this hotel rates 4 stars. The "Executive King Room" is truly claustrophobic. There is a bed, and a desk with one chair. If a guest actually sits in the chair another guest cannot pass by. The "coat rack" has enough room for the 2 robes supplied by the hotel, plus one overcoat. That's it. The door to the bathroom is a sliding door intended to save space. The problem is that the door gets sticky as it closes and there is nothing to grip. The bathroom itself has just about no room for setting anything down. Finally, there is no service elevator, so nearly every time we used the elevator a service person was trying to get on with a cart or something else. This is a waste of time for the service person and guests. You can get good deals for this hotel on the right night - now I know why.

Having enjoyed Hotel LeSoleil in Vancouver I was looking forward to my stay in New York. I was disappointed. Perhaps the most uncomfortable bed I have experienced in a hotel ever. I’m honestly not that fussy but this was awful. My daughter had the pullout couch in the queen suite and that mattress was even worse. No pillows provided for the pullout. Requested tea for the Kuerig and seemed like too much of an effort for staff. Maybe hotels in New York are supposed to be like this?

We checked into our original hotel to find it was dirty and disappointing. Walked 3 blocks to this hotel and found paradise. Checked in the next day to a much larger, cleaner and lighter room. Staff couldn’t have been more accommodating Maid service every day. Great bar during the evenings and really attentive staffLovely cafe on site tooHonestly couldn’t recommend this place enough and the best bit.....we got a better deal than the place we originally bookedIf we come back to New York this is where we’d stay

The location is great, the rooms are in nice size ( the closet is bit small for 1 week) and the staff is very nice. Compared to other rooms in New York it can be said that it is very spacious and equipped

I've stayed at over 40 hotels in Manhattan, and unlike many other cities, I haven't found an absolute favorite.
