The Hotel Soleil certainly provided excellent value at its price point, not quite luxury, but very comfortable and well appointed. While West 36th is not a tony address, it is very convenient for many business and tourist venues. Staying on a high floor, it is rather quiet, which is a big plus in Manhattan.The public areas, and the rooms are tasteful if generic. Quality beds, bedding and toiletries are a plus, although soaps designed in Italy and made in China and a room devoid of art work except for one vapid wall hanging in the bathroom are not endearing. :Free wi-fi" is included, but there is a dubious $20 Service Charge which purports to cover that, storing luggage before and after your stay and various other sundries. Why is offering free Dasani water such a big perk when NYC has (or did) some of the best tap water in the country?The staff are cheerful and casual. Breakfast in their dining room was workmanlike if not exemplary. Fast and modern elevators are a distinct plus. From the high floors, you might have a nice view of the Empiure State Building.There are perhaps half a dozen mid range hotels on this somewhat scruffy but safe block. This is probably the best of the lot. Unpretentious, clean and modern, it is a good re-purposing of an old office building. I would stay here again, but there is a bland quotient that won't make me a long term loyal customer.

I’d never heard of this hotel before I saw it on TripAdvisor. And I’m glad I did. We’re midway through a stay here and can honestly report how delighted we are with it. The hotel is only 2 years old and that shows with everything sparkling new and shiny. The service is a true indication of why we like this place. Jamie must be the friendliest most helpful bellman we’ve ever had in 50 years and perhaps 30 hotels in NYC. Reception staff Aida and Iina also were very good. Rooms vary in size so if you need a bigger one ask for it. The location is great for Macy’s and Empire State Building. But not too far for an easy 10 minute walk to Broadway and the Theatre district Highly recommended

My husband picked this hotel to take me to for my 50th and i am so glad he did...This place was awesome...Room was compact and view was amazing....Loved the coffee machine...All the staff were helpful and friendly....May need to return one day.

My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights during US Thanksgiving. We had a nice room with one double bed on the 17th floor overlooking the Empire State Building. Had a nice bathroom with shower and enough counter space to satisfy both my wife and I. The wifi connection throughout the stay was great and large flat screen tv was perfect and channel selections easy to change. Room had a safe and fridge and the bed was very comfortable. The location of the hotel was very central to most everything you want to see and do in NYC between 5th & 6th Avenues. We hit the most awesome weather during our visit so we walked pretty much everywhere. Times Square, Theatre district, Bryant Park, MSG/Penn Station, Macy's, NY Port Authority were all within easy walking distance for us. All the staff were very friendly and helpful from the front door staff, front desk, housekeeping, maintenance, etc. Housekeeping did an awesome job cleaning the room and wine glasses every day. We didn't eat in their attached restaurant but the menu looked appealing. The fireplace, sofa's and chairs in the common lounge area adjacent to the front desk offered a great location on Thanksgiving Day to come warm up after watching the parade for a couple hours. It was the only cold day during our stay. There's plenty of pubs & restaurants to choose from within a block radius of the hotel. The access to and from LaGuardia Airport was good given the access through the Queens Midtown tunnel. We used a taxi coming in and Uber going out and both cost $45, 35 to 45 mins depending on traffic and time of day. Their gym was small but clean and efficient with a recumbent bike, treadmills, stair climber/trainer. My only wish is that an upright bike should also be one of their cardio machines. Overall, we had an awesome time in NYC and staying here added to that experience.

The room was immaculate, and very nicely laid out. The location is close to everything in midtown. The staff were wonderful... specifically, cheerful, efficient, and most helpful. We were on the back side of the hotel, but our room was amazingly quiet given the location. We literally didn't hear a peep. And, did I mention the bed? One of the most comfortable ones I have ever slept in in a hotel. We stayed in a semi-suite, which had a couch and a second TV (we never turned either TV on) cleverly tucked on the other side of the bathroom, which was also immaculate and well-designed.The desk is big enough, and there are enough outlets that you could stay here on business. There was also an iHome for both a charging dock as well as an alarm clock.And, don't overlook the "Couples Kit" in the mini bar!
user_name:
Sheppard W
east setauket, United States

review_body: I have just come back from a weeks stay. Couldn’t fault the hotel, the staff are friendly and couldn’t be happier to help. The room was kept lovely and clean.I would 100% stay again, the location was fantastic. We paid for a view room and what a view it was.

My husband and I recently stayed at Executive Hotel LeSoleil and really enjoyed our experience. We arrived early and the room was ready for us! The room is very well appointed with a great layout. The furnishings are tasteful and modern as well as comfortable and clean.We received a nice amenity on behalf of the hotel which was a very nice touch. I especially would like to thank Mohandas in the Front Office for his assistance in reserving my room. Under Paul Ridguard's (General Manager) leadership this hotel will certainly continue to succeed.

First time used Le Soleil and wasn’t disappointed. Can’t say enough about the location, being in the heart of Manhattan. Major attractions, transport etc. literally a stone throw away. Room was fine but wold improve if additional storage would be made available.Good solid service all round.Will be returning.

This hotel is perfectly located for everything in Manhattan. Madison Square Gardens, Times Square, Macy’s, Empire State Building are all a short walk away and Herald Square subway station is nearby. Lots of bars and restaurants in the same block. Hotel staff are helpful and friendly and rooms are spacious and well appointed. You can open the window too which I like. Would stay again. Highly recommended.

I have stayed here several times...started because I could walk from Penn Station, but then I was charmed by the courteous people at the front desk and the clean, modern and well-appointed and quiet rooms.BUT--recently, the hotel has added a $20 resort fee to its rates--and this simply feels like a price increase. Not sure what I am getting for the $20!!

This was a great location as it looks straight onto the Empire State Building, you really need to request a room with a view and preferably a suite as the rooms are quite small however a great sized bathroom with luxury toiletries, although they provide soap over shower gel. All staff were very helpful especially Scott the concierge.Great bar and restaurant as part of the hotel and a good American welcoming feel to it all.I would highly recommend this hotel.

Here for 2 nights in an executive queen suite. Nice lobby, easy check-in, room was clean and nice size for NYC standards. Great location to walk most places. WiFi worked well. Wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again for business or pleasure.
user_location: Arenal Volcano National Park, Costa Rica
user_name:
kylemU2862MF
Arenal Volcano National Park, Costa Rica

review_body: November 2017 - Nice and service minded personnel, large and comfortable rooms, cleaning and maintenance as you'd hope, in a great location.This was our first time in NYC, and we would gladly return to stay at this hotel again!

As a family of 3 we stayed for a week in this hotel. The staff from Reception at check in through to the concierge and housekeeping staff were always pleasant and helpful. The rooms were clean and refreshed daily with top up of complimentary water and coffee for the machine in the room. The hotel was 1 block from the metro and there were plenty of cafes bars and restaurants on the same street or nearby. Only change would be for space in the room for another wardrobe or similar to hang clothes as the one provided was too small for 3 occupants. Overall though an excellent stay with helpful staff

We stayed 6 night in this hotel early in October, 2017This was our first trip to New York which booked with the hotel direct corresponding with Ms Murat, director of Front Office. She was very informative regarding the hotel and most helpful.Right from the concierge opening the front door upon arrival to the checkout helped to make our New York trip a most enjoyable experience.The hotel is in a very central and location yet just far enough out as to be not overcrowded.Times Square a mere 10 minute walk away, the Empire State Building just two blocks down was a fantastic view from our bedroom especially all lit up at night.Not the largest hotel in New York but just perfect to provide a very comfortable stay with a great ambianceThe bedroom was not large but I am informed this is normal by New York standards, However what the room lacked in size was more than made up by the cleanliness and quality of the fittings. The shower room was large and provided a very good shower with a rain effect head.Bathrobes, coffee making facilities etc. were provided, the hotel even provided an umbrella in the room for sole use.The restaurant was busy but we were directed promptly to a table by friendly staff on the both occasions we ate there.All in all we had a great trip and would thoroughly recommend this hotel and will stay there on our next New York visit.

the place was more than wonderful, specially that it was my first time to go to new york.it has an amazing location ... an easy walk to Times Square and Empire state building.the staff was more than helpful and very friendly.

I needed a last minute hotel a few nights ago. A search revealed the Executive Hotel LeSoleil. I had stayed at another -nearby- hotel the night before, but I didn't think I'd need to stay in New York for another night. At about 10 PM I booked the Executive. The price was outstanding for the location, amenities, etc. I had a smallish room, but it was perfect for a single guest. And, I'm assuming I didn't wind up paying for a bigger room I didn't need. The room could not have been cleaner, and more up to date. The staff was very friendly.I wound up spending 2 nights. And, very glad to have discovered the Executive, where I expect I will stay many times in the future.

Booked the hotel for a 5 day stay in an executive queen suite. Size of the room perfect, bigger than average NY room sizes. The only thing missing is a cupboard where to put Your clothes in but there was enough room to put it anyhow. Complimentary coffee everyday, wonderful bar/restaurant with a great choice of local beers and whiskys (American Kölsch beer!). I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a relatively (well, it's NY) quiet location right in Midtown. Don't miss the Keens Steakhouse just around the corner.

The Executive Le Soleil hotel has the best ,an excllent service,starting from the front desk all the way to the cleaning lady,very helpful,very friendly.I cannot thank u enough and i am sorry i dont know all the names but ill mention few,first of all i want to thank Magdi for all the help he gave me,in finding places i couldnt have found without his help.I want to thank Negesti,Mathew,Jeremiah .I am sorry for not mentioning every name,thx to u all.As for the location,it was excellent,close to everything, such as, The Empire State Bldg, Rockefeller Ctr, Grand Central Station, Times Square, etc, There are plenty of restaurants available for any meal of the day. Considering the location, the street isn't as busy as you'd think. Since the street isn't as busy, there is usually space for a cab to pick you up and drop u off. The area is considerably safe.As for our suite,it was spacious more than enough for our luggage and everything else we had,2 televisions,an iron,a fridge and it was a good size,the bed was very comfortable so the room had everything we needed and it was very clean.I am already planning my next trip to NYC with one condition that the stay will be at the Executive Hotel Le Soleil and in the same room,1504,thank u for making my stay in NYC a wonderful experience i will never forget.

I loved this hotel! The staff is friendly and accommodating. The location is great and an easy walk to Times Square and Empire State Building. The room was modern, clean, and very spacious for a NYC hotel room. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

The Executive Le Soleil Hotel is a newer hotel in NYC (within the last 2 years) in an area close to a variety of attractions. (Empire State Building, Herald Square, Times Square, Broadway, etc.) The hotel itself is very attractive and the rooms are a little different from the typical hotel room, in a good way. The decor throughout is appealing and there is a warm, inviting restaurant/bar in the hotel. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Be aware that the hotel does charge a facilities fee of $20+ per night. This property offers a great value for the money and I would recommend this hotel to NYC travelers. My only complaint is that the rug in the room could have used a cleaning.

This boutique style hotel is centrally located near Times Square. My nephew and I stayed 4 nights. Everything is just a few blocks away: the subway, Times Square, the Empire State Building and great restaurants. It is located on a relatively quiet street for NY standards. We were on the 10th floor facing the street but was not bothered by the 1-way traffic or pedestrians. The rooms are clean, tastefully decorated, quiet and the bed was comfortable. I was not bothered by not having a full closet or any real place to unpack as I tend to never unpack when I travel. The bathroom was big by NY standards. Found the 2 free bottles of Dasani water an added touch. My only slight complaint is the carpet could use a good cleaning. Though unsightly, it was not filthy but there were obvious spots. I found it to be a good value and would stay again while recommending to others.

I booked this hotel through a 3rd party booking site 4 days ago and had a confirmed booking at more than $500 per night. Upon landing at LGA I had a message saying my reservation had been cancelled because the hotel overbooked rooms. I had to spend an hour on the phone with the 3rd party booking site while still at the airport trying to find another hotel in New York.There are plenty of decent hotels in NYC. This apparently isn't one of them.

Perfect location 2 minutes from the subway, 5 minutes walk from Times Square, 5 minutes walk from the Empire State BuildingLarge rooms , very clean equipped with a coffee maker and a minibarLarge bathroomIn the hotel there is a restaurant where a very good breakfast is servedYadira from Reservation was very patient and took care of our perfect vacationAndre at the reception gave a lot of tips where to go and what to dothe  door mans always with a smile and very helpful

A hotel in a good location. Only a 5 minute walk to Times Square. Subway close by. Room was small but clean. The room was lovely and quiet. We didn't hear the street noise at all. Two TVs. The wooden sliding bathroom door was ridiculously heavy and difficult to open/close. We had a room with a queen bed and sofa bed. The sofa bed was way too soft, but fine for our 5 year old. A very small amount of hanging space (no closet, just an open one that fit maybe 6 hangers on). Maybe more suited to business travel. Not cheap. Cost us $3,000 (AUD) for 6 nights.

Great location 2 blocks from the Empire State and a short walk to Penn Station. Nice hotel, modern clean accommodation. I would stay here again. The room: we were a party of 3 staying in a suite. The space was fine for 3 adults I don't think it would suit 4. We had plenty of space for our bags. Hanging space is limited. Set up is good bed at on end, bathroom in the middle and sofa bed at the other end provides separation and some pricacy. Also had a small fridge. A 5 star rating would have been provided if some things were finessed e.g. - my booking was for 3 adults but room was kitted out for 2. So we had to request additional pillows, glasses, mugs, tea pods, bottled water etc as only 2 of everything was provided. - Sofabed needs a better matress or the hotel should provide a mattress topper when the room is booked for 3 or more people. - No lighting at the sofabed end of the room besides a table lamp which had to be unplugged and moved by us to another part of the room in order to open out the sofabed. - sliding door to bathroom was exceptionally hard to use, it didnt glide smoothly on the tracks it was very stiff to pull across and there were no handles which made the task even harder. This meant the door couldn't be closed properly, not great with 3 of us in the room. We reported this and were informed it couldn't be fixed without cutting chunks of plasterboard out of the wall. No attempt to squirt WD40 to see if that would help. So if we wanted to try and get the door nearly closed this required several attepts each time. Once the door was nearly closed the person inside was in effect trapped unless assistance from someone on the other side of the door was provided. This also resulted in multiple broken nails (ladies :-/). Not great! As the door could only be 'nearly closed' we resorted to going to the hotels public restroom on level C.Tip: - avoid room 403 if you want to be able to close your bathroom door / not be trapped in the bathroom. - Check out Eaterly near thr Flatiron fabulous italian food.

Very central to many attractions in central manhattan. Nice clean hotel with friendly staff. Room was a little small but in New York I think that's the norm.The only issue I found was that there's nowhere to put your suitcase. Had to keep putting it on the bed every time I needed something.Would stay again.

Very attractive, pleasant, quiet boutique hotel. I would give it a 4+. Room was small but very nice with high ceilings and floor to ceiling window. We had a straight on view of Empire State Bldg (not at eye level of course as it is nearby) and One Trade Center (more distant). Large bathroom and nice sized entry way that was out of view from the bedroom. Nice shower, no tub. Large television with great reception. Hotel has a nice coffee bar and restaurant. Everyone very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Great location for convenient access to main attractions. Was a little expensive for smallish room but with the window and quiet boutique feeling we felt it was worth it. We were pleased in every way and would definitely return to this hotel.

This hotel was perfect for us. We had a view of the Empire State Bldg; The room was clean and the bathroom was like new with an excellent shower. The staff made us welcome with a complimentary bottle of wine and a rose w/an anniversary card. What a nice touch ! The location is perfect for midtown sights as well as a short subway ride to lower Manhattan. The restaurant had excellent service and great food. We will be back as this hotel has everything you need for a NYC getaway ! From start to finish - a perfect weekend !

This hotel is a nice boutique Eurostyle hotel with small rooms. It is not a 4 star hotel and the name "Executive" is misleading. We arrived early but no early rooms available. Front desk woman said that they were short-staffed.Waited 10 minutes for baggage room attendant, finally asked front desk woman to call him. The stay itself was fine; clean room and bath, tv and a/c working. If you are looking for something like this, it's ok and the location is very good.

Knowing all about small hotel rooms I was really surprised by this one (1) no closet only some limited hanging space, (2) not a drawer by the bed or elsewhere, (3) Luggage had to be taken to storage (4) there is a desk + chair, but chair can only be used if positioned on bed. BUT - lovely view if Empire State building and prime location. Housekeeping was not great either.

L'hotel è posizionato in un luogo assolutamente comodo per visitare new york. Vicinissimo alla public library e all'Empire state building è un quartier generale strategico per girare tutta Manhattan. Il personale è cortese. Il prezzo è assolutamente allineato a un hotel della medesima categoria. Non fatevi deludere dalle stanze non molto grandi: è una caratteristica tipica di quasi tutti gli hotel newyorkesi.Decisamente consigliato.English version belowThe hotel is located in an absolutely convenient location to visit New York. Close to the Public Library and Empire State Building, it's a strategic headquarters to turn around Manhattan. The staff is courteous. The price is absolutely aligned with a hotel of the same category. Do not be disappointed with the rooms not very large: it is a typical feature of almost all New York hotels.Definitely recommended.

I stayed several days during Labor Day weekend. Good location between 5th and 6th Ave. My room was facing the Empire State Building, so the view was great. The Hotel was beautiful, clean, smelled like new. My room was tiny, but the bathroom was spacious. It didn't matter the miniscule size of the room, because we were not planning to spend to much time in it. Yesenia, the front desk clerk was fabulous, knowledgeable, and very friendly.

This is truly a great hotel. The staff is very friendly, helpful and experienced. I had a beautiful room with 'city view'. That meant that I could view the Empire State Building and One World Trade Center at the same time. A luxury feeling for me means that everything, also the tiny details has been considered and taken care of and with Le Soleil that was the case.They make you feel very welcome which is important for a guest and they will do everything to make your stay a pleasant one.

Stayed here for 4 nights traveling for business. Very small hotel but the rooms are tiny! They don't have a closet which was a first for me! I had a heck of a time finding the luggage rack. I gave up the first night and put my bag on the floor. Then my friend told me it's cleverly placed under the desk. It's difficult to work in these rooms because of the tight quarters. I will give the room 3 big stars for things that I appreciate when I travel; They supplied 2 complimentary water bottles each day. This is a huge plus to me! Especially in NY where I really do not want tap water. They provided a Keurig coffee maker and complimentary coffee each day. Plus an amazing shower! It was new, powerful and fabulous! The staff was great and the location was perfect for work for me.

The room was comfortable but small. The bathroom large and very nice. The elevator is SLOW. We waited quite often with a full elevator of people to "board". Every person in the elevator must use their room card, for every floor, very tedious. The fire alarm went off twice for a VERY long time at about 10pm and an announcement was made that it was a drill. We finally got concerned about the inept handling of the drill and when we tried the fire door to the stairs it was locked. LOCKED! That was a little freaky. Lastly, we were supposed to have breakfast included per the booking and it wasn't. They couldn't find the vouchers but sent us to the restaurant anyway. The restaurant staff asked questions and looked suspicious. So unprofessional. They finally served us a light breakfast but we didn't pursue breakfast for the rest of our stay. Overall, we had a marginally unsatisfactory experience. Accommodations were acceptable.

Location was very convenient as we took the train into Penn Station and was within walking distance. Many good restaurants in the area and walking distance to Times Square for shopping etc...But was very quiet from street noise.Would definitely stay again. The staff was very accommodating at check in and Margret was superb! There was a little language barrier with some of the staff at check out but finally was rectified.

I stayed with my other half at the hotel for her 30th birthday trip to NYC. Due to confusion with what we thought we'd booked we felt our room didn't have the kind of view we'd expected. The staff were very helpful, switching our rooms including luggage while we went out to explore. The room they gave us was perfect and had the view of the Empire State Building we'd hoped for (See pictures attached). Thank you Chris!Also due to them knowing the reason for our visit they sent us complimentary champagne and chocolates, much to our surprise. The location was fantastic, the staff were great and the hotel quiet, which is what you need when you've walked all day.I would recommend the hotel and our room (1805) on the 18th floor. Thanks for a great stay!!!Andrew (Wales)

We enjoyed our stay at Executive Le Soleil. The room was relatively small but compact enough (and with sufficient horizontal surfaces and outlets) to handle our electronics, regular stuff and us. The beds were very comfortable, and the room was made sufficiently dark by good curtains. We were also pleased that the room had a safe. The bathroom was very large, with a great shower and plenty of water pressure. Maid service was efficient and very competent. We would have liked more control over the air conditioning, but that was a small thing. During our stay, there was no food service available, but there are many restaurants nearby, so we survived that. There is a parking lot just a few steps away, and Le Soleil offers valet service for the not outrageous price of $65 per day. Other reviewers have commented on the location, and we agree that it’s great. The next time we choose a hotel in the Times Square area, we will choose this hotel.

I've stay in hotel LeSoleil about a year and a half ago and again in August 2017, and it was amazing.The location is great, 2 min. walking from a metro station, Herald square, Macys , 5 min. walking from Empire state building and Time square. I was travel solo so I can also say that the area is safe.The hotel facilities is great. Rooms are relatively big comparing to NY hotels, the staff was amazing – they upgrade my room and even sent me a very nice birthday gift to my room.I had pleasure knowing Chris and Yesenia from reception. They were so kind always smile and kind and helping whenever I neededI couldn't ask for better vacation

We were "stranded" in NYC half way between home in Canada and our cruise in Texas but Hurricane Harvey prevented us from cruising so we stayed in NYC. Last minute we booked this hotel and we were pleasantly surprised. We got a good deal through hotels.com and loved the location - walking distance to Broadway, Times Square, 5th Ave shopping, food, entertainment, Central Park, Empire State Building, etc. Clean hotel but the only weird thing was all kinds of little bugs/fly's that come out of the drain while showering. They fly out and land on the ceiling where they stay until the shower is finished then I assume they retreat to the drain because we didn't see them again. I counted 16 on the ceiling one day. Pretty gross but they didn't come near us and I was glad they disappeared. I called the front desk but no answer and couldn't be bothered to call back since we were out and about enjoying NYC. Wifi is good, didn't eat the food so can't comment on that.

What attracted me upon booking this place is location and great reviews on Trip advisor. I would say it is an Ok of hotel, fairly clean, but seems to be unfinished. When we checked in and got into our room we were surprised that the size of a bathroom is almost the same with the size of a room. Which is fine, especially for NYC. They tried to create a modern look for a bathroom, but forgot to finish small details, such as: molding: there is a spot right next to the entrance of the show where a piece of metal sticking out. If you didn't see it, you can cut your foot/leg pretty badly. Then, they used a glass panel (instead of show curtain), which looks very modern. But, once again, it wasn't secured properly. And if you had kids with you, who like to touch things and shake it wouldn't be safe. We didn't spend too much time in the room, but those things stood out.
user_name:
Irina P
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Would have given it 5 stars but don't want to mislead and have people thinking all glamour and glitz. Not to take away from the hotel because it is stunning. The room is laid out great to take advantage of New York size rooms. The staff are excellent, from front desk, chamber maids and doormen. One of the friendliest hotels i have stayed at.The hotel is in a great central location to maximize touring New York. Subway a couple of blocks away to go North to Central Park( you can walk only 25 min.) or South to Statue of Liberty. And those are probably the 2 furthest places that are a must Everything else is just blocks away.

Stayed for 5 nights in Aug 17. Room was decently appointed and would have been of good size for two if was not for the fact that there was 3 of us and the sofa bed took up quite a bit of space. However this was a very minor inconvenience in an otherwise very pleasant stay at a hotel which is ideally located for Times Square, Empire State, Broadway etc

We arrived to NYC after 2 weeks on the roads, so wanted a nice hotel in the center of the city.We were a family with two teenagers so had a big room which was very comfortable for us.The location of the hotel is superb, a walking distance to Times Square with subway stations not far from it.The staff was very welcoming and helpful, from the person who helped us as we arrived with our car to the front of the hotel, to the concierge and front office.We will definitely come back.

Got a room with a view which had a great view of the empire state building, the room was small but really comfortable and clean. Staff were very friendly and polite at all times and overall it was a really lovely stay.

Just spent a week here great location very clean comfortable hotel which has everything a city hotel should inc a gym, the food was great and there are lots of other places on the same block to eat and drink should you want a change. The staff were very helpful and friendly too

My wife and I stayed here for a couple nights while visiting NYC. Based on all the positive TripAdvisor reviews we decided to give it a try. We were very glad we did. This place is as good as all the "Excellent" reviews say. Great location, friendly and helpful staff, clean, quiet and comfortable. I am a very picky guest and quickly notice thin walls, uncomfortable beds, unusual odors, etc. This place has none of them. We will stay here again without hesitation.

My girlfriend and I booked a hotel nearby and after waiting in the lobby of said hotel for hours trying to fix whatever errors were made on their behalf, we gave up and looked for else where to spend the night. We called Hotel LeSoleil and Andre accommodated us and was so helpful. We were frustrated and tired and Andre was an absolute delight. The hotel was clean and the decor was lovely, our room was modern and comfy, but the real reason we'll be staying again is because the staff was so warm and professional.

This hotel was absolutely wonderful! From the moment my family and I walked in, we were welcomed. Staff at front desk were very nice and room was ready when we got there. The location is amazing! This hotel is centralized perfectly. It's just a few blocks to Times Square,Bryant Park, Madison Square Garden, lots of shopping and restaurants all around, and just a 30 minute walk to Central Park. It also has a few subway stations nearby. The room was a little small for family of 4, but then again most hotel rooms in NY are. The only negative about this was the AC. It seems like it's an energy saving type of AC where it raises the temperature if it doesn't sense people in the room. So, at night I would sometimes wake up hot and have to get up and wave my hand in front of it or touch a button to make it cooler. Another downfall was that the sofa bed was in the way of the door (and the AC panel)... So if I would want to get up in the morning to exercise, I would have had to wake up my sister and her son (who were sleeping on the sofa bed) in order to close it and be able to get out of the room. Other than those 2 things, this hotel was great, and very clean. I would definitely stay here again!!!

I just made a reservation to stay in this hotel with Ms. Yadira Aviles. She was very helpful and very pleasant. This comportment is key to a customer in evaluating the type of people representing a hotel and Ms. Aviles' treatment towards me was exemplary. In today's world it is much appreciated and I look forward to my stay.

I had the pleasure of staying at this little "Boutique" hotel in the last part of July 2017. It came highly recommended and as my trip was a combination of business and pleasure I was assured it was perfect as it was in a central Manhattan location - great for sight-seeing and entertaining local New York clients.Being from Vancouver myself, I was struck by a great sense of familiarity since this hotel appears very much like the Vancouver Hotel LeSoliel ( that I have never stayed at but walk past all the time). It was obviously clean, the staff were extremely first rate and helpful with a Concierge service that surpasses larger hotels and larger brand (names). On the spot with their research to my questions and above and beyond to accommodate my very inquisitive 10 year old travelling companion ( my Son).The rooms themselves - well our room, while challenging in terms of a view ( expected in the heart of Manhattan ) - was ready for us and our needs. I can be a pretty picky guy when it comes to stuff like room cleanliness and can tell you that the cleaning and room maintenance staff here are trained very well. Our room offered a small living room type area which was perfect to set my boy at and watch TV, while I prepared my client list and agenda on the desk.The WIFi at the facility is exactly what you would expect a for a Hotel that caters to business people. It was working, reliable and fast. - This is important these days.. obviously. The food - now I honestly cant say while writing this what we had to eat there. I've been to so many hotels in the past two months and have seen so much that I just cant recall a single thing.. BUT I do recall this. It was fair, and it was good. I remember accepting that it would be a little more expensive then an outside restaurant - but again that is expected. If the food was bad, THAT I would have remembered ! . If you are running on a budget , the good thing is that this place has DOZENS of great dining spots and a market all within walking distance. Now, walking distance .. How's the Empire State for you ? Or Time Square? Subways ? Central Park ? Freedom Tower? Little Italy, Soho ? There were a few times I was preparing to call Uber and my some would say "Google says its a 20 min walk" or "Empire State Building is just two blocks away". Yeah, in terms of location and accessibility - LOVE IT !!!

Hope its not late for this review. I came back to NY for the 4th of July weekend and just had to book his hotel again. I travel to NY often for my marketing job and I feel like this may be my second home away from home.The hotel and rooms are just clean and upgraded, and the staff is just so professional and attentive. I got a nice complimetary room upgrade to a suite and as always, had a such a pleasure staying at this hotel.Location is everything to me and this was perfect - from a quick bite to eat late at night or some shopping trips close by (5th avenue is just a few blocks away).Thank you again Executive Hotel Le Soleil for your wonderful and luxurious hospitality.I will come back again!

Great location and the staff was very good from the doormen, front desk and cleaning staff, and the concierge was excellent and very helpful.Facilities and room were adequate at best. Poor shower, flimsy square bed pillows, and a bathroom door that doesn't lock (not ideal when travelling with children).

A nice and quiet hotel. Close to everything! Only about 150 meters from 5th avenue. A short walk to Empire state building, Mace and Times Square. We stayed 4 Nights With a Family of 4. The kids thought the wifi was rather slow!

This was our first time visiting NYC and this hotel location was excellent. The hotel is very nice. Like other reviews the closet space was almost non-existent and the bed wasn't as comfortable as I would have liked. My son bunked on the pull out sofa bed while my husband and I shared what seemed like a full size bed. The bathroom had great space and the shower was nice. We didn't visit the bar or restaurant due to all of the other local temptations. From what we are told this hotel has much more room space than others. We stayed in room 705 right by the elevator and never heard any loud noise from other guests coming or going. We stayed here from 6/10 to 6/16 and never had a bad experience here....NEVER! The hotel is located in a great spot close to shopping, a block away from the Empire State Building, a few blocks from Times Square, and the subway station is a block away. Lots of food spots nearby and the hotel staff was awesome. My son misplaced his class ring and the staff actually located the ring and stored it in the safe until our return. If you stay here visit the Fresh Leaf the breakfast is great!

I would stay here again. We had 4 people in a 2 queen bed room. Staff was friendly and accommodating. We were in town for shows at MSG and the walk was a breeze, less than a mile walking. There is a Shake Shack 3 blocks down from the hotel.

Hotel had the right vibe as I walked in. Good bar / restaurant adjacent to the lobby. Friendly front desk staff. Room was quiet, was able to get good sleep. Stayed twice, the first room had a bit of an odd "living area." Didn't matter, was there to work. Both times, had issues with cleanliness of the room. They need to vacuum. Mentioned this to front desk staff upon checking out the first time (Froot Loops on the floor from prior guests!) who acknowledged my feedback, but didn't do anything else. Room from my second stay had other evidence of needing to be vacuumed. Plus sine glass brought up from bar was left during cleaning, hand towel left in bedroom was still there. Fix the cleaning issues, would be four stars.

We (family of 5) stayed for 3 nights beginning of july.- The hotel is located perfectly, close to 5th avenue and alot alot of restaurants and shopping close.- Excellent service from the hotel staff. We hade some faulty booking made by booking.com but the hotel staff solved it when we arrived. -The hotel feels small/personal and coozy. Beautiful rooms with windows from the floor to the roof.- A fresh quite large gym in the basement- The block where the hotel is placed is quite calm and quiet.- We will stay at this hotel on our next NY-trip!

We were going to NYC for a sightseeing trip for my wife's birthday and chose this hotel. The location was convenient for midtown including Times Square. The staff were always very friendly and polite, the hotel decor was superb in the common areas and we had absolutely no complaints with our room. It overlooked the Empire State Building from the 15th floor so our view was brilliant. The room was modern and offered what we needed, along with a comfortable bed and a good bathroom. There was no lack of cupboard space either. Would recommend easily.

We stayed as an anniversary trip, and the staff left a card, chocolates, and a bottle of champagne in our room! Beautiful and clean with super convenient location and helpful staff. We will be back!!!

Hotel LeSoleil is a vibey/classy hotel that has some special qualities which make it a stand-out for us and will now be a 'go-to' hotel when business/pleasure requires us in Midtown! The best quality is the outstanding staff - Lily, Chris, Aida, Francis, Mathew, Noelle and Magdi (if I missed anyone, apologies). All who we came in contact were respectful, alert and responsive to our needs, approachable, positive and upbeat! The rare ability to be consistently professional with that personal touch was evidenced not only at reception but in places like the elevator! The hotel has a beckoning entrance/lobby that calls one to sit and relax, with the Trademark Restaurant (manager, Matt is awesome) adjoining open door, so waiting for our room to become available was actually enjoyable! Prior to entering the lobby, is the wonderful "park & go" which drew my husband to this hotel in the first place. Finally, the room appointed to us was perfect (and spacious for NY standards :).Thank you, Hotel LeSoleil, Lou and Donna will be back (when we don't want to drive back to our nearby home in NJ)!

Probably my new favorite hotel in midtown on a quiet block. 1.5 blocks from Subway, 2.5 blocks from all the shopping on 34th st.Relatively big, clean and modern rooms. Ours had a separate seating area with a sleeping sofa. Friendly and efficient staff.

If I could give this review 6 stars I would! It's as simple as that. The hotel was a beautiful escape from the madness of Manhattan! The rooms were comfortable & the staff were phenomenal! In particular 'Aida' was brilliant! It was my wife's birthday whist we were staying & they especially gave my wife a bottle of prosecco with some Belgian chocolates!We had 1 or 2 minor complaints & the staff made them disappear like a magic trick!I almost forgot to mention the view! We asked for a view of the Empire State Building & WOW!If we're ever lucky enough to return to New York we'll definitely stay here again!Thanks guys for an amazing stay!

Probably the best value for your money on Manhattan. Try to get a room on a higher floor with a view, the morning coffee looking out of the window is unforgettable.Pros: great location, close to the subway, to Empire State Building, to Korean quarter and walking distance to broadway and Times Square. The staff is great. Plenty of eating and drinking options in the street.Cons: The rooms are very small, do not even have a closet. But you probably do not need one when you are in NYC.I think this will be the by-far best hotel you can get for the relatively low price.100% my next hotel when I am back in NYC.

The entire experience at Hotel LeSoleil was wonderful. The staff were efficient, helpful and cheerful. We came down from Toronto to see Billy Joel at Madison Square Garden and we spent 20 minutes talking with the guy behind the desk about Billy Joel when we came back, loved it! The hotel itself was brand new, clean, QUIET (we stayed on the 12th floor off of 36th St.). We had a basic queen room and that's all you need, they use space quite well. Bed was really comfy. Bathroom was clean and modern, no plumbing issues. Great size TV. The air conditioning was quiet and easy to use. Effective blackout curtains made for great sleeps. We will DEFINITELY come back here and always recommend this hotel first to our friends and family who are travelling to New york.

To preface this review - you will have to understand what happened to us prior to check in. This was not our original hotel for our trip to NYC. We were booked through a Fundraising Travel Company and our 1st hotel was horrific. We were able to be re-booked and walked over a mile in busy NYC foot traffic to make it to the new hotel. So when we arrived we were frustrated and exhausted, but this quickly changed as soon as we met the staff. The staff at this hotel were beyond friendly and extremely helpful. They advised us on which trains to take to our destinations around the city and happily answered any questions we had. The rooms were beautiful. This is boutique hotel so the rooms are a little smaller than what might be expected but had all the amenities and a fabulous bathroom. The location of the hotel was perfect. Located in the fashion district, it was within a few blocks of Penn Station for easy train access and just around the corner from the Empire State Building. We went to multiple Broadway shows while we were in town and it was an easy walk there as well. We were close enough to Times Square to enjoy the atmosphere but far enough away to have some peace. There is a restaurant on site that was delicious. The menu is also available for in room dining if that is what you prefer. I simply can't say enough about this hotel experience. It was fantastic!

My family and I have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions. We keep going back for many reasons. It is in an excellent midtown location on a relatively quiet street and within walking distance to many attractions, subway stops, shopping and restaurants. The rooms in this lovely boutique hotel are nicely appointed, comfortable and clean. We have been most impressed by the customer service, particularly from Yadira in reservations. Yadira has been exceptionally helpful, professional, kind and considerate. She was especially helpful in assisting us with a last minute booking for our daughter who was returning jet lagged from a trip to Asia. Yadira went the extra mile to make our daughter feel welcomed. Le Soleil is our go-to hotel for all our trips to NYC. We love the staff and the cozy but chic atmosphere.

Upon arrival we were able to check in easily, ahead of check in time! Lilly, our front desk sweetheart, was very funny and inviting. She was extremely kind and thorough and pointed us in all the right directions!

This hotel was perfect for me. The rooms were small, but well equipped and nice. The beds were extremely comfortable, the shower was huge, and the hotel itself was close enough to walk to the sites we wanted to see (and only a block away from the Empire State Building) but far enough away from the bustle of Times Square that we didn't have to fight the crowds if we didn't want to. The employees were some of the nicest, most helpful that I have ever encountered at a hotel, helping us figure out which stop on the train would be best for our destination in TriBeCa and even inquiring as we came in our second day if our room met with our satisfaction. I would 100% stay at this hotel again.

Hotel Le Soleil is definitely a solid choice for accommodation while in NYC. I was visiting on business so the queen size room was more than enough. Traveling as a couple will require a bigger room as storage is limited. Rooms are small (it NYC) but clean and efficiently organized. Bath room are great and spacious with glass walk in shower. Bathroom amenities should include liquid shower jell instead of bars of soap. Booking, checking in and out was fast and efficient. Prices are more than reasonable for the location. and speaking of location, this hotel is in the heart of everything and you can explore by foot, or via the next door subway station, all the attractions. The restaurant has good verity of dishes but it is on the expensive side. There are many options around the hotel as alternative.The only problem I had was with housekeeping. At least once I came back to the room around 5pm and it was still not made up, and in many other cases, bathroom and coffee machine stocks were not replenished. Every time I called, there was no answer at housekeeping and I had to call front desk for help. That would definitely prompt me to give this hotel only 4 stars, but "It's not how we make mistakes, but how we correct them that defines us" and as such, in all cases, they rectified the problem within minutes and for that they deserve 5 stars. The combination of the location, the price and the service would definitely prompt me to stay there again.

my boyfriend and i stayed here last minute.check-in could have been smoother but it was fine.TIP: you need to scan your room card in the elevator to select your floor!!the room was very nice and it came with everything we needed. the bed was very comfortable and it was very clean. My boyfriend loved the complimentary keurig coffee machine.That night, my stomach wasn't feeling so well and my boyfriend went to the attached restaurant to ask for some hot water. the bartender that served there was SOOO sweet. Not only did he provide hot water, but he also gave lemon slices and a small cup of honey. That alone, made my trip. That extra step to service is really all it takes and makes a huge difference.It was a short stay, but the front desk was very helpful whenever we needed anything like toothpaste lol.The only downside to this was that because of the hotel's location I guess? The quality of sleep wasn't the greatest. You can hear all the people outside shouting - which we did all night. And bright and early around 5am we heard taxis honking away right outside our window. That part - the absolute worst.We would stay again if we got a higher room floor, maybe that would help with the quality of sleep.
user_name:
breakfastf00d
New York City, New York

review_body: My stay at Executive hotel Le Soleil was amazing, I initially booked thru a 3rd party And was given miss information accidentally I emailed the hotel instead of the 3rd party with my complaint, the next morning was given a call by a representative of the hotel by the name of Yadira Aviles who couldn't of been more gracious professional, she made certain that I was accommodated with an amazing upgrade for my inconvinence and assured me that she and the hotel, even though they technically were not liable would do everything possible to make sure my stay at Le Soleil was comforting and memorable at no additional cost which was a blessing .I was given the penthouse suite and totally enjoyed my stayThanks Yadira Aviles for your commitment to customer service and dedication to your hotel and your profession Warmest regards , Damian Adams

Wonderful stay, We were accommodated after my brooking mistake and upgraded.Beautiful clean, new hotel, very quiet European feel.The streer we were on was near many little bars with happy hour specials. and around the corner from Macy's on 34th street.Thank you, Moni!

I was incredibly surprised from the moment I got here, in the most pleasant way possible. This hotel was 20-50% cheaper than anything in the area, and I was prepared for an average experience. However, this hotel is a real gem for a great value, better than the Hiltons, Hyatts and Marriotts I usually stay in. The room is modern, spacious (mine had a sitting area with a fold out couch for extra guests) with luxury appointments, including fluffy terrycloth robes and an honor bar.There is a restaurant and a bar on site and room service is available. The hotel was just a 7-8 min walk to Bryant Park, 5th Ave and Broadway. The location was ideal for my work travel. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. I can't recommend this hotel enough. I wish I'd found it years ago.

before checking in the hotel, i sent a friend who lives in the city to see the place and the room I have booked. staff were all very sweet and friendly and were more than willing to help. special thanks for Yadira Aviles who was super proffesional and practical, yet warm, patient and reasuring.before I was confused of all the options of hotels in the city but having spoken to her, I really felt that we've made the right choice. thank you!!!!

Met two friends for a few days in NY stayed here great hotel reallly good location ( 100m to back door Macys) staff great . Apologies to receptionest who was great cant remember your name. Our room was spacious and comfortable. We were on the 17th floor so no issues with noise, our companions started on 4th floor but asked to move and were accomadated.

Excellent overall experience from a free room upgrade at registration to a warm friendly overall experience. Superb location; 3 mins walk to Macys, 5 mins to Empire State Building. I didn't use the restaurant but it looked great too. We stayed over Memorial Weekend and will definitely return to the hotel. Fab room and amenities. Highly recommended.

From the extremely warm check in to house keeping, this is the hotel you want to stay in on your next visit to New York City. The rooms are comfortable, spacious and luxurious but it's the little touches and the impeccable services provided by all staff that makes Executive Hotel LeSoleil an excellent place to stay!

Short trip to NYC, just a few nights. Arrived from Boston by train. 10-15 minute walk to hotel. Very modern room. Layout was great, allowing us to plan next day activities while our 11 yo son slept. He loved the large sleep sofa and pillows, and private TV. Two children could have slept on the same bed. Room was clean and quiet. From this central location we had easy access to the subway but also enjoyed walking around in the city to go from one site to the next. Moni and all the staff at the hotel were really friendly and helpful. I would certainly stay here again.

I'd emailed ahead as it was a special anniversary. We were greeted by Marjory on reception wishing us happy anniversary (fab) and then wine and chocs in our room! We had the most stunning view of the Empire State from our room.(lights up with different colours every evening, according to whatever is topical). The room was small, but spotlessly clean and comfortable (the best pillows EVER!) Bathroom and shower were large, and we had everything we needed. Towels changed daily. Coffee machine with pods and milk provided. We took a dozen of our own folding coathangers, although I'm sure if asked they would have provided more. Staff were fantastic - friendly and helpful, and we had several notes from the Maid wishing us a nice day. They made our special anniversary amazing. Location was brilliant, and we LOVED staying in this wonderful hotel with its genuinely lovely staff. THANK YOU EVERYONE :)

I've stayed at many NYC hotels before...this one I had zero complaints. It's NYC, the rooms are small, but it was well appointed. Bed was comfortable & bathroom was larger than expected. I never had a problem with the elevator like others did. The staff was friendly and the restaurant attached was great!

This hotel is perfect for exploring NYC! It's clean, fairly specious, great shower and perfect location. The bar is lovely for a night cap and the coffee in the shop below is great to get your day started. I had an issue with my deposit refund and it was sorted immediately after I contacted reception. Would highly recommend!

Prices vary wildly for this hotel, depending on season. You can score some great values during the chilly winter months--not so much in better weather. The location is great--walkable from both Penn Station and Grand Central. And the people, especially behind the front desk, are excellent. Rooms are fresh and well-maintained--

the hotel is quite small - about 8 rooms on its 20 floors. our room was quite spacious for its price point, with a good (southern) view. multiple dining options in the area, including their attached restaurant. friendly staff, windows that can be opened for fresh air (YES! thank you!), actual ceramic coffee mugs and plates, microwave/fridge/sink are rapidly becoming rare; nice to have them here. the only (tiny) complaint was a noisy bathroom door, which i am certain will be repaired quickly. subtly scented bath amenities, unlike some other hotels' oddball and aggressive scents. we'll come back if in town.

I chose this hotel largely because I've stayed at other locations in the past. Did not disappoint. Very clean, quiet room with modern amenities. Helpful staff, great location. Price was reasonable for the area. Definitely would stay here again on future visits.

This hotel is close to many tourist attractions and easy access to transport too. My room on the 18th floor overlooked the Empire State Building. The staff were both helpful and knowledgeable of the area and nothing was too much trouble when asked. The room was clean and serviced each day. My only concern was breakfast was not included in the cost of the hotel - but understand this is a New York thing?

We spent 5 nights at the Hotel LeSolell in late April. It represents a very conveniently and reasonably priced stay in Mid-Manhattan. It is located on 36th Street near 5th Avenue and conveniently to the high points of Manhattan. The amenities are first rate, including the Trademark bar in the hotel where I had the best Old Fashion ever. The rooms we had were a bit smallish but, nevertheless, comfortable. We would return to LeSoleil were we to return to Mid-Manhattan.

Very good location. Near 30th street train station. Staff was very helpful. Rooms very small but modern and clean. Free wifi. Comfy bed. Only one thing, even on 9th floor it seems noisy at night. You can walk to time square.

This was one of the best we have had the pleasure to stay in. Location, staff, rooms and view were all fantastic.We were on the 17th floor so the view was great especially at night,lovely big suite and nowhere near as expensive as others around similar location.

I am in New York routinely, but this was my first time staying at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil. It's a Vancouver-based hotel that has this one outpost in the States. The location in mid-town is a short walk from Penn Station but also convenient to other midtown locations, Murray Hill, Kips Bay and major shopping attractions. One of things that struck me about this hotel is that it was newly purpose-built, as opposed to a retrofit of an old office building. That shows in the dimensions of the room and bath, which are larger than what is found in many Manhattan hotels. From checking in (well before noon), to time in the room, to enjoying a cocktail with an old friend and dinner at the bar, I enjoyed everything about this delightful little hotel. The restaurant is first rate; similar to what you'd find at a Kimpton-affiliated property. I'll gladly come back to this gem in the future.

This hotel has a great location. The rooms are nice and we even got an upgrade. The staff are very friendly. Next time we visit the city I would definitely consider this hotel again. Also remember to use the restaurant that has a great style.

We stayed Christmas 2016, this hotel is well placed walking distance to Christmas places like macy's good food options on site and close by, they arranged a good Christams dinner for us close by, as most placed booked out.

Just stayed at Le Soleil and can say I was very pleased with the accommodations. Bed was very comfortable, room clean and updated. Quiet and located in an area near Time Square. Doorman was great as were the desk staff. Would recommend the hotel. Only thing is it is not cheap.

This well-located hotel, in mid-town and an easy walk to the theater district, has clean, comfortable, well-appointed rooms with all the amenities: 2 flat-screen TVs, stocked refrigerator & snacks, Keurig machine, iron & ironing board, safe, bathrobes, etc. I would call it "business class". The all-marble bathroom had a nice shower and plenty of room for toilet articles. My only complaint with the room was that it had insufficient closet space and a weird layout: the bedroom was separated from the couch/TV area by a very narrow hall with a desk. No one can pass by if someone is sitting at the desk. The desk is flanked by tall, open glass shelves/cubbies; on one side is the refrigerator and safe, on the other side is what passes for a closet. But the "closet" is just a 12" bar that holds 6 hangers. Not enough for 2 people who are staying a few days.The restaurant was up and down; it has a very nice (though expensive) menu, and the "hangover hash" was terrific. But the ham and cheese omelet was just about inedible, and the service was abominable.Good internet service throughout the hotel, and helpful staff.

Other than that it's ok. Location is good, mid town, hotel looks nice. Room size is ok, no place for real place for clothes which is strange. Room is simple. Price is excellent. Prob the best hotel is lowest price you can find

The hotel is very modern, very decent size rooms for new york, we got a good price but if $$ was not an issue too i would return to this hotel, had a nice wee bar too. There was nothing to complain about. Enjoy your stay :)

Lovely hotel with very helpful friendly staff. The location is excellent . Rooms very Clean but with the smallest wardrobe space I have ever seen in a hotel. Breakfast at the hotel is very overpriced and noting fantastic so would recommend eating elsewhere .

Booked having never stayed at a LeSoleil property previously and we were pleasantly surprised. The room was spacious and well appointed. We were actually surprised by the overall size which included a sitting area with sofa, large bathroom, desk/vanity area and bedroom. The decor is modern yet it feels very comfortable. The service was friendly and professional without being intrusive. We really enjoyed our stay and will return when we visit the city again.

Booking my reservation was made so simple with Yadira, she was extremely helpful.I was booking 2 rooms for a special trip into the city with my family for Mother's Day.It was talking with a good friend. Yadira did her very best to find us the best accomdations with all our needs in mind. I definitely get the feeling that the crew at LeSoleil know what they are doing. The right hand know what the left hand is doing at LeSoleil! Can't wait to stay there! Yadira goes by YaYa for short, ask for her!

In New York City earlier part of April State Hotel LeSoleil. Fiarly new hotel. Rooms were small but luxuriously appointed. Very simple architectural design. Amenities good. Not quite enough closet space to hang clothes. Restaurant service was good. Belhops and front desk staff were great. Made service could be a little better regarding cleanup. Great location in Mid Town. I would stay there again.
user_name:
Paul G
Santa Fe, New Mexico

review_body: My wife and I had five nights in this hotel in late March for sight seeing on a first time visit to New York. We found that it being situate in 36 street between 5th Ave & 6th Ave was central to seeing most things in New York ie Empire State, Broadway, Times Square, Bryant Park, Enterprise / Space Shuttle, Circle Line Cruise, United Nations, Grand Central, St Patrick's Cathedral all of which are easily accessed on foot. Central park, The Met, Guggenheim, Statue of Liberty / Ellis Island, Bronze Bull, 9/11 Memorial Pools, Wall St, Federal Reserve & Brooklyn Bridge however should be accessed via the subway once you work out its intricacies. The hotel comprise a rebuild from a gutted former building and is modern and comfortable with good service from the main desk and the room attendants with the rooms being spotless as you would expect. Our room was a queen room on a top level floor with a view merely across the street to the buildings opposite. It certainly was not a basic room. However the room was small with a free standing cloths rack, desk and only one luggage stand. We had two large suitcases plus two cabin bags so there was insufficient room for us to easily walk from the bed to the bathroom without tripping over obstacles, particularly without a light in the middle of the night. The hotel has a restaurant which appears to be run by a chain. However the menu didn't interest us and for the five nights there we dined across the road at the Keg (Irish Pub) which was excellent. We had intended dining out at least one night up market but after tiring days roaming around New York and with the cold rainy weather it was too easy to simply cross the road. What most persons would like to know is would I stay there again. The answer can only be a maybe given the size of the room. It always comes down to you get what you pay for. We paid US$1,147 for five nights and some might say that we got a real good deal and should be happy even if the room was small. Maybe so. But I really feel compelled to warn others over the room size.

I wanted to commend you and your company for the excellent experience we have had, and in particular the across the board friendliness, efficiency and politeness of your staff. We travel to NYC fairly regularly and I can confirm that we will be recommending you strongly to our friends and business contacts. Walking distance to many of the must see tourist sites from the Empire State to Broadway, but much quieter than places we have stayed in which are only a few blocks nearer to Times Square.Among the many excellent staff members who have contributed to our good experience here, I wanted to particularly draw your attention to the housekeeping/cleaning staff who work the 7th floor. As the job is by nature an invisible one I do not know how many staff members handled our room while we were there but I can tell you that in terms of courtesy and attention to detail they are a credit to your hotel. I hope you will pass on our thanks and I felt it was important to take time to let you know what an asset to your business these staff members are.

I stayed here in March with my husband. The website for the hotel offers you things they cannot deliver on, such a shuttle service from the airport and early check-in. We had a wedding to attend that afternoon and we barely got in our room in time to get dressed for the wedding.The rooms are soooo small, even for NY standards. There is no closet. They have a bulky piece of furniture that has hanging space for 4 items maximum. There is so much clutter on the furniture. When we asked for the coffee maker and mini bar tray to be removed so we could make space for our stuff the staff refused.The concierge and bell staff were very friendly and the rooms were clean, but because of the size of the rooms I will not be staying here again.

There was a lovely check in, charming staff, but we needed the pull-out bed they were unable to explain well how it worked. We asked for simple things like mugs for the coffee maker and tea, but they didn't get them to us. One room came without robes, and they got the rooms mixed up once. Also there isn't much space for clothes if you're there for more than a couple days.

We travelled here for 4 nights at Easter. We were upgraded on arrival to a suite. Check in was seemless, the room (No. 1340) was fab. We were high up so had a great view (not of the Empire State Building) and heard little to no noise from the street below. We slept soundly while here. The staff overall couldn't have been nicer and the location was perfect. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to NYC and if we get to go to NYC again, I would stay here again hands down.

I can't speak highly enough about this hotel. The location is brilliant. The Empire State Building is just around the corner and Times Square a five minute walk away along with all the main sights. The hotel itself is really new looking, the room was superb and the staff are incredibly helpful and friendly. A real gem and we didn't want to leave.

My husband and I stayed here over thanksgiving weekend. Room was spotless and comfortable and very quiet. We were beside herald square and just off all the shopping of 5th avenue. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I spoke with one of the maids in the lift one night and she was so lovely and seemed to really enjoy her job. Hotel staff organised transfers for us to airport. There were a few Irish pubs right beside hotel that had good happy hour drink deals. Would definitely recommend this hotel as it's very central but not in the craziness of times square.

Location of the hotel is excellent, the room was OK but not particularly clean, and had a funny urinated smell about it. So far so good, let's say, It went wrong at the end. The bell boy told us our bags were loaded in the hotel shuttle van to take us back to the airport, but they had forgotten to load one bag with all the passports in it. They eventually sent the driver back with the passports, we just barely made it to the flight and then they charged us another 70 USD for that second run to the airport. I don't expect them to apologize for all the stress and anxiety they caused, everyone can make mistakes, but I do want those 70 USD back.This "nice hotel with it's smiling friendly staff" (seriously guys, couldn't you be a little bit more modest about yourselves?) doesn't even answer emails when they screw up.

Good hotel with nice room , comfortable bed ang quite big bathroom. I liked the staff of this hotel! Smiling and friendly! The hotel is situated just a few meters from 5 th avenue! I will definetly stay here again

So glad we booked this hotel. On arrival staff were very helpful and check in was swift. Our room was a suite and we had requested a room with a view. We were not disappointed. Our suite was spacious enough for the 4 of us. The bathroom was big for New York standards and was modern. Hotel lifts were never overly busy and waits were short compared to others we had been to. Overall a great, stylish and friendly hotel in a central location. Would definitely recommend and would personally return.

This was our 2nd time in New York, the first time we stayed on 40th St. We were really pleased with the location of Executive Hotel Le Soleil and felt it was ideal for what we wanted, far better than our first stay. There are many restaurants, bars and cafes close by and you are merely a couple of streets away from the ESB.The hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff friendly and approachable. We booked a queen room with a view which was again spotlessly clean and decorated nicely. I have to admit that I was shocked at the size of the room when we first walked in and as many have mentioned previously storage really is an issue and you have to be creative with where to place your clothes. Once unpacked, our cases stayed in the unnecessarily large bathroom which sorted the issue out.The bed and pillows were very comfortable and housekeeping had always serviced our room prior to our return early in the evening. Would recommend this hotel wholeheartedly but WHEN we return we will give up the view for a slightly larger room. We didn't eat at the hotel but enjoyed a number of drinks there and found the bar to be friendly with a pleasant atmosphere.

I could not be more pleased with my visit to NYC. The staff at LeSoleil is AH-MAZING! The hotel is beautiful, has THE BEST location, rooms are clean and comfortable, wifi in the entire hotel and my housekeeper was the greatest! Thank you Diana for the fun and happy conversation while cleaning my room/taking such good care of me during my stay. Kevin at the bell desk - incredibly warm and helpful. Negesti as Concierge was so friendly and accommodating as well while I waited for my room (I arrived early). EVERY single staff member I interacted with was smiling, friendly and so happy to help. You will enjoy every minute of your stay - can't recommend it enough!

I stayed in the Hotel Soleil for 7 nights and found it a great place to return to each night after a busy day in the city. The Suites are not large, but they are most pleasant and aesthetic. Mine had a small sitting room with flatscreen TV, a hall leading to the bedroom, and in between, a nice bathroom with glass enclosed rainfall shower and a counter with plenty of room for toiletries. The bed is clean and comfy with silky cotton sheets and another nice flat screen TV is centered in front of the queen bed. I spent some time in the evenings watching movies when I was tired. The rooms are touted as soundproof, and they are, and the windows are well insulated when closed. My bedroom was situated in the back of the suite, so I could not hear interior noise like doors banging and elevators. I found the quiet aesthetic atmosphere most relaxing, even though I was facing West 36th Street...it was not at all noisy.  There are many hotels on these streets near Herald Square stuck in between older, spacious NY loft and apartment buildings, but this is one that truly works for the guest!! It is thoughtfully designed, the room has glass shelves and closet, a desk with large mirror and great coffee machine, everything works.The staff is friendly and helpful, the concierge(s) were terrific, and someone is usually watching the front door which is good for one's feeling of security. You use your key card for the elevator. There is a nice restaurant and a small cafe adjoining the hotel if you want to stay in and eat, but there are lots of places around Herald Square. I could have stayed longer and felt comfortable at Hotel Soleil! The only suggestions I have for the hotel are about their duvet covers. They use two sheets for this, and because the sheets are silky, they fall off the comforter. Since most hotels do not launder comforters between each guest, it would be much better if the hotel got some duvet covers that cover the quilt completely, especially at the top. Most hotels use these now, around the world. My other suggestion is about the in-room safe..... which was too small for a 15-inch laptop but ok for an iPad or tablet. I think a bigger safe would work better for electronics and papers for most guests. Highly recommended for a NY boutique hotel!

The hotel is nice and well maintained. Small boutique kind of hotel. The room was nice and room. Specially for New York. It is around the corner from the famous Macy's and a block away from The Empire State Building. Time square is only 10 minutes walk. Bryant park is 2 blocks away. Plenty of restaurants around. Pennsylvania station is only 5 minutes walk. The grand central station is 10 minutes walk. The restaurant downstairs is great but a little pricey. The service was excellent. We will come back.

Stayed for 4 nights very recently. I had booked a room with a view which didn't disappoint. I was allocated a 14th floor room with a fabulous view of the empire state building.I had read that typical NYC hotel rooms were often a little small however this room was perfectly adequate.Good size bathroom and lovely shower. Coffee making facilities were topped up daily . I do agree there is very limited wardrobe space, not uncommon in previous visits to Europe for example, so I had invested in some folding lightweight coat hangers which did the trick! . A high floor room ensured a very peaceful nights sleep with no street noise. All the staff I encountered were very pleasant and cheerful, thankyou to Diana in housekeeping for keeping my room spotless.In terms of location, very easy walk from Penn Street station. Madison square, Bryant park, Central park south, Empire state, Rockerfella , Grand Central, Times square are all easy to get to. Try and pre book tickets for the major attractions to avoid long waits, but expect airport style security checks. Of note lots of free wifi at these attractions even in Bryant park. Strategically placed charging stations for your devices, in particular at the Staten island ferry.Had a fabulous first visit to NYC and would love to return, would definately recommend this hotel.

We stayed at the Executive Hotel Le Soleil for 4 nights. The hotal has a great location in the center of Midtown Manhattan. The subway is just one block away and the hotel is a perfect starting point to explore Manhattan by foot.The room (Deluxe Queen Suite) was spacious, very clean and offered a great view to the Empire State Building.The room was very quiet (no street noises) besides some AC ventilators that were audible from the outside of the building.The staff at the reception was not to helpful. It seemed like they were happy if they didn't get to much to work. That was the only downside though.We recommend this place.

The location was very good. far from noise of Times square. very close to Macys. The room was small for 3 or 4 people and there was no closet in the room so you can not hang your clothes and coats. The room was clean. reception staff was very friendly. There was free wifi. Our room was near the elevator so it was a little bit noisy.

Wonderful front desk staff and check-in (I like that 3 pm check-in time -- I got there right around 3:10 on Monday 3/26) and the room was ready)-- the woman working the desk that shift was just fantastic. Likewise, warm and helpful staff at check out early the next morning. In between, the bartender was charming and friendly and poured with a generous hand, and all of our contacts were lovely. The linens were good and the bathroom clean and well-appointed, but everything quite condensed. Would not want to spend a lot of time in the room as it would get too claustrophobic for me. I will probably go elsewhere as I like a little more roominess (even in NYC) (in fact especially in NYC) but I was very impressed with the hotel's staff and their warm charm.

Great hotel for NYC business. Convenient location, fantastic staff, excellent service. The hotel restaurant had fantastic food and drinks. Nice rooms, fitness room. Only downside was elevator wait/crowding, and $65 per day parking.

Great hotel, great price, great location - I know where I'm staying next time I'm in NYC! They also have a driver who will pick you up at the airport in a big black SUV for less than the cost of a cab

Enjoyed my stay completely! Great service ! Rooms extremely clean ! Definitely will be back ! Quality relation to price 5 stars !!! Great location too ! And again can't say enough of the staff , kind , polite and always helpful

We had our trip cut short due to the blizzard and the hotel worked with us to refund us for the night we had to cancel due to the weather. Awesome hotel located near everything! Side Note: Cell Service is awful in some parts of the hotel, but they do provide free WIFI.

I came to New York early and I was able to be checked in early for a room. The room is super clean and very well maintained. Everything was upgraded and convenient. I love the location and it just close to everything I needed.I want to give a special shoutout to Moni, who was such a delight. Never have I seen an employee gone above and beyond to ensure their hotel guests receives the best customer service. She was so fun to talk to and full of joy. I saw her being able to be professional and more than help during difficult guests and rush hour. I would definitely come here again when I come back to New York again this summer.This hotel and its services feels just like a 5-star hotel with 5-star customer service.

Hotel was modern and up-scale with a great location! Very close to Herald's Square for shopping, the Empire State Building was two blocks away and Times Square was within walking distance too. There was a very inviting fireplace in the sitting area of the lobby that was nice to enjoy in the evenings. Bellhop was very helpful in hailing a taxi for us. I would stay here again!

Lovely Hotel , in a great location.Walking distance to Times Square, Bryant Park and Madison Square Gardens.Beds were comfortable and rooms cleanStaff were excellent and very helpful. Close to a number of eating placesWould definitely stay here again

Everyone here was super friendly! The restaurant has a great atmosphere and food. The view from our room also looked right up the Empire State Building! Everything here was very clean and upscale. Loved!

My wife and I just completed a three-night stay at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil, and I must say that we found it to be excellent.
