Although the room was not large, they make excellent use of the space. The room was very clean and tastefully decorated. The bed was very comfortable, and there were two television sets - one in the sleeping area, and one in the sitting area. (The sitting area had a love seat/sofa.) The front desk staff was very friendly and professional. The location is great -- very near to Macy's and the Empire State Building and a short walk to many other areas, including the Times Square theaters. We would definitely consider staying here again in the future.

Beautiful hotel. Spotless clean. Streets ahead of others in this area..Definitely 4 star. Staff lovely. Good quality of sleep, rooms soundproofed.nice lounge area. Fresh deli a few doors down, gorgeous food and fabulous staff.

We looked at many different hotels for our weekend in New York and finally took the plunge with this one. The hotel was nice and whilst the rooms are small as many have mentioned before, you just make do and make the best of it. The staff were great and the room was clean and perfect for our needs. We were on the 18th floor and had a great view of the New York skyline. Would recommend the Izakaya Mew Japanese restaurant which was on the same block, one street down. Difficult to find as in a basement but worth the hunt. Probably one of our best ever meals, amazing! One slight issue was being charged the wrong rate on checking in. Having booked on booking.com with an excellent rate, we were charged the full rate but luckily noticed. What out for that one! All in all a great hotel in midtown and ideal for a weekend break in the Big Apple.

Nicely renovated and close to midtown, just a few doors down from Keens Steakhouse, which is a "must visit" if you are looking for a high quality, old school steak-and-martini dinner. I stayed for 5 nights on business and had an issue with my room, which they swiftly took care of. All the staff was great, especially Marjorie, the manager who was responsive and kind. I definitely plan to stay here again.

Location is great - easy walk to great restaurants yet off the beaten tourist track enough to be be less crowded. Easy walk to Madison Square Gardens and Macy's. Plenty of Irish pubs and big variety of eating establishments at reasonable prices. Book at the hotel's restaurant to get a table as they are popular. Good value for money accomodation.

I can't fault this hotel for comfort, cleanliness and location. Couple of things - I used an international phone card to call home and was charged £8.90 for 'using' the phone. I always buy a phone card and use the hotel phones and have never incurred any charge. Since I've come home, I questioned this and apparently the charges are set out on a card in the room?Also, on check in, I presented my debit card and they authorised $400 which was immediately withdrawn from my account. Apparently, it takes 3-10 days to be recredited from checking out. I honestly don't mind hotel policy but felt this was misleading. My 25th visit to NYC and this has never happened. Again, hotel was lovely - friendly staff - but charges make me question whether I will return.

The public rooms are pleasant and the staff is friendly, but the rooms are really SMALL, even by New York Standards. There is no closet and unpacking a suitcase means putting it on the bed as there's no other space. The bed had a thin comforter--I had to ask for a blanket which took two calls to get. And, the housekeeping isn't great--they did not clean the coffee maker or leave fresh Keurig capsules. Not worth it, never again
user_name:
Flora F
Fairfax Station, Virginia, United States

review_body: This hotel is perfect,modern,spotless,great staff and so close to everything ! We stayed on the 15th floor and our room looked out to the Empire State Building! One thing I would suggest is more hooks to hang coats etc small rooms but seems to be the American way,room serviced every day,will definitely return.PERFECT PLACE TO STAY IN NEW YORK !!

Relatively new and very clean and comfortable. Friendly staff at each turn. Not a luxury hotel but a great find in a very convenient location. Queen bed single room was not large but not small either. Bed was comfortable - excellent pillows (something I'm very particular about). For the price (around $200/night) this was excellent value. I would definitely stay here again. Top it off with memorable bacon (in an awesome way) at the hotel restaurant (Trademark).

The hotel has a great locstion and the rooms are cleab and decent size.Although the rooms does not have functioning wardrobe, so we ended up having our stuff in our suitcases.Also I found it a bit strange that I requested bathrobes at least 3 times from the reception and I got them from cleaners when I ran into them onthw corridor when requesting from them. Also our air conditioning stopped working, but it was not fixed during our stay although I informed it to reception multiple times. I would have expected a bit better service from the hotel.

We have just arrived back to the UK after a 4 night stay at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and welcoming upon arrival and allowed us to leave our bags securely until we could check into the room at 3pm. When we checked in however we were asked for a 400 dollar (100 dollar per night) security deposit. This was not relayed to us when we made the booking and it came as a shock to us. So be aware of this if you book. The room we stayed in was on the 9th floor unfortunately we had a view of the office block behind the hotel but this didn't bother us as we planned on spending very little time in the room itself. The room was far bigger and elegant than we expected. Especially for the price and the location it was more than ideal. It was cleaned to perfection every day and we enjoyed staying here. Only downside is there were no tea making facilities and the minibar prices were extortionate. Including a bottle of water at 8 dollars!!! Would recommend for those wanting to stay in the central of manhattan. Just a street away from the empire state, macys and the subway at herald square.

The room was a decent size, bathroom was a nice size too, I loved the huge window with the empire state view too. The staff were really helpful in helping me locate a parcel that had been delivered but gotten lost and the little coffee shop inside the hotel was lovely too

Two rooms with two beds in Manhattan for around $200/night actually had me a little concerned about what we were getting into but the accommodations were very nice and the staff beyond friendly and helpful. Close to everything and perfect for a traveling family.

Stayed two nights with my son. Room was small but we knew that being in NYC. Great location about a block from Shake Shack And closer to Times Square than we thought. Nothing spectacular but nothing bad, I'd stay again. Bell man Kevin was awesome!

I enjoyed this hotel before I arrived. I read the reviews of this new boutique hotel with its convenient location, quiet rooms & most of all clean & comfortable accommodations so I emailed them & Ysidra helped answer my questions re: payment and I was sold. My reservation was set and I'm grateful this visit to NYC was just as I hoped: fun, peaceful, relaxing, convenient, & treated with superb service. Check-in was smooth with Chris & the charming gentleman with locs (I'm sorry I forgot your name but not your story & smile!) who were both courteous & efficient after a long flight from SF. At checkout Lilly and Lewis(Louis) helped me so fabulously by allowing me a later checkout since my flight was delayed. The doorman and another young gentleman at the hotel secured my ride to JFK without me calling an uber, a taxi driver, or taking the AirTrain. I'm so glad they arranged this! Mr. Faustus was an absolute professional, I arrived in style & on time for my flight home. I loved the cozy, warm yet professional ambience of this hotel. Ms. Kunsang insured my room was cleaned well and she was very considerate and kind to insure the housekeeping time worked with my schedule. I recommend this gem, I hope I get a more fabulous view of the Empire State at my next visit!

We stayed here from 3rd until 6th March. Lovely hotel. Great location for all the attractions. Brilliant staff. Couldn't do enough to assist. Special shout out to Lilly on reception, who made us feel so welcome and Chris who helped us with transport back to the airport. Would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

We have tried several different hotels in NYC and without a doubt the rooms at this hotel were the biggest, most comfortable we've stayed in. We did go up one level from the budget room to get a little space but if we had gotten the less expensive room I think we would have been happy. Unlike some of the other rooms we've stayed in, there's plenty of room to get around the bed without bruising your legs, also plenty of room to stash suitcases and clothes and the bathroom was very spacious. The decor was update and the room was very clean. And it was surprisingly quiet; we were right across from the elevator so worried it would be noisy, but it wasn't.  Another plus: it's a short 4-block walk from Penn Station so nice not to have to use a cab or subway to get to/from hotel. Service, though, could be improved a lot. The cleaning staff was incredibly friendly but the reception staff was not only cold, but rarely around. We rarely saw anyone in the lobby to ask questions or even hold the door open and the only person we ever saw at the reception desk to check in and out was efficient but not particularly friendly or helpful. With a little more attention to service and some other simple amenities (like fresh flowers in the lobby, along with perhaps coffee or ice water), this could easily be a 5-star hotel. Oh, but first, the hotel needs to fix its elevators--which requires a room key to operate. That's fine, as long as you don't hop on the elevator (or someone else does) at last minute, wave your key card and end up erasing all previously inputted floors.

We had a great stay. You can't beat the location with access to various subway lines, walking distance to Time Square, Flatiron District, Midtown etc. Plenty of breakfast options close by. Staff very courteous and helpful. Adequate exercise room with treadmills/bikes and free weights. Highly recommended.

This was my 2nd stay at this property. The location is perfect but it really is the wonderful staff that make it feel like home. The reception at check in by Gina was professional, courteous and kind. The rooms are so spacious and comfy you truly feel like you are home. A must stay when in downtown Toronto

Stayed a few nights prior to a Cruise with two other couples. Hotel was very well appointed, beautiful fixtures, welcoming staff. Staff did everything to help make our time comfortable and relaxed. Enjoyed the lobby lounge in the evenings, we brought in some wine and they help ensure we had glasses and answered question on the next day adventures. Great help organizing a car to the cruise. Will visit again. Great little breakfast place a few doors down, well priced and great food. Rooms are small but wonderful full length windows, the bathroom was high end, shower was huge. Give this little place a visit. 7 minute walk to Time Square.

Wonderful staff, and the the bellman was always so funny and entertaining. We felt so well taken care of in every kind of way. We were also upgraded to a suite, and since then we both were in heaven. Located only a a couple of hundred meters from Empire State Building and Broadway, close to everything. Thank you for making our stay so wonderful!!

Had a great experience! We got this amazing room on the 19th floor with a beautiful view over Freedom Tower and the Empire State Building. The room was spacious, and the bathroom clean. The staff was both friendly and very helpful. Perfect location!

Staff was absolutely on top of everything and extremely helpful. The hotel is actually a condo building. Tiny little kitchen but washer and dryer in room was wonderful. View of other buildings ok. Floor to ceiling windows in bedroom nice. Just a couple of blocks from Hockey Hall of Fame and access to underground PATH across the street. Cool little restaurants all around. We loved this place and would stay here again in a heart beat!

Akua Afriyie was a very respectful and hardworking room attendant. The room was very spotless and cleaned very nice. You guys should hire people like her to help improve the business. She was very receptive, kind, generous and very cordial. Please keep up the good work!
user_name:
aidoodaniel
New York City, New York

review_body: This was my first time in NYC and I made the right choice for accommodation. Stayed here early Feb 17 for 10 nights, I received a helpful email before we even arrived and check in was easy and fast. Which was appreciated after the 30hrs of travel from Australia. Our room was clean, neat and everything seemed reasonably new. Although not a large room it was bigger than I had expected for NY and was spacious enough for all our luggage. However not a lot of wardrobe space. The bathroom was clean and a decent size. We were on the 18th floor and had a great view of the Empire State building and the One World building. It was also a quiet room (not sure if that was cause of the height, not sure if a lower room would have been as quiet). Free wifi and the room had aircon/heating which was easy to use. The housekeeping were efficient and managed to clean our room every day even when we had irregular hours. All the staff we encountered were friendly, professional and helpful. The gym is small, but has everything you needed. The restaurant attached Trademark has nice coffee and we only ate there once but the food was very nice. No room service which is a shame when you are tired, but when in NY you should probably eat out, so it was only and issue for a bit and then I got over it. The location was great, walking distance to many attractions. Check out was easy and fast. I’d read a few reviews earlier that had said they had had some issues after check out when they had returned to collect their luggage it had taken too long and you don’t want that when you are on your way to the airport, so I was a little nervous. But the hotel has fixed this issue. The staff member who helped us (wish I had grabbed a name) was switched on, fast and friendly. He was there to take our bags as we were checking out, took a time we would want them and helped us order a car service. All and all a very positive experience. I would recommend this hotel and will probably stay there again in the future.

This was a gem we discovered - strategically located with high standards. The staff - particularly Aida and Christopher were very receptive to our specific needs , even before us registering.The rooms are crisp and stylish. The housekeeping was polite and efficient. A special mention for Kunsang , who made us feel very much at home with her spontaneity. We look to coming back and making this our default option in NYC

My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights and flew home 2 days ago.Upon arrival we were greeted in a friendly manner and checked our baggage as the room was not ready. We left them and came back in to complete the check in process. We were assigned our rooms and went upstairs. The room we were given was small, very small really for 2 people with luggage. It would have been fine for a weekend but not a week. We went back to reception and asked for a change of room. Lillie on reception was absolutely fantastic! She helped with our issue And we're were given a larger room which overlooked the empire state.The room was cleaned daily and the staff were very friendly. The rooms themselves are well kept and tidy. The bathrooms are clean and spacious. The rooms had air con which were easy to use also. The hotel is in close proximity to almost anything you want really. There is a diner on the corner for breakfast, which is reasonably priced too. Msg, Macy's, times Square are a very short walk away as is the nearest subway Overall a great experience and would definitely go back

This is not the first time I've stayed at this lovely hotel and it definitely won't be the last. Le Soleil is perfect from the decor and amenities; down to a very welcoming and helpful staff... Thank you.

I am frequent NYC traveler. Stay at many different hotels throughout the city. I had a pleasant stay. I booked an executive queen suite, all they had left at the time of booking. It was a good value for the price. Very roomy by NYC standards. Marble bathroom, great rain shower. Two televisions. Comfortable form bed. No closet. They have a glass enclosure to hang your clothes and plenty of drawers. Desk with a coffee maker. Lots of lighting. AC/Heater worked perfectly. My room was on a high floor. But, right by the elevator and it faced another building. No view at all. Could not even see the street. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The restaurant onsite was really good. Nice bar area. Pricy but good food. The location is perfect. Walking distance to many restaurants, Herald Square, and subways. Cabs and Uber easy to get. There are two nice cafe's for breakfast two doors down next to the Hyatt Place and the Hilton Garden Inn. The hotel also has a small coffee and pastry cafe in the lobby. My stay was pleasant, the weather was not.

We are frequent NYC travelers. This trip was part business and fun. The hotel staff is excellent. Everyone we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to help in all aspects of our trip. Eddie was helpful making sure our baggage was available and gave us great suggestions on local eateries. The room was comfortable with all the necessary details. We will definitely stay here again!

We absolutely loved our time at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil, from the moment we were greeted by Moni, so warm and friendly, to the moment we checked out 4 days later.The location is unbeatable, midtown, between 5th and 6th avenue, you can practically walk everywhere.The staff are all so polite, warm and friendly.The hotel is in immaculate condition, the lobby is clean, tastefully decorated and welcoming.Good size lifts, something a lot of hotels fail to recognise, luggage takes up a lot of room!!!The bedroom was fantastic. We were on the 15th floor with an outstanding view of the Empire State Building, the room managed to blend functionality with comfort and all done in a tasteful fashion and spotlessly clean. There are only 8 rooms on a floor so it was very quiet.The bed was extremely comfortable. The wardrobe and storage facilities were first class and elegantly put together, combining boutique modernism with practicality and pleasing aesthetic. It was also a bonus to have a seperate kitchen area.What struck us most about the room was the size. Most hotels in NY struggle with their bedroom size and can be claustraphobic. The LeSoleil had so much space and room. A kitchen area with floor space for luggage, bags, coats etc, then a seperate bedroom area with subtle lighting and space to relax and finally a large bathroom, with a window!!!!! Not only a window but an amazing view of the new World Trade Centre.Great choice of TV channels too!It was a real treat to come back to the room at the end of a busy day and take some time to relax in a haven of peace before heading back out for the New York nightlife. It felt like our own NY loft apartment!I would definitely recommend The LeSoleil to anyone.An attractive, spotlessly clean, comfortable boutique hotel in a fantastic part of town, what is not to like!!!

Just loved it - funky enough, clean, super convenient to everything. Definitely recommend. Moni at the front desk is a rock star, she was extremely helpful, outgoing and sweet - made my stay extra pleasant! Hope to see her again when I return!

Familiar with Le Soleil in Vancouver, I booked myself and three of my team members into Le Soleil NYC in January. The rate was exceptional, including parking fees - and the service was warm and welcoming. Ideal location and rooms were spotless and comfortable. Small work out area but enough to get some exercise if you even need it after all the walking around you will do in NYC. Order room service from restaurant and had breakfast - food was very good. Highly recommend for your next NYC stay.

Lovely spotlessly clean room. Great location only 5 minute walk to Empire State Building.Staff are very friendly and helpful. Room quite spacious especially considering a New York City hotel room. Ate breakfast their once. Was beautiful , a little on the pricey side though.

Recently stayed here and loved the convenient location. We had plans to see a show and do some sightseeing and everything was walkable. Hotel itself is lovely and clean. The staff was the best! Friendly and engaging, making us feel welcome at every encounter. Great job!

I spent 5 nights on the 19th floor with a great view in a clean, well lighted room. I stayed in the junior suite which was small and wasn't really a "suite". But worked fine for me. It did have a good size closet, but not a lot of drawer space. (Shout out to Housekeeping for their great job... and note.) They have a fine bar and are connected to a small breakfast/coffee spot . Yidira was nice enough to give me a complimentary pass for breakfast every day. Otherwise they left me alone which was fine. And the desk was helpful with any questions. The location is fantastic. Right in the heart of mid-town. Close to Rockefeller Center, The Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden and a quick walk to Bryant Park ( a great little gem). Close to great food, bars and a fast cab ride to anywhere, uptown od down.

The location is fantastic. Right in the heart of midtown. So close to Macy's and walking distance to so many attractions. The staff are very welcoming and friendly. My only criticism is the rooms are very small even by New York standards. I was travelling solo and it was just manageable. I had 2 large suitcases and had nowhere to really put them. That said, the bed is oh so very comfortable and the bathroom is lovely. Enjoyed my stay. Love,love,love New York

We are looking forward to our future visit. Yadira is very professional and answered all my questions regarding my reservation. They also offer a concierge service for any additional reservations you might need. Excellent customer service!

I stay at LeSoleil every 2-3 months during business trips. While there are many hotels in the garment district, I keep coming back.The staff is always gracious and helpful. The suites are spacious and maintained at the highest standard. The perfect place to rest during an intensive work week.Special thanks to Andre at the front desk!

The hotel rooms are not rooms but small and comfortable apartments. There are only five per floor, which means it is very quiet and peaceful. When it rained, the hotel provided umbrellas. When our previously arranged taxi did not show up, the manager Gina called a taxi for us right away and we still paid the flat fee for the right to the airport. This place is a home away from home. It is very clean and very well maintained. We had a corner suite and a beautiful view. We had a room, a living room and a small kitchenette, which included microwave, over, coffee maker and a dishwasher. There were also washer and dryer. There were two flat screen TV's. The bathroom was modern and clean. I have no complaints whatsoever. I would definitely book with that hotel again. Two thumbs up!!! A+

Lovely, clean, modern room with a fantastic city view ( ask for a high floor). Very quiet! Friendly, courteous, professional staff. Stopped into the bar for a cocktail before heading out on the town for the night and had the best Negroni In years. We will stay here again!

My wife and I just stayed at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil for a quick getaway to NYC. The location is great, the rooms very clean and comfortable, and the staff is generally very friendly. For the price this hotel is hard to beat if you need or want to stay in Midtown. It really is a hidden gem in many respects. The only hiccup was retrieving our baggage at the end of the stay. We had the hotel stow it for the afternoon for us, and when we retuned it took nearly half and hour for the bellman to arrive with it. Consequently, we missed our train from Penn Station, and had to wait for the next one. It was frustrating because neither the concierge nor front desk staff seemed able to help us. This departure experience is the only reason I didn't give it a five star rating. Otherwise it was generally a positive stay, and I would almost certainly give it another chance when we return to NYC.

We stayed in this hotel for Chritmas holidays with our kids. The penthouse room at the 20th floor was perfect for a family of 4, and very clean and modern. The hotel is well located in the heart of manhattan. It is a shame our experience ended up so badly. We had left our luggages at the hotel on the last day, and it took the staff over 30 minutes to give our luggages back ! We said we were ready to go and pick them ourselves, but they would not allow us, and we had to wait for the staff to deliver them to us. In the end they nearly insulted us and have been extremely rude when we said we were not happy with the service (we nearly missed our plane because of them). So if you stay there allow extra time to pick your luggages !!!!!

We chose LeSoleil because of its location. We usually stay north of Times Square but wanted to try something south because of the Times Square traffic. LeSoleil was quiet, and within walking distance to the Theater District and dining options, The staff were helpful and friendly and the cost very reasonable. The only downside was that the room was small with little storage space for someone like me who tends to overpack. It seemed almost claustrophobic at times, but we did book the least expensive option so other rooms may be larger. In addition, when you're in NYC, you don't spend much time in your room anyway so the size may not bother most people. All in all it was a good choice for us.

We went to NYC for Christmas last year. We stayed at Executive, I have to admit it was a great experience with some very friendly people at the front desk. Moni at front desk checked us in seamlessly and answered all my 50 questions patiently with a smile, both scarce in Big Apple. If I ever want to visit NYC again I certainly keep this place in mind, only a few blocks from Times Square and close to almost anything.
user_name:
muradkarimi2017
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My wife and I stayed here January 11th and 12th. The property is pretty new, and it shows--a very sleek, economical design that does not spare on good looks. Our room was very comfortable, the bathroom was great, particularly the shower and the bed was very comfortable. Climate control was perfect. We stopped by the bar in the hotel restaurant for cocktails, and that was a great experience as well. A friendly staff, a great location and a wonderful stay all around. We will return.
user_name:
Steve C
Sayville, New York, United States

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is very close to Herald Square and Macy's, handy for the subway and there are several restaurants/ shops nearby to grab a quick breakfast. The rooms were small (typical for New York) but ours had a fantastic view of the Empire State building which was lovely to wake up to. The bathroom was modern and spacious, although the shower pressure wasn't that great! However, this did not get in our way of enjoying our stay. Staff were friendly and helpful for the most part. Must mention Yadira who provided us with a lot of help prior to our visit and went out of her way to make our stay extra special due to two anniversaries being celebrated while we were in NYC. Would recommend this hotel and would happily stay again!

My brother-in-law had stayed here several times with his wife on the recommendation of one of his clients. We stayed at LeSoleil for two nights at my B-I-L's recommendation for a family birthday party in the city. We found at the LeSoleil friendly, helpful staff; a fabulous modern, clean, quiet room; and a wonderful stay. LeSoleil will be the first hotel I consider on our next trip to NYC. The only thing that will make me look elsewhere is if the LeSoleil is full on the dates of our visit.

We won't be reaching the hotel until the 19th January but all I can say is if the pre-arrival service is anything to go by this place is going to be amazing! Yadira has been so patient and incredibly helpful with my booking - and I've been a difficult customer making multiple changes to a group reservation. So helpful, with a really fast response time. Thanks so much - and see you soon! ☺️

From the moment we stepped out of the cab to when we checked out, all of the staff made us feel welcome. Staff were always happy to answer questions and nothing was ever too much bother. The hotel itself is a little gem in this part of town and very convenient for seeing the sights. There are plenty of choices locally for food but the menu and especially the coffee at Trademark and Grind were the best. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and cannot recommend this place enough.

A very nice, modern hotel in a brilliant location, with outstanding service from the staff. Rooms are small, but typical of Manhattan. The attached restaurant, Trademark, is excellent too. We would happily return.Tip 1: the standard rooms are extremely small and if you have more than a couple of suitcases, you might struggle - so the hotel's upgrade offer is worth taking to get a little more space.Tip 2: the Park and Go package is well worthwhile as well, utilising as it does the very close parking building.

Second stay at Executive Hotel LeSoleil. The location is great. Convenient to Penn Station, Times Square, Broadway Theater district, New York Public Library, access to NYC subway lines going every where. The hotel staff is friendly. The rooms are modern and beautifully appointed. Choose the Executive Queen Room for a room on floors 14 and above. If you plan on spending all of your time at the hotel then the Executive Hotel LeSoleil may not be the best choice as the rooms are not that big. But there are options...If you need a little more room pay for those with the small extra living area. For even more space choose one of the penthouse suites.If you need a closet for a lot of clothes you'll probably want to stay somewhere else as your room probably won't have a closet.I paid around $125.00/night.

We were only able to stay for a short time, but in that short time, everything went well and we would definitely stay there again. The hotel has a nice, comfortable lobby and they had some hot apple cider for the guests- which was nice as it was December and a bit chilly outside. The staff was attentive and check in went smoothly. There's a quaint, little cafe adjacent to the hotel which is a bit expensive but the ambiance is nice and it's convenient if you want a bite to eat. If that doesn't suit you, there's plenty around and the hotel is in a great location. The room was a standard size for NYC (so a bit small) but that's to be expected. Overall, it was clean with a friendly atmosphere and we'd definitely stay there again. Oh, and our room had a good view of the city (room 1309)

We had booked the hotel for a week of vacation and Christmas shopping. When we arrived, we were first told to pay a deposit of 400 €. I was told this was customary in New York. The problem with a deposition is that it will take up to a week after you left the hotel before the money is released. I have been to New York many times during the last 25 years without having to pay a deposit. Confirm a credit card number yes. Perhaps the reason is that most of my trips have been in my job and were booked through an agency. I couldn’t remember anything about a deposit in the confirmation we got when we made the booking in June. When I asked what the 400 € was for we were told it was for any damage to the room made by us. It was not he money itself. It was more the lack of information in the reservation process that annoyed me.When we came into the room it was also much smaller than expected. I was almost certain that in the confirmation it was stated 28 sqm. or 301 sqf. I checked the confirmation we got two days before leaving for New York. And to my surprise there was nothing about room size and at the bottom of the confirmation it was stated that we must pay a deposit of 100 € a day or 700 €. On Hotels.com there was now no information about room size. We booked this hotel because the room was of fair size. We must work for some hours even when on vacation. We own a small company that needs some TLC every day. Therefore, the room can’t be too small. We need at least one desk with a chair and an armchair to be able use our laptops. This room was approximately 19 sqm. or 210 sqf. The start of our week in New York wasn’t the best. But it improved. A couple of days later I searched for the first confirmation from Hotels.com. And in that it was clearly stated that we had a booked a room that was 28 sqm. And nothing about a deposit. I told that to the front desk and they promised to look into it. When I came back to room there was a mail from Hotels.com asking about of our first experience with the hotel. I briefly told them about the disappointing room size. I guess it was not the hotel that had misinformed us, it was Hotels.com. But the hotel management reacted promptly. The next day we got a room that was of the expected size. The first room was small but it was like a Swiss army knife. It had all but in a small size. You only had to accept to move around yourself and the luggage as in a slide game. Everything from the air-condition, that it is necessary in such small rom even when it was below zero outside, to the rather large bathroom worked very well. Some small details that we appreciated. A real door to the bathroom, not a glass wall as in the W Hotel at Times Square, an iPhone charger, a coffee machine with decent coffee and a shower you could understand how to maneuver without being an engineer. We are both trained engineers (nuclear and building) but we often have problems with showers in European and some Asian hotels. And a small but very good detail. If you must go to the bathroom during the night you are often blinded by the sharp light in the bathroom. It makes it difficult to find your way back to the bed, even in a small room, without hitting the wrong things or waking up your partner. Here the electrical sockets in the bathroom were equipped with a very small light that was sufficient for doing what you came for and it didn’t ruin your night vision. The room we changed to was also nice and had the size we needed. A small remark though. It had a small extra room with a sofa. I would had been nice with a small table there for drinks or food. The air condition system in the larger room didn’t work very well but they fixed it. Both rooms had wonderful views. The Wi-Fi in both rooms worked perfectly. No complicated log-on routines and enough and speed both down- and upstream. We travel with 2 computers, 2 iPads an and three iPhone that must be in sync. It was a blessing after staying in some German hotels as Steigenberger during the autumn were everything is very complicated and Wi-Fi is almost nonexistence.We didn’t have any breakfast at the hotel since we wanted try out different places each morning. There are so many small establishments serving breakfast near the hotel I don’t think we did found them all during our stay. On some evenings, we had to work late in the room instead of going out for dinner. It was very easy to find places near the hotel where we could buy a couple of sandwiches even at midnight. If it had been small table in the room, we might have considered food from room service. But now having a sandwich was the easiest solution. We had wine in the bar one evening. Wine is very expensive in New York even compared with Sweden where we come from. But both the bar and the wine were nice so it is only to accept.The staff was friendly and professional. The location is perfect. Near at least two subway lines, a lot of restaurants of all kinds, more shops than you need and in walking distance of all the sights in Midtown. It is an also good starting point for longer walks to for example having lunch at Sylvia’s on 125 st. or to Chelsea Market along The High Line. After some misunderstandings at the beginning of our stay we liked the hotel. We will probably choose Executive Hotel LeSoleil next time in New York.

I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights over the Christmas holidays, and was completely satisfied with my visit. The folks at the front desk and concierge were very helpful, and while the room itself was rather on the small size, the washroom was quite large, and the bed was comfortable. One thing i appreciated, and i may have just gotten lucky, i found my floor very quiet, despite the hotel being booked solid. As mentioned in other posts, the location is great; easy access to public transit, and just a couple of short blocks from Bryant Park. Considering the holidays, I believe I got a good price for the room, and based on value, i would certainly stay at Executive Le Soleil again.

Stayed at the Hotel Le Soleil in NYC over the 2016 Christmas period and found it to be a great hotel. Was very fortunate to have had a larger sized room, which provided for all that extra space..when traveling not so lightly. Room had a very comfy bed, with an average sized modern bathroom (rainfall shower) and a great lounge space with TV. Found the housekeeping team to be very nice, and really appreciated the nice notes that were left each day after they had visited and serviced the room. Equally impressive were the two gentleman on the door; both of whom were friendly and attentive at all times. The only issue I had with the hotel was the gentleman at concierge, who seemed to be lacking a screw..or as one would say " had a loose screw". At each time my partner and I passed by his little booth he was deeply fixated on texting or seemed to be showing a great disinterest in helping the heavy flow of hotel traffic; whether it be smiling or lending a hand holding/opening a door..he was rather inactive. At one stage I did see a lady with a few heavy suitcases trying to grapple her bags and hold the door open all at once.. and he seemed to be far more interested in texting (may have been on Tinder- who knows) then to throw an arm out and help her. I do realize it may have not been in his job description but certainly when you are sitting in a concierge booth 3 feet from the main door..you send a strong first/last impression when guests enter and leave. I have only made mention of this gentleman after reading previous reviews that like mine draw attention to the exceptional service that this man "brings" to the table.........All in all, I would certainly recommend Paul and the team's premises to any traveller. It's situated in a great location, presents as a very clean and modern hotel and delivers in regards to providing for an enjoyable base in the big apple.

I stayed here with my teenage son and mother for 6 nights from 14 December and was so pleased with my choice. Having researched many hotels and having previously stayed in Times Sq, the location of the Le Soleil was perfect, it is located between 5th & 6th Ave, around the corner from Empire State and Macys and was extremely quiet despite being centrally located within the heart of Manhattan. First of all, the staff here are lovely, always offering a smile. In particular, Eddie was a gem, imparting his local knowledge of places to eat, and Chris on reception always friendly and with a permanent smile. I feel that you always get the best out of people by treating them with respect, they do an outstanding job in what can probably be at times, quite challenging, trying to appease people who must have nothing better to do than moan.Our bedroom (we booked the Elan Suite) suited us perfectly. It has 2 bedrooms and is located on the 20th floor overlooking 36th Street. Yes, it perhaps could benefit from a few more hooks and shelves in the bathroom but there was nothing that detracted the overall enjoyment of our holiday. The room was warm (it was extremely cold during our visit), clean and comfortable, what more could you ask for. The rate paid was in line with NY standards, this is a popular and expensive destination and therefore hotel prices have to reflect this. Upon our departure, Eddie organised a car to take us back to JFK which although slightly dearer than a yellow cab (only about $10), it was well worth it. Had I known, I would have contacted the hotel before our arrival to arrange this from JFK as the journey was far more comfortable going back than it was coming.Overall, we had a wonderful stay, the staff do a excellent job and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

We booked a room with a city view; however upon arrival the room was small and the view was awful (definitely not a view of the city). The clerk on duty (Moni) heard our concerns and immediately researched and researched again until finally finding us a room with a view of the city. Customer service was excellent but the bathroom need more counter space (too small).

Had the chance to stay on this hotel for 1 friday night, before leaving the country.Got the room on sale so l've been assigned on a low floor and didn't get any upgrade so can't comment about the view.Overall great location, room size's was okay and so were amenities, it was missing hot water occasionally, therefor 4 stars and not 5.

Stayed 7 nights at this hotel.Arrived late at night, got a room we were not happy with the living area of ​​the suite consisted of an Ikea armchair in a closet.We complained to the receptionist who really made an effort to help us.However, there were no rooms available that night so we had to promise that they would check on it the next morning. We got vouchers for caffe shop as consolation.Next morning there was a similar service minded receptionist who swung a new room in 1704 we were very happy with. Thank you for the very good service.The hotel was classically decorated and nice. Location was very good, close to a lot including Macy's, Time Square, Avenue 5 mm. Also close to the subway.Some people in the surrounding area, maybe next time we take a hotel in such Chelsey or similar. Very touristy.Housekeeping was quite late, we thought some days 16:00, but they cleaned very well.A little warning for those who arrange transportation to the airport, the company does not belong to the hotel and was a little fishy.The lady who stood insisted that we would show the pin code and even wrap our whole number, so we blocked the card after this. Suspected skimmning we thought.Unfortunately the hotel rooms in New York overpriced, you get little for the price, it applies to any hotel there.

Just stayed 3 nights at this Fabulous hotel in the heart of NYC.Great location on 36th street just off 5th ave and close to all the favorite sights. Stay here at Le Soleil you will meet the friendliest staff ever and warm hospitality. The prices are right and so are the rooms. Job well done LSNYC!

Celebrated our wedding anniversary in NYC and stayed at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil. The concierge service we received at the hotel was outstanding including a special pre-arranged in-room rose petal/champagne presentation upon our arrival...a true 5-star experience!

A nice surprise as I stayed in this hotel during a business trip. It is located very close walking distance to most of the NY attractions. The hotel is a well managed small hotel. It has nice amenities with nice restaurant and a bar. The rooms are small but adequate and well decorated. The rooms are quite and very clean. Highly recommended.

My husband and I visited NYC in December last year and stayed at a different hotel to this one near times square. That one had a very fancy lobby and much sharper interiors in the common areas; however the rooms themselves were tired, a little grubby and very unloved. The reason I mention this as it was impossible not to compare the two hotels when we arrived on 9th December this year at LeSoleil. The street itself is quieter but so close to Macy's so a fab location. It's a much lower-key hotel, the lobby is quite unassuming and underwhelming but still warm and inviting.The bedroom was located on the opposite side to the street so was very quiet, no outside noise whatsoever. You can see the Empire State building out of the window (although it's not quite the 'city view' to get carried away with). The room was tiny. Much more suited to a business trip for one person (in hindsight we should have asked for a larger room with all our luggage but couldn't be bothered!). It was definitely a squeeze but the amenities were brand new, very clean and modern. The bathroom (shower particularly!) was wonderful after a long day sight-seeing (although the door to it slides rather than opens and was quite noisy sometimes).On the whole, the staff were helpful and friendly. We weren't pleased that arriving back on our first day at 4pm that the room had not been serviced so made this known to reception. There were no issues after that and they gave us 10 dollars each off breakfast the next day.The main thing I liked about this hotel (as it's a major bugbear of mine) was how quiet it was. The room doors were soft closing (how does every hotel not have those! What's worse than hearing slamming doors all day/night?!) and there aren't many rooms per floor so noise is minimal.I would visit again as overall we had a very pleasant stay!

Small room -- no ! Lack of storage -- no ! The 2 things I was wary of after reading reviews turned out to be okay . After a long flight Moni checked us in and it was uphill all the way ! The Door team were great and even Maintainance Eric looked relaxed as he was on a job ! Trademark was busy ,noisy but served good , well presented , modern food - it is a young person spot but still worth a visit.A wee downside -- the housekeeping is done by Contract staff so it is not nor will it ever be perfect. One mistake however was rectified and we were given a nicely written note of apology , first rate resonse ! To sum up , a first rate location , a willing Team and a " good " feel made this a great stay , I also booked direct and was never offered the huge prices some complainers refer to -- so , BOOK DIRECT !!
user_location: El Fondo de les Neus, Spain
user_name:
leonspain
El Fondo de les Neus, Spain

review_body: This was our first visit to NYC. We researched many hotel options the city has to offer and decided on Executive Hotel LeSoleil. We were not disappointed! The hotel is beautiful, modern and staffed by welcoming, friendly individuals who seem to enjoy their jobs and are attentive to guests. The fireplace room next to the lobby was cozy and beautifully decorated for Christmas and a wonderful place to enjoy a morning cup of delicious coffee from Trademark Grind, located adjacent to the hotel. Our family (2 adults, 2 adult children) stayed 4 nights in room 1604 and had a lovely view of the MetLife building. The room didn't have much storage area or a closet, but we were fine living out of suitcases for a few days. Nice tolietries, bathrobes, Keurig coffee machine and the mini bar were nice additions, as was the very spacious bathroom. The bed, pillows and linens were very comfortable and very welcoming after long days walking throughout the city. The location was fantastic! We walked to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Central Park, Trump Tower and shopping on 5th Avenue. Easy subway access is close by at 34th St/Herald Square. We had considered spending more for a hotel in Times Square, but after visiting that area, we were happy we had chosen Executive Hotel LeSoleil instead. We found it to be close to everything, but less chaotic and crowded than Times Square. It felt more like coming home to a comfortable, relaxing place-a nice respite from the busy world of the city, crowds and holiday season. We enjoyed great NY pizza from several nearby restaurants, donuts at Planet Donut and pastries from Ferrara's Italian Bakery & Cafe. We ate at the Keg Room across the street from the hotel, and while it might be fine for drinks, I would not recommend it for dinner. Mediocre food and extremely poor customer service from our server. I wish we would have opted for the hotel restaurant instead. We found Executive Hotel LeSoleil exceeded our expectations and would highly recommend it, especially to first time NYC visitors who are not familiar with the area. We would definitely stay here again! Thank you to the management and staff for providing top notch service. We hope to see you again soon!
user_name:
Shari S
New Smyrna Beach, Florida

review_body: Outrageous prices...only location and the courteous and accommodating treatment of Lilly at the front desk made it worthwhile. We were fortunate to get an upgrade to a mini-suite that make the $500 per night a little less painful.Avoid the rude treatment of the ladies at the restaurante.

There are several options in this area, but the Executive is the way to go. The location is right in midtown, in walking distance to many attractions and shopping with easy access to the subway to get you anywhere you need to go. There are plenty of food options close by, but you may want to stay in and head to Trademark which is attached to the hotel. As others have noted the rooms are on the small side with limited storage so you may need to get creative, but if you spring for a city view room (which you should), you won't care. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff are great and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

I cannot praise this hotel enough! They helped me propose to my partner and made the experience no only easy but feel very special! The staff were so friendly and helpful and the hotel was in the best location.

Lovely updated, modern hotel very conveniently located. Be sure to request a room on an upper floor as traffic noise was an issue. Rooms are nicely sized by NYC standards, and everything was super clean and well maintained. I would definitely stay there again.

It's a nice place to stay, but nothing fancy. The bed was squeaky, the walls were scuffed etc. The room was clean and the bar/restaurant is good. The location is pretty good as well. For the right price I would go there again.

The location of this hotel was perfect as it was centrally located for walking exploration,yet off the beaten track . We stayed on the 16 floor and heard very little street noise. The elevators(2) were a little slow to respond but nothing out of the ordinary for NYC. The rooms were small ,yet well kept and nicely furnished. The bathroom was larger than the norm. We had a nice view of the Empire State Building from our window.The staff were exceptionally courteous and helpful throughout our stay.

We stayed December 1-3, 2016Upon returning home, I wrote an email to the corporate manager and hotel manager. I waited for over a week to hear from them before I wrote this review. Seems they just don’t care.Please read all that happened, and decide for yourself if you think staying at this hotel is worth the risk. We booked this hotel based on the good reviews and location.The room originally assigned to us was so small. As soon as I walked in, I wanted to cry. After talking to the front desk, we were assigned a new room, 1201. It was the same room, but with an extra sitting room added. The sitting area only had ONE chair for one person, so we used the area for our luggage and clothes. There is not a closet, but a rack and only enough room and hangers to hang coats so we unfortunately had to live out of our suitcases for three days. The room was nothing exciting. The bath layout was nice. The room needed hooks or other options for your clothing. The view was an office building directly across, you could see people working inside.We got a good night’s sleep, it was very quiet there. After showering in the morning, I could not find the hairdryer. So I had to call for one, a little inconvenience, but nothing major.Saturday morning, before we left for the day, we put the dirty towels on the floor as directed by the sign in the bathroom. We got back to our room around 3:00 pm to get ready to go out for the evening and left again around 5 pm. We got back to our room around 11:30 pm, and our room had NOT been cleaned or refreshed! We called the front desk. No one answered, so I went down. Aida said that she was sorry and would send someone up with towels, shampoo and coffee. She offered me tickets for a free breakfast. I didn’t accept the tickets as we wouldn’t have time in the morning. She asked when we were leaving and I told her around 10. She said breakfast started at 8. But she didn’t understand that we didn’t want to take the time out for breakfast before we left on our seven hour drive. Aida then offered us $50 off for the night. I said that was fine. I was just tired, wanted a shower and needed towels, shampoo and coffee. I went back up to the room and we waited for 30 minutes, and NO ONE came with our supplies. My husband called back down to the desk and we were told it was on it’s way up to us. Five or so minutes, a man came to the door with a very nice and “sincere” apology saying he forgot. He handed the items to my husband and left. My husband put the towels on the bed. There were three towels, no wash cloths or hand towels and one towel was dirty or stained! Wrapped in the towels were at least 5 coffee packs and NO shampoo! I was so upset, I went to bed and left in the morning without a shower.At check out we met Chris. I told him what had happened and handed him the towel. I also told him about the mug and how we never did get any shampoo. I asked for the Manager but he said she would not arrive until 10. It was about 9 am and we wanted to leave. He could tell I was upset and I was trying to be as nice as possible. He politely only charged us for two nights. This was a vacation that we had been looking forward to for months. It is far from a Luxury Hotel as advertised. This hotel did not meet our expectations of an upscale boutique hotel. I understand that people aren’t perfect, jobs are hard, especially working in the hotel industry. But this was unacceptable. Inoel, Kevin, Lilly, Aida and Chris were super nice! They were professional, friendly and seemed to take their jobs very seriously and I wish them success and happiness. They would be a great asset to any fine hotel. To sum it up, the ball was dropped in housekeeping. Dirty towels, dirty rooms, garbage not removed, mugs washed in the room and neglect to replenish the guest’s amenities, guests coming back to their rooms in the evening to an untouched room, are too important to be neglected. I was told that the hotel policy was for the used glasses and mugs to be washed in the dishwasher.Do you want to come back to your hotel room at 11:30 at night to a dirty room, live out of your suitcase, sleep with garbage and use mugs and glasses that are washed out in the bathroom after the last guest? Not what you would expect at a hotel at this price. Not what one would expect at $3-400 a night! Sure, I'm glad I only had to pay for two nights. But it still wasn't worth it and spoiled a big part of my vacation.. And NO apology or explanation from management. Next time, we're going back to a Kimpton Hotel.

This was my third trip to NYC but my first time ever staying in this hotel. I must say from the time that we checked in until we left we received first class service here. As soon as our cab arrived from the airport we were greeted by a very friendly bell hop who proceeded to grab our bags and carry them inside the hotel. Check-in was quick and all the front desk personnel were very courteous and helpful. Since there were 4 of us we booked a room that would accommodate 4 adults. Our room had two king size beds as well as a very large bathroom. We also had another small area which contained a small fridge as well as a mirror and outlets which allowed someone to get ready here when the bathroom was occupied. The shower had excellent water pressure and was quite roomy as well. The overall condition of the hotel including the lobby, room, restaurant, etc., appeared to be relatively new and well maintained. Overall, I really can't think of an area which I was not satisfied in. I will definitely stay here on my return trip(s) to NYC.

My stay on December 11th was very nice the workers all were friendly.. Never not a frown or attitude.. I felt comforted and safe and cozy. One worker stood out the most name Kevin. He was this nice sweet handsome Jamaican with a lovely voice. Thank you Kevin for taking a picture with me on my way out on my last day.

For our first time to NYC we wanted to stay some place affordable and nice. After much searching on the web we found Le Soliel and booked our room for 3 December nights.We arrived in the evening and were warmly greeted. Upon check in the type of room we had booked wasn't available so Guest services rep Chris Pro moved us up a couple of floors, And in NYC the higher your room the better your view. While our view was decent it was on the opposite side of the Empire State Building. So I went down and asked Chris if we could move the next day. He assured me a room with a nicer view for our final 2 nights. When I went to the desk in the morning Chris and Luis made sure that I knew the room number of our new room (1701 highly recommended) and asked me to have our things ready to be moved before we left for the day. We returned to our new room with all of our luggage in place and had a wonderful view of the ESB. These guys went above and beyond to please us!Oh and the room was comfortable, in a great location as far as food, transportation, convenience stores and site seeing. I highly recommend staying with Le Soliel if you are ever in NYC.

This boutique Hotel has everything I want or need for my visit to NYC. Friendly staff, clean rooms, and a great location..This is my 3rd time staying here in 2 years and I highly recommend it. The hotel is within walking distance to Penn Station and has such a great vibe.. Love it!!

Moni is defeinitely a great person at Front desk at this hotel, made the check in process happy and interesting. She was smiling and cooperative and friendly, made the check in proces interesting and added great impression of the hotel.

We had a great stay at the Hotel LeSoleil in New York City. The hotel is seems very new and modern. The room wasn't big but it was well appointed and very comfortable. Moni at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful and Eddie and Chris at the front door were very helpful and always there to open the door and answer any questions. We also ate at the Trademark restaurant next door which was very good. It had the best french fries we've had in years and the hamburger was also very good. The location of this hotel is outstanding and close to Times Square, Greenwich Village, we even walked to Central Park. We would recommend highly and feel it was a good value.

I recommend it. Great staff, great area to stay! Close to Macy`s, Lord & Taylor (wheew, expensive and pretty!), a fifteen minute walk to Times Square, the Hotel is directly in front of Empire State building. We stayed at the 19th floor. The room was small, indeed, but the bath was amazing. Friendly cleaners, tip them! 4/5. Close to 4.5 / 5.

This hotel is very nice. The employees are great and the location is fantastic. My room was great. Comfy bed, excellent shower/bathroom, and perfect AC. The only downside is the hotel is a little pricey. If you can swing the cost it is a very nice place to stay.

Staff was friendly and professional. Hotel was was very clean and well kept. Our room was cozy and anyone who knows the cost of real estate in NYC will know why the rooms are on the smaller size. Everything else more than makes up for the size. The hotel is in a great location, conveniently located close to many sights and the subway. We highly recommend!!!

A chic new hotel in the center of manhatten. The location is perfect between shopping distric and party areas like chelsea and meatpacking district. The decor is stylish, the rooms for new yorker conditions large and the staff friendly and attentive. Especially Yaya cares reliably and particularly nicely for all wishes of the guests

My husband and I stayed here from November 6-10th this year. This was our first trip to NYC and we loved this hotel and the staff. The room was very nice and spacious. We had a Queen Suite w/View which had a small sitting area included with a 2nd TV. The only negative about this area is that I wish they would have had a small love seat or chair with ottoman. They had 2 chairs which were like large versions of a dining room chair. We didn't spend that much time in our room so it wasn't an issue. I used it as an area for our suitcases and changing clothes. There were floor to ceiling windows which were nice. The view was OK, We weren't facing any landmark buildings. We were in a corner room and there were 8 rooms per floor I believe. The hotel was nice and quiet. We were on the 17th Floor and facing the east. The hotel is on 36th and 6th which was a great location for us in Midtown. Close to shopping and other attractions. We walked a lot and it was great. Far enough from the bright lights and noise of Times Square. I will say there is not much room to hang clothes at all. Bring things that you can leave in your suitcase. There was a mini bar and refrigerator in the room. I'd recommend buying your own beverages and keeping them in the room. The 1 liter Smart Water from the hotel is $8/bottle. There is a CVS just a few blocks away and we bought water from there during our stay.I was a little nervous about coming to NYC for the first time. We flew into LaGuardia and I arranged a private shuttle to and from the airport for our stay through the hotel. Total cost was $130. The first shuttle was an older van which was quite old. The shuttle back to the airport was nicer. I will say that I felt safe with both of our drivers. This made it much easier than trying to find a cab or Uber as well. It didn't cost that much more than a taxi would of based on my research.Before we arrived I contacted the hotel with some requests and Yadira was the primary contact and she was EXCELLENT! She went out of her way to make sure we were taken care of during our stay. We ate in the hotel restaurant for breakfast one morning and it was very good. The small coffee shop was OK, nothing special, but convenient. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful during our stay. We will definitely stay here again when we return to NYC!

I rarely take the time to write a review but wanted to pass on a special thank you to Ms. Yadira Aviles who assisted my family with fulfilling all of our room requests. Her service was prompt and took the time to ensure that all our needs were met. New hotel, great location to all sites, and very, very, reasonable rates. Thank you

The hotel is in a great location for Macy's, public transport and sight seeing. The room was well decorated, as was the rest of the hotel was. Our room (Executive King) was small, with no where to put the suitcases, clothes or even stuff in the bathroom. We also had to request a hairdryer which had gone missing and for new shampoo on the second day, we did get both in the end. The service was OK, not amazing for the price.

Stayed here for our 15 yr wedding anniversary and asked about upgrading room. Moni and Aida at front desk were so friendly and helped me out big time. This hotel is in a fabulous area too! We would definitely stay here again when we visit NYC again.

Great location for the Thanksgiving day parade 2016 - 1 block away from parade route. Room was too small for 4 adults, would recommend 2 rooms instead. Front desk service was great, asked for extra blanket, and it arrived within a few minutes. Close to shopping, and plenty of food options.

The location is great! Walking distance from Time Square, next to the subway!The room was very small, we had 3 luggage and we had to close them and stand them up to pass on the other side of the bed. However it was very clean and the amenities were excellent!They should change a Russian concierge as we tried to book a tour and she couldn't help us evrn for the basic. Totally unhelpful!!!!!

Hotel is well situated in midtown and close to broadway. Rooms are smart, modern, and clean. The front desk staff, Dr Dre, Inoel, and especially Moni, are the most helpful, friendly, and welcoming I have been served by. Moni went out of her way to get my 2 week stay off to a great start!

My husband and I recently spent a weekend Le Soleil and enjoyed efficient and friendly service from the staff. After attempting to resolve a credit card issue with our 3rd party travel provider prior to our stay, Yadira (reservations) took special care to ensure that our reservation was not cancelled and even had a welcome surprise awaiting us upon check in. Our room was comfortable, well-appointed, and quite large by NY standards. The location was perfect with Penn Station and the Herald Square subway stop each just a couple of blocks away, as we spent time in Brooklyn and saw football game at the Meadowlands.

Thoroughly enjoyed this hotel all the staff were polite, helpful and informative. I found it to be great value for money and to have amazing decor and services available 24/7. Would highly recommend this hotel

Our first night in New York and what a perfect place to start.Great location , On arrival you know its going to be good it feels sumptuous and warm as soon as you enter the lobby. Lovely Bar & Dining area, Beautifully clean rooms, lovely staff what more could you ask for  i will return .

My friends and I arrived ridiculously early (around 8am) to the hotel. They took our bags and let us wait in the lobby until a room became available (around 2:30pm). We were really tired and hoping to get a room earlier but understood that check out was later. To pass some time, we decided to have breakfast at the hotel. The place is beautiful, but the food was not good and a bit overpriced. Besides the breakfast, everything else about the hotel was great! It's walking distance to major city attractions like Times Square and it's surrounded by places to eat. The room was nice and clean. I didn't hear too much of the traffic outside. When it came time to checkout, one of my friends forgot her juice in the mini fridge so we called the hotel to check if it was still there and it was! We came back hours later and they kept it refrigerated for her. It meant a lot for them to do that considering it was just juice. So thank you to the hotel staff for being exceptional!

My wife and I have stayed in NY many times over the past few years and this lovely friendly Boutique Hotel proved a great option. We had an executive queen room room up on the 19th floor with a stunning view of the Empire State Building and the Freedom Tower. The room was compact (typical of Manhattan) but beautifully designed and superbly appointed. The tv is great and the coffee machine a definite plus. We loved the spacious bathroom with walk in shower and by the end of our stay loved the hotel and would consider returning ( if we got the right deal) In our opinion it compares favorably with the Row, Omni Berkshire and even The Grand Hyatt. The area around the hotel is great Macy's is just round the corner The Keg Room is across the street and several eating places and takeouts are in walking distance. The subway is one block away. For us it was a perfect stay staff were really helpful - especially Duty Manager Luis who helped us with our return transfer.

Everything about this hotel was really great - the price, the location, the staff, cleanliness. Th only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because, for us, the pictures were a little deceiving, I live here in Manhattan so I understand space issues - but the rooms were incredibly small. They were beautiful, clean, and comfortable, but very small. We got a 2 bed room to share with another couple and it was quite uncomfortable. That being said, everything else about the place was great. We ordered seamless (a few times) throughout the night and the desk staff was happy to accept the food for us. Tip - make sure you bring water/ snacks they stock the room but you have to pay for it. Someone drank the bottle of water in our room and my credit card was charged $8 for the one bottle of water -_-
user_name:
Jt214
New York City, New York

review_body: Great place to stay in NewYork. Location is perfect but quite.Room was superb, gym is small and nice and you have a great bed (and a safe) at room. 2 minutes walk to a subway or just by foot to anywhere in Manhattan.Loved it!

Stayed at this hotel because it was around the corner from Gotham Hall where I attended an event, it was great just to walk to the location. It has modern rooms space oriented as space is rare in NYC, great value for the money, I enjoyed my stay. The staff at the hotel were the best and went out of their way for me on several occasions, I have never received such great service even at a 5 star hotel. I am always of the belief that people are the most important asset in a business and these guys were great. If you are looking for great value and good service and if you have business in this area, I recommend this hotel.

Executive Hotel Le Soleil is close to all attractions we wanted to walk to during this visit. It is a hotel that is "One-year fresh" from the entrance, to the lobby with fireplace, to the restaurant/bar, to the layout and the newness of our room. The staff was incredibly helpful, friendly and professional, especially when confronted by an unusual exterior situation that affected arrivals and departures to the hotel. The valets were superb. The bar manager and bartender were knowledgeable about their product. One suggestion: It would be nice if the restaurant stayed open from breakfast through lunch. We will definitely look to book a stay here in the future.

We appreciated the good location and the nice sized room, but unfortunately there were WAY TOO MANY missteps and poor follow through from multiple hotel staff. I had to report relatively minor, but not insignificant concerns -- clogged bathtub drain and a clunky/squeaky door -- every day for the entire stay and the situation was completely ignored. The "business center" (two desktops with a nonfunctional printer) was essentially a staff lounge and I was told to "go back to the front desk". Some of the desk staff tried to be responsive, but after an e-mail exchange with the General Manager (after check out), it seems that disrespectful customer service is something the staff learned from management.

I had a quick overnight stay at the hotel. The staff were all very friendly, even at the late hour. I enjoyed a most comfortable night. I have no complaints at all and would certainly stay again. Thanks.

Really central business hotel with super nice staff. We booked at the last minute using Expedia points, but the lovely concierges, manager and valets were all so attentive. A really central location, really close to Penn Station.

This was my 1st hotel stay in N.Y. I really enjoyed it because the staff made sure my comfort as a guest was worth it. Yes, indeed it was. They helped me every way possible and the room was so clean and gorgeous.

After reading many reviews for NYC hotels we chose this one for our recent 4 night stay. We opted for the Queen Suite with view having been to NYC before and knowing that rooms tend to be on the small size. We weren't expecting it to be a 'Vegas Sized' suite but it was big enough for our needs and the separate seating area allowed us to store away our suitcases easily. We were on the 19th floor facing the opposite side to the Empire State Building, so we could see out towards the Met Life building and various other skyscrapers.The bed was comfy enough and we had 2 TV's although we did only use the separate seating area for luggage storage so never used the 2nd TV.There is very little draw and hanging space so we had to be creative in where we placed our clothing and I was disappointed that the shower was over the bath as oppose to being a separate shower.When we arrived it was raining heavily so were thankful for the umbrella that was hanging in the room. It wasn't until we came back in the evening that we noticed the umbrella was on the mini bar menu for $15!! We placed it back and was not charged upon check out. The only other gripe I have is the complete lack of shower gel in the room. I did ask at reception for some to be brought up but it never materialised so I went out and bought my own.We never ate at the hotel so can't comment on the food but all the staff we encountered were helpful and courteous. The bar downstairs was good for drinks and the hotel has many close bars and restaurants, although all of Manhattan is easily accessible by cab or subway (or good old fashioned walking), due to the hotels central location.The hotel offer an airport shuttle through a 3rd party which we took back to JFK and it was on time and very reasonably priced @ $25 each.I'd stop there again if booking a Midtown hotel

After checking into my room I received a knock on my door because they thought the room wasn't ready, which it was. I then received a phone call to say someone smelled smoke outside my room I DO NOT SMOKE, The call was accusatory and scolding. I insisted the person calling me come up to the room and check for herself . She did and said she might have smelled smoke,but not sure and not about to say she was misled or in the wrong.That evening I returned to my room and found an apology note, small chocolates, bottled water and a $10 gift certificate. The next day I returned to my room late afternoon and my room wasn't cleaned. Spoke to the woman checking the minibar and she arranged to have someone clean it. This took about 30 minutes. Went out again only to return and find the elevators not working and had to walk 8 flights to my room.Would I stay here again, absolutely not.

This is my third time at Le Soleil. It is a very nice, beautifully decorated hotel. I booked the smallest room which worked fine for one person, but I'd recommend a larger room for two people. The bathroom was really large with a great marble shower. The entire room was clean and modern. The bed was very comfortable and the floor to ceiling windows are nice -- the view of the skyline is great.The staff was great including the front desk. Eddie at the front door is incredibly helpful and nice - truly cares about the guests and goes out of his way to assist. While I was waiting for a ride, I saw him help a man find his phone and welcome quite a few guests and their luggage to the hotel - without skipping a beat. He's a gem!  Like other reviewers, I note that the modular furniture does not allow for much hanging and storage space - especially in the standard queen size room. If you are at the hotel for more than a few days, it probably will not be sufficient space, especially for more than one person.As a woman who travels on business frequently, I appreciate a secure and well run hotel. That's why I've stayed here several times since it opened. I had breakfast in the hotel restaurant with a guest and enjoyed it -- not inexpensive (as is true of most hotels) but very nice. With my room, I received a certificate good for a coffee and muffin in the take out area - also very nice. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Penn Station and very conveniently located.

Location is great if you are taking the train to or from Penn Station. The standard queen room was tiny but modern, new, clean and comfortable. The room had big windows, lots of natural light and a lovely view of the city. Space is tight but used efficiently. There is barely any space on the floor for your suitcase (though there is a suitcase rack) and very little closet space but the room is well equipped with coffee maker, iron and ironing board, plus an umbrella (a nice touch). The Queen bed is very comfortable. The electric outlets are few and not well placed but adequate. The bathroom is spacious but could use more counter space for toiletries. Free wifi is fast enough. Staff is very friendly and helpful. There are also two computers plus a printer in the basement for guest use. Overall it's a very comfortable and convenient hotel to stay. It's great for a solo trip, I wouldn't put more than one person in the standard room though. It'll be too cramped.
user_name:
TWGirl
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I selected the Executive Hotel LeSoleil for our 8 night late October NYC stay after reading many many reviews and matching it for location and price. We ended up paying $2990 including all taxes for a "Queen Suite with a View". That meant the room would have an extra sitting area separate from the bedroom and be on a floor 13 or above with a view. The room had all of that. I had made a call prior to the stay and based on a previous review asked for Yadira in order to get a room with a view of the Empire State building. We did get that but other than that you can't see much other than rooftops from where we were. No big deal, although they may have better views facing Broadway, not sure. At any rate here is what I thought.The Good: The staff was friendly. Upon going into the room I immediately called housekeeping to request two extra pillows and extra hangers and they were brought up right away. The room was clean (see the bad for details), The bed was comfy, The windows opened for fresh air, the street noise was not an issue. The bathroom was large and the shower was really good (other than the fact it was a tub shower, which I never understand, who takes a bath in a hotel anyway unless its a Jacuzzi tub) Free WIFI which was excellent. There is a small fridge, sink and Keurig in the room. There are plenty of places to grab a snack things to bring back to the room on the same block as the hotel. We didn't try the Restaurant on the first floor during our stay.The Strange: So the "sitting room" that made this into "a suite" was an alcove across from the bathroom with one single chair and a table. There was also a 2nd TV across from the chair next to the bathroom door. When I first saw this, It thought it was hysterical that they called this a "suite". Although I still think it is a poor excuse for a "suite" it actually came in handy at night when my wife was ready to go to sleep and I could sit in this alcove and watch TV or read my tablet without disturbing her. (low volume or closed captions on the TV.) The door to the closet was so close to the bed that I always had to wait for my wife to get away from sitting on the bed in order to get into the closet.The Bad, but not terrible: The only Ice machine is on the 2nd floor. With only 2 elevators and no service elevator for the maids, going down 16 floors to get Ice was only worth the trip once.
