I didn't find out until the last day they would have brought Ice up to the room if you called to ask.It didn't matter if we left the room at 8am or 11am, if we came back around 3pm to rest up before going out to dinner and a play or such, the room was never made up yet. We would have to tell the desk on our way out for dinner and it would be made up by the time we got back after our evening outing. Most evenings they did do a good job of cleaning the room, but one night, (funny enough a night I complained about the issue of never having the room clean when we return at 3 or so) they left chocolates as a "sorry" gesture but forgot to clean the dishes or replenish the coffee. The location is not really a "bad" but I thought I would note that even though it is in walking distance from all the shows and Penn Station, the nearest Subway is 2 blocks and Broadway and most Shows are about 1/2 mile to 1 mile. Overall, we were pleased with the Hotel. If there is another trip, I would consider it or something slightly better location wise.

We stayed here for a weeks holiday with our teenage daughter. We organised a few bits through the concierge before we arrived and unfortunately the private transfer from the hotel didn't turn up which after a long flight was a real disappointment but in fairness may not have been the hotels fault and they did do a full refund. The hotel was lovely with a fantastic location which is very central. We had a queen executive suite which was perfect for the 3 of us. The only drawback was lack of space for clothes but we managed and we were hardly there anyway. The room was immaculately clean and the bed super comfortable! Eddie and his colleague were fantastic. The concierge team certainly weren't as knowledgeable and helpful as Eddie and his colleagues. The front desk staff were great and very accommodating. The cafe was lovely and even had gluten free cookies unlike it seems the rest of NY! The bar was lovely with great staff. Will def stay again and would recommend. Thank you from the 3 of us

This hotel is in a great location in NYC. I just booked a few rooms and Yadira the woman booking the reservation was unbelievably helpful. She understood what my reservation requirements were and made a stressful situation into an absolute pleasure. I would book this hotel again for business.
user_name:
aig731
New York City, New York

review_body: Excellent service, very nice rooms and lovely informal bar and restaurant. No room service, but they will prepare meals for you to collect. Highly recommended if staying in Manhattan for either business or pleasure

I've stayed at this hotel twice over the last few months when visiting NYC on business. The staff are friendly, playful, and welcoming. The rooms are sleek with awesome views. My first room provided such a close up view of the Empire State Building that I needed to lay down on the floor to see the top! Last—and definitely not least—the breakfast in the cafe downstairs is superior. I will definitely be staying here again during my visits to NYC in the future.

I was so impressed I rebooked for two more visits. Great location near two main subway lines so I could get anywhere in Manhattan for just the price of a subway pass. Tiny but well-planned room with decent view. Very quiet, just what I asked for. I'll return!

I booked several rooms at Executive Hotel LeSoleil for a guest traveling to New York from all over the world for an important meeting. From the moment I made contact with the hotel (two weeks prior to our arrival), the staff was very helpful, patient and most professional, even as I continued to request adjustments and additional rooms as our needs continued to changed. Still, the front desk staff and sales manager were very organized and even provided me with a confirmed and accurate list of all the guest names and arrival/departure dates. When the guests arrived, they were able to check in without a problem and they were VERY pleased with their rooms. When I entered my room, I was pleasantly pleased at how immaculate and beautiful it was -- the perfect oasis to relax in prior to and after an important event. I would definitely stay at this hotel again during business or personal visits. The accommodations and service were outstanding and helped make our visit to NYC a wonderfully inviting experience.
user_name:
Vicki R
North Carolina, United States

review_body: Perfect location.Queen room is tiny, you can barely open suitcases; When you open the door you encounter your suitcase. No storage space and no bath (shower only). When we arrived we had an issue to resolve; whilst the night receptionist was willing to assist, the morning one had attitude and was impatient. There have been cases of stained bed linen and towel. Lower rooms where there is no noise, there is no view.

Ok, I check into this hotel a little after 3pm. I go up to my room, hang out the do not disturb sign, and start to get ready for my evening. By 5:30 pm, there's a note outside my door saying that housekeeping was unable to make up my room. I think that it's odd that housekeeping needs to get into my room an hour after I just checked in. I assume it's a mistake, and throw the notice away. I go out to meet colleagues at another hotel (where they are staying). We have such a productive meeting, I don't return to my room until after breakfast the next day. So I go to my room to make sure I have all my stuff, and a house-keeper jumps at me, What are you doin? she asks aggressively. I explain to her that this is my room, I haven't checked out yet and I just want to check my room to make sure I didn't leave anything. She gets very aggressive and doesn't want to let me in. I show her my key card, which still works and everything. I have to practically push past her to check out my room. It was an awful experience. I travel a lot in my work, and I have never encountered such rude housekeeping staff ever before. Furthermore, the housekeeper called down to the front desk to report that a guest had abruptly barged into her own room. When, I checked out, the receptionist was not cordial and didn't ask me how my stay was. Listen, people, I may not wear a suit, but I am still an executive. I know good service, and I know when I am being slighted. You don't want my business? Fine. I don't want to give it to you.

Good mid-town location in walking distance to Penn Station and just a couple blocks from Macy's. Check-in around 3:30 PM on a weekday was busy and slow. The bedroom is small but very well furnished. Would have liked an in-room safe, but does have a Keurig coffee maker, minibar, iron, and hair drier. My iPhone would not connect to the free in-room wifi. The bathroom is much larger than average, very modern, and very well equipped - probably the best thing about this hotel. The two elevators are not fast enough for the size of the hotel, so elevator waits were often long. Checkout was better than check-in. Service was friendly, but did not particularly like housekeeping knocking at 9:30 pm asking if I needed the bed turned down. The price may be in-line with other NYC hotels, but let's face it - very outrageous: $350 per night.

I just got back from a quick trip to NYC and had the pleasure of staying at Le Soleil. I was only there for one night, but I felt like I had been staying there for years. The staff were super friendly and efficient. Big thank you to Carmen who went out of her way to accommodate me when my mom showed up as a surprise and then upgraded us to a bigger room. The rooms are small, but lovely, clean and the housekeeping staff will bring you anything you need. And who stays in their room in NYC anyway?? Go out and enjoy! The location is perfect for everything and only a couple of blocks from GrandCentral and/or Penn Station if your travels need to take you out of the city. Hotel Soleil NYC has a great bar/restaurant and even a coffee shop attached for that morning fix. Its perfect and I would totally stay here again!!

It's hard to find a decent hotel in NYC. Anytime. This is it. Essentially brand new, great GREAT location, attentive staff, clean (but small rooms). We came off a red-eye and showed up at 8 am - and they had a room ready ! This hasn't appended to us in this century before (normally it seems that hotel rooms are like airline gates: regardless when you show up, they are occupied). Is it perfect? maybe not, but the price, the location, the facilities are to die for.
user_name:
Manfred L
Santa Fe, New Mexico

review_body: The rooms are beyond small. There is nowhere to place our suitcases, extremely small rack...not even a closet...to hang our clothes. No space in bathroom to place our toiletries. It's clean and modern but the worst place I've ever stayed in NYC. I do not recommend this hotel, especially comparing the price to the tiny, tiny room.

Even by New York City standards, this was a very small room, and not cheap. Luckily, we were only here for one night. It was a nice room but not a good value. The is a restaurant and a coffee bar so that's a plus and its walkable from Pennsylvania Station.

I've lived in the NYC/Metropolitan Area all of my life, and I love staying in hotels when I want an escape from my normal. It isn't easy to afford an ideal hotel in this city -- meaning location and price. But we had a better view than if we had stayed at the Plaza -- we overlooked the Empire State Building (at about a block away, it's actually so close it feels as though you could reach out and touch it), and downtown including the World Trade Center, standing at the distant center of our view. Bryant Park and the New York Public Library are a five minute walk, a 20 minute walk to Central Park. Times Square, Radio City, Broadway, Rockefeller Plaza, St. Patrick's Cathedral and Fifth Avenue shopping are all centrally located to this hotel, all within a 5-20 minute walking distance. Stroll through Central Park on your way to the museums. It was perfect for the fall weather -- just bring a comfortable pair of shoes. The hotel and our room was impeccably clean, the staff was delightful, warm and welcoming -- and helpful when we needed a wine bottle opener -- from the moment they opened their doors to us. From the front desk to the doorman, to the hotel managerial staff -- they were all professional and personable. The rooms feel like more of a cozy, modern apartment rather than hotel -- which is what I love about boutique hotels. And that view. We felt like pampered Manhattan millionaires for a couple of days. I can't wait to come back to Le Soleil, and I am so glad to have stumbled upon it. But as the hotel is relatively new, I just hope they never sacrifice quality -- such is often the unfortunate price.Okay. My one gripe -- hotel coffee is always horrendous. And I'm a basic coffee girl, I don't need fancy coffee. But I wish hotels would cut it out with the gas-station grade coffee for these ridiculous capsule coffee makers. And also, I need more than one packet of coffee mate. Spend a little money on good coffee for your guests, I'm begging you. Did I mention, I love coffee? But lucky for you, there's either a Starbucks, deli or cafe every few feet in the city. But still, give us some good coffee to wake up to! That's literally my only complaint -- which is really a non-complaint.

Good location, friendly staff who were happy to chat, nice coffee shop on the ground floor and a well designed place.Clean and bright hotel in the heart of the city that ticked all of our boxes.We would definately stay here again.

We recently stayed with our young daughter at the LeSoleil for a week for family vacation. The hotel is in a great location easy to walk to Central Park, highline, very close to Times Square, and there is a subway right around the corner. I didn't think much to be so close to Heralds Square but it was actually quite nice we often bought breakfast and ate it there in the small park. The room was both quiet and clean and seemed like our own little wing. The gym was nice as well and had all the amenities. Lots of people have commented on the size, we had a queen suite and with everything I have heard I found the size absolutely fine for New York. The maid service each day was wondeful. There were two drawbacks: the first night, the fire alarm went off in the middle of the night, waking our family, we were then told to please stand by, so obviously technical, though I was worried at the time. There were three more alarms, four more loudspeaker announcements and an announcement to 'go back to what you were doing' it was 230am naturally this was sleeping for most guests including our infant who was awoken multiple times. That kind of stuff just happens and I realize if it's a technical issue the hotel is not expected to offer discounts on the room and such. But I was confused that nothing as said at all, I was expecting perhaps a short apology note, a small coupon for coffee, or at least for the staff to acknowledge what happened. That kind of thing really throws off anyone hoping for a great nights rest. Second the whole staff is fantastic the bellman, the maids, but the front desk staff is a little below their standards in comparison, twice we asked for a restaurant recommendation and were told to 'walk around' I found this impersonal for such a nice establishment maybe as they establish themselves they will form preferred relationships with great restaurants in the area.

Hotel location is just grate. Close to Madison Square Garden by walk only 15 minutes. I like to walk so for me the location was perfect. Hotel rooms where white small and they have quite odd solution for bathroom door. Its a little bit drily for older people. Bed was only queen size so it was small to me. Very helpful doormen during the week. I dint use the hotel restaurant. Lots a good places around the hotel. Good free Wifi.

My family of 4 stayed for one night. The room was clean and the hotel was very quiet. Great location for walking to Empire State Building, Times Square and Central Park. Loved their coffee shop right next door. Would definitely stay here again.

I am always extremely picky about the cleanliness of a hotel and while the room was clean, the hallways could use a little more attention. The windows in our room were very tight, couldn't even hardly hear a noise from the street, which was great. The best part of the hotel and experience were Eddy and Kevin. Extremely friendly, easy to talk to. Both were a wealth of knowledge about where to eat, visit, things to do. Both Eddy and Kevin were very helpful if we needed anything and attentive to the guests. Five Stars for Eddy and Kevin!!

Awesome Luxury Hotel in close proximity to Times Square, Madam Thussads, Empire state building. Food is overpriced and breakfast is not included.- Awesome Location- Luxury Rooms- Nice Views-Friendly Staff-Flexible Check In & Check Out timings

This is a great location - easy walk to the Oyser Bar, Highline, Penn Station, midtown shopping and restaurants. That's the good news.But for over $400 a night I expect a top-drawer experience and this fell short. They said at the desk that they have only been open a year. High marks for staff enthusiasm and friendliness, that's the best feature here.Yes, as you read in the reviews, the rooms are tiny.Missing hardware from light fixtures and burned out bulbs. Peeling paint and stained ceiling tiles in the bathroom. Black stains streaking across the curtains. The bizarre tall metal and glass shelf fixture had hangers but no real room to hang anything. Loud noise all night from the adjacent stairwell and closing doors on our floor.No in-house restaurant, so no room service option. Appreciated the Keurig coffee maker and better-than-average toiletries, but in general the room amenities are only average.The queen sized bed, linens and pillows were average quality, no better. No extra pillows in the room.There are three other hotels within a few feet, and a Kimpton nearby. I would not stay again, and would certainly not spend this much to stay here again. Sorry, but I left feeling I'd overpaid for a very average hotel experience.

We went to New York for a 2 days trip just for sightseeing , i would say,we stayed in this hotel for it's near to Macy's where all tourist go, the Empire state building is just 2 or 3 blocks away. The hotel staffs are superb!!!Our room was great except for the sheer curtain that has stain, it needs washing, overall its neat and tidy.

I've stayed at many hotels in NYC for business travel and the Executive Hotel LeSoleil was, by far, the best experience yet. This part of the city was new to me and Eddie helped me each day with directions, tips and a great attitude. He was a joy and made maneuvering through Manhattan much easier than expected. I will definitely stay there again and recommend this hotel to my colleagues and friends. I wish I could clone Eddie for the next trip, as well!!

We recently decided to visit the wonderful NYC once again and anyone that knows New York will know that their is an abundance of accommodation and it could quickly become a costly exercise so choosing a place to stay may be a little hit and miss, however we need not have worried.After a very long flight from Australia, we arrived fairly late in the evening and were promptly greeted by a well dressed gentleman with long dreadlocks and a wonderful smile...he went by the name of Dr Dre and we hit it off from the outset. Nothing requested was too hard or impossible and many evenings we would get back to the hotel very late and then spend the next hour or so getting to know these wonderful , hospitable people whose sole focus is to ensure their guests have a wonderful stay in their lovely hotel.Dre and his crew of Lily, Mo and Tysheba,amongst others, were always familiar faces we looked forward to coming home to after day after day exploring everything NEW York has to offer.The hotel is a wonderful boutique hotel with ample room inside the suites and definitely not the small little rooms one comes to expect from most hotels in and around Le Soleils location....the restaurant serves wonderful food and we were also very lucky that the cafe had just opened where we delighted in coffee each and every morning....our friends who stayed at different hotels became advocates of the coffee shop also.We have definitely made friends for life with the staff at the hotel and hope to someday return the compliment should they ever wish to explore our beautiful country Australia.Dr Dre and the gang, you guys are legends and we appreciate you making our stay in your beautiful city a magical one....keep in touch and keep doing what you guys keep doing.....and hey Mo dont you lose that music in your soul...sing loud and proud baby girl.See you all again soon.Danny and Carol Daher from Down Under!!!!!

I visited NYC for a weekend trip this past weekend. It was my first stay at Hotel LeSoleil. I can't say enough about how wonderful the Hotel and the staff were.. The Hotel is beautiful . The staff were so accommodating with all my requests. I wanted to stay an upper top floor with a view of the Empire State Building.. as requested , I stayed on the 19 th floor with a full view , so beautiful .. my room was wonderful . Big modern bathrooms and even an efficiency with microwave and refrigerator . Everything was Very clean . The staff was very friendly , and always making sure my stay was satisfactory. I was in walking distance to everything. Empire State Building, Madison square gardens, and time square.... I would definitely stay at Hotel LeSoleil again and recommend it to my friends.... Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Less than a 10 minute walk to Times Sq , Macy's , Empire State Bldg makes it a great location. Herald Sq subway is just around the corner from which we travelled to Central Park , Cony Island , Brooklyn with ease. We paid around $1500 for a weeks stay which we thought was excessive for this hotel but apparently it's the going rate in Manhattan. Overall because of its central location it would be worth staying here again

I only got to stay here for a night for business and was impressed with fast and friendly service at check-in and at the front door, comfy bed and very clean room. I did get upgraded when I checked in, and loved how my room was quiet (which I requested). I was pleasantly surprised with a bonus awesome view of the Empire State Building and a 'spacious' room in NYC with kitchen corner. The gym downstairs is clean, nice and small with the basics including weights and cardio machines with individual TVs. This location is easy to get to any train, including Penn Station and walking distance from those tourists. I'd be happy to book this hotel again on my next trip!Remember: It's important to manage your expectations when staying in Manhattan... I think some other reviews from tourists are a bit harsh on room sizes in general
user_name:
ckwokers
New York City, New York

review_body: We spent nearly a week at his lovely hotel and can't wait to go back! The hotel is very well-situated, easy walking distance to lots of sights (Empire State, Times Square...). We walked and biked everywhere from the hotel, using the Citi bikes which have several pick up/drop off stations within a couple of blocks of the hotel. The hotel feels new and fresh and our room was very well laid out, large and pleasant. The bed was very comfortable and the room extremely quiet. No hint of the hustle and bustle of NYC streets while inside the room- very peaceful! Every staff member we encountered was helpful, friendly and professional. Trademark, the restaurant in the hotel, was great as well- nice atmosphere and delicious food (try the zucchini hummus!). The Grind, the coffee shop in the hotel, was an excellent first stop in the morning for great lattes and homemade muffins. All in all, an excellent place to stay while enjoying amazing NYC!

Stayed here for first time last week on business as our usual places were booked. The location is excellent for Theater District\Midtown: tucked away on relatively quiet and nice 36th between 5th and 6th avenues. The lobby is small but tasteful, relaxing and warm. The front desk staff were exceptionally helpful and nice. Eddie the bellman is a star -- checking my luggage for me as the room was not yet ready and then retrieving it to allow me to change into suit for meeting and then getting back out for me a couple hours later after the meeting for check into my room. My room was small but well appointed with a comfortable king bed, 42 inch flat screen TV, and a sleek, modern marble bathroom with great walk in shower. I had a high floor rooms with pretty view of the Freedom Tower and Empire State building.All in all - a really solid place to stay and enjoy.

I and my wife stayed at the hotel for 20 (twenty) nights. The location was great, the building was in very good conditions and reception desk staff were extremely nice and helpful. However, both the room service and room furniture were not the best. In particular: (1) For at least five times, when we returned at the hotel around 5:00 PM after staying away since mid-morning, the room was not yet cleaned; (2) Room cleaning was superficial; (3) When we made very simple requests (e.g., having a bathrobe), we had to wait for a lot of time; 4) The "Queen Suite" was pretty large by New York standards, but the wardrobe was very small (even for a short-term stay of two people) and the separate living area was almost useless, having just two uncomfortable chairs and not even a little table. In conclusion, both hotel's management and room interior design can still be improved a lot.

I just spent the last week at this hotel (I travel to NYC once a month for work) and will certainly skip this hotel in the future. The whole experience left much to be desired.First, I arrived at 4:45pm to check in and had to rush back out by 5pm for a work event. My room was not ready. I asked for the front desk to help me get a taxi while I freshened up in their lobby bathroom. They did not find me a ride (and we are in the biggest city in the world - there are taxis everywhere) which made me late to my event. The hotel staff asked me to leave my luggage against a wall until my room was ready and that they would take it up to my room for me. When I arrived 4 hours later, the luggage was still sitting where I left it in the lobby (luckily untouched). I expect MUCH more from an "executive hotel." Second, my room was clean and spacious, however, housekeeping knocked on my door one night at 11pm with no explanation as to why they were knocking (very shady.. Much too late to be knocking on the door) and to top it off, there was a pipe issue which resulted in a repetitive wobbling sound every single minute. I did not sleep and it was very annoying. The positive parts of this experience:- Room was clean and spacious- Centrally located - I asked to switch rooms due to the repetitive sound issue and my request was accommodated There are so many nice hotels in the city, I would recommend skipping this hotel and trying somewhere else.

I picked this hotel because we could easily walk to Madison Square Garden for the Adel concert. Beautiful place to stay. Our room was just wonderful and the Staff was outstanding. TRADEMARK Taste & Grind (restaurant in the LeSoleil) was very good. We had drinks and food there during this trip. With the UN having meetings we found it difficult to get Uber or a Cab. We weren't sure how we would get to the airport. Never fear Agnes got us a great rate and door to door on time ride. We will be back.

First of all, the location is amazing, it's in the heart of Manhattan, the Empire State building is about a block away, Times Square is a 10 minute walk, the shops are on the doorstep and there is one of the best steakhouses in NYC about 10 steps from the hotel. Aside from location though, this hotel is clean (it's relatively new) and we were impressed by the spacious room which had a separate entrance/seating area with a TV in addition to the bedroom - good when you want to eat and watch TV without disturbing a sleeping baby! The decor is simple, modern and cool. The bed was so comfortable, especially after 10 hours site seeing on your feet! The staff are friendly and very helpful, without being overbearing. We traveled with a 10 month old baby and wholly recommend this hotel for other couples and families, though it is convenient for any type of traveler. We plan to stay here again should we go back to New York.

Stayed 10 nights… Perfect location! Lovely staff! TRADEMARK Taste & Grind… Awesome coffee for the fussy Aussie coffee snobs. All amenities are close by. Shop till you Drop on 5th ave. Would definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Ok.. so ups for this hotel is a good level of cleanliness and its location in the heart of Manhattan. Downs?- Small room with a disproportionately large bathroom. We could barely move inside the room and almost no closet space whatsoever. - Staff billed me more than the booking.com amount agreed when I took notice they were resistant at first but eventually caved and it took them almost 45 mins to rectify (still waiting for refund to show on my bill). - No breakfast!! - No complimentary water bottles!!- Bathroom fixture missing for the length of our entire stay.- overpriced but then again, I accepted to pay what they wanted so the blame is not really on them. Bottom line:I don't think I'm going to be staying in this hotel next time I'm in NYC.

We loved our stay at LeSoleil (except for the shuttle service, worst experience ever!): - the staff were so nice (except for our experience with the concierge who arranged our shuttle back to the airport): Moni was especially patient and kind with us tired travelers when we arrived, she made us feel welcome and did her best to accomodate our wishes for quiet rooms but with views and close to each other (we had booked two rooms), Eddie (the doorman) is so friendly and smiling and probably has a solution for every problem you could encounter! - the hotel was clean- the hotel has a really convenient location- the hotel was quiet, loved that (I'm a very light sleeper and having quiet nights allowed me to the required energy to do everything I wanted to do it NY!). The AC doesn't make a sound (we were there when it was about 30°C so much needed), and we didn't hear a lot of street noise for NY (NY is a noisy city, so we could hear some but I'd say they were pretty well blocked). - we went to the restaurant (Trademark) and the food was great (albeit a bit salty for us, but this seems to be quite common in NY). The restaurant is a bit noisy (again, seems to be quite common in NY!), but try to get a booth and it helps. However, as mentioned above, we had a very deceiving experience with the concierge who arranged our shuttle back to the airport. Not only did we find him quite rude but the shuttle never came! We booked the 1:30pm shuttle and he told us to be there at 1:20pm. By 1:45pm the shuttle was still not there and everytime we asked him where the shuttle was the guy kept saying "it's here, in a few minutes" and he was on his phone all the time so we could never really speak to him (it sometimes seemed like he was avoiding us). By 2pm (we had been waiting for 40min and the shuttle was 30min late) we got a little impatient and told him we had had enough waiting and we needed to know where the shuttle was, and he told us it would be there in 20 minutes!! Needless to say we were not happy at all, we told him to cancel the shuttle and pay us back (luckily we had paid in cash) and that we would find another way to get to the airport. We asked Eddie (the doorman) if we could help us find a cab to get to the airport and he did just that: 10 minutes later a big car (big enough for the four of us and our bags) pulled up and we were on our way to the airport (and made it on time!). We were quite surprised that a hotel with such great service would have such a bad shuttle service and it stained our impression of our stay to have a stressful experience like that to finish off at LeSoleil. I would have put 5 stars if it hasn't been for this last bad experience.

Stayed here for 5 nights with the other half. Finely run hotel with lovely staff, who were helpful at every turn. Hardly in the hotel, yet most of the staff remembered names and greeted us on every entry/exit. Nicely placed in Midtown, amenities local, with, most importantly, a great boozer across the street (The Keg Room). Can't fault our room, bit of luxury for me. The shower was the cherry on top... would recommend to all, not a budget hotel at just shy of £1200 for the 5 nights... but you wouldn't be disappointed

We stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel is ideally situated for first time visitors to the city. The room we were given faced the Empire State Building, what a joy to look out of the window at that icon. The room was nicely appointed, comfortable, clean and also had a small lounge which gave us the space for our luggage to be spread out. The bed was super comfortable. Staff young and very friendly and helpful. My only niggle was the toiletries were not replaced daily. Normally we never eat or drink in the street we stay in but on this occasion we did so experienced a host of different foodie places & bars close to the hotel. NYC is an amazing city and our experience was made more pleasurable by staying at Executive Hotel LeSoliel.

Lowe d place, location is wonderful believe if u wanna wisit new york then this is the place. It is very safe, clean, friendly and nice view hotel... It is located in 36th and you can get a subway from 34th and go to time square, broadway and central park etc . If u just walk a bit then u re in front of empire state which is the the place that u watch sky and feel like u re in heaven☺️ Another place that u can go by walk is brynt park and public library. Brynt park is so peacefull and u can have your breakfast there. In your life time u shld go to new york and this hotel is in the best location

We went to New York to celebrate our nephews 21st and after looking at plenty of other hotels plumed for the lesoleil. If you want anything ask for Eddie on the door he is brilliant. And very helpful. Room great and even for four staying as you only sleep there. Didn't get chance to use the resteraunt but it looked fab and customers seemed happy coming out.. The front desk were great if you needed anything pillows etc or your shower not draining very well they got it sorted. Would go back at the drop of a hat.

Bedroom & bathroom decorated lovely, linen was lovely. All areas were spotless. Bedroom was a bit small but suited us fine as we were in New York to see the sights so weren't in the hotel much. The Staff here were fantastic, so polite, couldn't do enough for you. Location of this hotel was great also. Would i stay here again ? without a doubt, highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to see the Sights

The room that I've been to was so beautiful and the service was so nice , I forget my passport and they send it to me to the airport , but the only things that the room was too small and the fridge is too tight

I have to start with the front desk..... I called several times canceling and remaking my reservations, the young lady whose name I can't remember was very patient and very kind on the phone. I finally get to the hotel and I have to say it was absolutely beautiful. Check-in was very easy and smooth the lobby is very inviting and beautifully decorated. I upgraded the room to be on a high floor so I would have a view of Manhattan instead I had a view of an office building, but it was okay I wasn't there to look out the window but to go out and experience Manhattan.The room was clean and beautifully decorated the bathroom was incredible, The walk-in shower was huge and inviting. The only problem was closet space, it had a drawer and a small space to hang clothes but otherwise the room is very comfortable.The staff with Incredible very friendly and helpful.The location was perfect you could walk practically anywhere.I'm looking forward to my next visit

Had a great stay this weekend at Hotel LeSoleil. Upon arrival we parked in the parking garage near the hotel. Word of advice, if you are planning on driving to the hotel & staying, we learned that they do offer a parking package if you book on the actual hotel website. We booked through hotels.com, so we were unaware of this option until the lady at the front desk informed us. Hotel staff were all very friendly & helpful! Everything about the hotel was very nice & clean...from the lobby, to the elevators, hallways, and most importantly...the room! Hotel is in a great location, about a 5 minute walk from Times Square & just one street over from the Empire State Building. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a nice stay in the heart of NYC.

I called the Executive Hotel LeSoleil in June 2016 to set up a visit to New York for my family. I spoke with a very professional and friendly hotel representative in reservations named Yadira. I started talking with Yadira and explained I was planning to visit NYC and was celebrating 2 special occasions. Yadira went out of her way to get things started by getting us a room with a view as nice as possible. We arrived September 4,2016 and was greeted by very friendly personnel at the front desk named Chris, and Andre. Chris took our bags upon arrival and informed us our room had been upgraded to the penthouse what a pleasant surprise. We went to our room on the 20th floor which had a spectacular view, and was immaculate. We were treated like royalty there was champagne on ice, chocolates, and they even gave 2 cards, one for my wife and one for my son for their birthdays. The hotel manager Nicola, and Roshi made sure everything was excellent. Thanks again everyone, awesome service. Yadira congratulations on your new baby. We will be going back to NYC soon and will definitely be staying at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil New York, very impressive five stars.Thanks Calvin and family

We were visiting New York to celebrate our belated wedding anniversary. Our stay in this hotel was very satisfying. The staff were very helpful. Being located bang in the middle of manhattan, everything was well within walking distance. We had requested for a room with a view and I must say that we were given a wonderful room from which the Empire State building was visible in its full glory. The only down was the bed. We didn't get the kind of comfort we were looking forward to. Then again, it's our opinion. Overall, a nice hotel with friendly staff. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

I liked the rooms a lot - clean, newer and bigger. The elevators were really slow. The staff was attentive and friendly. The location is on 36th between Fifth and Sixth. A longer walk to many destinations.

I stayed at Executive Hotel Le Soleil a couple of times over the past three weeks, because my normal NYC hotel was either not available or the rate had suddenly shot up. Glad I made the switch. The hotel is new, clean, convenient. Service is good as well. Definitely one of my top choices in the future. Their frequent guest program is very mysterious, however. I signed up and never got an email acknowledgment nor a membership number, so I am yet to receive any points for my stay nor do do I have any idea of what the benefits are. Strange.

I can't speak for the other rooms, but the difference in room size vs. the cost was too minimal to pass up and not upgrade. I abhor small hotel rooms which is why I chose the Executive Suite (Queen Bed and Pull out Couch with separate sitting area). The room was sizeable compared to other NYC hotel rooms (aka - didn't feel cramped and claustrophobic), clean, staff extremely nice and loved Trademark downstairs. The location was convenient to Herald's Square, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, public transportation,etc. Perfect location, great experience and will definitely stay again.
user_name:
DCharlieNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: A wonderful hotel,perfectly situated with all the amenities one could hope for and reasonably priced to boot too.I could go into more detail and will at some later date after I have visited it again (which I shall be doing again later this year )to make sure that my inital impression was not just an extraordinarily positive one of a kind experience.

This hotel was recommended by the organizers of the conference I attended. My executive queen room was small (not unusual in New York) but very clean. There's no closet, but the glass shelving unit includes an open rod about a foot long for hanging clothes, sufficient for one person on a business trip. The shelving unit also contained an iron and ironing board plus a nice big umbrella for the predicted rain. There are three drawers and a good-sized desk area, with a desk lamp that has extra electrical outlets around its base. Beneath the desk was a folding luggage rack. The alarm clock (set about an hour ahead of actual time and which I could never figure out how to re-set) contains one USB port. There's no printed hotel information booklet, but you can find out where the ice machine is located (2nd floor) and that the restaurant next door is closed on Sundays, etc. on the TV's main information menu. A liter of bottled water was provided on the first day, presumably for the Keurig beverage maker. My room was on the 17th floor and the street noise was audible but relatively low for New York, not an impediment to sleep. I was able to set a comfortable temperature in the room and the shower was good--my only suggestion is to put in a grab bar or two for clientele who might need some extra stability in the shower, as the entrance is about four (slippery) feet away from the controls. I appreciated the extra make-up mirror in the bathroom. There is no room service, but there are several places to eat or buy a sandwich within a few meters of the hotel.

Me and my girlfriend stayed here in March and we had the most amazing time, we travel a lot and this was by far one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in.The hotel staff:Super friendly and had a lot of patience with my accent (I'm from England) Guy on the door was excellent, helped us bring our cases inside and every time we left to go somewhere he would suggest new places and ways to save. Location:The hotel is situated in the most perfect place being walking distance from Madison square garden, The Empire State Building & Times Square. There are also plenty of restaurants local to the hotel; Chick-fil-a being just around the corner & Plenty of places to go for breakfast.The room:Never have I been to a hotel where the pictures online did not do the rooms justice prior to arrival!Bathrooms were modern and extra clean, beds were so comfortable & the views were brilliant.We are already planning our return trip to Manhattan and we will 100% be staying here again!Thank you very much!

This hotel is suppose to be relative new by New York City standards. It did seem that way, when we finally got into our room around seven in the evening, on the first day. This, in itself, is not that surprising by New York City standards. OK, so far, so good. The room was quiet. The bed was clean. We stayed for four nights. We requested early make up of the room, since we are old, and tired, and want to go to bed relatively early. Besides, NYC is always a real whirlwind. However, the bed, towels, etc. were never made up, when we wanted to end our day. We came back to the hotel anywhere from seven to nine. Even after repeated complaints at the front desk, nothing got better. True, the people in reception were very nice; but they and/or management could do nothing with the housekeeping staff. We always left tips. We never got anything we wanted. Fresh towels, clean sheets were as distant a dream as three dozen roses, fruit baskets, etc. for the insult. Forget it. No, not really.
user_name:
sculler-in-charge
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: A fairly last minute booking at a busy time (big trade event was on and end of summer) so I couldn't get too fussy with my choice but I was really pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was and what a good spot it was in. The staff were helpful and friendly, the room was tiny with a King Bed but that's ok it is New York!The room was fresh and the bed super comfortable. We heard no noise from other floors or rooms.The only downside is that the inside of the windows needed a good clean - too many faces have pressed against it. Also the bathroom door didn't shut very well, it kept hitting the skirting board. Minor minor details. The bed was extremely comfortable and the pillows total bliss. Room temp was great considering it was hot outside.The adjoining restaurant and coffee shop were fantastic and it really added to the experience.

Safe area. Very friendly staff. Complimentary Wifi. Perfect location with shopping and many restaurants nearby. Super clean hotel. Queen room was small - not much space for suitcases etc. The bathroom is big with a walk-in shower but there is no hook or shower caddy to place your wash cloth on. Just a tiny corner rack for soap/shower gel. There is a hook for your bath towel though. Good air conditioning system. If you want fresh air you can open the room's window. Very tiny cooler that is prepacked with beverages ($$$). Excellent views from the 18th floor. I must commend the housekeeping staff for the daily excellent job they do. Free baggage hold area at check out. Concierge will arrange for taxi service to JFK etc if required. Will definitely return to this hotel. It's wonderful!

this hotel was perfect. The location is perfect. You can walk anywhere uptown and an easy taxi rude downtown. Also close to subway. The rooms were very comfortable, not large, but fine. The bell staff were fantastic. One tip definitely approach the bell staff or the guys at reception before the conceierge. They are all locals, and were amazing. Unfortunately the concierge staff were all foriegners and although very pleasant, weren't as familiar with the city as the bell staff.

I like how the room is organized to have a separate sitting room. The staff was very friendly. The chairs are very low and strangely uncomfortable. Their was no view because I was too low (10th floor). They were not very responsive to requests to our request to clean the room at a later time. All in all, it is in a great location and was good accomodations for the price paid.I would consider returning.
user_name:
Christine2013_13
New York City, New York

review_body: Great hotel, nice rooms although very small. Great location close to everything but not so busy.Many places to eat, all kind of food, prices and styles. Close to many Kosher restaurants.Shops, subway, penn station, times square within blocks.Service is very good.

Good roomGood bathroom Good viewBig T.VSafeVery cleanExcellent restorant down stairs $$$$Super nice staffIn the heart of New York Good pillows Quiet roomStayed in the 18th floor Secure3 Pokemon stops in the hotel No weirdos stayed at the hotelWould stay there again 100%

This hotel is build in between some old buildings but is easily recognisable due to its fancy facade. They have very strict check-in policy which means even if you arrive 5 mins before the listed check-in time, you will have to kill some time in the waiting area and enjoy a coffee at their espresso bar, lol, which is the only place where you can get something to grab, like some cookies or donuts.. At first i did not believe that they don't even have a kitchen. But then after waiting for 2 hours, we got the room which turned out to be more than what i expected. Extremely clean and tidy room with everything in place, decent bathroom but no batch tub. Room service was bit slow since they don't have enough staff considering the number of rooms. Overall, an average experience but it was good at the price i booked it.

We call it quaint albeit it's not small and the suite rooms are large but it's the feeling you get. The staff are amazing and so attentive and helpful but not overly so. They are like an old friend you just met and they want to make sure your experience is great. The French decor style we loved and the bed was very comfortable. Our room had a huge deck and chairs and a table on it and plenty of sunshine. Only a couple rooms have decks we were told but we loved it. Each floor has very few rooms so you don't have a long hallway of rooms as the bldg is more square with 2-4 rooms in each section. We will stay here from now on as we really loved it!

Have just come back from a five night stay, at this hotel. The trip was a vacation to celebrate our anniversary. The location of the hotel was great. So close to lots of different attractions, The Empire State Building/ Times Square.Lots of Subways. Close to a few good bars ( The Keg Room , fantastic). The hotel staff were lovely, so kind and helpful. The room was comfortable and clean and we had a lovely view of The Empire State building. The only downside was it didn't really feel like a real hotel. There wasn't any information in the room about the hotel, just a price list. The Hotel didn't really have a restaurant and bar. It was attached to a restaurant, which served nice food but never seemed to be open when we wanted a drink. Also, its much more of a restaurant than a bar you can sit down and have a drink. Our room was only cleaned twice. We arrived back from sightseeing most days by 4, and they would come to clean it then, when it wasn't really convenient, which was strange. On the whole , I was pleased with my stay and would stay again.

My partner and I stayed for 1 week in this hotel in August. The hotel is fairly new and houses the usual facilities you would expect in this type of accommodation; coffee-maker, iron and board, etc. It was also exceptionally clean and tidy. We booked the executive queen suite which comprises the above with a kitchenette area and a separate reading area. The hotel was superbly located in the Garment District in Manhattan and was within easy walking distance from the underground. Also within easy reach was a variety of shops, cafes, pubs and restaurants. The staff was very helpful and attentive and nothing was too much for them. The hotel was also probably the quietest we've every stayed in; no traffic (we did stay at the rear) and nothing much from the other guests. I cannot recommend this hotel enough and should I ever return to New York, this will be the hotel I'll be staying in.

The hotel was in a perfect location to walk around Manhattan. Central area near Empire State Building and shopping. A short two miles south and we were near NYU and the Village. Another mile further and we were in Little Italy. A couple miles north and we were at Central Park. The staff was super gracious; they were more than willing to accommodate us. The room was very clean and well-appointed, including a stocked minibar. We bought beer and soda around the corner though, and didn't use the pre stocked drinks. We were in a queen room with a view, and had a nice city view. It was small, but that's not a surprise in the city. The bathroom was large and the shower was big and inviting. All-in-all, I would stay again.

We had a suite, but I would categorize it more like a deluxe room, maybe a junior suite. Not large enought to give it a suite status. But they probably have different room alternatives. But the room itself was nice, clean and modern. The hotel are centrally placed, however that depends of course with the goal of the stay. You will find supermarket and lots of small cafes and restaurants In the area. Keens Steakhouse a few meters away is a must - great food - not budget though. A good starting point for exploring NY.

This was my son's first time in New York City and choosing to stay in Executive Hotel LeSoleil was the best choice my wife and I made. The staff was incredibly welcoming and hospitable. The hotel was quiet and very family friendly. We were a block away from the subway and had about a 15 minute subway ride to Times Square and Freedom Tower. The location of the hotel was extremely convenient, especially with a 9 yr old child who was not accustomed to walking for a long duration. The cleanliness of the hotel was top notch and the hotel staff accommodated to our every need. Living in Dallas, my family and I are used to "Southern Hospitality", where a warm welcome and smile is part of the culture. This hotel provided just that, and more! I've visited NYC numerous times and Executive Hotel Le Soleil is the best hotel I've stayed in thus far.

My family and I stayed at Executive Hotel LeSoleil during the summer peak time. I must say this hotel was very clean and quiet. The rooms has a very modern, crisp feel to it. The AC worked great- considering it was so humid while we ventured out in the city. It was nice to come back to a fresh and comfortable setting.Central location. It was walking distance to Empire State Bldg and Times Square, fine eatery, subway stations, and desirable shopping stores.Hotel Staff -The staff were marvelous. Eddie and Luis was very friendly and helpful with our requests. I was really impressed with the elevator security. I definitely recommend this hotel.

We had a wonderful stay here before heading to Staten Island for a cousin's wedding! Beautiful hotel! Perfect location...walked to Empire State Building, Shake Shack, Times Square, Macy's, Carlo's Bakery, etc! The suite we stayed in was perfect and beds were so comfortable! We had several families with us at the hotel and we would just meet up in the cozy lobby. Eddie and Kevin were awesome!!! So friendly and very welcoming...always smiling and playing around with our kiddos. All of the staff was great! We would definitely stay here again and will recommend to others!

Our family spent almost a week at this hotel. Great central location. Comfortable rooms. Friendly staff. Eddie and Noel took good care of us--very friendly and helpful. Lots to see and do nearby. Bought Empire State tickets here and saved a ton of time not waiting in line for tickets. We would definitely stay here again.

The room is in a perfect location, just round the corner from the empire state building and a few blocks from Times Square. The neighbourhood has plenty of surrounding cafes and restaurants so eating shouldn't be a problem. We arrived around 8am in the morning but check in time was not until 3pm, so we had to wait around the hotel until 3pm for a room to be available for us, however they did store our bags for us. The rooms are quite beautiful, with very nice furniture, but we had 2 double beds and it was quite a squeeze for 3 adults and a teenager, but can't complain because the location was spot on. The bathroom was also very nice, but the door took a while to slide open and close every time, and it often got stuck. The wifi was very good also. Overall a decent place to stay if you're looking to stay in a central location in NY.

we stayed here for 7 nights .. yup ! that long ! and needless to add -yes the rooms are small but we were 3 adults and 2 kids in TWO rooms so there was plenty of space to sleep butttt short on space for our suitcases ... like someone earlier mentioned , you literally have to jump over your suitcases BUT i am not complaining because i love being so central to madness of shopping ( everythin is so so close ) and a couple of blocks away from the Empire state bldg and couple more blocks away from Times Square ( broadways shows and theatre ) and about 40min walk from Central Park - yes that sounds lon , but trust me - the vibe on the streets , the coffees alon the way and the shoppin stores thrown in between and i loved every minute of the walk ... even my 10yr old managed just fine . The staff at the hotel are excellent , the wifi is great , the housekeeping is on time ( and yes just TWO coffee pods is a real bummer but it was solved by calling for extra ones ) .Oh I must mention that our first night , we were surprised when we checked in , they had upgraded us to the penthouse and THAT is perfectly sized ... so if you are travellin as 3 adults and maybe a kid or two but are ok with sharin just one bathroom - ( 2 separate bedrooms though ) consider paying for the penthouse .

RECOMMENDED: I can't give this hotel 4* based upon some errors but still recommend. Let me start with the positives.Hotel is well situated near Penn Station and convenient subway to both up and downtown. The neighborhood is nothing special (lots of hotels) but convenient nonetheless. The hotel is new and has thick sound proof windows that open. Bedding was comfortable and the bathroom was very large and modern. Good lighting. Check in was quick and only 8 rooms per floor. Now the downers. The std queen room is incredibly small. There were a number of design flaws. The desk chair is huge considering the size of the room and bulky to move above. The coffee maker occupied 25% of the desks space, yet they give you only 2 coffee pods for the day. The bathroom was spacious and shower was great. But there is no place to put anything, we left toiletries on the floor. This would be a hard hotel for 2 people for more than a few days (climbing over your luggage gets old). I didn't see the larger room, but would opt for that. Wifi was free and worked well.Guest services cost the hotel their *. The housekeeping provides only a single bar of soap, which usually meant climbing thru the wet shower stall to grab the single soap bar. Easy enough - we went to front desk and asked for more soap and coffee pods (ironic they provide 1 caf and 1 decaf pod, doesn't make sense). However, they never got delivered (we had to go back down to the front desk to ask a 2nd time).On our last morning, we realized that housekeeping had not provided fresh bath towels or shampoo and called the front desk again. 40 minutes later the bellman turns up with a single towel. By this point, we'd improvised using hand towels and not in a good mood about it. Ironically, the bellman wouldn't leave the fresh towels and disappeared.Staff training is problematic and for a hotel running $300 a night, my expectations were somewhat higher.

A modern, new hotel in the heart of Manhattan. The location is excellent; close to the main shopping areas, within an easy walking distance to Times Square, theaters and great restaurants. Penn Station is just a few blocks away so it’s easy to go f.ex. to JFK from there. The Empire State Building is just across the street and some rooms – like ours – have a wonderful view of it.The room was cozy and nicely decorated with huge windows and very comfortable bed. The room was fairly small but pretty big for Manhattan. Not a lot of storage place for your suitcases thou and pretty much no space in the so called closet but it didn’t bother that much in the end (even if we stayed over a week). There was a minibar in the room and some snacks available for purchase as well. The TV was large and WiFi worked well too. A coffee machine was a great plus and there was also a fairly big table and even a bit too large chair (regarding the size of the room) in our room.It was extremely hot in NY during our stay but the AC was excellent so the freshness of the room guaranteed a good night’s sleep. For a midtown Manhattan hotel it was incredibly quiet as well. I have previously stayed several times in the same area but the rooms were never this quiet.The bathroom was spacious and modern with quite some storage place for your toiletries. Both our room and toilet were spotlessly clean and overall the hotel looked really ”fresh” and welcoming. The two elevators were so big compared to most hotels and we never needed to wait that long to get up to our room.Friendly staff with a few exceptions and especially Eddie was super friendly and helpful giving us some great tips for areas to visit and restaurants to eat even if we never asked any.I’d highly recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates a good night’s sleep in a quiet hotel, within easy access to pretty much anywhere in Manhattan. We’d definitely go back!

There is a new, quiet, unassuming hotel in the Empire State Building area. Le Soleil offers all the essentials at a decent rate. The rooms are impeccably clean and well maintained by housekeeping. This hotel is best suited for travellers with lighter baggage as rooms are on the small side with limited storage space.Hotel staff is very attentive to your needs. We received a call within a few minutes after check-in to make sure we were pleased with our room.Security is a priority - elevator functions by way of a "tapping" of your hotel card to access your floor.Higher floors have great views of the ESB and no sounds are heard from the outside which is amazing for the city that never sleeps! 5 minutes from Macy's and 10 minutes from Penn Station which was convenient for us travelling by train.Highly recommend!

I went to New York for a Hair and Beauty show and stayed at this hotel for the July 22-24 weekend. The location was great as it was close to healthy places to eat. The employees at the hotel are super friendly and helpful. I arrived early and they did their best to provide an early check in. The women who checked me in had spoken to me prior to the trip and was very friendly. I was however, surprised when told that the incidental fees to be charged would be $100 per night to a max of $400 for a stay. This is not what I expected as I booked this through a third party and was told that incidentals were $100 flat. The bellhop brought my luggage to my room promptly. I checked the room and noticed a stain on the duvet. I am happy to say that this was prompted dealt with. My room was very clean and quaint. I appreciate the seating area with a full cable, flat screen t.v. and chairs for lounging. There was another flat screen t.v. facing my bed. Absolutely fantastic!!! The washroom was up to date and reminded me of those in condominiums, I felt like a Queen. The room had snacks for sale and a bar fridge loaded with a few drinks. I would have liked something that would have allowed me to keep a slice of pizza in it though. There was no safe in the room, though it was advertised, oh well!! My room had a big, beautiful window and lots of light. It was hot that weekend so the air conditioner was just right and easy to maneuver. Not much closet space though. The space provided was just enough to hang 1 pair of pants and maybe a shirt. The pillows were very uncomfortable. They remind me of the standard overly soft pillows which disturb your sleep. Please change this, it really makes a difference. My last point revolves around check out process. I had discussed the checkout with an employee extensively the night before. When I went to check out, there was no bellperson. After the check out person called two cab companies, I was told that I could hail a cab at either the street behind the hotel or at the intersection close to the hotel. I was not impressed as it was 4am and I was alone. Luckily, I caught a yellow cab just as I excited. I really want come back to this hotel, but this incident is making me think twice. Please staff properly for early check outs!!!!

Staff was very friendly and super helpful. The rooms are clean, but very small to be expected in NY. The rooms are pretty quiet with the rear facing rooms have at least a glimpse of the Empire State Building which is only a block away.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and will be back! The staff was extremely friendly and so helpful with everything we needed (they switched our room due to a crying baby, purchasing theater tickets, flagged down cabs - thank you Kevin). The location was terrific...within walking distance to Broadway shows, Grand Central Terminal, and wonderful restaurants. Highly recommended!

In the middle of busy NYC this hotel offer a heaven with comfort, friendliness, and luxury for a very reasonable price.The staff are friendly helpful courteous and fun. The location is easy and close to many attraction. Accessible by train and buses. Highly recommend this hotel!! Thank you!!

The hotel is in an excellent central location in the Garment/Theater/Times Square area. The room was clean and very comfortable. We traveled with our two teenage kids and the room was spacious enough for all of us. There is a nice bar in the hotel where the staff are very friendly.

Had a great stay at Executive Hotel LeSoleil, the position is good for exploring all parts of the city. The staff are friendly and helpful and the coffee shop right next to the foyer was a bonus.The room were modern and clean but oh so small! I know this is New York, but anyone staying here for more than a couple of days will struggle to find anywhere to put anything. The wardrobe is nonexistent and there is nowhere to put your suitcases except at the side of your bed, which means striding over them every time you walk past. If space is not an issue, then I can highly recommend this hotel as everything else was great. If you do not cope well in a confined space, maybe look elsewhere .

Stayed here for a teachers conference in February. Great place. Staff was very helpful with directions, metro lines, etc. Room was a decent size, especially for NYC. Very comfortable bed and clean room.The restaurant hadn't opened yet, but if it is like the rest of the hotel it will be very nice. Great location, far enough from the noise of Times Square but close enough to walk. Not a great view but who really cares, your in NYC!I also was able to get an AMAZING rate, made the hotel even more enjoyable (the guy at the front desk seemed surprised with the low rate)Recommended for sure!

Great location, nice, small, quaint lobby. front desk staff friendly. Rooms nice, until. . . .I decided to book the Deluxe Queen room (as opposed to the standard queen) as a treat for my wife. The sitting room was a bit odd, but pleasant. Room size was appropriate for Manhattan NY. The issue came in the middle of the night. Evidently this hotel takes its eco-friendly concept a bit too far. The thermostat in the room is on a motion detector. In the Queen Deluxe room, the thermostat is in the sitting room, as opposed to the bed room. We woke up HOT (and not the good kind of hot!!). By the second night I figured out what was going on and woke to stand in front of the thermostat waving my hand in front of it like an idiot. I went to the front dest the next morning to ask for the thermostat to be under my control and not the remote control. The third night, same issue. The next morning another complaint by me, with no result. Granted it was one of the hottest weeks this summer, but isn't that when you want AC??? I voiced my complaint with the management via email when we arrived home and he offered an appropriate gesture to accommodate us. Thank you. Fix the thermostat and I would have given 5 stars.

Wonderful from the moment I stepped out of Uber. I was greeted with a warm welcome by Eddie the Doorman and the experience just kept getting better. The entire staff from the front desk to the bartender to the housekeepers were great... Especially Eddie, Chris and Luis. I travel often on business and have stayed in many 5-star hotels and the service at Hotel LeSoliel was just as good if not better! The friendly staff could not have been more accommodating. The room was small but very clean, comfortable and had all the perks you want when away from home. Pleasantly the bathroom was spacious as far as New York standards which made up for the small quarters.I only had a drink at the bar so not certain about the food. The location is ideal and very close walk to beautiful Bryant Park.This lovely boutique hotel will be one of my go to's when returning to New York.

We were a family of 11 traveling with young children to see The Lion King. The location was perfect. Everything within an easy walk. Each of the 4 rooms we had was clean, spacious, and very comfortable. The staff was wonderful...everyone. Excellent customer service! We were very happy with our stay and will definitely return. Highly recommend Executive hotel LeSoleil.

Stayed for 6 nights in July.Location Great location. Less than 5 minutes walk to Times Square and grand central and pen station. Several restaurants nearby although I found NYC as a whole as expensive as London when you eat out, if not more expensive. The food from the stalls outside on the road to Times Square was better than the restaurants. Great place to walk to Empire State Building, Rockefeller, and Madison square garden, fifth avenue and round the block from Maccys.Hotel Clean and very friendly. Upgrade to queen room with view is amazing. Iron, hairdryer, and toiletries are provided. Coffee machine is good. And there was a sink and microwave and cutlery in the room we had. Customer service is very good and very friendly. And spacious room. Rooms were quiet and great night sleep. Look no further if you are visiting for the first time. Book it.Concierge organised transfer from and to airport at a very reasonable price. About an hour and half from JFK. Bring waking shoes as there is a lot to see in nyc. Bought NY explorer pass for 5 attraction if that's your first visit as it saves a lot of money and time.

I would definitely suggest staying at this hotel to anyone visiting NY. Spacious clean room which was very modern and tastefully decorated. Large bathroom. Great price! I stayed at the hotel with a friend who had never been to NYC and the location was perfect for sightseeing. Empire State Building and Herald Square 2 blocks away. Walked to Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Flatiron and High line.

This boutique hotel has a friendly and accommodating staff, quiet comfortable rooms, and is in a fantastic location in mid-town. Our queen suite was on the 13th floor and was very quiet. Though just above a road, we heard very little street noise even with the windows open. Any noise noted came from the hallway, which rarely occurred. The room is small compared to most standards, but was large compared to NYC standards. When the door opened, one was standing in the sleeping area. The bathroom had a sliding door and a huge shower that could easily accommodate two people. There was a small "living" area with two comfortable IKEA style chairs and small table with a lamp. A television was in both the living and sleeping areas. The bed was soft and comfortable, and four sleeping pillows were provided. Climate could be controlled fairly well. There was ample counter space in the bathing area. Everything was quite clean. The hotel provided robes for each of us along with slippers. Also shampoo, conditioner, hair dryer, etc. There is a mini fridge that is stocked with drinks and snacks, but we opted to use it for our own items. A desk suitable for a computer and a few other things along with an arm-less, multi-purpose chair was in the room. Heavy wooden hangers were also provided. The hotel also has wi-fi and HBO but no other premium channels.There is little to no space for personal items. We like to unpack when on vacation. We each kept our items in our suitcases as there was only a tiny bit of drawer space, and enough space to hang a couple of suits. Ethan found himself needing to barter for counter space as Sally took up most of the counter space in the bathroom. (Girls need our stuff!!!) Also, while not a huge deal, the toilet handle would frequently stick. (We are certain that the staff would have immediately addressed this had we reported it.)This brings us to the wonderful staff. When we decided to laze about in the room for most of the day, we left a "do not disturb" sign on the door and it was totally respected. A letter was left for us outside of our door stating that they would happily address our room or needs after hours with a phone call to the desk. We asked the concierge for a recommendation of a good place to get a bagel. A few minutes later, there was a knock at our door. He gave us the name of a place along with a printed copy of directions. We requested a late check-out and was accommodated easily. We were generally greeted coming and going. Last but not least of all, Ethan forgot his credit card at the front desk and they gave it to Sally at his recommendation when she came in without a single worry of a wild shopping spree. There was space to visit in the main lobby and also a coffee shop/restaurant, but we did not make use of it. We would happily stay there again.

My husband and I were looking for a reasonably priced, but nice hotel in a central location. If that sounds too good to be true in New York City, the Executive Hotel LeSoleil is a great find. Easy walking distance to the Subway and lots of other hot destinations. Spacious (for New York), clean, and modern rooms. We booked the "queen with a view" and had a gorgeous view of the Empire State Building and the World Trade tower. We would definitely stay here again.

My husband and I stayed for 6 nights this July.We had a perfect vacation in this new boutique hotel.Perfectly located,close to everything,but quiet at night.Our room was fantastic as it was a suite with a separate sitting area including a second T.V. The bed was very comfortable.We look forward to returning! .

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in July. The location is perfect easy to walk around midtown, times square, ride the subway, and empire state building. Our room was small but nice and clean. There are 2 elevators so you may have to wait to use. Room and bathroom were very small for my 6'2" husband as there was not much room to walk around bed and luggage. There is not an actual closet but a hanging rack to fit only a few things. WiFi worked well while we were there. My experience with the staff was mixed. A couple of rude girls on the phone, at the front desk and concierge but very nice doormen and guys at the front desk when we left. This hotel is great for location, nice small room and clean.

Newer boutique hotel. Staff was helpful and professional. We had a queen suite and it had plenty of room. The room was quiet and the bed comfortable.The restaurant in the hotel was good and there was a lively group at the bar having fun. Hotel was close to the subway, shows, shopping, Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden.Because it is in the garment district the street is quiet at night as the shops were closed. However, there are other hotels and restaurants within the block that were open at night.I would stay there again.

We enjoyed our 4 night stay. Staff was courteous and professional. Hotel very clean and quiet. Our room was larger than we planned and that rarely happens in NYC. We had a little sitting area with 2 chairs and a flat screen TV, in addition to the flatscreen in the bedroom. Bathroom was a nice size, too. I would have preferred a little more space to hang and fold clothes but it was ok for 4 days. The neighborhood worked out well for us as it was in walking distance to our daughter. We will stay here again.

Loved this hotel! Huge room, quirky decor, but stylish, clean and professional. Staff were kind and helpful, always friendly. Pity they don't have a spot for breakfast, but given the central location there are plenty nice spots within walking distance. Price was very reasonable. Depending where in Manhattan you have meetings, this is a great location.

We stayed at this hotel for a night in June. I didn't really have high expectations for the place but I was really impressed by how good the room was. It was recently remodeled with an excellent bathroom and shower. The hotel itself presents well and feels nice and new. The staff was courteous and friendly. A problem with a blocked drain was quickly taken care of. The location is excellent. It's walking distance from the Empire State Building and Times Square. It's also a short distance to Penn Station. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is staying at midtown NY for a business or personal trip.

Everything was great, room was set up perfectly a special thank you to Yadira for setting up my room and helping me surprise my boyfriend for his birthday. Great experience I will come back there over and over again!

Very friendly staff , very helpfulStayed for 1 week - housekeeping were a let down, didn't replenish toiletries etc, had to keep calling reception to ask for replacements and for coffee etcBut the hotel was in a good location, so so close to Empire State Building Great for exploring the city. Lack of wardrobe space in the room when staying for long periodsStunning full length windows let tons of light into room making them feel huge and airy!

Great location, good value and the staff is incredibly helpful!!! Everyone was soooo nice and helpful. Great service. Very comfortable and homey atmosphere. Like it a lot! Will go back again. AS a single woman I felt very safe and secure.

My daughter and I spent the night at the Hotel LeSoleil while visiting NYC to see Hamilton. It was an easy walk from Penn station and a quick walk to Times Square. This location was quiet, easy to find restaurants without the craziness of Times Square. The room was extremely clean and efficiently laid out. Not huge but perfect for us. The staff at the hotel were great and very helpful. They let us check in early as a room was available. I also left something in the safe and they quickly retrieved it and helped us make arrangements to get it back. We highly recommend this Hotel!

We recently stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. We visit Manhattan 3-4 times a year. This is a new (10 months old) hotel with an excellent location, very nice rooms and more importantly, a wonderful staff. Everyone that we dealt with was exceptional. Thanks to Eddie, Nicola, Stanley and all the other wonderful and caring people who work here. You are really made to feel like family by these wonderful people who go out of their way to make you feel so welcome in their hotel. We have stayed in many hotels in Manhattan and this one is at the top of our list. We will be back in December. A sincere thank you to all of the staff here.

We visited New York to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday. The hotel was lovely and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. There were balloons in our room along with a bottle of wine and other goodies. All of the staff were so friendly even the handyman who shared the lift with. Our room was excellent with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building. We will certainy go back and would recommend this hotel.i

Concierge and staff were consistently professional, efficient and friendly. Room was very small but otherwise good, with natural light and comfortable bed and pillows. Air conditioning was finicky, difficult to adjust to a comfortable temperature though eventually we succeeded. All in all a very good experience.

I booked this hotel for my family to stay during a long weekend. The location is fantastic and close to major subway lines and buses. The staff was very friendly and gave us warm greetings upon check in (and every time we came back). The room is nicely divided into sections, which makes it feel larger than it actually is, and the decor is quite modern. It was clean and comfortable. Hotels in NYC are always going to be expensive, but I think this place was a very good value for the money. Again, the location can't be beat.
user_name:
Garland Q
New York City, New York

review_body: A truly nice hotel well worth a stay. Rooms and other facilities, including the restaurant, were well up to what we expected. The staff was friendly and gave us non New Yorkers good directions and alternatives for dining. The gym was reasonably well equipped and clean as were the rest of the hotel.

Apart from being a superb hotel it really is in a excellent location for the main sightseeing attractions. Firstly it's within a stones throw of the Empire State Building, then not much further is the Rockefeller Centre (top of the rock). Macy's is a few minutes walk away, Central Park say 15 mins walk. Bryant Park about 5 mins walk (not particularly well known but nice place to sit and watch the world go by). Anyway back to the hotel we had a room on the 19th floor with a view of the Empire State Building ! Awesome ! Room was nice, modern, clean, bed very comfortable. One of the highlights of the hotel for us was the staff. All very friendly and helpful. Special mention for Stanley who was so helpful with places to eat and directions to attractions etc. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation !!!

Great property: classy with superior service and personal attention. Stanley welcomes you at the door and is a superior statesman for this property. A Friendly, courteous, kind and most helpful professional. All the staff fot rhis profile and nade us feel at home for pur 4 day stay. The rooms were larger than typical New York midtown and very comfortable. Great access to Times Square, Broadway theatre and shopping and many desired sites. Quality Food service sites were immediately adjacent to the property. Will return!

This hotel is located near the home office for my company in NY. For the last few years I stayed at Hotel Metro. It was never great, but very convenient. About a year ago I decided it was time to find something new and came across LeSoleil and I am so happy I did! The staff is really quite exceptional.
