I have now stayed here 4 or 5 times and they are always friendly and welcoming, but not in a fake way. The rooms are nice and I have been quite fortunate to get some really great views. On my last trip they had a new coffee shop open in the building that was really good and I highly recommend that too. This is my new standard for the neighborhood and I hope they always have room for me!

We enjoyed our several nights' stay here, but there are so many other equal or better choices for the price. The accommodations and the staff lack attention to detail. The room was equipped for one person (one coffee package, one set of towels etc.) despite a reservation for two. We did not report this or complain, because it ultimately did not matter to us. I'm sure staff would have responded promptly, but one should not have to point out such things. The closet is just wide enough for one suit, so no luck if you have a more extended stay. That said, the room is pleasant and otherwise well equipped, beautiful bathroom, superb TV. Front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful.

I brought my girlfriend here for her birthday last month and we stayed for 5 days.The hotel is in an excellent location on 36th Street, two blocks away from the Empire State Building with Times Square a 10 minute walk away.Check in was smooth and uncomplicated and the staff helpful. The room was clean and very well maintained. It's a new hotel but the staff are working hard to maintain the excellent condition of the place.We had an excellent view of the Empire State Building which was worth the money we paid alone.The stay was comfortable and stress free and I really have no complaints at all about it. Yes the room was a bit small, but in Manhattan I'd say it was perfectly acceptable.Check out was faultless and they let us store our bags as we weren't due to fly until late afternoon. I had a good chat with Stanley (concierge?) who was a very nice man and summed up our stay at Executive Hotel LeSoleil.

We just spent four nights here for our very first trip to New York. The location is great for exploring Manhattan on foot, really close to the Subway and less than a 10 minute walk to Penn Station. In short, you can get anywhere easily in no time at all. The front desk was really friendly as was the bartender in the lounge (makes a good martini too), there were two concierge that were fantastic with information, tips and friendliness and two were not so good. That aside, the room was always cleaned well and we'd highly recommend this hotel.

We enjoyed our 7 night stay in this hotel. Everything was great. Staff is friendly and helpfull. Rooms are clean, spacious and well designed. The hotel is also conveniently located. All in all I'd definitely recommened this hotel for a stay in New York City

I liked very much my stay at the hotel excellent location near subwayThe only minus no breakfastThe staff very nice trying to help you on what ever you ask.There are many places you can eat around like coffee shops.But not having a good breakfast in hotelIs a minus for me there for i did not rate it as excellent.The room i stayed was very nice and cleaned every day.

I stayed two nights at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil. The rooms are quite small, but the price is really good for a decent place in Manhattan. I was upgraded to a "mini-suite" of sorts, which had a separate sitting area (a very small one).The main complaint about the room is that the layout was very odd and inconvenient. There was a desk, but it was situated directly in front of the bathroom door. So with someone sitting at the desk, no one can get into the bathroom. Fortunately, I was by myself, but if there were 2 people and one was working at the desk it would be very inconvenient.The service was very friendly at both the front and bell desks.There is an exercise room, although quite small (only one "elliptical").Overall I would recommend.

I recently spent a week here and if first impressions are any indication, this hotel makes a great one!! We arrived early in the afternoon and could not check in right away, but Stanley made sure we were taken care of and that we could go out and enjoy New York with no worries. When we returned to the hotel later on he had already arranged with "Eddie who is always ready" to have our bags delivered to our room. These two gentlemen are great Ambassadors for the hotel and set the tone for my entire stay. They made some fabulous dining recommendations that were within walking distance of the hotel and gave us some other tips on the subway, must see spots and some lesser known New York gems. Every day as we were passing them in the hotel, they would take time to say hello and make sure we were having a enjoyable stay. Eddie, recommended Ess- A Bagel as a place for the BEST bagels in New York. I have to agree with him. The hotel is located very conveniently located between 5th & 6th Ave on 36th Street and is within walking distance to many of New York's popular attractions including Times Square, The Empire State Building, Macy's and can even walk to Central Park from the hotel... it took us about 15 minutes.

Being that it was our first time in NY, my friends and I wanted to make sure we got the experience with safety and convenience. This hotel gave us that and more. Everyone was extremely nice- Eddie, Stanley, Chris and all were always willing to help and were super friendly! The location was great and SO much was walking distance- we barely needed to take a cab or the subway (though you should a couple times for the experience). The beds were very comfortable and the rooms always clean. Thank you to Hotel LeSoleil and staff for making our stay one we will never forget!

Central location, ideal for a city break, rooms are comfortable, don't listen to the moans about not much hanging space for clothes, there is ample unless you're staying a fortnight.The staff are the most welcoming, helpful and really go out of their way to help. Best I've ever come across anywhere in the world.easy walk to 5th Ave, Maceys, Times Square fantastic local places for food and coffee right on the doorstep.LouisXIII the concierge has said I should say he is the best of them all as he rarely gets mentioned in reviews unlike another chap, Eddie I think his name is. but they all have a wealth of knowledge on everything you need for a good stay.

My husband LOVES this hotel and that is great praise because his standards are very high when it comes to hotels. After staying there for a second time, it has quickly broken my top three. I have travelled many places domestically and internationally and this is my favorite domestic hotel. So, next time I have to stay in New York City, I will look first at the Le Soliel for availability.

This is a great hotel, in the garment district but so close to Times Square, Bryant Park, Macy's, Broadway, all within a walking distance. Room was very clean indeed and shower was excellent, quite large considering with enough clean towels and toiletries. Everyone on reception desk was friendly and helpful and that includes the concierge. Can't fault it. we were on the 16th floor, so not noisy, air-conditioning was perfect. Lobby small but very cosy (who needs a lobby right?). bed very comfortable indeed. Lovely fresh coffee we made in our room every morning. Surprised no free water. Bar was expensive so we didn't get anything but you don't really need to with a Duane Reade on every corner. A bit expensive but worth it as room was not that small for a change and again very clean and all staff extremely friendly and helpful.

After having spent some time reading (negative) reviews about New York hotels, it became clear that hotels in New York are just way more expensive other cities we have traveled to. This is currently amplified by the weak position of the euro towards the dollar. It's a pity. But if that's reality, and you are a first time visitor to New York, it doesn't help fellow travelers to complain about your moment of adjustment.Midtown is an excellent position on Manhattan to start exploring. As such LeSoleil is in in the middle of the middle. A lot of highlights are at walking distance.With a room at the back of the hotel, we didn't have much of a view, a true New York experience allowing for perfect sleep. The bed and cushions were very good for us to rest well after a long day full of impressions. We spent most of the days outside the hotel anyway and went to the Top of the Rock for the view. The room was (with the reviews in mind) beyond our expectations of space, clean and well taken care of. Some extra storage space for clothes would have been appreciated even more. The bathroom had a modern feel with a great shower and plenty of space. Service downstairs was royally friendly. There are plenty opportunities for a breakfast or dinner in the area.

We booked a queen room but were apparently upgraded to a queen suite. This worked well as although we had no views, we did have a separate reading/ TV area. Room was a good size but does lack a wardrobe. Coffee machine was ok as were the bathroom amenities and bathrobe! Good location in midtown and although we were only on 2nd floor, we didn't hear any street noises. Staff were pleasant and room was cleaned well every day. Lifts are a bit slow. Good spot for a stay in NYC.

My husband and I stayed in LeSoleil during our 5 day trip to New York in May 2016. The hotel exceeded our expectation for the price we paid - it is on the less expensive side from the similar style hotels in the area but nothing that we've observed compromised the quality of our stay. As pointed out in previous reviews during busy hours it might take 5-7 minutes to wait for an elevator because it is small and slow. We've only experienced it once and it really wasn't an issue. The hotel is located great for somebody eager to explore Manhattan sights by foot. Personnel in the lobby was smiley and friendly - we would definitely stay there again.

My boyfriend and I decided to spend the holiday weekend in the city and came across this hotel and its good reviews. One thing is for sure, they really do have great customer service, calling to check if everything is ok was a surprise to us. The room was a decent size and I liked the big size of the bathroom. The only comment that I would say about the bathroom is that there was no shower doors, just a glass panelling, and it was kinda awkward to shower. We enjoyed that there was mini fridge in the room, that was really handy. The bed was comfortable. The room we stayed in had a view of the street and that was ok. From the 8th floor you didn't really hear any of the street noise, which was good.

Pros: Very attentive customer service, great view of Empire State Building, clean room, dishes in suite option, additional TV viewing space in suite option.Cons: Small & uncomfortable bed and pillows, no room service options (breakfast, lunch or dinner), half of shower glass window exposed, mini-bar refrigerator below par.

The location of the hotel is perfect. The rooms were very clean and secure. The staff were amazing. They were friendly and willing to assist in anyway to make our stay enjoyable. Will definitely stay again.

Hello, We recently stayed at your property over memorial weekend and wanted to extend our gratitude. Your hotel was one of the best experiences we've had. The cleanliness professionalism and service were exceptional. Every one of the staff was courteous and friendly and Eddie went the extra mile to make our stay as convenient as possible. The location was ideal as well and made it easy to get to all the tourist attractions while still remaining less hectic and quiet. We will highly recommend your hotel to anyone visiting and will definitely be back to stay. Sincerely, Satisfied Guests

I took some time researching and making a choice on where to stay in NY on our vacation. (Last time I visited NY, I was with family and they had a very expensive hotel room somewhere on Manhattan and they had a rat. ) I was extremely happy with this hotel! Above and beyond my expectations! Super clean every day, the staff was very very friendly and helpful, and the location is just perfect! 2 blocks from the Empire State Building, about a 5-10 minute walk to time square, Rockefeller center, the library and it's off of 5th AVE!!!! Tons of restaurants and shopping on the same block, which is great, so you don't have to take the taxi all the time (traffic is a nightmare) and the subway (we took it for entertainment purposes) is on the corner of the street. We had no upgrades for the room, but it was modern, worked and looked great, loved the bathroom, totally updated and comfortable. I would definitely go back to this hotel and recommend it highly. The only thing I did not like, was that the air heating/conditioning made a noise in the wall. I didn't find that to be a big deal

We can't fault this hotel, we stayed for 4 nights for my best friends' birthday and every aspect was brilliant from our arrival to the moment we left. The best part of this hotel is the staff, from check-in to departure they couldn't do enough for us. The location is perfect, the rooms are beautifully clean and there is a great bar. Thank you to everyone for making our stay so fab and contributing to my friend's fabulous 50th trip!

I stayed at Le Soleil with three friends. The service was personalised and fantastic. The staff is well trained and go well beyond the call of duty. The location isnt fantastic but it is central and the interior of the hotel more than makes up for it. The rooms are small but they are well designed sleek and modern and for multiple persons the setup of the queen suites is appropriate as there is a room a walkway and a small cove that serves as a mini den. I would highly recommend them. Alfredo and Nicole as well as several others whose names i cannot recall form part of the extremely friendly.

Would like to thank Yadira for organizing a package my friends 50th Birthday. She was in room 1905 which was her date of birth and month. She said her room was done out beautiful.Thanks again Yadira for making her stay a one she wont forget.

We were only in New York for 5 nights . 4.5 days we wanted somewhere that was great value for money and close to everything. This was a Great Location walking distance to so much and just far enough away form the husltle and bustle of Time Square but only a few minutes walk... We tried to book a Queen suite room and none were availbe so setlled on booking the Queen room. We found this room very small, ok for one person but not for us. The staff at the time were very helpful a special mention to Andre, Lilly and Eddie . We were told there would be an upgrade avaiable the next day, and after a little hiccup we were then upgraded and couldnt be happier. Our view was fantastic and the room size was great and very clean. Stanley the doorman is excellent from getting a cab to just giving directions such a lovley guy. We would tell all our friends to stay here and we will be back ourselves some day. Our only regret is we couldnt stay longer !

We stayed here for the graduation of our son. The location could not have been better. Hotel lives up to a small 4*, great value for money considering comfort and top location. We had an executive suite which are on lower levels, so opt for a big room on higher levels with view. Don't expect large rooms, this is NYC. Rooms are small but then if you are visit NYC, you never stay in the hotel except to sleep at night!! Don't expect breakfast as there is none but a block left or right you would not know where to eat the choice is so vast. Shops are also all around on Madison or 5th block away. Practically walk everywhere...its so convenient. Hotel is very clean, good helpful, kind staff. Nice living room to work. Nice restaurant and bar within the hotel. Definitely will stay here again on my next trip to NYC.

Has to check into this hotel on very short notice have original hotel lost my reservation and informed of same at the front desk. Clean modern suite at a great price. Desk staff very helpful. Would definitely return.

We stayed at Executive Hotel Le Soleil for 10 nights and what great choice. We booked the hotel mainly on all the great reviews that it was getting on trip advisor and having stayed there I can see why it's so popular. Great email communication before we arrived from Marjory and when we arrived Andre welcomed us to New York (and the hotel!) and was extremely helpful. Eddie helped us to our room and during our stay always had a smile on his face. We were on the 17th floor and had room 1704 which was a lovely big suite, 2 big TV screens, immaculately clean, nice bathroom and the room was very, very quiet. Rooms cleaned to a first class standard every day and the staff are a credit to the hotel. Wifi was spot on! Nice adjoining Taste and Grind coffee bar serving up great coffee. At night we chilled and unwinded with a beer in the quiet relaxed environment at Le Soleil. Everything about the hotel is positive. It's just 3 minutes walk from Herald Square, the Subway and Macy's... 5 minutes from Penn station, Madison square garden, Empire states and just 10 minutes walk from Times Square, theatreland. I could go on and on, but I won't! Thanks to Stanley for sorting out our journey back to JFK and thanks to all for making our stay a fantastic experience.

The location is ideal for theater and business travelers. Located between 5th and 6th Avenues in mid 30s. Room was wonderful, modern, clean and well appointed. Chris and Penny at the front desk were uber helpful. Nice addition is the wonderful bar and restaurant opened just a month. Found Le Soleil by accident. Love the vibe and quality for the $$. We'll be back.

I was having a hard time finding a good hotel at a nice rate. Upon looking online I discovered Executive Hotel LeSoleil. The rooms were booked tight. It was by tooth and nail I was able to get a room. Mr Andre the reservation clerk worked his magic and found me a great room. I began to explain my rough experience i was having durning my vacation in N.Y.. He and Ms. Lopez made me feel wonderful about my last day there. After finding me a room he helped me find great parking after I told him about my 65.00 ticket. He was awesome. They both displayed great "customer service skills". The room was excellent and very comfortable.They were the first people to make me feel welcome in N.Y and it was my last day there. Thank you guys for making me feel appreciated in your city.

I stayed 4 nights and found this fresh modern hotel to be a very good value. Rooms are impeccably clean, though compact, and have all requisite comforts. The bathroom size, shower and finishes was luxurious by New York standards, very ample and a real plus. The hotel is conveniently located near subways and midway between midtown and downtown, easy to get anywhere. The hotel restaurant is likewise contemporary, with an emphasis on good ingredients, simply prepared, and a variety of small plates and everything from gourmet burgers to full entrees. Finally, the craft coffee bar attached to the hotel offers superb espresso and drip coffee and breakfast pastries! What more can a West Coast coffee snob ask for?

Made this reservation last minute (day of) and very impressed with the accommodations for the price point. We were only using it as a place to rest our heads, but it was nice enough to have spent more time in as well. no complaints

Stayed overnight for a business meeting at this relatively new establishment in mid-town - primarily because of its proximity to the venue I was attending. Hotel still feels new - everything looks nice and clean. Staff were helpful and welcoming. The room was a tight fit but fairly functional; it was well stocked with food and drinks and amenities, viz., bath robe, ironing,coffee maker and fridge. Bed was comfortable and climate control was responsive. There are no closets and hanging space is limited. Bathroom has a walk-in shower stall but water pressure could be stronger. Wifi was free and the signal reliable and robust. There is no room service as yet (coming soon) but food at the attached restaurant (Trademark Taste) was very good (dinner); however, service was a little slow. Overall, I thought this was a nice establishment that is well-managed and is worthy of your consideration if you care to be in this part of town.

We were on vacation and stayed for 4 nights. The location is great; short walk to Bryant park, macy's, rockefella and affordable eateries nearby. Room was comfortable though did not have enough closet space. Wifi was reliable with strong signal. There was still noise from garbage trucks early morning even though room was soundproof ( i was on the 5th floor). We felt welcomed at this property- the doormen in particular Stanley was very friendly and it was always a pleasure to be warmly greeted by him. Housekeeping seemed less consistent and reliable. We called housekeeping and no one picked up and had no refills for tissue paper. On one particular day, we came back to our room with beds half done ( it looked as if someone had slept on one side of the bed) and window was left opened. If not for housekeeping would have given this hotel a much better rating.

We had a great stay here. The staff was unfailingly polite and helpful, rooms were clean and well maintained, location is great. Our room was a queen with a small separate sitting area as you entered. We were at the back of the hotel which was very QUIET (essential for us; no view but not something we cared about). Only thing to note is that hanging storage space is limited. There are adequate drawers and shelves, but the open closet really only holds a few items. That was very manageable for us and a short stay, but if you travel 'heavy' it could be an issue. Usually we just go back home after a night in NYC but this was a busy weekend so we decided to stay in town. Great value for what we got and so easy and pleasant that we will probably return soon.

Cant say enough about this hotel!We finished our honeymoon at NYC for 5 nights and booked this hotelEverything was amazing since the first moment. they upgrade our room to a suite and the staff was super nice and helping - each and everyone of them!The guy at the front desk Luis was so helpful and such a great guy to talk to, could chat with him for hours!Next to the hotel there is a really cool place to eat breakfast called "Pure Fresh", we ate there every morningThe location is perfect, walking distance from everything importantThere is no doubt i will stay there again in the future, thank you guys for everything!

Loved this hotel. Great location, hip vibe and great staff. Was upgraded upon arrival. Room was very cool, modern and sleek, very comfortable. Would definitely come back. Eddie was great with our bags and helped store them while we went to brunch upon check out.

So this is the 4th or 5th time staying at the hotel. The last time I was here I even booked 4 other rooms for my friends and family and convinced them to stay here.This time in NYC I decided to try something different and stayed at another property around the corner but was not impressed and soon moved back to the Executive for my final nights stay in NYC. Now Eddie at the door is a charm and recognised me straight away and took me to the front desk and let them know I was a very regular customer. I was only in town for 1 night and had booked a standard room as the price difference to the suite was ridiculous for 1 night. Just to add I usually stay in the queen suit as they are very spacious and perfect for a longer stay. Anyway at reception I asked Eddie to see if he could possibly get us an upgrade as a favour and Im sure he asked but unfortunately the management does not see fit in rewarding loyalty. I understand if the hotel was at capacity but from looking online they had numerous queen suites available and although Im not expecting something for nothing and was more than happy to be in my room I had booked and paid for I just feel it would have been a nice touch to upgrade us.The hotel itself and location is awesome but certain staff and management could do with a lesson in customer service. On one of my trips in Jan I was caught up in the snow storm and checked the price of extending my stay on booking.com and then checked at reception which was much higher. When I informed the member of staff I was advised to book it on booking.com. this along with telling me to go to my room for a cup of tea when there was a machine in reception was not very welcoming.In regards to extending my stay and telling me to book online, I was not impressed as I had extended my stay on a previous trip and the member of staff at the time matched booking.com.Do I like this hotel and will I stay again? Yes probably, although I did initially change over to a different hotel for the first few nights which shows my loyalty to executive le soleil isn't what it has been and this is all down to the service of staff.

Spent several days there in April - first night by myself and then my wife joined me for some additional time in NYC. The hotel staff was absolutely wonderful and remembered it was my wife's birthday when she arrived. I want to thank Alfredo, Stanley, Andre, and Eddie. Will certainly be back again.

Tastefully decorated Boutique hotel. Centrally loacated, short distance to Macys, NY public Library and Grand Central Station. Many Mid priced Restaurants within walking distance. The hotel is spotless, beds exceptional for comfort. Staff friendly and there to help. We upgraded for 25 $ more per night. This gave us a slighty larger bedroom and a sitting room with second tv and huge windows with a nice view. The two chairs in this room were not the best and could be more comfortable. Bathroom was a good size. The hotel and room is spotless.We would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Executive Hotel LeSoleil was all we could have hoped for. We booked only a week before arriving and still managed to get a room with a view. We stayed in the executive queen suite ( which was very spacious, as it had an extra sitting area with tv) the bathroom was also very spacious. Everything was very clean, new, and comfy. No noise even though you are in the centre of manhattan. Stanley and the entire staff ( sorry cannot recall other names) were very friendly and helpful. This hotel is walking distance from many places, empire state, broadway, times square, bryant park, herald square and metro station is very close by too. Please just include european plugs in all rooms as we had difficulty finding an adapter. Would definitely visit this hotel again(hopefully very soon).

Very new and elegant hotel with kind and careful stuff (hi, Eddie :)) before booking we've read about excellent location, but in real life it appeared better than we expect. Amazing view from the room. No any noise from the street which is very important for Manhattan. Excellent! The best hotel we've staid (5 times before).

Ok. I lived in New York from 2003-2012 but I come back often to work and play. Midtown is not exactly a fun place to go out, but it doesn't matter because it's close to every train, and walkable to places that are fun. The hotel is new so it's clean. The staff is friendly. Ask for a room with a view facing south and you'll get to see all of downtown.I will be back.
user_name:
frequentflyer227
New York City, New York

review_body: On arrival we were greeted and welcomed to the hotel, guided to our room, which was extremely spacious. The room offered a seating area away from the bed with its own television. The heating/air con was easily controlled and the shower was good with ample room. The restaurant was of a good quality and the service was again excellent, the menu was adequate and reasonably priced. All the staff from front of house to housekeeping seemed intent on being there for the customer.The location is good for all major attractions and we were able to walk north to Central Park and south to the World Trade Centre. There are plenty of cafes/bars for all your meals. A really good location with the benefit of a quality establishment and exceptional staff.
user_name:
LibertyLegend
New York City, New York

review_body: By all standards (and my entire family works in hospitality management), our stay was exceptionally pleasant. The situation is ideal, as it at walking distance from all major landmarks. The room was clean and functional. The decoration was tasteful and we appreciated being supplied with phone chargers (important for european travellers whose plugs will not work). Most importantly, the staff was available, understanding, helpful and kind. They took into account our personal needs and made us feel personally welcome and cared for. This stay was a surprise (my boyfriend proposed there) and all of the staff (at the door, the reception, bar and room service) made it an exceptional experience. They will always be a part of it. In fact, it meant so much to us that we have already booked our next stay for our wedding!

Really friendly staff, I was made to feel very welcome. The room was a decent size for an NYC boutique hotel and the bed was very comfortable. The only downside was there is no real restaurant, there is a cafe next door that has a restaurant but it's not clear how associated they are. I have to say that the cafe does the best fresh mint tea I've ever had and a pretty good cookie too! I would definitely stay here again, location is also super central so that is a plus.

My stay at Le soleil over all was very good it exeeded my expectations. Although the front desk service was a little unhelful and not so friendly upon check in. The other staff was great and helpfull also the house keeping staff was friendly. Our room was a suite on the 19th floor . Worth the price and cinsidered as a huge room especially for newyork . Modern furniture,cozy lobby and had a great quality sleep. Big,modern and clean bathrooms too. Over all a very very nice hotel would be my top pick for my next visit.

Girls night out (mom and two daughters) while the boys (dad and two sons) slept at the USS Intrepid. Excellent staff, great room, comfy bed. Eddie helped with bags (storage, etc.) and really made us feel at home. Thanks! Great trip!

I stayed at the Le Soleil New York as a last minute option for one night in New York. Overall, it was a fine stay, but nothing special. There were a few key things that made the stay less then great and would cause me not to return.First, the good. The staff were very friendly when I arrived late with a reservation that had just been booked. The got me checked in quickly, and sent me off to my room. The room on first glance was nice, small, even by New York standards, with a larger bathroom, mini-bar, robe, and good size TV. Also, as a big plus, I had a non-view room (actually my preference) which was very quiet and had no street noise.Now for the not-so-good. My number one complaint is the bedding, which is listed as “sumptuous beds with luxurious bedding.” I will tell you right now that it is are anything but that. The beds are old, and hard as a rock, and the sheets are so scratchy that I was looking for anything to wrap myself in so I didn’t have to touch them. Even just sitting on the bed wasn’t comfortable. If you like hard beds with scratchy sheets, you’ll be good, otherwise look elsewhere. Also, as a note, I know people are going to say bedding may be preferential, but I have literally never had this problem at any hotel I’ve ever stayed before Le Soleil. Probably the worst night of sleep I have ever had in a hotel.My other complaint is about room cleanliness. While the room was overall, fairly clean, the walls had dirt scuffs on them, there was dust everywhere, especially on top of pictures, baseboards, etc., and the bathroom shower could have been cleaner.Overall, it was an okay stay, but I don’t think that I would go running back to this “luxury” boutique hotel, especially in NYC where there are so many other options.

Stayed here for 1 night and wish it was for more. Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Lobby looked very warm and inviting. Room was comfortable and well appointed. Fridge was filled with liquids but could have been a bit bigger. Bathroom was spacious.

Firstly the staff - every - single - one - of - them - were excellent.The hotel location is A1! You really could not get a better situated hotel.Several reviews talk about a refurbished hotel. Our room was not recently refurbished!See that attached photo - dangerous plug socket.Bathroom door lock did not work.Wifi keeps disconnecting because of silly accesss rules. This is 2016!Toilet blocked easily.Shower tray kept overflowing. Clearly sewerage issues.Room very small.$50 a night deposit!"Adult" items in the family room "mini bar" Hotel: plug socket, bathroom door lock. Good staff. Poor WiFi rules but got speed. Good location. Small room. $50 a night deposit.Shower not draining.That sounds really bad - it wasn't. However, it wasn't as good as we expected.

This hotel is located a close to Madison Avenue, Park Avenue and the Empire State Building. It is a newer, immaculate hotel with a very friendly staff. The front desk, as well as Stanley and Eddie and the Concierge are there to assist you in any way possible. They go out of their way to make your trip pleasurable and to help advise you about the best restaurants, the best tours. . .anything you may need to make your NYC experience the best it can be. When returning to NY, I will definitely stay here again!

We recently stayed at LeSoleil for three nights and I feel like it was truly a find - a tremendous hotel with heart right in the "heart" of the city. I was looking for a luxury hotel (4+ stars) that could accomodate 4 of us (2 couples) in a larger room, and be somewhat affordable (by NYC standards). We stayed in a very generous sized room, with a queen bedroom on one side and the sleeper sofa in the main area of the suite, with the luxurious bathroom in-between.The hotel earned its 4 stars in the usual ways (gracious lobby, attention to detail, furnishings) - however it really set itself apart by their treatment of their guests. I mentioned that it was my sister's birthday during our stay, so they noted this on the reservation. I was overjoyed when the crew at reception broke into a chorus of "Happy Birthday" on our second night there. Upon getting home, I realized that I might have left behind some clothing at the hotel. They had the items - and were very helpful in shipping them back to me. This hotel is truly a find, and has such nice people working there. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and plan to go back next time I need a hotel in NYC.

LeSoleil is a beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of the garment district. The staff was friendly, my room was small but everything was new and clean. The room had all I needed, the bed was comfortable and I slept soundly. This was the quiets room I've ever enjoyed in Manhattan.

The staff at Executive Hotel Le Soleil were beyond amazing and friendly. Thank you Christopher for making our honeymoon a true experience to remember, Thank you Yadira for your beautiful room decorations and all of our special treats... Marjory, your professionalism was great! Thank you for such a great stay and service! Our Bellman, Eddie, was so helpful with anything we needed and always greeted us with a smile! My husband and I truly enjoyed our stay here and are definitely coming back :) We HIGHLY recommended staying at this hotel if you are coming to NYC/Times Square!
user_name:
Frances T
North Bergen, New Jersey

review_body: ok the room is small. However, take into consideration where the room is? Mid town Manhattan, walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, empire state building around the corner! 5th Avenue at the end of the street! What's not to like?

I was here for a convention and my stay was great. All of the staff were very attentive especially Eddie who looked after me, flagged cabs and offered some great suggestions. The queen room with view had a small kitchenette which was an added bonus, everything was very clean and well maintained. Great location near Herald Square, metro and good restaurants. I would stay here again.

Have visited NY many times and like to stay in Times Square near theater district. 1st time at Executive Hotel LeSoleil. Would definitely stay here again. Very nice hotel at a good price. Service was awesome, especially Eddie and Chris who were so pleasant and "above and beyond" helpful. Nice bar/restaurant attached which just opened.

Every member of the staff seems to bend over backwards to make sure you are taken care of. Our room was lovely, clean, and spacious, with a seating area separate from the sleeping area. There is also a desk, several drawers for storage, a rack for hanging jackets and other clothing, and an in-room safe. The bathroom was spotless and modern. This hotel provides exceptional value due to all of its amenities and its location. I cannot stress enough how great our experience was. Just fabulous.

Room are small, but very clean and upscale, right in the middle of everything Empire state building around the corner, Macys right there, 5th Ave , short walk to Times Squareshows, Central parkFirst time in NYC- doorman helped out with directionsOverall, Great

What a great Hotel find it was!Booked this hotel with recommendation of friend of mine for our company. What a great decision it was. Last thing you need to worry about it your group complaining about hotel of your choice.We all loved staying here and our president let me know we will be staying here whenever we are up in NYC. No need to search for better hotel stay. And he is used to staying in hotels like Park Hyatt or Four Season Hotel.Names to mention at this hotel.Bernie - Best Sales Manager, what a amazing guy! He makes sure everything goes well.Eddie - Front man guy. He is off on Tuesday and Wednesday but if you are there other days, look for him and he will get things done for you whatever it is.Best part is hotel was close to everything we needed except Air port.

Amazing staff, clean and fresh hotel with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in when away from home. Ample space in the room, awesome shower and really super location. A special shout out to Andre at the front desk, Stanley in the front of the house and Amanda at the coffee station. You guys are the best. It is quiet and offers views of the Empire State Building. This is where we will stay when in NYC from now on.

Stayed here with my girlfriends for 4D/3N to experience luxury & royal treatment in NYC! LOL!! The place is very new, lobby always smells great. My arrival was so smooth, Stanley assisted me with my baggage. Truly appreciate the front desk lady who gave us a room upgrade. The doorman (Eddie), concierge & the girl at the coffee shop are all friendly & very helpful. Even our room cleaner -Akua. :) we normally leave her a thank you note & she's so sweet to leave us short greetings as well. Our room is huge compare to NYC standard, it can actually fits 4 people. We can sleep all day with their bed because it's very comfortable. The bathroom amenities are awesome and yes, we are definitely going back! thank you guys!

To find a truly nice hotel in NYC can be tricky, but this is certainly one of them. Nice and serviceminded staff, clean rooms, comfortable beds, nice bathrooms, great location. Ask for a room with a view and take a shower looking at the Empire State Building.

This hotel is an exceptionally nice 4 star hotel, close to a 5 because of the staff. I booked last minute and got a fantastic rate and was pleasantly surprised by how nice my reception was and how great the room was. The room was quiet, off street and well appointed. The room is just laid out well. There’s a sitting room when you enter with TV, then the bath in the middle which kind of separated or made a separate bedroom. The bed was very comfortable and I was able to sleep with the window open or partially open. There was a coffee maker in the room and the housekeeper generously gave me extra coffee. The designer utilized glass armoire’s for closets which further separated the sleeping area from any noise in the hall or from the elevator.This hotel is a rare find for NYC with a great location just off 5th avenue and short walk from Penn Station. I was in my room within 1 hour of landing JFK and taking the LIRR to Penn; not bad for 5 pm in NYC.

We were a group of three friends who stayed at the hotel for 9 nights. We got a warm welcome and the staff was always friendly. When we were seated in the lobby the staff always asked about or day and gave us tips for things to see.Sometimes the cleaning staff forgot that we were three people staying in the room, and we often had to ask for extra towels. But other than that the room was spottles. The hotel is located a short walk from Times Square, and had Victorias Secret, Gap and Forever 21 right around the corner. Also not far from Empire State Building and Madison Square Garden. In summary the stay was great and we would love to come back!

This is a very comfortable hotel within easy walking distance of Times Square. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The standard rooms are small but more than adequate for a three night stay. The bathroom was fabulous. There is a coffee bar in reception but we did not use this. The one thing I didn't like were the mini bar prices which were to say the least very expensive. But a market nearby catered for our needs, water snacks etc. I would recommend this hotel as a base for a short visit to the Big Apple. I would certainly stay here again.
user_name:
colin S
Worcester Park, United Kingdom

review_body: I've now stayed at Executive Hotel LeSoleil twice and loved every moment of it. The staff is fantastic and very welcoming - the rooms are spacious and very comfortable. It's been an extremely pleasant stay each time and I plan to exclusively stay with them each time I'm in NYC. The location is very central and easily accessible, near Penn Station and subway lines. Highly recommend!

From the moment I first checked in with Andre it was really a great experience. All staff were all so friendly and willing to accommodate requests. They also remembered who we were and genuinely seemed to enjoy what they did. Eddy was also great at the front. My father has some issues walking and he picked up on it right away. No requested seemed too small because he's do it was a smile. I have saved this hotel on my phone for all other trips!!Thanks!!!

We decided to visit NYC for 4 nights and stayed at LeSoleil. I would have given it 5 stars but we opted for a room with a view which ended up being tiny. The view was good but not much better than our friends' room which was on a lower floor but much more spacious. I think the hotel could have done a better job explaining how much space you sacrifice when choosing a room with a view. With that said, the staff was very courteous and helpful. Eddie at the door greeted us warmly and offered to help us every time we went back to the hotel. Andre was also very cool as he checked us in the first night. The location was also great with many bars and restaurants just a short walk away. I would definitely stay here again. Though this time I think I'd choose square footage over the view.

It was one of the more pleasant places i have stayed in New York. Much better than throwing ridiculous amout of money on old hotels where the rooms need upgradation. The bathrrom was nice and the bed was comfortable. Alfredo made sure that i was able to do an early check in and staff was excellent and very helpful.

Excellence from our check in til leaving 4 days later. The service was wonderful: rooms clean and spacious. Even though the restaurant is not yet finished, the staff readily gave suggestions for places nearby. Good location, only a few blocks from Broadway and Times Square without all the noise at night.

Hotel in great location near to attractions, shops, bars and restaurants.Staff are all very friendly and welcoming.Room a disappointment on arrival, dirty marks on walls and carpet, two lights not working and the toilet handle fell off after the first flush!All issues rectified besides the walls and given a voucher for a free breakfast of pastries and coffee.Had to ask for housekeeping to attend to uncleaned room on one evening, they arrived straight away so good result.Dirty glasses left in room on another occasion, but again sorted swiftly after asking.Only a coffee machine in the room so no way of making a cup of tea.Rooms very small and next to no hanging room for clothes.Nice hotel lobby to relax in with a real fire.
user_name:
Dawn K
Market Drayton, United Kingdom

review_body: Had a great stay in this new boutique hotel. Exceeded expectations. Location was perfect, away from the hustle bustle of Time Square yet easy 10 mins walk to Time Square. Lots of restaurants around. Around the corner is Macy's.Staff especially Nicola & Andre at the front desk are great to accommodated our needs.Bell captain Eddie was exceptional.Room was spacious and clean marble counter and bath.Totally enjoyed our stay because of the exceptional staff.Will definitely return if going back to New York.

Eddie and all of the service staff made us feel right at home. We will stay here every time we come to the city. Rooms were quiet, conveniently located, everything was so clean and it was reasonably priced, too! Thank you for helping to make our city stay terrific.

We spent 5 nights in the Hotel (5 people in two rooms). One room had a sofa bed for extra guests.The location is fantastic and you can walk to a number of sights/shops in only a few minutes and the cost was great value for the location.The rooms are great with only minor issues being poor shower pressure and the beds are almost too soft!!The new bar and restaurant was to open just after we left but it looks good and will be a good addition although there are plenty of places to eat and drink nearby.

We found this hotel on Jetsetter and decided to try it out. We were attending the NIT at Madison Square Garden and the hotel was just a short walk, so it was perfect. We were helped at the front desk by Louis, who could not have been any nicer!! Louis made check-in so pleasant! The doorman was also so helpful. I asked directions and he actually walked outside and showed me exactly where to go! Our room was very clean with a comfortable bed and nice linens. We will definitely come back to the Executive Hotel Le Soleil!!

A brand new hotel in Mid Town NY. Pleasant rooms of average size with a very modern feel, good Wi-Fi in rooms but terrible in reception area. The rooms are comfortable with good beds and bedding but not as described, no duck down duvets or pillows, ours were distinctly man made fibre. The room servicing is poor; they always forgot something, soap, shampoo, tea, coffee, tissues etc. Housekeeping needs to be improved.Yet another shower that breaks the myth that showers in the US are high pressure and excellent, the pathetic trickle from mine was insufficient to wet the whole of my body at once.The concierge staff are friendly and helpful but the receptionists showed no interest in their guests. The coffee bar was permanently closed during our stay and I cannot supply a restaurant review because it has not opened yet!This hotel, which is well situated, could be excellent but requires a management effort, to make it competitive with other mid-price range competitors.

Executive Hotel LeSoleil, There is not enough to say about this hotel. It's absolutely beautiful, The lobby is spacious, rooms are amazing, staff are top notch, some of the best in New York City. I was there for a birthday present that my girlfriend had set out for me. The hotel was very well located right in the middle Manhattan. Everything that you would want in a hotel you can find it in LeSoleil I really wanted to eat at their restaurant but it doesn't open until april first, I will be back to eat there and visit the hotel once again. Can't finish this review without giving a great mention to Kevin and Luis XIII, they were my go to guys in LeSoleil, Truly Know how to give Fabulous customer service.

Everything went very well. We got EXACTLY what we were promised, the rooms were clean and the location was perfect! Definitely worth every penny! Loads of breakfast places etc. around. Would deffinately recommend.

Excellent location behind the Empire state building and 5 blocks from the Penn station.very clean and modern rooms. The bed is super comfortable.The staff is very friendly and helpful. Soon the hotel will open a restaurant which will be very convenient.

My second trip back. Great hotel in an ideal Midtown location. Rooms are larger than most NYC hotels with all the right touches. A restaurant is opening soon and it looks great. This is becoming my place to stay when in NYC.

My husband and I spent what turned out to be an absolutely frigid 2 days in February to spend time with our daughter, who lives in NY. Though we arrived well before the time that our room was ready, the friendly staff invited us to relax in the lounge after they stored our luggage. It's in a great location, and if it hadn't been so cold (and snowy) we probably would have walked to more places. The doorman went out of his way to keep us inside while he hailed cabs. The room was very clean and comfortable. We had one small problem; a light bulb for reading over the bed was out. I called the front desk and they took care of it immediately. All staff members were friendly and helpful. The only thing that would have made it better is if there had been a breakfast available. We would definitely stay there again.

I came here with my girlfriend to celebrate our two years anniversary. We've been planning this trip for about a year now, and we chose this hotel based off how the bathroom looked. However, everything exceeded my expectations. First of all, the staff are by far the nicest, most welcomed, caring, and etc people I ever met. Every one would greet us as we walked by without hesitation.Upon arrival, Stanley was the first person that we met and he happily took care of our bags as we walked around the city until our room was ready. Both Eddie and Kevin went above and behind to take care of our needs.The thing that left an impact on me the most was, when Kevin was done with his shift he went out of his way to say goodbye to us. We talked about how great this hotel and everything is, that we have no problem coming back here again. In fact the moment we got back home, we instantly booked our room. The hallway smells like cupcakes. My girlfriend agreed with me when I pointed it out.

Wow. I went to New York for a convention, and stayed here. What a beautiful hotel.Not only was the hotel amazing, i was extremely impressed by the staff, especially LuisXIII at the front desk. He was very friendly, asked me if i needed anything, and recommended places to see, and eat. He is a major asset to this hotel. I will definitely be back!!!

Good location, staff are alright, rooms are new, had a great week in New York but I am very disappointed with this hotel in the aftermath. Desk was busy when we checked out and the concierge took our keys told us everything would be taken care of and the incidentals deposit (50$ a day for us us 5 days) would be returned in 5 working days.We did not use the mini bar and obviously did not damage the room. Despite numerous phonecalls from overseas and greeted with unhelpful staff who did not want to know and unresponded emails I was getting nowhere over a month after our stay in getting my deposit back.I had to get the visa department of my bank involved in order to get the rightful refund of my money!!! Very frustrating Very poor by the hotel! Do not stay here plenty of other hotels in NY.

I spend about 80% of my time living in hotel rooms, so I'm not easily impressed. I must say, the Executive Hotel LeSoleil surpassed my every expectation. From the prime location close to Times Square, yet surprisingly quiet, to the friendly staff and manager who went above and beyond to ensure I was taken care of, to the well appointed room with tasteful finishings, the LeSoleil left nothing wanting. Even the internet was complimentary; unheard of in NYC. I have never had a more enjoyable New York experience, and would like to personally thank Lowell, Margarie, Eddie, and the rest of the team at LeSoleil for treating me like a part of their family. The hotel is only a 30 minute ride from LGA and a 10 minute walk from Penn Station, adding convenience to its long list of attributes. No question, I recommend the Executive Hotel LeSoleil to anyone visiting New York. 5 Stars!

Stayed here for one week in a executive queen room with a view. We found a great deal on booking.com and paid around $160 a night. We got a room on the 19th floor. The room was standard NYC size but the bathroom was quite big. We had a small closet (almost walk-in) which I understand not all rooms have. That made a huge difference, otherwise we wouldn't have had enough room for the clothes we brought for our one week stay. (Suitcases were kept closed standing, not enough space to have them laying down, hence one doesn't want to keep the clothes in them.) The bed and pillows were so comfortable! The duvet could have been thicker, first night was a bit too cold for me. Room was clean and nicely decorated. Since the hotel is quite new everything in the room was really nice, not worn at all. The view was great, big window facing the Empire State Building and far away One World Trade Center. The room was quiet from outside noise but the air conditioning made some noise. We had to turn it off each night to not get disturbed by it. Bathroom had a nice design, also very clean. Downside was the low water pressure in the shower (which others also have noticed).Location is perfect for a tourist, close to subway at 34th street and in the middle of Manhattan making it easy to get around all of Manhattan (and to other boroughs) by subway or even by walking. The staff was really polite and helpful!Despite the minor downsides explained above I give the hotel 5 out of 5, as you can see, because of the low rate we paid. You probably won't find another hotel this good to that low rate in Manhattan. If I had paid their standard rate I would probably have given it 4 out of 5. Either way I would absolutely come back!

I spent a week back in my home town and was pulled in b/c of the very reasonable rate that was offered by Jetsetter for the suite. It turned out to be an excellent choice! The hotel is relatively new in midtown, with easy access to pretty much every train line, including Penn Station, all within a few blocks. In fact, they were still working on the restaurant, which is expected to be open in March. Although smack dab in the center of midtown, amazingly, it was the quietest stay I ever experienced in NYC. The suite was very new and clean, and quite comfortable. It does, however, seem geared to the short stay business traveler b/c there is NO closet. There was an area to hang clothes that was attached to the desk and book-ended by some shelving and 4 SMALL drawers. The "closet" had 5 hangers, and one of those precious hangers was occupied by a hotel robe... say what?!?!?!?! I would have asked for more, but there wouldn't have been room, since the ironing board was hogging up space! I've never learned to pack light, so found it challenging to deal with this shortcoming (exacerbated by a winter coat... now down to 3 empty hangers!!!!), but finally figured a strategy that allowed me to hang my current and next day's clothes on a rotating basis. This was not make or break for me, but worth noting. On the plus side, the bathroom was a decent size, though neither small nor large. Be forewarned that it is accessed with a pocket door directly across from the desk chair, so when you get up from the desk, you have to manhandle the chair (no wheels) back under the desk to get into the bathroom. Staff was really wonderful and helpful, the doormen were rarely there when you needed them... particularly, upon entering the hotel. This was largely due to a portable entrance to keep the cold air from blowing into the hotel, which I expect won't be necessary in more temperate climes. All in all, it turned out to be an unexpected find and I have every intention of returning!
user_name:
Jilzy1
New York City, New York

review_body: Me & my wife visited the hotel for our 20th annieversary & had a fantastic stay its in a great location not far from all the sites & easy access to the metro lines.The hotel is immaculately clean & the rooms are comfortable & spacious.The staff are fantastic from the reception desk staff to EDDIE & STANLEY on the door nothing is to much trouble for them. Every morning we were greeted with a good morning Mr & Mrs Ferguson & hand shake from Lowell the hotel manager a nice touch from him to start the day.We will be returning to the hotel in the future keep up the good work & thanks for helping us have a wonder.ful trip

Great location in midtown, Right around corner from empire state building. Several inexpensive diners on street. Very close to several subway stations, macy's, times square, bryant park. We were on 3rd floor, 2 queen beds. They were comfortable, but could hear some street noise. No closets or much storage space, small room. Nice shower. Staff friendly and helpful. Also a good work out area. We flew in out laguardia. They have shuttle service back to airport. Cost us( 3 people)42$ plus tip. Taxi ride from airport to hotel on a sunday was 31$ plus tip.

Had a wonderful time at the lesoliel. There 6 nights and the room was great and had 2 TVS (wonderful for marital harmony). Bed was comfortable. Staff was fantastic all around and any requests we had were met promptly and politely. Sorry don't remember many names but Eddie at the front door was very helpful. Can't wait to come back next year with kids and granddaughter!

I have been staying at LeSoleil since its opening a few months ago and I am super impressed. The rooms are amazing with the glass closets and showers and - if you are fortunate enough to get the Empire State view - it is like nothing I have ever experienced. The staff is always so nice and hospitable and they even remember me now when I enter the hotel or my company makes the reservation. In a busy city like NYC, it is amazing to find a jewel like the LeSoleil that treats you like you are their #1 customer each time you visit. My last experience this past week, I had an amazing room with my own sitting room cut out from the rest of the room. The bathroom was huge and the bed was comfy as always. I felt like a celebrity! I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to more stays here in the future.

This is a copy of a letterl I wrote to them:Dear sir/madamIn my letter sent March 2nd I requested my room to be prepared for our arrival.The final order was a Rose pedal turndown and a bottle of sparkling wine, but settled for still wine since your establishment could not get us sparkling wine. Odd as it may sound for a reputable hotel.On our arrival this had not been prepared and two staff members told me that they had decided on another date and asked when I would want the surprise to be.I find this very odd and not only a turndown but a turnoff.Your front desk person said that if she had failed she was sorry and there wold be plenty of nice memories in NY anyway.This is very disapointing. As is the size of your queen sized bed which is not 60” to 70” unless you are using a smalleer inch than usually is.I do hope you make sure that if a guest orders something on a specific date he will not have to negotiate with your staff for another date more suitable for them. To add to my letter I found it overrated and underserviced. The attitude I got from the front desk when complaining over them ruining a romantic entry was increadable. I would not go there again and not recomend it. Technically everything is there. Except for a polite attitude. I do not like that. I love giving my wife a romantic reception when we are travelling and this hotel is the first one to blunder it.Any positive points? The cleaning staff is nice.We will finish our stay here at a very overpriced hotel but I will not boook here again, nor can I recommend it, There are two hotels next door. Look at them.What a let down.The queeen size bes is for a very petite queen and the wifi looves apple (ipads) but not W10.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week in the executive queen bedroom with a view. Our hotel location was very convenient and everywhere we wanted to go was within walking distance. The hotel is surrounded by bars, shops/stores, tourist locations, restaurants, etc. We didn't really need the metro passes that we bought. There was construction but it wasn't a bother or anything.Everyone here was amazing. The staff greet you every time they see you. Ed/Eddie was one of the memorable staff members that we talked to. It wasn't just because he worked in the front, he also sang to one of his coworkers. It was the cutest and sweetest thing to see! He was so happy and energetic, which was so contagious. It made us smile. Besides him, the people at the front desk were also very friendly. We were able to talk to them comfortably. Stanley was nice too! Everyone was a total sweetheart. I wasn't able to get everyone's name but I wish I did, so I could include at least one thing about each of them.Although the check out time is at 12 noon, our bus ride back to Boston wasn't until 12:30 midnight. We are beyond lucky and grateful to be able to leave our bags with them.Overall this has been the best hotel that we've stayed at in NY. We'll definitely be coming back to this hotel next year. Hopefully we will see familiar faces because they were the ones that made this trip so memorable

I am writing this review as I await our transport to JFK. All things good can only be said about this lovely hotel. Very speedy checkin ,very friendly staff and the room was excellent. Spotlessly clean and fresh. Great location to get about this very busy city. Despite construction on the sidewalk outside the hotel it didn't put us off as it didn't disturb us at all. Highly recommended.

This is my second time staying here. The first time was on business and I enjoyed my stay so much I booked this place again for a family trip to NYC to see a Broadway show. I will never stay at one of the large big name hotels again in NYC. The location is great (just a few blocks from Times Square) however it is just far enough away where the street and surrounding areas are not crowded at all so you can walk around without fighting the times square mob scene. I have never stayed in a more quieter hotel room in NYC. Since the building is so new the insulation and windows block out so much of the noise that you usually hear from the street and the adjacent hotel rooms. We reserved an executive room with two queens and the room was quite large by NYC standards. Everything was very clean and brand new. The bellman at this property are top notch and both Eddie and the other guy (sorry, forgot his name...tall guy with the cool haircut) went above and beyond to take care of my family. Book directly with the hotel and prepay for your room to get the best deal.
user_name:
Pete M
Toms River, New Jersey

review_body: 2 queen beds are a tough find in New York - this is a great option. LeSoleil has surprisingly large rooms (for NYC): all new, high ceiling, good bathroom shower, no complaints. Great mid-town location (short walk from Penn Station and close to Empire State Bidg and Times Square). Prices can vary widely for all NYC hotels, but this was one of the lower-priced options for a room with two beds. Certainly worth checking out.

An exceptionally lovely stay at this hotel, it is my pleasure to write this review and highly recommend. Centrally located (great if you are running all over the City and want to be near trains, etc.) The hotel has a warm and inviting environment. The staff is absolutely wonderful!!! Great customer service. The rooms are small but expected in a city location, and they are clean, well appointed and comfortable. Nice shower/bathroom. We are breakfast people, so we loved that steps away there are several good and inexpensive places to grab food. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to NYC for business or pleasure. We look forward to returning!

We spent two nights at Hotel LeSoleil on a brief visit to New York, and we could not have been happier with our choice! The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful, the room, while small, was extremely nice, and super clean. Its location was excellent; a few steps from Herald Square, but the street was actually quiet. The day we left it was raining fairly hard, and the staff was at the front door offering umbrellas for guests without them, making sure everyone was prepared.We will definitely be back the next time we visit NYC!

Really good location, staff were great. Not sure the city view is worth the extra, you just see the roofs instead of the walls of the buildings opposite!! But it did mean we were higher up so it was nice and quiet at night. Rooms a bit on the small side and very little storage but pretty normal in NYC. Would recommend this hotel. Brits out there, the tea and coffee facilities in the room only include green tea, so take tea bags if this bothers you!!

I needed a hotel room last minute. I chose this hotel on a chance and was very satisfied.1. The booking noted that the hotel was under construction. I did not notice this at all.2. Arrived at the hotel, someone immediately came out and greeted me, nice and friendly3. Check-in was smooth4. Room was surprisingly large for NY. Had a little separate sitting area that was neat.5. Furniture was sleek and modern. A small annoyance; he table was glass and that was not helpful with a wireless mouse! 6 Heat/Cool seemed to be fine, it was comfortable so I just shut the air7. There was a clock with one USB slot next to the bed (large queen sized), other than that I could not find any convenient plugs. The room overall could have done with more conveniently placed plugs8. Shower was clean, toilet seat was not centered well. Hotel provided a robe. No body wash, just a bar of soap (small peeve)All in all, the price was right and the room was comfortable and i had a good night's sleep

Stayed here for 4 nights in February for valentines, perfect location, 2 min walk to Empire State, 5 mins to Times Square. Very friendly hotel staff, clean, good size rooms, would definitely stay here again and recommend to others. Well done guys

Positive points :1) The staff of this hotel is extremely nice, professional and helpful. All of them were just perfect :) 2) Fantastic location ! Can easily access to the main activities by walk or subway or taxi. (i.e. Times Square is really at 10-15 min walk max, Empire State Building at 5 min walk and even the One World Tower is at about 1h by walk by crossing the different areas of NYC that is also just a great time to spend)3) Hotel is in a street (not avenues) so not that much car traffic passing4) Got the king size executive. The bed was very soft but surprisingly extremely comfortable.Negative Points :1) We booked the king size executive room type but our room was on the lower floors (4th) of the building and facing the street. Therefore, no view (except on the street) and it was, at times, a bit noisy during the night and early morning due to the car traffic & garbage/delivery truck & the dancing school (used for some latin dances on Saturday nights etc ...) in front of the hotel. (I am a light sleeper ... so I would recommend to ask for the back-street room if you are light sleepers ...)2) The bell of the elevator can be heard in the rooms (even when the lift is not at your storey, therefore ask for a room far from the lifts because it can be easily annoying during the night and early morning if you are light sleeper) We also could hear people talking when they were walking in the aisles ... (But hopefully no noise at all from the other rooms)3) Got "special rates" when booked and therefore was good quality/price compared to the others hotels in NYC but it can be quite expensive if you pay the full price ...Despite these 3 "negative" points, I recommend this hotel but with the higher floors rooms and facing on the Empire State Building view

Just come back from a 6 day stay at the is lovely hotel and very clean as it is newly opened.I visited with my partner, auntie and uncle. Very clean great location. We stayed in a Queen suite on the 13th Floor which was a good size with a view of the Empire state building.1 block from Macys, 1 block from the Empire state some rooms even have a Empire state View and a short walk to Times Square and Bryant park.The staff are really nice and very accommodating. The Manger Lowell really nice and will go out of his way to help.Before booking this hotel i was looking at some of the negative reviews about the noise of the drilling due to the unfinished Restaurant. This was not a problem! The only time we noticed there was some work going on was when we checked in that was it , we certainly did not hear any drilling in the rooms as stated in other reviews.There are Lots of places to eat around the hotel and if in need of a quick breakfast there is a deli next door but one which is great. Also a pub over the road called the Keg room which has a great atmosphere and serves lovely food.Our visit was for mine and my uncles birthday . 30 minutes after we checked in there was a knock at the door and it was reception desk with a Birthday Gift. Lovely touch! Would recommend!

Excellent service. All associated, desk, concierge, door man were so friendly and helpful. Eddie at the door was great. Friendly and said anything we need, when you are ready, call Eddie . The room was magnificent. This is a very upbeat modern, new hotel. Room was very clean and houskeeping on the spot with service. Location just around the corner from Herald Square and the world famous Macy's I encourage anyone considering staying in the heart of New York City to call and book.

Terrific location, wonderful staff and beautiful room. My wife and I could not have asked for better spot for an overnight in NYC! We drove in from Vermont and found the hotel easily accessible from the west side. We choose the park and stay rate which included parking in the garage next door. Great rate and value for the money!

We spent two nights at this small boutique hotel. Considering we were in the middle of NYC the queen suites were quite spacious and the bathrooms were great. Every staff member was warm and friendly from the doorman to the cleaning lady on the 7th floor. There was no restaurant in the hotel, but there were plenty to choose from on the hotel block or on Ave of the Americas which was a half block away.

Just got back from three nights at this wonderful boutique hotel. The staff couldn't have been nicer and the room was well appointed (small...but you're in NYC!) with a great bathroom. Even more important, the bed was comfortable and it was quiet (even on the 6th floor -- I assume the higher you go, the quieter it gets). Both Eddie and Stanley need to be mentioned for their smiles and willingness to go the extra mile to accommodate. We have found a new favorite place in NYC...and we'll be back!!

The Executive Hotel LeSoleil is excellent and almost every way. Its a smaller boutique hotel tucked away between 5th and 6th avenue, close to the subway, dining, and shopping. The staff is outstanding. Taline and Chris at the front desk are wonderful. I hesitate to name names because everyone I encountered was outstanding. Every need was met. The doormen were so friendly and accommodating. The room I occupied was the Executive Queen suite. Not large but roomy enough. The only downside of the room was that there is not a closet, only a small space to hang clothes. There is not a restaurant onsite but I understand there will be one soon. I will return to this hotel in late March. I'm so looking forward to it!

This hotel have a good situation. The room are clean and they have good price. We still there one week and perfect!! The worker are very disponible. We ll keep good memories of Eddy he is very nice and try always find a solution for the custumers. When we come back in NYC, we ll take this hotel again!!!

We went in this hotel from the 23rd february until the 1st of march and it Was a perfect place to sleep to visit NYC ! The room Was exactly the same as the pictures and we were at the 19th level and the view Was so beautiful ! Nothing to say about the cleaning: done everyday, very good bed, spacious bathroom (without bath for us), just missing a little place to put your personal belongings but its not very important cause you are in the room only to sleep ;) ! And i would like to thank Eddie who was extremely nice with us and very helpful ! We will come back for sure !

Just completed a 4 day visit to NYC to see a few shows with friends. We found this hotel on Jetsetter and the price was terrific so each couple booked an Executive Queen Suite. Check in was quick and we did request that our rooms be located where we had good light and were not next to the elevators. We were on the 6th floor, so no views of ESB and one of our rooms faced the back of buildings on the other street-which was not pretty at all , but did add to the quiet . The hotel feels very 'Kimpton'. Modern, clean and warm. The lobby is small , but there is a drawing type room at rear with a gas fireplace and many areas suitable for conversation or relaxing. They should have their restaurant open in a month or so- which will add the necessary component needed to encourage guests to linger - so hope to check that out on a future trip. Room and AmenityThe rooms are very modern and appeal to my type of accommodation. Surfaces are clean and open and the lighting is pleasant with table lamps and mood lighting , so add a feel of relaxation and calm. Please note- if you are a typical traveler who takes tons of luggage on short trips- this hotel is not going to be ideal for you.Hanging space is quite limited, but there are drawers and a desk - which we annexed to hold our items while there. We had a queen suite which was divided into two areas- space wise by the bath. The sitting area had two chairs from IKEA ... And next to it on the side table - a note stating that their ' real' furniture was on order, but had not yet arrived. The chairs worked ok, but we're not the type of chair you'd see in a hotel of this quality and by no means encouraged us to ' sit' in the sitting area for long. I really do hope their order comes in soon.!Rooms are pretty darn quiet by NYC standards. I did find it odd that housekeeping ' upped' the room thermostat every time they cleaned. Both couples found the rooms plenty warm enough , and had to open a window for 10 minutes to ' balance' the heat upon our return. The room was very clean, and the bath was well appointed. Suggestions: Move the TP holder to under the wood vanity edge as more than once I either scraped my leg or knocked the TP to the floor. Also, please provide at least two bars of soap please ( one for shower, one for sink) and how about a shower cap or other necessary toiletries that we travelers count on ? A second set of glasses for the bath would also be nice . I loved the product choice , but felt that the restocking of towels and such - should have been a bit more generous with 2 in a room. The bed was quite comfortable, with great sheets and nice lighting in the room very good - both for make up and dressing. Thank you for the amazing full length mirror and the In room safe - both really good features. The Keurig coffee maker in our room was not working , so they did replace it- however- like another guest noted - it only came with enough capsules for one person to have coffee. This is something they can improve in the months to come... by offering complementary coffee in the lobby in the morning or by adequate supply in the guest's rooms. These are the details where Kimpton and Portrait hotels shine and truly do bolster guest loyalty. LeSoleil.. Hope you are taking notes?Staff We found the staff to be helpful and engaging. Eddie was wonderful and the housekeeping team did honor the notes I left requesting extra towels etc. Stanley also worked his magic at flagging down taxis in the pouring rain and the desk personal seemed amiable and friendly. Location:Location is good ,especially if you are up there seeing shows .It's an easy walk to the Empire State Building , a nice walk to Flat Iron district or Bryant Park - and we even walked to MOMA despite the frigid temps this past week. Neighborhood Food and feel: Food is not as ' local' as some other neighborhoods , but you can easily solve that by dining outside of the immediate area- as this part of town is more geared to tourists than city dwellers. This is main stream shopping with no real speciality stores nearby. You will find all the chains.. Macy's , H&M, etc. I never did find a grocery store, which is the real sign that there is a neighborhood associated with this part of town. Your choices for that type of stuff will be limited. To summarize, a lovely and polished hotel , with a modern elegant feel that is proximate to many of the destinations travelers to NYC may want. I like where they are heading and expect that they continue to work to entice return guests by making it even more comfortable down the road. I hope that EHL will improve on the details that seem ever so close to their reach- as I would likely stay there again.
user_name:
Logistar
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Beautiful and clean hotel with great staff members! We stayed on the 18th floor, which had an amazing view of the city. Central to everything and very quiet. Eddie was very friendly and helpful. Definately would stay here again!

Stayed at the Executive Hotel Le Soleil New York with family of four using two interconnecting rooms. Hotel is clean and modern, with excellent central location. Great little hotel and with reasonable prices too. Would stay there again.

This is a new hotel with a great staff. I stayed for 4 days and they were always willing to assist with any need that I had. Jackie at front desk, was a gem:). The location is perfect, the room was just right.

So happy with our stay at this hotel! Great location, friendly and helpful staff, well kept hotel. Room was perfect for 2 people some might think small but its NYC and you have way more to do then hang out in your room anyways! The best thing was the location which was in my opinion prime if you want to get the most out of your visit to nyc! Right around the block from the subway and smack dab in the middle of Manhattan island! Would recommend to anyone and will defiantly be back!
