This hotel was an absolute pleasure to stay in, the welcome that we got every time we stepped into the lobby was second to none !, the location was perfect a few minutes walk from Herald square, times square and 5th Ave., the room was just fine, very clean, gorgeous spacious bathroom, the room was cleaned every day, We were on the 14th floor with an amazing view of the Empire State Building, this hotel has a ' home away from home' feeling and we felt very safe and secure throughout our stay, i would highly recommend this hotel and i will do so to my friends at home in Ireland ! Thank You Hotel Soleil for helping make mine and my Sons NYC stay very memorable !

Spent one night at the Executive Hotel LeSoleil. As others have said, the lobby was quite large, the staff was friendly and accommodating, and incredibly professional. The inside has a great look, very upscale appearance, even in the rooms. The check-in process was simple and quick, although I found the policy of requesting a late check-out to be strange. I requested a late check out promptly during check in, but was told that late check-out requests had to be made the morning of check-out, which can defeat the purpose entirely. The rooms were quite small, even for New York standards, but the bathroom was massive, and the view was great. I was more than a little upset at the lack of a closet in my room in which to hang my suits, the only option being to move the bathrobe and umbrella to take advantage of the limited space in which to hang anything. Additionally, I found the condoms and lubricant available on the desktop in my room to be more than a little tacky, and made me question whether or not I should be paying for the room by the hour. Finally, upon getting ready to leave this morning, I found at the foot of my bed, on the sheets that had been previously covered by the comforter the evening before, an unsettling brown stain (picture enclosed) that made me severely doubt how well the linens had been cleaned. Despite the professional staff, the wonderful interior decorating, and the great location of this hotel, this incident with the sheets has entirely put me off returning to this hotel on future business trips.

This hotel is a gem! Your stay starts with a genuine welcome by the staff. The lobby is large and a great place to kick back and relax by the fireplace. A coffee bar across the lobby is great. The rooms are about average size but planed out better than most. The king size room has a varied mini bar PLUS, a very comfortable robe..perfect when coming out of their very large showers. A very spacious business center makes a days work go a lot faster. A hidden gem, I will return and a definite recommendation!

Firstly have to say great location!! Only 2 blocks from ESB, and 10 minutes from Broadway and Times Square. We stayed in the Executive Queen Suite which was very spacious and a very comfortable bed. Even though we didnt have a great view from our room (facing the back of some offices) it didnt matter as were out of the hotel much of the day and night. The hotel restraunt wasnt quite ready, but it wasnt a concern for us given the numerous places you can eat out in NYC. There's also a great place 3 doors away to grab a nice breakfast bagel, fresh coffee and orange juice before heading out an exploring NYC.

I can not say enough how great this hotel is. Room was clean, big enough for 2 and the view of the Empire State Building was amazing! The location is perfect, close to everything. The staff were friendly and helpful. We will definitely return.

I stayed here in February and have to say it was a great hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were lovely. Spotlessly clean. Bedsheets changed every day, microwave in room, which was handy and tea/coffee maker there too.Hotel is very central to Times Square and Empire State. Plus train journey to many other points of interest. Would return to this hotel again if visiting NYC and would highly recommend it to friends and family.

Great location. Very clean Hotel. Recommend getting a suite. All staff are professional and friendly. Walking distance to Time Square, MSG, Empire State Bldg. Will be back to see Alfredo and Eddie who made the stay great!

On our first trip to New York, my husband and I stayed at the Executive Hotel Le Soleil. It was for our 6th year wedding anniversary and I experience nothing but joy when I think back to the amazing experience we had. This hotel is strategically located in the heart of the city and not far from everywhere else. A few blocks from the Empire State building and Times Square with lots of places to eat and shop nearby. We were upgraded to a nicer room when the staff learnt it was our anniversary and the room was not as small as we thought New York rooms will be. It was a good size, very modern and very neat. The staff were just simply amazing, from the doorman to the staff at the reception, to the Managers. Everyone seemed so polite, so welcoming, so warm and so professional and so willing to help. We enjoyed the service so much that we paid to stay an extra night instead of spending it at a family friends'.At night, it was very peaceful considering we were in the center of a city that truly never sleeps. We have decided that as long as they continue to have a receptive and respectful culture, we would not try anywhere else as we really enjoyed our stay here.If you are looking for a hotel with OK sized rooms, impeccable service and strategically located, then look no further than the Executive Hotel LeSoleil. I would STRONGLY recommend it :)

My sister and I went for a long weekend trip to the city. We stayed at this beautiful hotel and had a wonderful time.The staff was amazing in every way from check in to check out. Friendly and helpful.The location of the hotel is fabulous. Close to Times Square and right next to the Empire State building. Easy to get around.The rooms were new and beautiful. Simple elegance. Very comfortable and quiet.We cannot wait to go and stay again!I highly recommend Executive Hotel Le Soleil for anyone.
user_name:
Lauri F
Amherst, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: We decided to give this a try cause of the cheap price. It was a good choice. We stayed for the weekend on the 17th floor. The bed was very comfy and clean and the walls are thick so it was a quiet room. The bathroom was just as big as the bedroom, which was nice. Usually NYC bathrooms are small boxes. The shower and sink were great and they give you complimentary shampoos, one bath robe and hairdryer. The room was a tad small as far as the bedroom and there was just a small area to hang cloths. The tv was nice and the view was great. The staff was super friendly and the theme and lobby were really nice with a lot of seating and a fireplace. The hotel offered free wifi that was easy to connect to. The hotel is also close to a lot of great pubs and main attractions so it's a good steal. The only negative was a small breakfast area and no complimentary breakfast! We thought there was but apparently they only do that for certain occasions with booking.com? Otherwise the small bar sells croissants and coffees. Only three small tables to sit at. Overall I recommend it!

Personnel at the hotel could not have been more polite and accommodating. Always a smile on their face. And the location on W 36th street was ideal. Walking distance from Grand Central, and then from the hotel walking distance to Broadway and Times Square. Outstanding time.

The hotel room we booked was small but it was lovely, clean, had a nice view and had a comfy bed although quirky things happened with towels in that some wouldn't be replaced or just disappeared. The reception staff were polite but the first thing we were asked when we arrived was did we want to upgrade to a suite and we weren't actually given any details of the hotels facilities and then they weren't helpful once we turned down the upgrade. Luckily we had asked to see the upgrade offer and the room we were booked in to to compare. The upgrade was not worth $175 more which was what they were asking for. Also the website for this hotel it states dressing gown and slippers provided, which is a bonus and saves packing your own but when we arrived there was only one dressing gown and no slippers. We rang down to ask about the dressing gown and got the response that guests usually bring their own!! Not when you advertise supplying them they don't! Anyway the did provide another dressing but we didn't dare ask for slippers as well. Another thing that is advertised is coffee machine and again this is strange as the provide 1 pod decaf coffee and 1pod normal coffee and some days 1 pod green tea now as their were two of us you would think they would supply 2 pods of each so you could both have the same if you wanted. The guys on the door were very friendly and helped direct you and provide suggestion for where to eat, perhaps they should teach the receptionists how hospitality works. I would stay here again due to its location and cleanliness but they need to review what they offer as it is described as a boutique hotel!

The atmosphere in this hotel is calm, clean, and happy! The staff are outstanding. Lacking food source, but there is a couple of good places just doors away.Spacious bathroom, nice robes, and bed linens, calm , new decor, and best of all VERY QUIET! The sound proofing is marvelous!

The room was teeny-tiny, but I was staying here alone for a business trip, and it's nyc, so I didn't expect to have tons of spare room. The bed was comfortable and the robe was too. The bathroom had nice furnishings, and the room was wonderfully clean. I would definitely stay here again.

We are actually currently staying in the hotel, the staff are friendly enough and the doormen are fantastic. However, don't trust the room descriptions!! We 'upgraded' to a queen suite.... Nothing suite like about it, unless you count one glass, a chair and an extra tv?! We have 1 bathrobe for two people, no slippers ( as advertised) and frankly I've stayed in budget hotels that feel more luxurious. It's a mid range hotel which is a shame....

Booked on third party website for under $150. Two double beds in spacious room with nice linens and pillow choices. Large, beautiful bathroom. Perfect location, easy access to all things midtown. Nice front desk staff. Highly recommend a stay here.

Excellent option in central midtown location. Close to metro and shopping. Easy walk to Times Square. Very friendly and professional staff. Quiet, clean and reasonably sized room for NYC. We walked to see a show and took subway several times for events in Brooklyn.

This was my first trip to New York and I researched a lot before booking this on a discounted rate online, and it was a brilliant deal with no penalty for being a solo traveller. I got a spacious room, huge TVs, and lovely crisp linen of peculiar sizes (maybe it's an American thing!). And the service from Luis at Reception and the other staff was exemplary. The location can't be beaten for exploring central New York - between 5th and 6th Avenues, and next door to Broadway and access to the subway, a little way along from Times Square. Couple of downsides - the shower pressure was terrible (I was on the 8th floor). It would almost make me not book here again as after a long flight or a day walking the city I was desperate to have a strong, hot shower, and with such a weak flow I was shivering. (And you'll have a terrible time if you have long hair to rinse!) Also shampoo, conditioner, moisturiser and a soap are provided, so bring your own shower gel if you prefer this to a bar of soap. The towels are tiny, no bath sheets or hair towels here sadly. The extensive extras available in the room were very expensive (altho the coffee machine was free and great!), so I recommend a deli a few doors down the street for essentials such as bottled water and midnight feast supplies. And as other people have stated, you have to be patient with the lifts, so best not to be in a hurry to get somewhere!One final thing to watch out for - when you check in, even if you've already paid for your stay, you will be expected to hand over a card to be debited immediately by $50 for each night of your stay to cover incidentals, unlike the UK where you simply provide card details and no payment is taken until you check out. The dollars will eventually be refunded into your bank account. I was told this is an American hotel thing, but it caught me by surprise and didn't appear on any of my booking documents (it does appear on the hotel's own website apparently). I was very kindly shown some flexibility on this as I made a big fuss, so pre-warned is pre-armed!All in all, a lovely stay in a great location. The hotel will arrange transfers which is super-helpful, and having done a shared shuttle, next time I would definitely spend more to have my own cab. Can't wait to return to New York!

New to the scene, while this Hotel recently opened in September it shows the knowledge of a whole life of experience in the business. The room was quite nice and in proportion, not huge but not small either, quite to the point for a city break. The bed confortable, the bathroom sparkling clean and the facilities up to scratch. It shows the people running this place knows the business thoroughly. The location was superb, a stone throw from the Empire State, right between 5th and 6th avenue, bang on midtown Manhattan. The staff couldn't be more pleasant, really, from check in to good bye there was always a nice feeling. Top Marks! really I would consider it to be my only option to go back to New York. One note for the hotel... considere triple glazing for the windows. I could sleep through but still could here loud traffic there and now

Stayed two nights with my 12 year old son and would return. Very comfortable bed. Compact, yet well-appointed room. Beautiful bathroom with great counter space and a modern open shower. Nice lobby lounge with an electric fireplace -- a nice respite from busy NYC. Elevators can get busy, and you hear some mild street noise, but wasn't disruptive at night. Great midtown location. A restaurant is coming in 2016.

Firstly this hotel is in a great location, the rooms were beautiful and very big for NYC. The view was amazing we were so lucky to be on the 19th floor looking straight at the Empire State Building it was unreal but awesome to look out at through the night we didn't even close the blinds as we didn't want to miss one minute. The best bit of this hotel is the Team from house keeping who generally seemed please too see us and came across very happy in their job to Chris on the front desk and Eddie on the door, on our checkout I had lots of questions all were answered professionally and accurately, also we were heading to the cruise port and and wanted to stow our luggage till late on when we were going to leave and they were very helpful, they went above and beyond to make our stay truly exceptional and they are a credit to the hotel Thank you

An excellent place to stay, right in the centre of things. Easy to get about the city from the hotel. Accommodation was very good, every day when we got back to our room it was always neat and tidy. All staff were very helpful and friendly. We had an extra night due to the weather (snow) The transfers from the hotel to airport were very good. Would stay again.

Me and my boyfriend chose to stay here for our first visit to New York for 6 nights in January. The location was perfect, plenty places to eat, Macy's right at the end of the street and an amazing close up view of the Empire State Building from our window :) The room was lovely and had everything we needed. The staff were very friendly, didn't get names but the door man in particular! We were given good advice for getting to the airport on time at the end of our trip as there was a storm coming, they booked us a taxi and we got there in time.We found the hotel very good value for money and would defiantly stay again. The only criticism we have was when we arrived the young man on reception took a while to book us in, he kept looking at his computer screen for what seemed like forever at the time, which was worrying. He also told us there was a problem with my card (even though we paid in cash) when there was enough money in my bank. 'He then said oh actually no it's fine' With no apology. After such a long trip it was very frustrating. This was annoying as first impressions really do count and apart from that it would have been perfect. Thank you for a lovely stay!!

Came in to keep my daughter company while she went on interviews. Everyone at this little hotel was warm and gracious, friendly and helpful! Great location and plenty of good food nearby. We will return again when we come to New York! Special shout out to Stanley who greeted us upon arrival and Jackie for coming to our rescue with toothbrushes.

As a female solo traveller I was nervous about visiting NYC but I had an amazing time. The location was perfect! Literally 2 min walk from a subway station, close enough to walk to a lot of great sights and venues (even in the Winter!). In an area that felt safe and had food places and shopping right outside the door. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Stanley (the concierge?) was a great welcoming- as soon as I walked in he gave me a mini tour, gave me a map of the city and pointed out with directions highlights. To check in early was an extra $25 fee, but i opted to just leave my bags and adventure, when I returned they dropped my bags at my room for me. The hotel itself was very nice, great bang for your buck. I had a picture perfect view of the Empire State Building from my room. Nice facility. I had a lovely stay, it made my first NYC experience absolutely amazing.bonus- theres a fitness room although I was too tired to use itThey only had a mini counter for pastries/coffee and wine, but there are a lot of food options right next door. I believe they have a restaurant in the works. Also, the shower in my room had a unique design which was cool -- except it didn't drain very well (I think this was because of the design, it drained into a slit in the middle but didn't drain fast enough to enjoy your shower without overflowing the shower area). And the toilet (also a design flaw) the handle fell off at one point, I thought a screw was missing, but it was just the way the lever was designed- it didn't screw on but fit just by flattened piece to piece.

Can't say enough about the positive, can do attitude from each and everyone of the people who work at this hotel. The hotel is new, well thought out and extremely convenient. A real gem in midtown. This is the place if you are looking for a quality hotel, reasonable rates, and a great location.

I went to Hotel Le Soleil with my family during Christmas-time in 2015, not only for Christmas but also for my granddaughter's 16th birthday. We had been looking online for the best deal (low enough price, good service, "cute" hotel) - and I guess you could say we got almost all of that.We got there after a delayed flight and a very stormy ride (to no fault of the hotel), and right at check in time. Unlike other guests, we had no wait to check in, which was a plus.However, I feel as if the front desk employees could have been considerably more welcoming. On our room reservation (Executive Queen Suite), I made note that we wanted as high of a floor as possible as it was for a special occasion. I called the day before we left for NYC to see if there was an upgrade option to get an ESB view, and they said they would try. Needless to say, we were a little surprised when we got to the front desk and told it was not possible to get a better room in the package we bought, and were stuck on the fifth floor, facing regular NYC buildings.The room itself was not bad. We have been spoiled on previous trips in terms of room size, but I find this room a pretty decent size for New York. Modern furnishings. Clean, simple, and compact. Free wifi, which the kids loved. In all honesty, the view was not terrible, but again - not what we asked for on multiple occasions. The bathroom was spacious. Ask for lots of soap and towels if you have multiple people staying in a room. Should also note that there are only 2 elevators in the hotel -- never had a problem with them though.As others, we really loved the doormen. Front desk employees were always just "eh." Overall, just a few changes could make the rating "Very Good," only personal experiences prevented it. Hotel Le Soleil acted as a hotel should while in NYC - a place to rest. I would stay again IF prices stayed relatively similar to where they are now. However, go up $100 and I think the deal would be easy to overlook.

Wonderful hotel great King room - clean Morden everything you want from a hotel - Rooms are small but perfectly formed as you'd expect from a nyc Manhattan room will most defiantly return - staff at the hotel especially from desk couldn't do enough 5 stars

We had tickets to a Broadway show and wanted to stay overnight in the city. My husband found this hotel online and the price was so good that I thought it was too good to be true. He booked it and we were not disappointed. The room was newly remodeled, nicely appointed, clean and comfortable. The staff was pleasant as well.

The hotel is nice but frankly I have a very bad experience with the doorman who us also the bell man when we checked out and needed assistance with luggage and taxi... basically, it was not there and we had to dragg 8 pieces of luggage out of hotel and tried for over 25 minutes to find taxi to airport . The bell man was very rude and ill mannerd to the point he was ready to start a fight instead of helping hotel occupants. .. basically the worst hotel experience in my 20 years of travel experience..
user_name:
Abdul rahman H
Riyadh, Saudi Arabia

review_body: This place is awesome to stay at in NYC. Good location and great service. The rooms are small but all of the hotels in NYC are like that, the difference here is that these rooms are so comfortable and cozy! From the front desk to the concierge to the bellhop they were very friendly and did everything to take care of my every need. (Eddy the bellhop was the best out of everyone, amazing service!) Please dont stay here because I want the price to stay reasonable so I can keep coming back. This will be my #1 pick to stay when I return to NYC in the future!

Check in process needs attention..a bunch of people waiting there for couple hours and they started checking in exactly at 3:00 PM. If you have rooms ready then why don't just assign it right away? Everything has a price tag, if you are using that cell phone charger in your room then you are getting a bill of $15, for a bathrobe its $75. The room was good and comfortable but that's what you get in all the hotels in that street for same amount of $ along with breakfast. I did not find anything special to go back to.

The room was good, we were 3 people in a queen suite, got it a very reasonable price. The sofabed was fairly good, but lacked pillows and had only a blanket. We also heard the drilling, but it did not bother us to the point to complain. We asked if we could get a suite with a view, but unfortunately it was all booked.The staff was very friendly and we enjoyed our stay and the location is superb.

I booked Executive Hotel LeSoleil on the app "Hotel Tonight". The rate was exceptional, considering typical Manhattan hotel prices. When I went to drop off my bags in the morning before I walked to my office, I was able to actually check into my room at 8:45am. I was pleased with this occurrence. The room was small, but it was modern, quiet and clean. They didn't have a closet in the room, but rather a open air, rack to hang your suits and coat near the window. This didn't bother me, as I was only travelling for a night. The room may have been tight with two people. Travelling solo for a short period of time - I would definitely return to this hotel. It's located in Midtown - not too far from Herald Square, far enough away from Macys and Penn Station to feel less crowded with tourists.

We arrived into Penn Station and it was a 10 minute walk to the hotel. The hotel is clean, modern, and comfortable. Since we arrived about 11:00 on Sunday morning and check in is in the afternoon, they confirmed our reservation and room type and stored our bags for us. We headed out to Times Square, another 10 minute walk, to lunch and a Broadway show. When we returned at about 5 p.m. there was no problem retrieving our luggage and getting our keys. The room was a Queen Suite with a view. It was on the 19th (top) floor. It was a beautiful room, but keep in mind that, in NYC a 19th floor view is one for which you have to look up. It was beautiful nonetheless. There is a place to hang clothes, but no closet -- it worked for us .There was a beautiful robe and an umbrella to borrow, a coffee maker, iron and ironing board, safe, I-phone dock, and hairdryer. The suite had two TVs. The bed and pillows were incredibly comfortable. The room was quiet. We never heard another person on the floor. The curtains kept it nice and dark in the morning. We were on the run so much our first day that we never noticed the inviting, cozy lobby beyond the registration desk, complete with a fireplace, so we never did get to enjoy that, but will definitely do so on our next stay. There is no restaurant, but they serve pastries with coffee in the morning for $5, and there are two places on the same block that serve breakfast and lunch, and two others that serve dinner as well. With all of the things that we loved about this hotel, what we appreciated the most was the staff. There was not one person who was not friendly, efficient and helpful. Shout out to Eddie, the doorman who first welcomed us to the hotel, and took our luggage from us, and then wished us a safe journey home on our way out.  We frequently stay in NYC and this was, by far, the best hotel experience we have enjoyed. We had been saying that we would want to continue to try other hotels but, after this, Executive Hotel Le Soleil will be our only choice.

As mentioned in other poor reviews there's construction that wasn't mentioned anywhere and disrupted our first day there. We'd been up early to drive and were exhausted and just wanted to grab a quick nap. We called immediately and the staff were unable to relocate us and were less than sympathetic. Some of the staff were excellent, others seemed to not care at all. I liked the decor. The construction is very sloppy. A lot of the finish work is either not done or is poorly done. The tile work is actually very well done though. I wasn't a fan of the type of pocket door. I've installed ones that latch and lock, have handles, and ride much more smoothly.All in all, I'd be very reluctant to stay here again.

Needed a place to stay in Manhattan overnight on business and saw this place online - glad I did. Gorgeous property with maybe the friendliest and most helpful staff I've encountered in a long time. Spotless and interesting rooms, comfy beds and a great price for Manhattan. Will be my "go-to" hotel next time work takes me to New York City. Highly recommended...

We checked into our room after driving from North of Boston around 3pm on a Friday hoping to lay down for a while before hitting the streets. We laid down in our queen suite and all the sudden... DRILLING. The floor shook, we wouldn't hear each other without yelling. I called the front desk and asked to be moved... I was told no, there were no other rooms to move me to and that there should have been a disclaimer when I booked (I double checked, there was not). The ear shattering drilling continued for the next TWO HOURS. To me, it doesn't matter the rest of the stay was unremarkable. This ruined my impression and I will not be returning - horrible, terrible, nonono.

In the heart of the city.. Very nice staff and clean.Easy access to a lot of things .Rooms are small.. might be worth the upgrade to a suite. Was only $25 fee to upgrade when we went. Room charges were high for drinks and snacks and no blanket in the room ,But bed was very comfy..

We stayed here recently for a 40th Birthday celebration & found the hotel to be more than comfortable. The staff were very friendly & more than happy to help in any way. The room we had was a deluxe king & it was more than big enough....After all we were only there to sleep & freshen up. The room & hotel was very clean & linen changed every day. The bed was extremely comfy which is welcome after a day pounding the streets. The hotel itself was in a great location & close to cafes/restaurants & you're just a couple of blocks away from the Empire State Building & in the other direction Times Square. All other attractions easily accessible from here. Would we stay again???? MOST DEFINITELY. Thank you.Mr & Mrs Osborne. England.

Was over £200 a night, but room was very nice, Location was awesome, Maceys,Empier State Building are a few 100 yards away! If you put your walking shoes on you can walk almost anywhere from this hotel! It was worth paying the extra as some hotels in NYC you have to share bathrooms ect! If you book this place you would be happy!!:)come out of the hotel turn left and at the corner of the street there is a reaustrunt for tidy food!

Stayed 3 days at Le Soleil.Very clean and superb location.Friendly staff as well.Room is kind of smaller than other hotels in Manhattan, but you will have bigger bathroom than other hotels.And hotel has 2 elevators only. Be patient!

The hotel was great. We were there for a show at Madison Square Garden and it was an easy walk. Free WiFi, close to shopping and a great deli on the corner that's open 24 hours. Rooms were big for NYC. People were very friendly. Only one issue - we valet parked our car which ended up costing about $15 more than had we parked it ourselves in the garage just a few doors up from the hotel and when we went to leave we were told that it would take 30-45 minutes to get our car. That was not acceptable as we had to be home at a certain time, so we had to walk about 8 blocks to get the car ourselves. Eddie the valet was very nice. I think it was the front desk's fault for not telling us about the time it would take to get the car. Lesson learned. But I would definitely stay here again.

Centrally located, near empire state and times square. Great, new rooms, perfectly arranged and clean. Friendly service. Good business center with computers and printer. Could have breakfast included but otherwise a nearly perfect hotel that yields good value for money.

My husband and I were in NYC two weeks before Christmas. We had a wonderful stay at this hotel . I had not stayed at Le Soleil property before and if this is any indication of what they are like. We will most certainly return. THe staff was so very kind and helpful. The rooms were spotless. WE had a small problem with the temperature in our room...they were in our room in minutes. We could not have asked for a better location either! It was so central. Hats off to the General Manager and th his staff. Job well done! Thank you

From the minute we walked in the door we were welcomed with open arms. Every single person was fantastic the entire 2 days we were there.Overtime I'm in New York I'll be staying here! Super clean, great location. Everything was perfect.

Having just opened, this hotel will develop into a great place to stay for business and pleasure in mid-town. Located near Herald Square it's close to Penn Station (2 blocks away), Empire State Building and Macys. Metro stop is located on the corner - a 2 min walk. The rooms are large compared to many in New York - a small kitchenette makes it more a studio apartment than hotel room. View was spectacular with typical New York rooftops and a clear view of the Empire State Building. The staff go above and beyond to be helpful. Only issue was the elevator configuration. It was often a wait of up to 5min to get a ride to or from the room. Apart from that I highly recommend this hotel.

Hotel Le Soleil is a short walk from Time Square and Broadway. I guess you might call it boutique hotel. It is a perfect size to have all the amenities you might need for a short stay in the city. The staff was very attentive and accommodating. Check in was very easy, as was check out. We will look to stay here on future trips to the City.Parking in expensive in this area.

We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights, arriving very tired after delays & missed connections, jackie at reception was great, when there was an issue with the payment system she said you guys are tired, I'll try this again & you can check tomorrow. We were very grateful for this! Our room 1803 was a nice size, but a bit lacking in hanging space, for a longer trip, however just enough for our time there. The bed was very comfortable and the air con system worked well. We had a great city view, we were at the opposite side to the empire views but we loved it. The bathroom was a great size, the doors, as other reviewers have mentioned, are a little strange, you can still open & close them ok, my only real complaint about them is they were so noisy, not great for in the middle of the night. We got directions to jimmy's for breakfast the following morning from the general manager & all in all the staff were very courteous, friendly & great fun. I was surprised however the the concierge staff did come across as a little 'frosty' when being asked questions, it sometimes felt as though we were disturbing them. Eddie the doorman was a great help & mostly everyone had a smile. I am looking forward to returning when the restaurant & bar are complete as It will really make this fab hotel even better. I would highly recommend here as the location, decor, rooms, wifi & majority of the service, is fantastic!

Very good location in Midtown Manhattan, near the most important Museums and shopping store. Room are clean and wide. Personals educate and funny. For the first visit in New York is just perfect. Recommended.

Just checking out. Close to Broadway and all mid town attractions. Very friendly staff. Accommodating beyond anything I am used to in NYC. Rooms small but clean, updated and what you would expect size wise in NY. Will definitely be back.

I came here on 11th December 2015 for my 30th birthday with my mum. It was our first time in New York and not our last we loved it. Hotel was lovely we had a lovely spacious clean room and bathroom and was cleaned everyday. Very comfatable to relax in after a long day sightseeing and shopping and being a 5 min walk from Macy's was a bonus. Eddie and Stanley the bellboys were lovely and so helpful. My only criticism is that you are only given 2 pods of coffee for the machine which isn't enough really but apart from that we will be returning in 2017.
user_name:
Rhea W
Portsmouth, England, United Kingdom

review_body: We had a great time staying at this hotel. Very clean and functional. The only bad thing is that we got an unexpected charge for $5.44 on our card. We were told it was for a juice from the minibar. We don't remember getting one. It may have been the fact that I put a relatively large water bottle in the fridge and the juice got pushed to the side. From now on, I will take a picture (with a time stamp) of the minibar before we leave any hotel room.

I recently stayed at this hotel and was treated very well, the staff were so helpful and nothing was to much trouble for them , the hotel was clean comfortable and near to so many attractions , I would definitely stay here again without out a doubt.
user_name:
Janis F
Greater London, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel is just gorgeous but they need to work on their check-in process. We arrived early & they agreed to hold our bags while we toured the city. When we returned we were told tat our room still was not ready. We left again only to return to find that our room still was not ready. We watched as others were frustrated by the check-in process. The decor & the rooms made up for it, though. The rooms are just gorgeous. The lobby was just lovely-with a beautiful Christmas tree & a cozy fireplace. The espresso bar was not open most of the time unfortunately. The rates are a little pricey but I still think that it's worth it. We will definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Bob O
Odenton, Maryland, United States

review_body: this is a great new hotel in an amazing location. Unlike other NYC hotels, the rooms are very spacious, The staff was great. The Concierge was very helpful with information on where to eat close by and how to get places. The bellman walked us up to our room. FD arranged a car to take us to the airport, and the housekeeping staff on the floor were very friendly. My wife & I had a great getaway weekend. This is my new NYC home base.

A very conveniently placed hotel for shopping etc. The room was very well-appointed but small - we only stayed for one night at the end of a trip to NYC, DC and back to NYC again so it was a great location for a final night. Very comfortable, (unnecessarily) large bathroom in relation to the bedroom.The room was quiet though the lobby was noisy as they seemed to be doing some renovation work. (Only in the daytime!) No restaurant at time of visit though there was a small coffee-shop in reception. (Coffee machine in bedroom also)Three members of staff were extremely helpful: Agnes, Eddie and Chris.

Well what can I say ! My husband and I travelled to NY for the first time for our 50 th birthdays and it was somewhere I've wanted to go for 30 years putting the pressure on to find a hotel to live up to my expectations . Le Soleil did not disappoint. We arrived a little early but was able to leave our luggage and go off for a while. We had requested a room if possible with view of Empire State and wow what a view. The room was spacious and pristine.. ( tiniest criticism- best to bring your own shower gel as only a tiny bar of soap near the sink none by shower) Staff were lovely from the ladies in housekeeping to the people on reception and Eddie needs a special mention of his own ( management had better hold onto him - he's a valuable asset to your hotel ) Le Soleil could not have been situated in a better location with almost all of the sights within walking distance - Empire State, Times Square, Macy's, Rockerfella centre and Bryant park. The others were only short trip away.Thanks to all at Le Soleil

Will start with one word, FANTASTIC!Went to this hotel for one week, from 3rd of December to 10th of December 2015. And there are no doubts that this hotel is perfect. Maybe it is because it’s so new but I really think this hotel will keep the standard for a long time ahead!First regarding the hotel entrance/lobby: It looked very nice standing at the street in front of the building. Nice “wooden like” look and big fancy windows making it look like you was in a “Hollywood movie”. Entering the lobby was always a pleasure since there always was some staff welcoming you into the building. You really felt like home just after one day! The atmosphere in the lobby and the common space (with fireplace) looked very nice. We really never had time to spend there but it sure looked very nice and comfortable. There was no breakfast included but they had a small breakfast to offer. We never used it but trust me, there are plenty of choices just within 3 minutes walking distance from the hotel. So don’t deselect this hotel from you possibility list just because of the breakfast!Regarding the rooms we only have experience for the executive queen suites but WOW what a wonderful experience! We actually booked an Executive Queen Room with view but hade a chance to upgrade during check-in to a suit. Since I read some reviews here on Trip advisor regarding that the rooms was small and that the girl helping us with check-in commented that we should stay for a significant time so a bigger room would be nice we took the chance and upgraded the room. And she also told us that we surely would be happy with the new room and trust me that we where very positive surprised! Of course we missed the view but still we could see almost half of the Empire State Building from the room (stayed at 11th floor) and that was more than enough for us! The room included a bedroom with a nice TV and the bathroom was big and very nice. I liked the shower that was very spacious, not so very common according to my experience. The living room was really a standard increaser! The living room was a Perfect place for relaxing after a day out in New York streets. It had a separate TV (second TV in the suite) and two nice armchairs that really made the evening perfect for planning the next day. There was a note that the standard armchairs were late and still not delivered but the substitution chairs from IKEA made us (from Sweden) feel even more “home” in the room. There was also a minibar and a safe making the room perfect equipped. To be honest I think this is the first hotel room I stayed in that had a perfectly working air condition. After returning from a tough day on the New York Street it only took about 5 minutes to make the room very comfortable. The hairdryer worked very well!The location of the hotel was according to us also perfect. We used 4 days around the hotel without using metro/taxi or bus and still we could visit a lot of stores and tourist places. The other days we used metro to get further away on Manhattan. There was a metro station (34th street station and Penn station) more or less just around the corner. You reached the 34th street Herald square station in just 2 minutes. We went to a New York Rangers game at Madison square garden one night (located just above Penn station) and we reached it by foot in more or less 8 minutes. So for the first stay in New York the location of the hotel is more than perfect! Macys is also just around the corner.I must mention the Concierge service. We really didn’t use it for booking something but we used it to help us with some booking we made our self from home before the visit. They were very helpful and they the help us two times when we were pretty nervous that our own booking was wrong. Once for our tickets to New York Rangers and the other time when our shuttle to the airport going home didn’t arrive as schedule (we didn’t book the shuttle at the hotel, we booked super shuttle by our self). They called the shuttle and when they didn’t arrive still one hour late the man at the concierge desk help us with a private taxi to the airport instead (please send our special thanks to him). We never noticed his name but I guess he has a background from Eastern Europe (like Russia).So now if you read all of my review I am pretty sure that you understand that we were VERY satisfied and we would more than likely recommend this hotel to ALL of you! If we will have the opportunity the revisit New York we would probably not even look at other hotels, Executive Le Soleil is the place to stay at!

Just returned from 2 nights at Le Soleil. The staff was great, especially the doorman, Eddie who was very helpful. The lobby is decorated for Christmas and is just beautiful. No room service or restaurant but coffee is available at a little cafe in the lobby - very nice. I asked for a room with a view but was told rooms with 2 queen beds were on lower levels - so we had a street view. Not bad but a nice view would have been nice. Room was large enough, but we were given a room with a handicapped accessible bathroom which we did not request and the entire floor sloped into one corner for the shower - are all rooms this way? Not sure. They definitely need a soap dish in the shower area and a bar of soap. Had to use the one tiny soap bar that was furnished for the bathroom sink and there was literally no place to put it while in the shower. (Not sure how someone with a wheelchair would have done in the room itself, which did not seem to be wide enough - but I digress.) Our room was not made up on the second night when we returned from our long day out. I called front desk and they did send up some new towels when I requested them but I was disappointed to have unmade beds etc and they could have comp-ed us something - but they did not. Lots of loud banging - like a jackhammer beginning around 8 am which continued throughout the day. The location is great - just a short walk to Herald Square and the subway and staff was friendly. I would consider staying here again if my concerns would be addressed.

We have been to New York 3 times and have never been impressed with room size; This hotel had the best sized room!! The staff was fabulously helpful!! The hotel was perfectly placed to Time Square, And Centeal Park!!! The best hotel experience so far, will definitely be back there!

The rooms are small, like every other hotel room in NYC, but modern and well furnished. Le Soleil is a small hotel (I love that), with character. Even though we had not paid for an early check-in, they let us in at 10am without charging us a dime. Extremely friendly staff. Location is great, near Macy´s Herald Square.

Great Hotel in a convenient mid-town location. Very comfortable room with all the amenities. The staff was attentive and helpful. Parking is accross the street. This hotel has become the place I stay in NYC.

Good location, close to both Penn and Grand Central stations (15 minutes walk). Fast and helpful check-in. Walking distance to many sights.We had an executive queen view room, which had a partial (obscured) view of the top of the Empire State building and some city skyline (which was nicer than a typical view of just a building across the street) with large full-length windows. Also, because the "view" rooms are on a high floor, there is very little noise. : )The room was a good size but not well designed, so there was some wasted space, and very little closet/hanging space for clothes. The work desk was awkward to use because the poorly designed large chair.There was a small kitchenette, microwave and sink (which we didn't use).Free wi-fi worked well. Large very comfortable shower, and restroom.Breakfast was very limited (choice of coffee OR juice, with a croissant OR a muffin OR a fruit).Overall, this hotel was quite good and worth considering.

The hotel opened around Sep. 2015 so is completely new, so the rooms are still well kept and feel very clean.Still some construction going on so you can see maintenance people running around and some construction noise. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant yet, I assume it will open in early 2016. The gym is very small and has 2 cardio machines, free weights and one power workout machine. it is also very small, so not comfortable if you're used to a good long workout.I got a queen suite for a reasonable rate of $255, which is actually quite reasonable for NYC, however given the hotel has no facilities, you're basically paying just to sleep. the room has a bedroom, shower and separate living area with a second TV. the queen bed is good just for one person, so while the room itself could fit 2, the bed actually makes it a room for 1. storage for clothes is very limited.I got a room facing the back, so my view was the adjacent building and I could see some of the empire state building. The bed was very comfortable and I actually slept like never before in NYC, as the room was very quiet.Hotel location is ideal on 36th street, close enough to times square but not to close, easy access to subway and penn station, easy access by car to the tunnel to go for for LGA and JFK airports. lots of restaurants and bars and even Kosher places around. Cleaners across the street.staff is polite and professional when you interact with them, but my only interaction was at check in and check out.Room service is a bit inconsistent, coming in inconsistent times, refreshing the shower amenities randomly. I had only 1 bar of soap for the 5 days I was there. I wanted to see if at some point they would think to add one for the shower, but they didn't.Given the hotel is new, you should expect some hick ups, but no big deal. especially if you get a good rate for a new hotel in this location and you don't need an in house restaurant, go for it.I don't see this as a luxurious hotel, it's just a new place to sleep in, and good location.

This hotel in centrally located to many of NYC attractions. Hotel room was very clean and spacious. The staff went out of their way to make our stay pleasurable. Thank you to the front desk and doorman for everything.

Clean, great staff and awesome location. Everything I wanted from a NYC hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The room is well equipped (queen suite), with a comfy bed, nice lcd screens, minibar, iron and ironing board. I have absolutely no negative comments about this place.

I stayed at Hotel Le Soleil for three nights on a business trip. The hotel is in a great location, almost half way between Grand Central Station and Penn Station. My business trip had me going all over NY and NJ, so easy access to those to stations was great. The rooms are comfortable, but small. If I were staying on pleasure and had any more luggage than a couple of suits it would have been a problem. The beds are comfortable, there is Keurig in the room, the bathrooms are actually pretty spacious and I had a great view. Each floor is small with only about 6 or 8 rooms per floor. The staff was great. Very friendly and very helpful. I would easily stay here again.

3 day long weekend stay early December. Rooms were very clean and well appointed, typical NYC small size. Bathrooms good size w/large shower. Rooms were also very quiet (we were street facing 10th floor) which is a plus in New York. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful, especially Eddie at door! The only negative would be rooms are made up late in day, in our case between 5 & 6PM every day. We travel to NYC frequently and there are nicer places (more $$$) but for value we would stay again & recommend to others

Everything is fresh and new here. The staff is very helpful and the room is efficient and well stocked. There is just the right amount of room for a city hotel. My only request would be a small desk lamp and I had to dig a little behind the night stand to plug in my cpap. I'll come here again.

Really loved this little hotel. Lovely lobby and sitting area with a huge Christmas tree. Efficient service. Only four rooms per floor. Huge bathroom with large wet room shower. Floor to ceiling window in room. Clean and modern design. Nice mini bar options.

We were greeted with all smiles and friendly service. We arrived at the hotel early in the morning and were surprisingly checked in and to our room in no time. The rooms were decent size for the city, comfortable, new, well decorated, and clean. We had a great view of the Empire State Building. The hotel was very quite and it was nice to sleep without being awoken with the normal noises that usually plague most hotels. The hotel is central to many destinations and we loved being able to walk everywhere. The staff member that really went out his way for us was the door man. We will happily return for another stay.

I've just returned from a six night break in the bright lights of New York and found this hotel to be a real gem. It's in a great location on W38, just a stone's throw from the bustle of Times Square, in fact much nearer than I had realised when booking. On arrival this was a concern, fearing sleepless nights ahead, but the from the 17th floor you could barely hear a thing. Coupled with super thick curtains and a comfy bed sleep was never an issue! Rooms were a reasonable size, very clean and well appointed reflecting that this is still a very new establishment. We had a great view over the city to the WTC and the Empire State Building. Staff were all incredibly polite and helpful, with a big shout out to Kevin, who was working tirelessly but always found time to chat or crack a joke whenever we saw him in the lift. He's a credit to the hotel and always made us smile.The only issue we had (which I think is largely out of the hotel's control) was the shuttle bus that can take you to JFK. We'd planned to get a taxi, but as we were leaving the bus turned up, we had some time so took a punt. But be warned if you experience the same driver we have this is not for the faint heated or anyone unaccustomed to 'robust' language! Now I understand there is a certain style you need to drive in New York and I have respect for anyone crazy enough to do it, but this guy was just a neanderthal. Driving like Otto from the Simpsons at high speed across junctions at the last minute and all whilst shouting out obscenities to someone on a personal phone call. I am by no means a passive driver myself and am rarely offended by bad language, but this guy went way too far, most passengers were shocked. To make matters worse he actually demanded a tip from me as soon as he put my case on the ground (I was about to get out of my pocket anyway!). So my advice pay the extra 20 dollars and get a taxi! Other than this a great stay and wouldn't hesitate to return.

Just finished our stay in NYC at Le Soleil for a quick trip to experience the City during the festive Christmas season. Loved this hotel, staff, rooms and location! Was always a pleasure to return exhausted from hours of walking and have Eddie open the door and great us on our return. We had a fantastic visit and would like to thank the staff for contributing to that! Happy Holidays! Jeff and Randy, Austin, Texas

Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in September. When walking in we noticed the hotel does have a small lobby area but no cafe/bar/restaurant. There is a very small espresso bar which operates during early morning hours but that's it.The rooms were quit small which is to be expected since it is Manhattan but they were very clean and comfortable. There is also a coffee machine in the room which is a great plus. The bathroom door did not have a handle on it which made it harder to open and close the door. No huge deal at all but would suggest they changed that. Nothing over the top but a solid good value hotel.The location is quit good, close to everything, right in the middle of Manhattan. Lots of cafes, bars and restaurants close buy but those are mostly tourist traps. for better quality places you will need to go to other neighborhoods (village, soho, chelsea...) If you are looking to see all the tourist highlights then its a really great location. For a more local experience stay away from Midtown.

This hotel is great! It is convenient to everything in the city. The staff was kind and courteous and went out of their way to make it a comfortable stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and plan on returning to LeSoleil my next trip to the city.

In September my boyfriend surprised me with a birthday bash in NYC. He rented 4 rooms in this hotel for ourselves and friends. We all were pleasantly surprised to find a hotel that we never stayed at before, that was super!! Not only was the staff helpful in every way, but the rooms, were new, fresh, clean and contemporary with a warm feeling. The location was better then ever! We walked to Central Park area for dinner, and roof top cocktails. In November we decided to go back again. Fabulous in every way, one more time! I hadn't realized that the location was as good as it is. time Square, Herald Square, Central Park... All in walking distance. Not to mention the shopping district right there! We rented a suite, which had every amenity one could ask for. An apartment in the city! Thank you to the staff and management for making Le Soleil a haven in itself...Perfect !!!,

What a gem Hotel Le Soeil is!! Hidden on 36th Street this hotel is convenient to everything in New York City. Everyone in the hotel went out of their way to insure our stay was perfect. When we ordered some extra coffee it was immediately delivered to our room within 5 minutes with a smile. The entire front office was very personable and wanted to make our stay perfect. We were going to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade and they led us right to the perfect viewing area. I know that the hotel is brand new and they are putting a restaurant adjacent to it but there is every dining option you would like all within the same block. Unfortunately I left some garments in my room when I checked out and the General Manager personally sent them to me the next day. Thank You Lowell! Guaranteed you will not go wrong with this new addition to New York's hotel inventory -- Scott B.

So, the hotel is still having work done although it's open. Today a lot of drilling, housekeeping, don't expect your room to be serviced before 6pm. The hotel is rather basic, not much facilities in the room, or hotel. Ok for a base but not worth the money per night.

This place is perfectly positioned in the centre of Manhattan, offering a great springboard from which to jump into all things New York. We stayed in a queen suite for one week and were not disappointed. Our room offered a stunning view of the mighty Empire State Building, towering above and visible from our bed on the 16th floor room (ask for a view room) making every morning special, as this icon bade us 'good morning'. The room had a microwave, sink and mini-bar, along with a handy coffee machine, complete with unlimited coffee and green tea pods, and the ability to heat water for standard tea bags, which we brought with us. Everyone was clearly focused on making us feel welcome and at home in Le Soleil, particularly the concierge Eddie, who took an interest in our plans for the day, without being overly inquisitive. Our room was very clean and beautifully prepared for our return after every days' exploring. This hotel is a a sure bet if you want a first class base with real free Wi-Fi, centrally located with excellent staff, focused on making your stay memorable.

We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in November. Our room (an Executive King Room) was nicely furnished but not particularly spacious (although this is probably to be expected in New York). The layout of the room did make good use of the space, however more bench top space, especially in the bathroom, would be appreciated.The TV was large and clear (with a good selection of stations), and the Keurig coffeemaker worked fine (although the coffee wasn't as good as a Nespresso unit). When we visited, the hotel's restaurant was not yet available, although there was a small coffee area available in the lobby in the mornings that served Nespresso and a small pastry selection.The staff were all very pleasant and helpful, however the concierge seemed somewhat lacking in experience (which is probably to be expected in such a new hotel).The location of the hotel was excellent: very close to a subway station and the shopping on 5th Avenue.Overall, we had a great stay, and would definitely consider returning when revisiting New York.

Hotel Le Soleil is only a few months old and everything was exceptional - location, price, and service. My wife and I stayed 3 days and enjoyed nights - celebrating our 27th Anniversary in the Big Apple. When we mentioned our anniversary, Luis the desk person upgraded our room to a higher floor so we could see the impressive sight of the Empire State Building. Eddy the bell hop was friendly, courteous and informative. Thought the stay, we found all staff to be of exceptional service. Needless to stay, this will be our hotel when we visit NYC and have enthusiastically referred it to several of our friends and family.

newly built hotel therefore very modern. We stayed on the 11th floor in 1103 and it was very quiet. Very clean hotel and room. Staff very friendly and helpful especially with knowledge of the City and how to get about and where to go. They will arrange transport for you i.e. airport transfers, taxis. Stanley and Amanda were especially helpful.I stayed for four nights with my daughter and the room was more than adequate.As for the location well this was the best and we were very close to Times Square, subways, Macey's and bus depot.I would definitely without any hesitation stay here again and would recommend it. we stayed from 21.11.15 to 25.11.15.

Just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel and thought it was fantastic.We stayed in 809 which was quiet and had a street view. It was a small room but more than adequate for us as we were out all day.The bathroom was huge with a wet room style walk in shower. The bed was very comfortable and so was the room temperature.We thought all the staff were so friendly and could not do enough for you.I arranged via concierge before i arrived hotel shuttle and also tickets for the Radio City Xmas show which was fabulous. The location was perfect for us as we were on a shopping trip and boy did we shop.... Loved it !!!If i return to NYC this would be my first choice.

This is a new property with friendly staff and a convenient location to mid-Manhattan. The rooms are small but comfortable. The bathroom is nice sized. The hotel does not yet have its liquor license so there is no on-site bar or alcoholic beverages in the in-room mini bar. The bed was comfortable though only queen sized. We were offered an upgrade to a suite but declined. If you can find a space to stow your bag and are not planning to spend a lot of time in your room it is quite satisfactory. Our room actually had a view. We were on the 12th floor. There was a concierge on duty but I did not use them. It can be a little difficult getting a cab at the hotel door as it is between 5th Ave and Ave of the Americas and is 1-way towards 5th Ave. If the weather is nice and you are not hauling luggage, it is not far to Ave of the Americas where cabs are abundant. Had an issue getting an Uber pickup as well but no problems getting back to the hotel.

Hotel Le Soleil is a great option in mid-town if you're looking for clean, comfortable and spacious accommodations in Midtown. My favorable review is largely based on value and I have the impression that this new hotel may be offering reduced prices to attract customers. For example, the hotel offered an upgrade to a one-bedroom suite for $25.00 a night, which I availed myself of. The suite was spacious. I don't know what a single room is like. It is a very nice hotel: new, clean and spacious. The decor is nice but not exceptional. It's a step up from more expensive chain hotels but not quite in the boutique category. Service was only so-so. The staff are very friendly but the housekeeping service seemed disorganized. They seemed to miss a few things (like no restocking coffee pods) each morning. The free Wi-Fi was outstanding - the best I've ever experienced in New York City.
user_name:
pwrstr
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My daughter & I had the most wonderful stay at Le Soleil between the 21st - 26th October 2015. This boutique hotel is brand new, absolutely spotless, modern with a luxurious feel. The staff are fabulous & so friendly. They even had a birthday present & card awaiting my daughter, as they had learnt of our celebration before we arrived. But I leave the best to last .......Eddie the concierge ! All of the concierges were wonderful, but Eddie was outstanding. He directed us on our way everyday, making visiting the nearby attractions & iconic buildings easy to find & enjoy. It was always a pleasure to get back to the hotel as the welcome you got felt like coming home !We loved Our first visit to New York, all the better for staying at Le Soleil, we will be back ! A huge thank you to all but especially Eddie, Sarah & Kitty Rankin

I visited Hotel Le Soleil for business and it is a brand new boutique hotel - about 3 months old - in Midtown Manhattan. I was upgraded to a higher floor, but you need to ask for it. The advantage is a terrific view of the Empire State Building. The rooms are standard NYC mid-size, but very clean and Quiet with minimalist decor, which makes it seem larger, in my opinion. The bed was ultra comfortable and the TV and bath facilities all worked well. There is a mini-bar with goodies in the room plus a Keurig, but I did not use it. They provide an umbrella, iron, hairdryer and robe for your use, but there is no closet, just a standing shelf unit for handing and folded clothes. One of the cons is no restaurant or bar - just a small counter offering soft drinks, water and pastries, but there are plenty of great options on W36th. The staff is super friendly and overall I really liked the rooms, cleanliness and location. I would recommend Hotel Le Soleil and return if I need to be in the Midtown area.

I will book again at this property. The staff was very friendly and I felt comfortable with the level of interaction. The room was clean, comfortable and attended to well every day. The location is great and there are some good dining options in the area. Certainly a great place for a home base! Wifi worked well, check in/out was easy.Nothing but positives to say about this property.

My friend booked this hotel. It's only 3 months old and in good location. The good: 1. Location2. Front desk staff. Very nice!3. Attractive/modern decor 4. Very clean and new 5. Boutique hotel if that's ur style (but without amenities u would expect) However: The not-so-good. 1. No valet. They tell u to park down the street2. The room was smallest I've ever stayed in NYC.... By far. Two beds with no room on side of beds to wall. Maybe foot. Only one foot to walk in front of bed to to desk/furniture. Two protruding furniture closets since no closet in room. 3. Bathroom tiny. 4. Toilet ran constantly.. Tv didn't work with remote. 5. No room service. 6. Am coffee in lobby. For a cost. 7. Average bed/linens. Nothing special. Thin blanket with sheet over. Cost:$450. Should have done better research. Our bad. U can get rooms 2/3 price cheaper, just as good location and much bigger room as well as a more full service hotel or more-amenity boutique hotel.

The rooms are clean and functional. Though the rooms are typical "NYC small" they make good use of the space.The bathroom is nice--the shower is plenty roomy and the supplies are of a good quality. The staff was wonderful. In particular, Jujie, Luis, Eddie & Taline were especially helpful throughout my 4-night stay. They offered great recommendations, were always pleasant and enjoyed their work.

Located in midtwon just off 5th this relatively newly opened hotel is the perfect location for exploring all parts of NYC. Subway is 2 minutes walk away on 6th, Empire State just round the corner and a myriad of shops and restaurants nearby. The staff are friendly and the rooms very comfortable. Not cheap but nothing is in midtwown.

This hotel is in its 'soft open'. Currently no food & beverage (except for the mini bar) and even the front sidewalk seems incomplete. But it is definitely a working hotel, and a decent one at that. I only wish I could say it was all good, but I did have some difficulties.The first room I was given for my 4-night stay (1707...north-facing, which is to say not much of a view) was tiny. I guess I should say "normal," by NYC standards. And it would have sufficed, I suppose, but for two things: 1) there are no actual closets in the rooms. They have a sort of Ikea-looking piece of furniture that has drawers and a place to hang clothing, but the hanging area is limited and if you have a winter coat or anything wet to hang up, you are out of luck. It's an attractive, minimalist piece of furniture...just not entirely adequate. 2) The shower in room 1707 (and probably some others) is a rainfall shower. But it is not located on the shower ceiling...it is on the wall in front of you. That fact, plus the lack of great water pressure, means you shower under a sort of limp stream of water. The bathroom is beautiful and well appointed, but in my book a hotel room lives or dies by how good the shower is, and this was a fail.Alfredo at the front desk was very nice during my check-in and arranged to have me change rooms after my first night. It took some coordinating to actually do, but he and the rest of the staff were very helpful and for my final 3 nights I was in 1805 – a larger room with a much better view (looking due south past the Empire State Building) and a much better shower. Still with low water pressure, but at least this one was hand-held and thus much more effective.Oh, and still no closet!So, if you can find a nice rate (say, $250 or under) and can somehow get one of the south-facing rooms with a hand-held shower...I'd say go for it. Otherwise, I dunno...just not entirely worth it. No matter how friendly the staff may be – and they are.

Very good experience, especially with the outstanding kindness of all the staff. Also maintenance was quick and efficient. Room with a view just a little small but great bathroom. Special note to Amanda: you are great! Hope to be back soon :)

Great Customer Service especially EddieExceptional Front desk serviceTimely response on my special requests and needsGave me complimentary late check out and extra pillows!Clean, Lovely and Spacious RoomsJust got a problem with their policy for Holding the whole amount of stay + holding security deposit at the same time but nonetheless my stay was fantastic. Definitely will be back soon =)

As others have noted, this is a very new hotel. It is very nice and it was worth upgrading to a small suite (which also had a kitchenette). The room was spotless. Upon arrival, there was a little snafu with my reservation - but they reassured me they would handle it (and they did - promptly). The folks at the desk were consistently wonderful, as were the "doormen" (they really weren't door men at all -- they were welcoming, helpful hotel ambassadors - just wonderful). I didn't have a lot of requests, but I'm sure if I did, they would have been very helpful. I watched them assist other customers with enthusiasm. There are some minor kinks as this is a new hotel. I understand from the hotel manager that they are going to add a small sofa to the room I was in. I also found the heat/cooling system a little less than optimum -- it was actually warm in nyc this visit and the system seemed to cycle off (motion detector?) while I was sleeping and I would wake up in the middle of the night to a pretty warm room. However, I was on the 19th floor and there was NO street noise!! Also excellent wifi!The windows are floor to ceiling glass -- and while I wish I had the Empire State Building view -- it was lovely nevertheless. The armoir hanging space is limited, but the unit is very efficient. Bathroom was terrific, sliding door not optimum but who cares? Bathroom was spotless, well appointed - water pressure not stunning, but passable. My room had a small kitchenette, which was also spotless and even had some dishes and utensils as well as a good size microwave. The restaurant and bar will be finished in a few months and I am sure it will be a great addition, as the decor of the hotel is lovely. I often stay in NYC and sometimes want my hotel to be walking distance from Penn Station. This hotel is a little farther from the station than I usually stay, but it is well worth 5 more minutes of walking....and I would certainly stay there again. It will be my first choice in the area...hopefully its room rates will not become prohibitive, right now they are incredibly reasonable and represent great value for the money.

Beautiful hotel with the comfiest bed I've ever experienced. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and the situation is good for sights and transport. Whilst the hanging space is poor, my wife & I found that there was sufficient drawer space for our six night stay.

Absolutely fantastic hotel. The hotel was spotless. In a great location next to Herald Square and next to Kleen Steakhouse. Highly recommend this hotel. We stayed on the 17th floor and had a great view of the Empire State building the room we stayed in was perfect for couples
user_name:
J K P
Kilkeel, United Kingdom

review_body: We had a fabulous stay at Le Soleil. Great location and very well appointed rooms. The staff was courteous and the bellman Eddie went above and beyond to help us. When returning to the city, we will most certainly be staying here.

One would think that there'd be no problems in a brand new hotel but soon after arriving, tried to take a shower to discover that the drain was blocked and the bahroom floor was flooded. Furthermore, after reviewing my credit card statement, I discovered that I had been billed twice for use of the mini bar.

This hotel is pretty much brand new so there are a few small details that they are still figuring out but I would definitely stay here again and I can tell that they are working hard to make this place the top place to stay in NYC.The locate is perfect and the rooms are clean and the decor is tasteful.The front-desk staff is great. Check in was fast and accurate. The bellmen are amazing too, especially EDDIE but I'll get to him later.We appreciated that the hotel tried to give us as large and as spacious of a room possible, and that is likely why we were given a room for those with disabilities. This means I'm not sure how the other rooms are decorated but we found the furniture in the room quite scarce. Things that could be done better: a coat closet or rack, luggage racks or someplace to put some clothing. One of the days we had horrible rain and there was no place to hang up the 4 wet jackets we wanted to hang to dry. We also found it hard to find a place to put our toiletries.. a small shelf or two would have been great.The business centre and free wifi are nice touches as is the morning coffee bar. The young lady that works here is also amazing. One morning we were a few minutes late and she re-opened for us with a big smile and lots of energy... EXCELLENT service by this wonderful woman. All of the employees on the conceirge desk needs a bit more training. We were not confident that they knew the tours they were selling. We also had a significant problem with airport car service upon check out but EDDIE saved the day and found us a cab during Friday night rush out and the shift change. He was AMAZING and needs to be recognized.All and all, I think this is an excellent hotel and I would recommend it and stay here again without hesitation. The few things I mention as negatives are only done so that small improvements can be made.

This hotel has recently opened and I say... book a room here while you can get one. Once the word gets out on it's wonderful location and boutique feel- you won't be able to get a room. I stayed here for 4 nights over Halloween and can't say enough about it. The service, location and amenities were superb! The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel design is very modern and stylish. It was spotlessly clean. There is an espresso bar in the lobby and several wonderful delis right across the street. It is convenient to absolutely everything-literally-5 mins to Times Square and the theater district. Wonderful hotel! Can't wait to go back! I didn't really want to post this review because I wanted to keep this little jewel to myself- but the staff was just so great- they deserve recognition!

Stayed here for 4 days &, although we experienced a couple of problems, the staff were helpful & friendly. The Booking.com room description was misleading (not the hotel's fault) & the first room was too small for anything other than an overnight stay but we were moved, by José, into a suite looking out onto the Empire State building. The room was clean, comfortable & fresh. Even when the air con broke down, we were moved straight away (thanks to Stanley for the help moving). Great location which is a 10 minute walk from Times Square & 5 minutes from Macy's.

Just home from a five night stay here with my Daughter.The hotel was amazing, great location, room and bathroom modern and cleaned daily. They have everything you need, wifi, a business suite on the lower level (great for printing boarding passes) a gym, small café selling drinks and pastries and a relaxing lounge area.The staff here are some of the best I have experienced, always happy, friendly, courteous and professional. Special shout out to Stanley and Eddie who were both so lovely, friendly and helpful, they are a credit to this hotel!A fantastic first trip to New York, when we return this hotel will be first on my list :)

Yadira from Customer service/reservation was very helpful and friendly. I was able to request a room with a view, but she also advise me that she'll make the request but it was not guarantee. She also was ableto reserved the best room to fit my budget.
user_name:
Leonor A
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here for a NYC weekend. The hotel had been open for about 6 weeks so everything at this point is fresh and new. Standard room was a good size by New York standards, bathroom was excellent. Hotel location is fantastic as it is pretty much central to everything by foot or a short cab/uber ride. Eddie at the front door was fantastic and extremely helpful on reco's of where to go or dine! All of the staff were excellent and attentive. Great time and we will return the next time when in NYC!

My mom and I checked in here after a TERRIBLE experience at an airbnb. We arrived at 11am and were immediately given a room (even if check in wasn't until 3pm). The hotel was lovely and brand new and very reasonably priced. The room was spacious, clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The location is AWESOME. Very close to the subway. It's on 36th street between 5th and 6th avenue so it's away from all the noise. Just a block or two from some great shopping on 34th street. About a 7-10 minute walk to Time Square and Broadway. It's about a mile away from the MoMa and Central Park (we just took lyfts or ubers when we didn't want to ride the subway). The staff was INCREDIBLY helpful and so sweet! We stayed for 4 nights and we will definitely stay here when we come back to New York

A lovely hotel to stay in NYC. Top location, nice rooms, comfy beds, clean. Very helpfull staff. Many thanks to Yugie, Luis, Stanley and Joseph - all you are great and made our stay in your city unforgettable!

I stayed at Hotel Le Soleil, not realizing I was a guest in only its 8th week of operation. Can I just say how much I LOVE being on new carpet, new tile, new sheets (ok, you get the gist). The hotel was lovely. It had a beautiful lobby, convenient, 24-hour snack station (coffee, tea, pastries, etc.), very quiet elevator and nice, well lit hallways. The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating while remaining completely professional, and my room was very nice (see pictures). The view was beautiful on a clear night (again, see pictures) and even though I was in the heart of a busy area - near Herald Square, I had a very quiet, restful night's sleep. The room was not very large but in NYC, such is hotel life. They have a free gym on site, and while their full restaurant services are not yet open, they have a full list of restaurant referrals if you are typically a room service kind of person and need nourishment.Overall I highly recommend staying here and look forward to doing so again myself.
user_name:
Gregory M
Tinton Falls, New Jersey
