review_body: friendly stall. especially our eddy. what a delight. very helpful. bit on expensive side. but worth it. very clean. central location. only downfall is that there is no consideration given to storing your suitcases etc unless you book premium rooms which comes at cost. décor is modern. manager was unfriendly as did not honour our on line booking.

I booked the hotel based on reviews that concluded that Lesoleil is good value for money. My experience is different, and I would probably not stay there again. First the pros: hotel is clean, lobby area is gorgeous, and staff are friendly although not necessarily efficient. I booked a standard king-sized bed room for 7 nights, expecting a good-sized room with no frills but everything in working order. What I got was a tiny room with problems every single day for the first 4 days of my stay. Here is a list of issues I encountered with Lesoleil and that were not resolved to my satisfaction. 1 – I arrived early and room was not ready. I left my luggage and was told they would be at my room when I arrived. They were not. I came down to get them, instead of waiting for staff to bring it up, which was smart in retrospect because: it took 10 minutes for somebody to show up to get my luggage and when I got it, it was not my luggage! I had to come down to the basement to get my stuff, which would probably would be much worse if the wrong luggage was put into my room or delivered to me. 2 – Room was tiny, but well designed. Yet, no amount of good design will change the fact that there was barely enough space to open a large suitcase and that I had to put the bathroom robe and umbrella at the top of the armário to make space for a couple of suits and three shirts. Couldn’t fit anything else in the hangers, so had to leave shirts folded and iron them day by day instead of having one ironing session. Also, it was really fun trying to open the ironing board in the tiny room.3 – Bathroom flooded. Room was brand new and I certainly did not expect it. It was resolved swiftly, though. 4 – A friend dropped an important envelope for me at the hotel, and sent me a note saying it was there. I asked for it but the staff repeatedly said there was nothing for me. It was a tense 10 minutes, as I was trying to get hold of my friend while the staff finally remembered there was another place where the envelope could be. Of course it was there.5 – I had to ask three days in a row for coffee mugs. I had them in the first day, used them, the cleaning staff took it and did not replace it till the fourth day, even after daily requests. Minor detail, as there were paper cups in the room, but if I am going to have horrible Keurig coffee, at least I would like to do that in a proper mug. 6 – Elevators cannot handle the number of people moving around. There is no service elevator, so the two lifts have to handle all staff and guests moving around. At 20 floors with 8-10 rooms per floor, it simply did not work well. I lost a lot of time simply waiting for the elevators to bring to and from my room. All in all, I paid way too much for a tiny room with some design flair and friendly staff. For U$50 more per night I could have stayed at the Astoria, but I usually like executive hotels. Spacious, no frills, comfortable. I don’t mind the lack of a bar or restaurant in the hotel. I was not looking for luxury but comfort. In the end, I got neither.

This hotel started out with reservations YadiraShe was helpful when an online price was cheaper she urged us to get that price. My inclination after chatting with her was to book it with her instead. Bottom line the hotel was booked and we are more than pleased with her service as well as the courtesy of the front desk. Yadira had to be met and she was delightful. Also she gave us a recommendation of a restaurant close to hotel. We did it for lunch and it was awesome. Check out my review on the restaurant. Another person was a delight the bellman was met on the elevator and his upbeat attitude matched mine as every day is wonderful to be living. He brought it further stating " sometimes I live it one minute at a time. Then when there were no papers he was willing to go buy one for me. I declined. Guess where I will stay next time in New York.Thanks staff

Great location, five minutes walk to Times Square or Empire State Building but quiet so you can sleep at night. Spotless room, super friendly staff and the icing on the cake, Eddie the doorman, knows everything and has the widest smile and the best customer manner you will find anywhere in New York. This is not an overpriced and ultimately disappointing hotel that you read about on so many reviews of New York hotels, it's a great find, stay there and see for yourself.

We stayed five nights at Le Soleil. This was our first trip to New York and we had thought long and hard about where in the city we might like to stay, how much we were prepared to pay and the facilities we needed. Le Soleil proved to be an excellent choice. Being new everything was spotlessly clean and the staff keen to help. (Yes, Alfredo and Stanley - you deserve a mention for the warmth of your welcome!!) We were on the 17th floor with great views of the Empire State. Some reviewers criticise the rooms for being small but my understanding is that to get a large room in New York you would need to pay a lot more. We found the size perfectly adequate. The space was used well and we had enough drawer and wardrobe space to empty our cases and to move around quite comfortably. The bed and pillows were lovely and once we worked out the air conditioning system we were able to get the room temperature to one which suited us. The double glazing was very effective at keeping out any street noise. The bathroom was a good size with a great walk in shower.The location was good within easy walking distance of Macy's, Broadway, Times Square and Grand Central Station. There was a subway station just round the corner. Eating out in the area we found less good although there was a useful Pret a Manger across the road which was good for breakfast. For small intimate restaurants Greenwich would have been a better choice of area. Nothing in New York is cheap, so, given that proviso, I would say that this hotel offers good value.

Small hotel with excelent service, clean and great location. Free wifi and cheap shuttle to the airport.The personal was very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and with enough space considering it is NYC. We've stayed in different hotels in NYC and this one is just as promissed. You wont be dissapointed

We stayed for five nights, room was clean and spacious, staff friendly and accommodating, lack of restaurant was disappointing, but there are plenty of options close by. Andrew's Coffee Shop was great for breakfast and McGinnetty's Pub had great value meals.

Excellent hotel in a perfect location. Disappointed we had a brick wall outside our window until the third night when we actually looked up only to find the Empire State Building towering above us!! Wow! Staff were delightful. Hotel stylish and spotless. Can't wait to return!

no restaurant....no bar .... what are the toilet doors all about? they dont work (room 1907) .... front desk transfer of communication between shifts is non-existant ... I would never stay here again ... they only thing thing this hotel has going for it , is Keen's Steak Restaurant and Bar along the street

What an amazing find. Realize the rate was incredibly inexpensive for Manhattan (probably because hotel is brand new) but it was superb. Clean, very spacious, comfortable beds, quiet, excellent helpful staff. (Not only friendly but knowledgeable. )Great central location. Easy access to train, Penn Station, No on site restaurant yet but plenty of food nearby. options from take out tonsitndoen restaurants nearby. Would definitely return here again!!

First off myself and my partner got the room at special rates due to the hotel's opening - so our review indicates a great value at this price. We would not be able to afford this hotel at it's regular rates. The hotel was right in central Manhattan only 5-10 minutes away from sights such as Times Square, the Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, Madison Square Garden and lots more. This was a great place to stay for a first trip to Manhattan because nothing was too far away.The lobby area was clean and staff were always attendant and polite - with GREAT customer service! Each person would say Good Morning / Hello and ask if there was anything that you needed or wish you a good day. This really made the hotel feel welcoming and less cold and corporate than most hotels I've stayed in. Checking in was quick.We stayed in an executive queen room on the 9th floor. The room was spacious and was and more than appropriate size for a couple travelling for a week - made up of an entrance area with 2 chairs and a TV, the bathroom, a table & chair with a giant mirror, and then the back area with the queen size bed and floor to ceiling windows! The bed was very comfortable. Bed sheets were fantastic. Next to the bed was an apple dock / clock with a charger which was useful and a nice addition. The TV was large and had lots of channels (It could also be used as an alarm clock!).The sliding bathroom door was a bit of a mystery as it appeared to have a lock fitted but no way to actually lock it ... not a massive problem for us but did mean the door was difficult to shut as it was rather heavy. The shower was lovely and modern with the glass panelling. All shampoos and soaps were replaced daily!Air conditioning in the room was great and simple to use! It was so easy to change room temp if I was feeling a bit hot or a bit cold.Ironing board and iron were welcome additions. Clever marketing of the hotel to place tasty looking cookies on the side as they are hard to resist every day! There was a coffee machine but a few english breakfast tea bags wouldn't have gone amiss!Our view out of the window was into another building. We did enjoy guessing what the people in the offices were working on! We did not mind this because we understand that Manhattan is a central hotel, surrounded by buildings. Our hotel room was also lovely and quiet, really relaxing after a day out in the busy city.When we checked out, our flight was not until later in the day. The hotel held our bags for us. We were really concerned about being over our weight allowance but a friendly member of staff weighed them with his 'experienced arms' and reassured us they were within the range! This was a small exchange but really made a difference and relaxed us!!Thanks for having us Executive Hotel Le Soleil. We would definitely stay again!
user_name:
Jules G
Greater London, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel had only been open for 25 days the hotel is brilliant no obvious snagging to be completed. Rooms are perfectly sized for the centre of New York. The staff were superb and could not be more helpful - we had a blocked drain and this was sorted with no fuss and very quickly.Would definitely recommend the hotel which will only get better when the bar and restaurant are completed! (Espresso is great for breakfast)

Le Soleil... A study in duality.First let me say that everyone on staff at Le Soleil was exceedingly helpful and courteous. My husband arranged this hotel for my birthday and called ahead to have flowers and balloons in the room on our arrival and they did a great job. There were balloons scattered around the room and a beautiful flower arrangement. The room itself and building overall were very clean and neat. I felt everything was fresh and hygienic. The building itself is warm and homey, not corporate cold. The location is perfect for access to all of Manhattans offerings.Combined with the friendly staff, I would almost say LeSoleil is "inviting" but this is where the "buts" start...Coming into the lobby, which is actually quite open and well appointed, we were a bit overwhelmed by the volume of the background music. We would have considered spending some time in the guest lounge if not for that. Check-in was however quick and friendly.We had reserved a "Queen Suite with a View" for a premium price so we had some expectations that, sadly, we're not met there as well.Initially we noticed a lack of "surface space" in both the sitting area of the room as well as the sleeping area. The list of conveniences, comforts and options that missed the mark is a little long so bear with me.There wasn't a luggage valet so we had to make due with balancing our suitcase on the ironing board or access our luggage kneeling on the floor. The one desk area where was nearly unusable as half the surface was setup with a Keurig Coffee maker and all the coffee making accessories and products. More of the space was stocked with a small grocery of snacks at premium prices. $6.00 for a travel snack sized Pringles chips? Really?The sitting area also lacked usable surface space. Had we chosen to celebrate my birthday with champagne in the room, we would have been hard pressed to find table space for the bottle and glasses. It's more disappointing because the room wasn't inconveniently small so the limited surface space wasn't a matter of avoiding crowding, just poor planning.The bed was actually quite comfortable BUT the pillows were almost useless. They were down pillows that compressed almost flat when we rested our heads on them. We actually ordered up an additional set of pillows, making a total of 7, but it didn't help much at all. With the TV on the wall at the foot of the bed, it was quite difficult to find a comfortable reclining position to watch as it felt like the pillows melted away into nothing when the least amount of pressure was applied. Stiff necks for all. Returning to the concept of hygiene, the bathroom felt quite clean but also fell short on some conveniences. Water pressure was woefully inadequate.A placard describing the building as Eco-friendly was a convenient excuse but a different shower head would have compensated. A sliding door would also have been nice. Having to step fully into the shower stall to turn on the water, taking the initial flow of cold water right in the face wasn't a pleasant experience. And back at the bedside, one side of the bed offered a clock with built in USB charging port and an Apple lightning charger dock but the other side had no matching convenience or an accessible outlet to plug our own chargers into. I know that sounds small but in the age of smart phones, iPads and Kindles, this really does seem more necessity than convenience.But, given all this, I will still give three out of five just for a super friendly and helpful staff, location and overall cleanliness.

This hotel has no restaurant or Bar despite advertising a signature restaurant and bar. I do not know how they can get away with this!. The beds are small and uncomfortable. If you have a lot of clothes to hang in a wardrobe you will be very disappointed. The lifts are extremely frustrating. I could go on. So many problems here

Firstly i'd like to make it clear this is a fantastic hotel and i'm one fussy bugger who reads every tripadvisor post on where i'm staying. I would stay here again anytime. The staff are amazing and the hotel is very clean and located in a perfect position to reach all sides of New York without the noise of the busy street.We were originally checked in to a room on the 10th floor (overlooking the street) with a Queen size bed which would've been great if the room was bigger. We have a 19 month old baby and needed a cot in the room which was supposedly arranged on booking.However when we saw the size of the room there was no space for our luggage, buggy and a cot, it was really a tiny room with a big bed in it.I went downstairs and spoke with the reception and the guy showed me an executive suite on the 11th floor (facing offices not the street).Now this was a good size suite but sadly it only had a king size bed in it, however it was a sacrifice i was happy (being 6'2" a big bed is needed) to make so that my toddler had some room to move about in. And two large flatscreen tv's.They allowed us this suite at no extra charge, very kind of them.They brought up a travel cot but left it for us to assemble ourselves which i thought was pretty bad form.The negatives about this place are...There are a lot of things that could improve the hotel, sadly they should have been done at construction stage.The whole design lay out of the rooms are pretty thoughtless from an architectural point of view.Wasted space in the bathroom with a huge shower that doesn't drain properly hence you're left standing in an inch of water and a shower that only reaches about a foot away from the wall so you end up trying not to head butt the wall while getting your hair/body wet.Also to have an executive suite with only a king size bed in it is a huge let down. Also something not considered at design stage.There is no 'grab handle' in the shower should somebody need it if they are unstable on their feet and no emergency cord should someone fall ( i thought this would be law).There are no glasses in the bathroom for when you brush your teeth to rinse with water. And something that i think is alien to New Yorkers, no toilet brush (Thankfully i never needed it). The sliding bathroom door was a real pain especially as it never had any kind of handle or finger holes to assist in sliding the big heavy door and it never even had a lock on it.Two bottles daily of complimentary water are pretty common in decent hotels these days and would be a nice touch.The hotel restaurant wasn't opening till November so i can't comment on the food.The above are all things that could be looked at but probably won't be.But as i said in the beginning, this is still a super hotel, you'd be crazy not to stay here. Trying to be cool but sometimes was impractical!

First time in New York so was very unsure if I had booked a good hotel. I was not disappointed. The location was brilliant for getting around New York and the rooms had everything you could need, iron, ironing board, coffee machine, docking station and umbrella!!. The staff were very attentive and made you feel most welcome. The hotel had a personal feel which is rare in any city. I would highly recommend it.

This is a brand new hotel very conveniently located near Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Macy's etc. Rooms are small but beautifully decorated with free wifi (a rarity in NYC hotels) and Keurig coffee machines. Staff is friendly and helpful. We arrived a bit before checkin but our Guest Services agent (Jackie) was able to juggle things so we got our room right away. Then she called to see if everything was ok. Bellhop (sorry I didn't get his name) gave us several suggestions for lunch nearby. Still needs some work outside but am sure that will get done soon.A great find! Great value for the area.

This is a brand new hotel, so everything is new, clean and spiffy. The staff is so nice and helpful.The rooms are really big for NY. The beds super comfy. The bathrooms large. The room I had also had a mini kitchen with a sink, microwave and a mini fridge with drinks. The location is one of the best in NY, right in midtown.I will definitely return for business and pleasure.

A hotel room in the Big Apple has never been cheap. While we can never compare the rate between a decent business hotel in NYC with one in Bangkok or even in Shanghai, we can always compare one and another within the same city or the same neighborhood. While searching online, we found Le Solei was pricing more attractive than Hyatt place, Holiday Inn Express and Best Western next door. And after having arrived on the spot, we knew we have made the right choice.The hotel meaning the lobby and the room, being newly opened was brand new. The Executive Queen, albeit compact but still a comfortable one. Being new, everything was in perfect condition. However, we honestly wish the room could have provided more spaces to unpack and to hang the unpacked clothing. And, I myself really wish the coffee maker inside the room was not a Keurig machine. A Nespresso or even a Dolce Gusto will be a better fit to the right image of the 4-star boutique property as the hotel define itself.Service-wise, it was friendly. The Concierge helped with unloading and keeping our luggages promptly and did not hang on for tipping was a pleasant first image. A Cup of cappuccino or other choice of premium coffee was offered when we checked in early and before our room was ready was a nice gesture as well. A nice and pleasant experience. But still, a decent room in NYC is expensive.

The manager of the hotel was rude and extremely unpolite with us. We had a problem with the credit card at our arrival - easily solved - But since that moment we were treated like rubbish. The rest of the staff was nice and helpful, but not this man. We were punished staying in a lower floor where the street noise is quite loud. Rooms are very small, there is no cafeteria to have breakfast and you can waste up to 5 minutes waiting for the elevators. For an european, it's like a 3 stars hotel with the price of a 7 stars. If you take a small water bottle from the room they will charge you 4 dollars. I don't recommend this place.

Sometimes the on-line booking experience can be somewhat daunting, especially when you are adding in complications such as connecting rooms and complicated itineraries. Having just been through the process booking similar at Hotel Le Soleil NY I was pleasantly surprised how easy this was through their reservation contact Yadira. Made the process so simple. I hope the hotel is as pleasant. Thank you

My friend and I went to New York City for a girl's getaway and were more than pleased with Hotel Le Soleil. The location was perfect. On a side street so traffic noise was very minimal. Beautiful building and lobby and rooms were exquisite. All of the staff were very welcoming and seemed genuinely pleased that we chose their hotel. Room was a little small, but the amenities more than made up for that. I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to visit there again soon.

Myself and my girlfriend stayed here 12th September-14th September, I'm guessing this wasn't much longer after the hotel opened as we could find little information on the hotel itself so we didn't know what to expect. However, upon arrival (after an overnight flight from Vegas), very tired and hoping to check in several hours early, we were met by the some of the most friendly staff in NYC. Checking in early was not an issue and the lobby and decor of the hotel exceeded expectations for the price. There is also a small espresso cafe in the lobby if you want to grab breakfast on your way out. The location is great, less than a 2 minute walk to 34th St/Herald Sq Subway station, and the empire state building is 2 blocks over, there is also a great bar on the same side of the street as the hotel about 5 buildings down, reasonably priced drinks for Manhattan and a good atmosphere on a Saturday night.The room was outstanding, spacious and extremely clean. 2 big TV's, coffee, machine and in room safe. The bathroom was great, the shower was a large rainfall shower and having worked on a summer camp since April, this was probably my favourite facility. Obviously, this is a new hotel and much like a new home, there can be some teething issues, for example, on the power outlets by the bed, only the top outlet worked, not the end of the world and certainly didn't effect my stay, but on check out, I mentioned this, and the staff could not be more apologetic and told me they would get it fixed immediately, a great attitude and I have no doubt all minor issues will be sorted by the turn of the year, I must stress, no issue should take away the high standard and quality of this hotel, these are the things that happen when moving into a new building. Now the staff, a great collection of people that make it clear the guest is priority without being over the top. Should you need or want it, they will do everything in their power to have it done. Eddie worked in the lobby the weekend we stayed, met with a good morning when leaving for the day, offered a cab, recommended places and when checking out, organised our bags to be kept safe while we went out for the day as we had a late flight back to the UK. Eddie was also the first person we met when checking in very tired, he opened the doors for us with a smile on his face and set the standard for our stay with his courtesy. Joseph was another gentleman that worked the lobby over our weekend, both Eddie and Joseph worked on the day we checked out and while our bags were being retrieved to leave for the airport, we chatted to them and very friendly banter just added to the stay and made it personal as they asked about our time in the city. Just to add Joseph manged to carry my girlfriend's suitcase, my large backpack and several smaller back packs in one trip, a feat that I feel can't go unmentioned as it must have been about 70kgs all together. Overall, based on location, staff, cleanliness, room quality and general atmosphere and experience, you will be hard pushed to find a better stay in NYC for the price. Great stay, this hotel has my business for all of my trips to NYC in the future.
user_name:
DTW1993
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: We had a very enjoyable stay at Hotel Le Soleil - the staff on the front desk were amazingly friendly and helpful (and even printed us a map to get to the Yankee stadium by subway). The hotel is brand new, everything is shiny and new, modern decor and SUPER comfortable bedding. Ask for an Empire State Building view if you can, but our room on the other side was great anyway, with a great skyline view from the 18th floor. It is on a relatively quiet street for NYC - we heard absolutely no street noise or neighbour noise at all!Really, staying here made our NYC weekend getaway so easy, shops (Macy's) and subway station were within walking distance - a great location to base youreself and get around the city.There were a couple of little things that could be improved (the porter was relatively unhelpful when it came to advice regarding airport transfers and the pathway to the door at the entrance is uneven / not completed yet), but I would definitely recommend to anyone for a NYC stay. They had such a great opening special rate for us - I just hope we will still be able to afford it the next time we go!!

We chose to stay 5 nights at Le Soleil because of its excellent midtown location (close to subway, restaurants and shopping) and because of the amazing grand opening rates. Overall, we had a pleasant stay. The lobby was welcoming, rooms were clean with nice amenities, and most of the staff were friendly and helpful (especially Eddie and Joe!). However, we did encounter a few glitches: Our originally reserved room had been changed / upgraded but we were not informed prior to or during check-in (hence we were somewhat confused once we saw our room.) Then our room was not cleaned one day by housekeeping; the drain in our shower did not work properly (almost flooded the bathroom floor twice); when we were exchanged to a different room, that was already occupied by another guest; Most of these issues were quickly dealt with by the front staff, and no doubt once the operational kinks are sorted out, Le Soleil will be worthy of a five star rating.

This is a bit of a late review but I stayed here on the second night the hotel opened for 8 nights. Now iv stayed at A LOT of hotels in Manhattan and spent countless hours researching hotels to stay in and experienced staying in many different areas of the city. I LOVE this hotel and it is by far my favourite nyc hotel. As we stayed the opening week we got an amazing deal. The hotel itself is beautifully presented but what really sets this hotel aside are the staff. Special shout out to Eddie at the front door and Chris on reception. You guys are amazing. With the majority of NYC hotels being so big and having massive lobbies the personal touch is often lost, not here. Oh did I mention the service? I really dont need to, the staff are just amazing. The only area which needed tweaking was housekeeping and how they operate but im sure that will be addressed or already has. The rooms are spacious and well presented and the amenities are up there "the couples kit" was a welcomed suprise lol. Good job the rooms and soundproofed, jokes aside for people who stay in nyc often you will know this is a big plus.Hope you guys liked the backpacks and hope to see you all soon.

Being a first time visitor in NYC, I had a very hectic experience upon my arrival but once I arrived at the hotel I was not disappointed. The unique and beautiful art pieces and furnishings provided the hotel a relaxing and soothing atmosphere which is absolutely a pleasant experience to have especially after a long flight or journey. Every room has free wifi which is adequately fast so, one can can reply emails and continue doing work without interruption. There is also a business centre for work purposes if this is your preference. A good service worth mentioning is the hotel provides transport to the airport at a fixed rate compared to the yellow cabs. So, if you want to save on transport costs this is definitely the service to use. Additionally, the staff are very warm, friendly and glad to provide assistance. I enjoyed receiving service particularly from a genuinely nice staff member named Yujie Yang. Alongside being dependable she provides exemplary service and I would recommend any visitor to seek her assistance whenever you need it. I also loved the fact that the hotel is centrally located in the heart of Manhattan where shops and restaurants are within a walking distance from the hotel. If you would like to go shopping, sightseeing or have any relaxing leisure time, there are iconic buildings and places such as the Empire State building, Times Square and parks nearby. A visitor has the absolute freedom and options to choose whatever they want because everything is easily available and accessible.Despite my overall pleasant stay, there were only a few problems experienced which is expected in every case. Generally, the service is slow and the hotel's restaurant is not operational till December. So, one cannot have their meals in the hotel and access services such as room service, instead you would have to go outside the hotel to get a decent meal. Aside from the few problems, I enjoyed my stay at the hotel and will definitely return there when I visit NYC the next summer.
user_name:
Njeri M
Saint George Parish, Grenada

review_body: Currently staying in this brand new hotel and what a shame it isn't finished yet!!!!!No restaurant, no bar, only one lift working , no lock or handle on the bathroom door , small room kitted out with massive furniture .................. smallish things that add up to feeling a little hard done by that this four star hotel isn't really four stars yet.And the biggest rub was when we discovered no bath tub in our room !!!A big deal to us as it was requested when we booked . When I asked I was told by three different staff members that they did have rooms with bath tubs available but not at the price point we had paid !!! At this point I have taken their request and given them the review they have asked for. They want us to pay more money for a bath tub even though we were lead to believe we would have one but they can't seem to see we are paying full price for an unfinished hotel that is certainly not four stars!!!!

Stayed at Executive Hotel Le Soleil for 5 nights during their opening week. We recognized the name from the sister hotel in our hometown of Vancouver. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay! Rooms were clean, modern, and surprisingly large compared to your typical NYC shoebox. Excellent location - easy walk to 5th ave shopping, Bryant Park, Public Library, and Times Square. Staff were extremely friendly and professional. Would definitely stay again!

This hotel is in a great location. The staff could not have been more helpful - especially Stanley! The rooms are very spacious and modern. There are a number of great bars and restaurants both on the street and the nearby streets so everything is easy to walk to. Would definitely stay here again.

My husband and I stayed at a different hotel next door. As we were waiting for our ride to JFK, our Uber pulled over to the front entrance of Le Soleil. We couldn’t believe the bellsboy actually helped us get in the car. We are sold!

I arrived at this hotel early morning, (after a redeye flight) usually check-ins are not until 3:00pm. I was told by another employee there was no rooms available upon my arrival, we are talking about a 6 hour wait!! THANKFULLY, ALFREDO overheard and came to my rescue!!!! Within a metter of minutes i had a key to my room!!! He is without a doubt the best employee I've ever encountered in this and any hotel, extremely helpful to customers and peer employees. He is incredibly resourceful and understanding. He has defenetly turned my exhausting last minute trip into another sunny day in New York City. In short, he is AMAZING. A million thanks Alfredo.Hotel is extremely CLEAN and RENOVATED, I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family. I had a wonderful experience staying here and location is perfect, blocks away from everything.

We stayed for 4 nights arriving on their official opening date. Hotel was well situated near theatre and shopping and great for arrival at Penn station and airport trains. Room was smaller but not untypical for the city and adequate for our needs (except for coping with our many shopping bags!) Staff were excellent and friendly (particularly Stan the front door man).Lobby bar was not opened although advertised which was a disappointment, and a few kinks with the room provisions over our stay but all issues rectified quickly and pleasantly.

The hotel was lovely -- it had been open only 8 days when we arrived. We had reserved a queen suite with a sofa bed -- alas the sofa beds had not arrived. Since there were 3 of us they gave us 2 rooms for the same price. We were on the 19th floor. The views were great and no noise! The rooms are very nice, clean, and comfortable. The staff were courteous and helpful. The the concierge desk and doormen were especially welcoming and friendly --Eddie was THE best -- always friendly, approachable, and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

My wife and I stayed here for a night and couldn't have been more pleased. The rooms are small, but perfectly comfortable, clean and have all the necessary amenities. The smoke free atmosphere is commendable. But the really standout thing about this hotel is the staff. The minute I enter the door they made eye contact with me and smile, they really go out of their way to accommodate their guest and are incredibly accommodating and friendly. Chris checked us in he was very helpful and kind. The next day I walked up late for check out and he gladly change the check out to 1pm from 12 noon to give us time to get ready. In addition to that he gave us a lot pointer on where to find a nearby bar. Cant say enough about this hotel great experience.

I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Here is what I think of this hotel:Pros(1) The quality of the room is quite good and the bed is comfortable. The room size is not bad consider it is in NYC. (2) The location is very good. Cons(1) This one really upset me. I booked this room at Expedia and I put three guests when I reserved it. I got a executive queen room. However, when I read the fine print, it said only one queen bed and no extra bed can be added and I got really curious how they are going to fit three adults in that room. So I called and they said they couldn't find a sofa bed and because of that they would give us two rooms instead. Then, I was like "great" and did not cancel the reservation (I could still cancel it at that point). When I arrived and began to check in, this guy told me that I only had one room and only one person could stay in that room. I explained what I was told before and the conversation went on for a while; however, at the end he said there was nothing he could do about it and his attitude was not helpful but condescending instead. I was furious at the moment, so I went talking to the manager. Surprisingly, the manager was completely opposite and very helpful and after explaining our situation, he was able to find two rooms for us. I was relieved but I should not have experienced this in the first place. The first guy that I talked to never apologized and he sounded so unhelpful during our conversation. His manner will not be an asset but a liability to this hotel. (2)There were also hit and miss when it came to room service. One of our room had no room service one day (not because we put a sign on the door) and the bath floor mat was missing in my room one day. Also, I asked for late check out but they inactivated my key card before the new check out time, so I needed to go down and told them to activate again. (3) I know it is a new hotel, so it is understandable that it needs touch up here and there. But some obvious things like tape residue on the elevator door can be easier peeled off. So why don't some stuff do something about it??Overall, it is not a bad hotel but I am NOT "4-5 stars" impressed mainly due to some incompetent staff working there. Hopefully, it will get much better 2-3 months from now.

A newly opened hotel (I believe it was about 2 weeks old) with great staff who always go out of their way to help make your trip enjoyable. Special mentions to Chris, and Nora who both were pleasant to chat with and point me in the right direction.My room was on the 19th floor which allowed me a great view of the city skyline, and the room itself was clean and the bed comfy!From a location point of view you're smack bang in the middle of shopping central at a 2 min walk from 5th Ave and "thirty blocks of shops". Everything else is no more than a 2-10 min metro ride or walk away.If I was to pick at one thing, I would have liked a few machines in the fitness room.

The room inside are very clean and modern.I found the staff in the hotel very helpful specially Chris who went out of his way to find me a good room replacement. Thanks Chris. Lobby area is quite average and the restaurant is still not functioning which is a dampener.
user_name:
SGA S
New York City, New York

review_body: This is an outstanding, brand new hotel with so much going for it! A real find. The location is great, just downtown of Bryant Park and between 5th and 6th avenues. The staff are exceptional, very attentive to detail and all so kind. The room I stayed in (one bedroom Queen Suite) was huge, with a separate sitting area, wall to floor windows looking out onto the street and sky, and a vast and lovely bathroom. The bed was immensely comfortable, (you feel like you're floating above New York!) details all beautifully done (perhaps just have the option to switch on only bed lights rather than whole room? But maybe I just didn't find the option to do so?) and generally perfect. This is an overall excellent hotel and hugely promising once their restaurant is up and running.

We walked into a wonderful air conditioned foyer to be meet by the most helpful and amazing people behind the front desk who, after we'd told them about our disastrous experience with AirB&B, so kindly upgraded us to an beautiful sweet on the upper floors.The staff we met on our 6 day stay were so helpful and friendly that it will be the first place I'll be trying to book the next time I'm in New York.The hotel is locate in the middle of Midtown New York with Broadway, Time Square being 5 minute walks away.There is so many restaurants/diners/cafes nearby that you are spoiled for choice, we were there for 6 days and had some of the most delicious food we'd ever tasted.Subway is a 5 minute walk away.Empire State Building is a stones throw away.Best hotel I've ever stayed at....by a mile!

The hotel is brand new. I stayed in this hotel during the first week that open. Nervous at first but as soon as I met the front desk staff they were amazing. Within the bathroom you have acca kappa products that are just perfect. The housekeeping Service is good, very clean rooms and very spacious. I had a suite and it was more than enough space. they had different amenities at the desk of the room that you had to pay for but they were delicious. Very ideal location near everything you need to be around in midtown. My biggest take away was the quality of service that was provided by Luis XIII, I never had such an amazing check in experience and interaction with a agent like I did with him. He will for sure end up going far and needs to be promoted. Hotel Le Soleil is beyond my expectations. Will return
user_name:
Jasmine M
Subic Bay Freeport Zone, Philippines

review_body: My friend and I had just flown in from Paris. The friend we were supposed to stay with had and accident and was unable to help us. It was labor day!! No room at the inn!! My friend found the website for this hotel and after 3 hours at JFK we were able to come up with a Room at this wonderful hotel in the middle of NYC!! We stayed for 2 days and our every need was met in Evert instance. Did forget to mention that I had a broken foot?? and had been walking all over Europe? This hotel was paradise when I needed it the most!! Sorry I could not use all of the amenities included in this beautiful place! Thank you for being here for us! I'd especially like to mention Alfredo. When i could not get onto the WiFi or work the coffee maker he personally came to the room and helped me so I could contact our families!

Le Soleil is an excellent brand new hotel. I had the luxury of staying here the second night after its opening.Rooms are very spacious and are furnished to a very high standard. The staff were also extremely friendly and eager to help. The bar snacks were so beautifully packaged they were irresistible (especially the gummy bears!)Fantastic location, in the centre of Midtown, yet on a quieter street away from the noise of Times Square.I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and would definitely stay again.
user_name:
torty27
New York City, New York

review_body: Very friendly, helpful staff, especially when we first arrived Nora on reception helped with our query over the view from the room and kindly upgraded us at no extra cost. This made a huge difference to us during our stay. Stanley was always happy in explaining the surrounding area to us, also other members of staff looked up the addresses of specialised restaurants as I fancied a rack of ribs and my wife is vegetarian. The young lady on the concierge desk also very helpful, in fact the staff could not do any more for you as they made sure everything was to your satisfaction.
user_name:
Desmond B
Paddock Wood, United Kingdom

review_body: Stayed Sept. 2. The staff has clearly been well trained to focus on guest satisfaction, but they all seemed to genuinely care about the guests. Our room was of average size for NYC, king bed extremely comfortable. Impressed with size and appointments of bathroom. We used both the fitness room and business center, and found them both superior.

I want to Thank Alfredo for being such a great help and provide me with information and guidance on to how to get to places and where to go. The hotel in General in Great, it has some great people working in it as well! I would definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends of they come to visit NYC!

Absolutely loved our stay at Les Soleil. The room was a great size, and the hotel itself in the perfect location. I also especially loved the Acca Kappa bath products! But the best part about Les Soleil was the staff. Special shout out to Joseph, Eddie and Yujie. Thanks for making our stay extra special - you really know how to make a couple of Aussies feel at home in NYC! Can't wait to come back. See you then!

The hotel is brand new, We got great rates on booking.com. Position is fantastic, walking distance from many attractions of the city, and two minutes walking to subway. Room is nice and comfortable. All people in the hotel are vey kind and helpful. A very special thank to Alfredo at front desk who was able to take care of a wifi issue with my notebook. Thank you Alfredo 5 stars to you!!

Really enjoyed the staff and accommodations. Eddie was fabulous!!! Great location near Penn Station and Times Square. I would certainly stay there again. The view isn't the best but we were hardly in the room much.

We stayed here on the first night of the Hotel being open and it was so lovely. We live in NJ, but like to stay in the city every now and again if we are going out/heading to a late yankee game. The price was great, the staff was GENUINELY friendly, not in a "this is our grand opening please write us a good review" type of way, haha. They have some really great employees. Stanley is the man!! The front desk even printed our Yankee tickets for us. Beds are great, i loved the shower! AND it is very quiet, you kind of forget you are in NYC when you go to sleep. I also love how they have a Keurig coffee maker in the room :). The Irish pub next door is also awesome. A few blocks from Bryant park, so really a perfect location. This is our new go-to hotel for nights in NYC.Only downside is parking, but there is a garage down the street. I assume that eventually they will get some kind of deal with them. It was worth it.Thank you for a wonderful stay!!
